response: In a large stockpot cook cabbage and potatoes in chicken broth until tender. Add ham and half-and-half and bring to a boil. Serve in bowls.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel and core apples. Divide batter among 3 greased 8-inch round baking pans. Cut each apple into 8 wedges. Arrange apple wedges over batter in each pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Drizzle with caramels. Drizzle with melted margarine. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake 35-45 minutes. Cool. Serve warm. Makes 12 servings.

Place lobster tails in a shallow dish. Add enough water to cover tails. Place dish in refrigerator until ready to grill. Remove tails from water, pat dry and let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes. Prepare grill for direct cooking over medium heat (350 - 450 degrees). Brush the lobster tails lightly with olive oil. Grill the tails until opaque throughout, 8 to 12 minutes per side. Remove from the grill and drizzle each lobster tail with 1/2 tablespoon of lemon juice. Sprinkle lightly with paprika and serve immediately.
Combine sugar and water and bring to the boil. Simmer 5 minutes to make a syrup. Allow to cool. Combine berry puree with lemon juice and syrup. Place in a metal bowl or tray. Freeze till set.

In a heavy saucepan over medium heat, stir together first 5 ingredients until mixture boils and a candy thermometer reads 300 degrees f (soft ball stage) or until mixture is very thick. Remove from heat and stir in nuts until well coated. Pour onto wax paper in an 8x8-inch pan. Let stand 15 minutes or until cool. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for 1 week or in the refrigerator for 1 month. Makes 3 pounds.

On one slice of bread, spread sour cream and mustard. Sprinkle with red onion and fresh thyme. Spread the other slice of bread with sour cream and mustard. Arrange the turkey and tomato slices on the bottom slice of bread. Top with the second slice of bread. Place in a medium nonstick skillet and cook over medium heat for 4 minutes or until the bottom is crisp and the cheese is melted. Turn and cook for 4 minutes more or until the top is crisp and the cheese is melted. Cut the sandwich in half and serve warm.

In a large stockpot over medium heat, saut the onion, carrots, celery, and garlic in the butter until tender. Add the parsley, cloves, and thyme. Stir in the chicken pieces. Add the water, cover and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Remove the thyme sprigs. Add the rice. Cover and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes more. Discard the cloves. Season the soup to taste. Serve the soup topped with the parsley.
Soups are a great way to get kids to eat their vegetables. The key is to cook them so the vegetables are very soft. They should be so soft that the child does not need to chew. A lot of kids dislike vegetables because they are crunchy.
You can add any vegetables that your child will eat. You can also add any spice that you child will eat.
When the child is finished eating the vegetables you can add a bit more spice to make the soup spicy.
You can also add a bit more
Steam corn kernels and mash. Mix with other ingredients and fry as pancakes or cakes in hot fat. Serve with salsa.

Warm the tortillas in a microwave oven. Put in enchilada sauce. Add green onion. Lay the olives on top of the sauce. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Roll the tortilla up. Put in the oven for about 5 minutes. Serve with the enchilada sauce.

Combine creamy peanut butter, milk, and vanilla extract in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook until smooth. Add cooling mixture to cream cheese. Fold in whipped topping. Divide into crusts. Sprinkle with oreo pieces. Chill until ready to serve. Top with ice cream topping. Serve.

Cut off the stems of the cherries, leaving the stems attached to the pits. Put the cherries in a saucepan with the water. Cook on high heat until the water starts bubbling around the sides of the pan. Then reduce the heat to medium and cook for 15-20 minutes, until the skins of the cherries begin to peel away from the fruit. Stir occasionally during cooking so that the fruit does not burn on the bottom of the pan. Add the sugar, stirring constantly until the sugar has dissolved completely. Add the sure-jell, stirring constantly until it is completely dissolved into the mixture. Add the butter, stirring constantly until the butter is melted. Bring the mixture back to a boil, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Add the almond extract and stir until blended into the mixture. Pour the hot jam into hot sterilized jars. Remove the stems from the pits and put the stems in the jam. Leave 1/4-inch head space at the top of the jar before placing the lids on the jars. Process the jars in a boiling-water

Prepare vegetables as directed. In a bowl combine all ingredients except vegetables. Spread vegetable mixture evenly in a 13x9 baking dish. Sprinkle chickpea mixture evenly over vegetables. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

In saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add butter to hot oil, stir until butter melts. Add herbs, thyme, garlic cloves and dried onion flakes. Saute 2 minutes. Add wine, stirring frequently until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat, add worcestershire sauce and stir well. Add mushrooms and stir until heated through. Serve over steaks or hamburgers.

Bring milk to boil in saucepan over medium high heat. Add coffee. Stir 1 min. Remove from heat. Stir in pudding mix until dissolved. Add vanilla. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon over cake layers. Sprinkle with chocolate and cinnamon. Refrigerate at least 2 hrs. or until firm. Store in refrigerator. Serves 6 to 8.

In a small skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Cook chicken for 5 minutes or until cooked through. Slice bread lengthwise into 4 equal pieces. Spread one side of each piece with pesto. Top each piece of bread with 3 slices chicken and 2 slices of cheese. Broil for 4 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is toasted. Top each piece of bread with arugula and spread remaining side of bread with pesto. Close sandwiches with remaining piece of bread. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Bring to boil 8 cups of water. Cook rigatoni according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan heat oil. Add onion. Cook until tender. Add sausage. Cook until browned. Add chicken broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cook until broth is reduced by half. Add cannellini beans. Cook until beans are heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in sun-dried tomatoes. Add rosemary. Toss with pasta. Garnish with parmesan.

Heat the oven to 375 degrees F. Preheat the microwave oven to high (100% power). Place the kernel corn in a microwave-safe bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Microwave on high for 3 minutesdrain in a colander. In a medium saucepan bring the whipping cream to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to medium low and add the drained kernel corn and the butter. Cook for about 3 minutes or until the kernel corn is tender and the liquid is thickened. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the flour until smooth and well combined. Return the saucepan to the heat and stir in the salt and white pepper until combined. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 3 minutes or until the mixture is slightly thickened and smooth. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese until well combined. Pour into a 1-1/2-quart baking dish and sprinkle with the parsley. Bake for about 30 minutes or until bubbling and the top
Brown venison in butter. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Stir in soup mixes. Add enough water to cover. Cook for 45 minutes. Serve with biscuits or buns.

Brown the ground beef in oil. Add the other ingredients. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve on buns.
 easy hamburger stew
ingredients: lean ground beef, garlic, onion, potatoes, carrots, kernel corn, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt and pepper, worcestershire sauce
preparation:Saute ground beef, garlic and onion. Add potatoes, carrots and corn. Stir in soup, water and seasonings. Cover and simmer until veggies are tender. Serve over steamed white rice.

Melt margarine in skillet. Brown half the onions and half the celery. Add half the margarine. Brown half the chicken and add half the bouillon cube. Add half the water and cook 10 minutes. Remove and add other half of the onions and celery. Brown the other half of the chicken and add the other half of the bouillon cube and the remaining half of the water. Cook 10 minutes longer. Drain the water from the stuffing. Add to the chicken and stir to mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 F for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve on toasted dinner rolls.
Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher. Stir well. Fill with ice cubes in the glasses, pour over the drinks. Garnish with lime.

Beat together butter and sugars until creamy. Add vanilla and egg and mix well. Add flour, baking soda and salt and mix well. Stir in oats and chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet to cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350F. Cook potatoes until just tender. Drain off any excess water. Add beetroots. Season with salt and pepper. Place in greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Heat olive oil in small skillet. Add thyme leaves. Cook 1-2 minutes or until leaves are crisp. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of grated gruyere cheese. Spread over potatoes. Bake until bubbly. Sprinkle with remaining grated cheese. Bake 5 minutes more. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In an 8-inch square baking dish, place a layer of halved bananas. Sprinkle with sugar. Dot with butter. Continue layering until all of the bananas are used. Bake 30 minutes or until soft. Serve warm drizzled with caramel sauce or vanilla ice cream.

Put sugar, cornstarch and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook stirring constantly for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in jello and bananas. Add strawberries and stir. Chill for 2 hours. Prep time does not include refrigerator time.

Cook and drain the beef, add the onionadd the noodles and cook until tenderadd the cornadd the ripe olives and the tomatoessprinkle with the cheesebake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutesserve immediately.

Preheat skillet over medium heat. Place egg, banana, and vanilla extract in blender and blend until smooth. Add cooking spray to skillet and place 1/4 cup of batter in skillet. Cook until bottom is browned, flip and cook the other side. Top with sliced almond butter (or any nut butter) and chopped walnuts. Enjoy!
Separate and beat egg. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook egg until desired doneness. Top bun with cheese. Sprinkle with prepared mustard. Place egg on top. Serve immediately.

Cook manicotti according to package directions. Meanwhile, prepare the filling. Cook the ground beef in a nonstick skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbled. Add the onioncook until tender, about 5 min. Add the spaghetti sauceheat through. Lay a manicotti shell on a platetop with about 1/4 cup of the filling. Sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese. Wrap the manicotti around the filling and roll in hands to seal. Arrange in a 3 quart baking dishtop with string cheese and mozzarella cheese slices. Bake for 25 to 30 min., or until heated through and bubbly. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine mix and water in a large bowl. Mix egg and milk in a small bowl. Beat well. Combine egg mixture with muffin mix. Fold in chicken and black beans. Divide into 6 portions. Press into muffin pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Combine salsa and cumin. Spread over hot muffins. Sprinkle with cheese and cilantro. Serve with light sour cream.

Soak the lavash in water for about 5 minutes or until soft. Drain well. Blend the yoghurt with the garlic to make a smooth paste. Chop the carrot into tiny pieces. Peel and finely slice the cucumber. Chop the celery. Cut the snow peas into pieces about 1/2 inch long. Mix together the lavash and the vegetables. Season with black pepper. Stir through the yoghurt. Serve with mint or parsley sprigs.

Heat canola oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and cook 2 minutes. Add celery and carrots and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Add canadian bacon and cook until meat is browned. Add broth and turkey. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until meat and potatoes are tender. Stir in sage and pepper. Serve in bowls. Makes 6 servings.
Brown the liver in butter. Add other ingredients except hot sauce and tomatoes. Bring to boil. Add hot sauce and tomatoes. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve over rice.
Put all ingredients in slow cooker. Cook on low for 12 hours. Remove roast from liquid and shred with 2 forks. Serve with rice.
Heat milk in saucepan. Add salt, then rice. Cook over medium-low heat until all liquid has been absorbed, about 30 minutes. Fluff before serving.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees celsius and lightly grease a 12 hole muffin pan or a 12 inch tart tin. Place all the dry ingredients into the bowl of an electric mixer and mix for 10 seconds on low speed until the mixture is evenly mixed. Add the butter and mix for another 10 seconds until the mixture resembles bread crumbs. Add the milk and mix on low speed for 30 seconds or until the mixture is moist and holds together when pressed between your fingers. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead until smooth and elastic. Roll the dough out to 3 cm thickness. Using a 7 cm round cutter, cut out scones and place onto the prepared pan. Brush the tops of the scones with extra milk and sprinkle with extra coarse sea salt if desired. Bake the scones for 15 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve warm with your favourite jam, jelly or fruit spread. Makes 12 scones.
name: scott

In a large skillet, heat butter. Saute onion and garlic until softened. Add celery and saute until tender. Add chicken broth and cook until liquid is reduced by half. Add apple and sage. Cook until softened. Season to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine 3 cups sesame seeds, brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter, peanut butter, and egg. Beat until thoroughly combined. Add the flour, soda, and salt. Beat until combined. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on pan 1 minute. Remove from pan. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container. Makes 3 dozen.

Cream together butter, sugars. Beat in eggs one at a time, stir in cherry juice. Combine dry ingredientsstir into creamed mixture just until dry ingredients are moistened. Spoon batter into greased muffin cups 2/3 full. Sprinkle with pecans and maraschino cherries. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 20-25 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Drizzle with icing made from 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 2 teaspoons maraschino cherry juice, mixed well.

Heat 2 tsp oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, add leeks, cook for 5 min, stirring occasionally, add 1 tsp chile, cook for 5 more min. Add 2 1/2 cups stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, add corn and cook for 10 min. Add 1/2 tsp salt. Divide among 4 bowls.

Wash green beans and pat dry. Lay on baking sheet. Add onion, garlic, pecans, oil to pan and saute until onion is softened. Spread nuts over green beans and sprinkle with onion mixture. Bake at 400 degrees until crisp-tender, about 20 minutes.
Mix mango nectar and mango in the bottom of your glass. Add gold tequila, triple sec and fresh limeade concentrate. Top with ice. Garnish with fresh mango. Dip the rim in the salt.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook, turning once, for about 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Add water and salsa. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in corn and rice. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, covered for 5 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in ricotta. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with warm flour or corn tortillas.

In a bowl, combine the first 5 ingredients. Divide meat mixture into 4 portions. Shape into 4 patties. Cook in skillet over medium heat until brown. Turn once and brown other side. Serve on kaiser rolls with barbecue sauce.

Sieve together the flour and salt into a bowl and rub in the butter until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Make a well in the centre and pour in the egg and milk. Stir to make a soft dough. Add the sugar and currants. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface until about 5mm thick and use a round cutter to cut out 10cm discs. Heat a heavy frying pan or griddle pan and add a little sunflower oil. Put the discs on the hot pan and cook for about 1 minute on each side until golden brown. Remove from the pan and keep warm whilst cooking the rest of the mixture. Serve warm with butter and jam or lemon juice and sugar.
In a small bowl combine mustard and honey. Combine mustard mixture and vinegar. Dip each pretzel in mixture. Sprinkle with dry mustard.

Grind sugar with 1/4 cup water and ghee in a blender to a thick paste. Add the ground sugar and ghee mixture to the carrots and blend again to form a smooth mixture. Put the mixture in a pan and bake for 5 minutes or until the mixture starts to harden. Remove and let the mixture cool. Cut into squares.
name: carrot bites a raw gluten free treat
ingredients: carrots, walnuts, raw cashews, dates, fresh ginger, cinnamon, orange, zest of, sesame seeds, unsweetened dried shredded coconut
preparation:In a food processor fitted with the s-blade, process carrots untill finely ground. Remove and set aside. Process the walnuts and cashews in the food processor until finely ground. Add the dates and process until finely chopped and incorporated into the nuts. Add the reserved carrots, ginger, cinnamon, orange zest and process until dough forms. Shape the mixture into 15-18 small balls. Roll in

Cut 3 - 4 inches off of the blossom end of the zucchini. Slice into 1 - 1 1/2 inch slices. Sprinkle lightly with salt. Place in colander for 30 minutes. Drain well. Combine vinegar, sugar and sesame oil in a medium sauce pan. Bring to a boil. Add garlic and hot pepper flakes. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the zucchini and toss to coat. Let cool. Serve at room temperature. Store in refrigerator.

Mix the prepared horseradish and all of the other ingredients except the apple juice and the sour cream in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 7 hours. Remove the meat from the slow cooker. Shred the meat and mix in the apple juice and the sour cream. Serve the meat over the vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8 inch square baking pan. Melt the chocolate and the butter in a double boiler over medium heat until smooth. Cool for 10 minutes. Stir in the sugar and vanilla until smooth. Whisk in the eggs one at a time, until the mixture is smooth and shiny. Stir in the salt and the flour until incorporated. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Cool and cut into squares.
Mix all ingredients together. Shape into small balls. Place onto a ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten with a glass. Bake for 10 minutes.

Prepare the mascarpone mixture. Place the mascarpone cheese and cream in a small bowl or in a food processor. Process until very smooth. Set aside.Prepare the coffee mixture. Place the coffee in a small saucepan. Add the coffee liqueur. Heat just until steaming. Do not boil.Remove the coffee mixture from the heat. Stir in the mascarpone mixture.Prepare the ladyfinger layers. Dip the ladyfingers in the coffee mixture until slightly soaked. Lay them in the bottom of a 2-quart glass bowl or trifle dish.Top with a layer of the mascarpone mixture. Repeat twice with the ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture.Top with a layer of the mascarpone mixture.Place in the fridge for 30 minutes.Serve immediately.

Combine lemon juice and olive oil. In a ziploc bag place chicken breast halves and pour the marinade over. Place in the fridge for at least 4 hours or over night. Preheat oven to 400. Place on a cookie sheet. Spray with cooking spray and bake for 15 minutes. Turn over and bake another 15 minutes or until done. Serve with pasta and salad. Serves 4.

In a blender combine 2 cups cubed cantaloupe, 2 cups sugar and 1 cup fresh lemon juice. Blend until smooth. Add 1 mint leaf and 1 basil leaf and blend until pureed. Pour into 6 glasses, fill with ice and top each glass with 1 1/2 ounces light rum. Garnish with mint sprigs and basil sprigs.
Puree all ingredients in food processor or blender. Serve on greens or as a dip.

Place bread slices in an 8x8 baking dish. Spread each slice with mustard and top with a slice of ham. Sprinkle each with a little gruyere. Break an egg over each. Top with milk and cinnamon sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with raspberry jam and sprinkled with powdered sugar.
Recipe for an aphrodisiac sandwich for the hungry.

In a large bowl mix together all of the ingredients except cheese and biscuit. Spray a 9x13 casserole dish with cooking spray. Pour mixture into casserole dish and sprinkle cheese evenly over top. Bake for 45 minutes at 350F degrees. In the last 10 minutes of cooking time, place biscuits in oven until lightly browned. Serve with biscuits on side. Makes 8 servings.

Place the breadcrumbs in a medium mixing bowl and add the light sour cream. Mix well together. Melt the butter in a frying pan over medium heat and cook the chopped onion until softened and slightly browned. Add the cooked salmon to the pan along with the chopped chives and parsley. Season with pepper and the mix well. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Place the cooked salmon in a pie plate or a shallow baking tray and add the lightly beaten eggs along with the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with the cheese and bake in the oven for 40 minutes or until just set. Allow the quiche to cool for about 30 minutes before serving.

Place the chicken stock in a large pot and bring it to a boil. Add the onions and simmer for 4 minutes. Add the couscous and salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook according to the package directions. In a large skillet heat the butter and saute the pine nuts for 30 seconds or until lightly brown. Remove from heat and sprinkle the parsley over the couscous. Serve hot.

Place the brats in the bottom of a medium sauce pan, then cover with the beer, add the onions, peppers, and olive oil. Bring it all to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover the saucepan and simmer until the beer is evaporated (this will take about 30 minutes) and the peppers are tender. When the peppers are done cooking, remove the brats from the pan and set them aside on a plate. Add the butter to the saucepan, then return the brats to the pan, turning them over so that both sides are exposed to the butter. Cook the brats for an additional 5 minutes over medium-high heat, turning them frequently, until they are browned all over. Serve the brats with the onions and peppers on a hot dog roll with mustard.

In medium-size nonstick skillet cook bacon over medium-high heat until crisp and remove from pan with slotted spoon to paper towels to drain and cool. Add garlic powder and salt to drippings and cook and stir over medium-high heat 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add cabbage and stir-fry over medium heat 5 minutes or until tender-crisp and lightly browned. Sprinkle with mustard. Makes 4 servings (about 3/4 cup per serving).

In a large bowl, combine corn, carrots and onion. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add carrots, onion and capsicum. Saute for 3 minutes. Stir in barbecue sauce. Cook until vegetables are crisp-tender. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Combine vegetables and stuffing mix. Spoon 1/4 cup vegetable mixture onto each piece of bread. Roll up. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake rolls for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Sprinkle potatoes with curry powder and dry mustard, arrange in a 12 by 8 inch baking dish. In a small bowl, combine honey, margarine and curry powder. Pour over potatoes and sprinkle with chicken pieces. Cover and bake 1 hour at 375 degrees. Uncover and bake for additional 15 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked.

Mix brownie mix as directed on box for a 9 x 13 pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree over for approximately 40 minutes. When done, allow to cool. Cream together kahlua and pudding mix with milk in a saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and fold in cool whip. Spread pudding mixture over cooled brownies in the pan. Chop up candy bars and spread on top of pudding mixture. Spread with remaining cool whip and sprinkle with toffee bits. Refrigerate at least one hour before serving.
Name: BROWNIES FOR BREAKFAST Ingredients: BROWN SUGAR (56g) BUTTER (56g) EGG (3) GOLDEN SYRUP (56g) FLOUR (40g) COCOA (56g) SALT (5g) NUTS (56g) Preparation: Preheat oven 180c. Butter 20cm square cake tin. Melt butter and choc in

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add onions, carrots and celery. Sauté until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in beef until meat is cooked. Add remaining ingredients to skillet. Simmer until heated through. Serve hot with cornbread.
Place all the ingredients in a food processor. Pulse until well combined. Rub the mixture all over the chicken. Place the chicken in a roasting pan. Roast for 1 hour. Serve with the sauce.

Cook rice according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat butter and olive oil in large skillet over medium heat until butter is melted. Add garlic and pepper and cook until softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Add shrimp and cook until pink and curled, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Stir chicken broth and lime juice into pan and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir coconut milk and cilantro into pan and season with salt to taste. Serve with rice and garnish with cilantro leaves if desired.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Add a dash of saffron for color. Mix well and let sit for a couple of hours or overnight. Serve chilled and garnish with cashews and almonds.

In a large bowl combine milk and heavy cream. Beat in egg yolks and vanilla. In another bowl combine eggs and granulated sugarwhisk until thick and lemon-colored. Stir egg mixture into milk mixture and mix well. Add limoncello and mix well. In another bowl combine stale bread and milk mixture. Spray a 2-qt. baking dish with cooking spray. Pour bread mixture into baking dish. Bake at 325 for 45 minutes. Cool completely.
These recipes look great! I love to make bread pudding. I always have to get to the store the day before I want it just so I can get the right bread.
Yummy recipes! I love bread pudding and will definitely make the old fashioned chocolate one this weekend.
This is so weird. I was thinking about making bread pudding and now here are these recipes. Thank you.
Bread Pudding is such a great comfort food. The brazilian pie looks so yummy!
I love bread pudding and these are great recipes!
I am making bread

Combine first five ingredients in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves. Increase the heat and cook for 20 minutes or until it reaches the softball stage on a candy thermometer (230 degrees). Remove from the heat and beat with a wooden spoon or a whisk until the mixture is slightly cooled. Beat vigorously for 2 minutes or until the mixture is well blended and stiff enough to form a firm ball when dropped into a cup of cold water. Drop by the spoonful onto wax paper. Let stand until firm.

Put 1 cup of milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk together the remaining 1 2 cup of milk with the cornstarch until smooth. Whisk into the heated milk. Cook until thickened and bubbly, whisking constantly. Remove from the heat. Stir in the whipping cream, vanilla extract, and salt until smooth. Pour into individual serving dishes. Chill for 2 hours or overnight before serving.

Cover bottom of pan with 1 to 2 inches of water. Add carrots and squash cubes. Cover pan and cook 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp. Uncoverstir in onion powder and garlic powdercook for 2 minutes more. Sprinkle with fresh dill weed and season to taste with salt. Serve immediately.

Prepare rotini pasta according to package directions. Cool under running water. In a large bowl combine cucumber and lemon juicemix well. Add dried dill and garlicmix well. Add imitation crabmeat and snow peasmix well. Add cooled pastamix well. Add mayonnaise. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Slice bacon into small pieces and fry in frying pan until crisp. Remove from pan leaving about half the bacon grease in the pan. Cut carrots in half lengthwise and slice them into small pieces. Place in frying pan with the onion. Add the remaining bacon grease and brown the vegetables. Add the brown sugar and cook for another minute or two. Add the black pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Grease 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Beat together flour, sugar and butter. Spread in prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes in preheated oven. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add powdered sugar 1/4 cup at a time and continue beating until combined. Add milk 1 tsp at a time. Beat until fluffy. Spread over crust. Bake for 10 minutes in preheated oven. Cool. Cut into bars.

Soak the beans overnight in the water to cover. Drain and rinse the beans well and place in the crock pot. Add the turkey drumstick and fill the crock pot with more water. Add the kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper and the cayenne pepper to taste. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve with the turkey meat and the cooking liquid with the beans.
Slice apples into thin wedges. Dip in cinnamon. Drizzle with peanut butter. Add a graham cracker on top of each wedge.

In a saucepan over medium heat combine orange juice, lemon juice, splenda and thyme. Cook until mixture thickens, stirring often. Strain into freezer safe container. Freeze until granite consistency forms, stirring occasionally to break up crystals.

Cook meat and onions until meat is brown. Add garlic and oregano, stirring for a minute. Stir in the tomato paste and water. Bring to a simmer. Add the dried herbs and the canned tomatoes. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, combine oats, flour, and cinnamonadd butter and mix well. Press mixture into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely. In a small bowl, combine pie filling and extractspread over cooled crust. Freeze until firm. Top each serving with a scoop of ice cream and sprinkle with toasted coconut or chopped nuts. Makes 12 servings.

Cut bread into 3/4 inch slices. Drizzle each slice with extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle each slice lightly with kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper. Top each slice with a thin slice of manchego cheese. Heat broiler. Spread the slices onto a cookie sheet. Place under broiler until cheese melts. Drizzle the slices with balsamic vinegar and sprinkle with fresh basil.

In a small saucepan, stir together the lemon juice and zest and the sugar. Heat over medium heat until the sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the gelatin. Let cool for about 5 minutes. In a large bowl, stir together the buttermilk and the cold water. Whisk in the boiling water and the gelatin mixture. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and refrigerate until set, about 4 hours. Stir the pudding until it is thick. Spoon the pudding into individual serving bowls. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream. Sprinkle with the lemon zest.

Preheat oven to 180 C. Cream together the butter and sugar until well blended. Add egg and vanilla essence. Sift together flour and cocoa. Add to mixture and stir. Stir in peanuts. Drop by teaspoonful onto ungreased baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool on wire rack.
People who like Peanut Butter also like:
Mix slaw and onion together in large bowl. Combine dressing and toss salad and toss until evenly coated. Refrigerate 2 to 24 hours before serving.

Pre-heat oven to 375f. Mix ground beef, stuffing mix, water, and the powder ingredient from the variation you chose. Press into 12 muffin cups sprayed with cooking spray. Make an indentation in center of each meatloaf. With spoon fill indentation with sauce. Bake 30 min or until cooked through. Top with cheese, continue baking 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Drain ricotta of excess moisture. Blend ricotta and goat cheese in processor. Add walnuts. Add honey. Process just until combined. Let stand 30 minutes. Shape into a ball. Serve with crackers or fresh fruit.

In a skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add zucchini and onion. Cook and stir until onion is tender. Add diced tomatoes and basil. Cook and stir until tomatoes are hot. Serve immediately. Sprinkle with shredded cheese.

Melt butter in a large saute pan. Add mushrooms and cook until golden. Sprinkle flour over them and cook until lightly browned. Add the broth and cook until thickened. Add the seasonings and cook for a minute or two more. Add the chicken and cook until done. Add the heavy cream and cook until the sauce thickens. Stir in the port. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a large zip top bag or bowl, combine all the marinade ingredients. Add the pork chops and coat thoroughly. Seal the bag and marinate overnight. Remove the pork from the marinade and grill to your liking. Serve topped with cilantro and limes. Great served over rice.

Unroll crescent roll dough into a rectangle. Spread with butter, then layer with browned sausage, onion, green peppers, and cheese. Beat together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and oregano in a bowl, then pour over casserole. Bake at 425 for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Brown steak in skillet with 1/2 tablespoon butter. Add onion, garlic, and garlic powder to skillet and brown over medium high heat until onion is softened, about 4 minutes. Add mushrooms to skilletcover and cook until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes. Pour remaining butter over steak, and stir until butter melts. Add Worcestershire Saucestir until evenly combined. Spread topping evenly over steak. Bake 5 minutes or until heated through.

Heat olive oil in large saute pan over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic and saute 1 minute. Add rice and saute 1 minute. Stir in chicken broth, frozen peas and sharp cheddar cheese. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let sit 5 minutes. Fluff with fork.

Bake potatos till soft, remove skins, mash to desired consistency. In sauce pan, bring water to boil and add bouillon cubes. After 1 minute, add sour cream and cheese until melted. Add mashed potatos and mix well. Cook for another 5 minutes stirring constantly. Add bacon bits. Serve garnished with green onions or bacon bits if desired.

Heat oil in medium pot over medium heat. Cook onion and green peppers 5 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook 1 minute more. Stir in water and tomato paste. Add basil, oregano, and parsleystir until blended. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve with pizza.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Grease muffin pan. Cream together brown sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in egg, bananas, and vanilla. Combine the dry ingredients in another bowl and stir into the banana mixture. Spoon the batter into the muffin cups, filling them to almost overflowing. Bake for 25 minutes or until the muffins are golden brown.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Remove the seeds and ribs from the sweet bell peppers. Set aside. In a medium-sized saucepan, combine the garlic and oil and heat over medium-high heat until the mixture starts to sizzle. Add the basil pesto and heat through. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool. Combine the mozzarella and pesto sauce in a small bowl. Stuff the bell peppers with the mozzarella mixture. Place the stuffed bell peppers on the grill and cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until the bell peppers start to turn a darker color. Serve immediately.
Name: Spinach Basil Pesto
Ingredients: Spinach leaves, Basil leaves, Pine nuts, Garlic clove, Olive oil, Parmesan cheese, Salt, Fresh ground Black pepper
Preparation:Combine spinach, Basil, Pine nuts and Garlic in a Food Processor. Pulse for a few seconds. With the machine running, add Olive Oil. Process until mixture is creamy. This

In a medium saucepan combine the oil, seasoning, rosemary, orange marmalade, vinegar, and stock. Bring to a boil. Add the thighs, reduce heat to medium-low, cover partially, and simmer until the thighs are just cooked through (the meat should be firm to the touch), 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, in a large saute pan over medium-low heat, heat 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the scallions and season with salt. Cook until the scallions are tender, about 2-3 minutes. Add the arugula to the pan and cook until just wilted. In a medium bowl combine the scallion-arugula mixture with the dressing from the saucepan. Toss to coat well. Slice the thighs into bite-size pieces. Add to the scallion-arugula mixture. Toss to coat well. Serve immediately.

Bring boiling water to room temperature. Add oil, salt and pepper to matzo meal and stir until well combined. Beat eggs with water. Add to matzo meal and stir until well combined. Use to fill gefilte fish balls.
Squeeze the juice from lemons, limes and oranges. Reserving one lemon for garnish. Pour into a gallon container. Add water and sugar. Mix well. Chill. Garnish with lemon slices.

Combine pasta, tomatoes, olives, bell pepper, onion and feta cheese in a large bowl. Pour the olive oil and rice wine vinegar over the pasta mixture and toss to coat. Sprinkle with basil. Season with salt and pepper. Serve chilled.

Sift together dry ingredients. Cream together the butter and sugar and add the eggs one by one beating well after each addition. Beat in the dry ingredients and milk and the rice with the last addition of milk. Leave to stand for 15 minutes and then beat again before cooking.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a slow cooker. Sprinkle thighs with remaining spices and arrange in slow cooker. Cover with sauce mixture. Cook on low for 7-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. Remove from slow cooker, slice and serve with remaining sauce on top.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees celcius. Blend flour and eggs until smooth and add water and mix until the dough forms. Knead until smooth and place into round shapes and press the shapes on the tray. Bake for about 20 minutes until done. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cut sausage into bite-size pieces. In a large skillet cook sausage and peppers over med-high heat until sausage is brown. Drain off fat. Add broth & pepper to skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain pasta and toss with sausage mixture.

Heat oil. Add onion and garlic. Sauté until onion is translucent. Add salami. Cook until salami is crumbled. Add tomatoes. Season with red pepper flakes. Let simmer for 20 minutes. Spoon sauce into a baking dish. Sprinkle breadcrumbs on top. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with basil and top with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve over cooked pasta.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat 2 tbs of oil. Add eggplant and onion. Cook for 3-5 minutes until eggplant is tender. Add garbanzo beans and ground cumin. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Add lemon juice and fresh mint. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, combine remaining 1 tbs of oil with lemon juice and salt and pepper. Toss with feta cheese and set aside. Assemble sandwiches. Layer bottom with eggplant mixture. Top with lettuce leaves and feta cheese. Drizzle with dressing. Wrap sandwich in a pita and serve.

Cube the italian bread and spread out on a cookie sheet. In a saute pan over medium heat, heat the oil and garlic. When the garlic is golden and fragrant add the cubed italian bread. Add the parmesan. Stir until the cubes are evenly coated. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes. Watch for browning. If you like them really crisp, bake a bit longer. Turn off the heat and add the kosher salt. Stir until the cubes are evenly coated. Serve warm or at room temperature. These are really good with chicken soup. I like them with tomato soup. I will be making these for Thanksgiving this year. I will be serving them with the turkey and mashed potatoes. Yummy.

Toss fennel in 3/4 teaspoon salt and 3/4 teaspoon pepper in small bowl. Heat oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add fennelcook 6 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Stir in chicken stock, bring to boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. Stir in mint saucecook 2 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heatstir in 1/8 teaspoon pepper and mint sprigs. Transfer to serving bowl. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Mix together everything except cornflakes. Form into a square about the size of your palm. Dust with cornflakes and bake at 350 for about 20 minutes. Serves 4.
This is a quick and easy recipe for potato cakes. The cakes are easy to make and can be served with many different toppings.
You can use any kind of cheese you like. I use a sharp cheddar. You can also use any kind of topping. I used a topping of sour cream, chives and bacon bits.
In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, egg, cheese and bacon. Shape mixture into 8 patties. Roll in bread crumbs. Place on broiler pan. Broil for 10 minutes or until delicately browned.
If you like this recipe you might like to try this one as well.
I have some great news. You will be getting a FREE cookbook from me. The cookbook is called Easy Everyday Cooking. It contains over 150 recipes and there is even a recipe for potato

Spread cream cheese on toast or crackers. Sprinkle onions on top. Then sprinkle jack cheese on top of that. Drizzle mustard on top of that. Then sprinkle on top of that. Cut apple into slices and place on top of that. Garnish with chives and sprinkle with nuts on top of that.

Cut the tofu in half lengthwise and then slice into 1/2 inch wide strips. Whisk together the egg and chili sauce in a shallow bowl. In another bowl combine the panko with the oil and salt. Dip the tofu strips into the egg mixture and then coat with the panko mixture, pressing the panko into the egg coated strips. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the panko coated strips and fry until golden brown 3-5 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with soy sauce.
I'm sure there's a better way to say it... but... I'm in love with this site!! I've been searching for vegan recipes for a while now, and this site has everything I need! I just made the recipe for the panko tofu, and I'm going to go eat it right now.

Cook vegetables according to package directions. In 2-quart casserole, melt butter over low heat. Add vegetables. Stir in sour cream, soup, cheese and cracker crumbs. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.
Cook penne according to directions on package. When done add broccoli florets for 1 minute. Drain well. Add olive oil. Mix in walnuts, blue cheese and lemon. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

In large saucepan, combine 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup vinegar to boil. Add 3 to 4 pounds of small red potatoes and boil until tender when pierced with a fork (about 20 minutes). Drain and let cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine the cooked potatoes, diced celery, corn niblets and scallions. Add the Rotel tomatoes and chilies and the bacon, if using. Toss to combine. In a separate bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, mustard and enough of the remaining vinegar to reach desired consistency. Add the spices and toss with the potato mixture. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. You can substitute green chilies for the Rotel tomatoes and chilies.

Combine oregano, basil and pepper in a small bowl. Lightly dribble steaks with olive oil and sprinkle with herb mixture on both sides. Grill steaks over high heat about 3 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Sprinkle with cheese and lemon juice just before serving. Arrange sliced olives around the steaks on the plate. Garnish with fresh oregano leaves. Serve with rice or baked potatoes.

In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise and mustard. Brush both sides of each slice of bread with oil. Spread mayo mixture onto one side of each slice of bread. Top one slice with cheese and tomatoes. Top with remaining slice, mayo side down. Grill sandwich until bread is browned and cheese is melted, 3-4 minutes per side. Let cool slightly before serving. Cut sandwich in half and top with apples. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet, cook ground pork until no longer pink. Drain fat. Stir in onions and cook until tender. Add salt and pepper. Add garlic and mustard seeds and stir for 1 minute. Add water. Put in casings and tie off ends. Cook in boiling water 10 minutes. Remove from water and let cool. Refrigerate overnight and slice.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, cook and stir until onion is golden brown. Add butter, stir until melted. Add beans. Stir until heated through. Add vinegar and salt and pepper. Simmer 1 minute. Serve immediately or cool and store in refrigerator up to 3 days.

Grill tuna to desired doneness. Remove from grill and place on a large plate. Pour wine into a small saucepan. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let cool for a minute. Strain liquid into a bowl. Discard solids. Add rosemary, oregano, garlic and lemon juice. Whisk until well blended. Pour over tuna. Serve with steamed rice.

Slice squash into 1/2 inch rounds. Arrange in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Cover with foil. Roast 30 minutes. In a heavy bottomed pot, saute the onion in the oil until softened. Add the chicken stock and curry powder and bring to a boil. Add the squash. Simmer until the squash is very tender, about 15 minutes. Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. Adjust the seasoning with more curry powder, if desired. Serve with sour cream and scallion. Serves 2. 1/2 C. fat free sour cream 1/4 tsp. curry powder 1 tsp. scallion, chopped

Place the chickens in a shallow roasting pan. Sprinkle with the chili powder and oregano. Drizzle with the olive oil and squeeze with the lemon. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 45 minutes. Increase the oven temperature to 400 degrees farenheit. Baste the chickens with the pan juices and roast for another 20 minutes. Cut the chickens into pieces and serve.

Heat the oil and fry the onions and garlic for 5 minutes or so on medium heat. Add the flour and stir well to coat the onions and garlic thoroughly. Add the ale and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon or spatula to break up the lumps of flour. Add the stock, stir well and cook for a further 5-10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with mashed or boiled potatoes or rice.

Soak fish in water for 30 minutes. Remove & drain well. Sprinkle with salt. Place walnuts in a blender or food processor. Pulse until coarse. Add raisins & sultana raisins & pulse again until it is a paste like consistency. Slice off tops of fish & remove insides. Spoon in walnut mixture & top with a piece of butter. Replace top of the fish & secure with toothpicks. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat & saute fish for 5 minutes per side or until cooked through.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place wings in a shallow pan. Combine lime juice, soy sauce, ginger, and cilantro in a small bowlpour over wings. Bake 1 hour or until wings are tender, turning once. Place tomato sauce in a shallow bowlstir in hot pepper sauce, cilantro, and scallions. Toss wings in the tomato mixturesprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with hot mustard, if desired.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove to paper towels to drain. Keep warm. Cook chicken in butter over medium heat for 5-6 minutes on each side or until chicken juices run clear. Top each chicken breast with barbecue sauce, green onions, tomato and 2 reserved pieces of bacon. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Mix first 3 ingredients in heavy saucepan over low heat until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and add lemon peel and juice. Cool for 10 minutes. Dip cereal into mixture and place on waxed paper to cool. Store in tight container. Dip in powdered sugar before serving.

Preheat grill to medium. Combine spice mixture. Pat dry chopsrub with spice mixture. Grill 8 to 10 minutes per side until done. Combine glaze ingredients. Brush glaze over cooked chops. Grill 2 minutes more. Serve with peaches.

Mix eggs and milk. Add salt & nutmeg. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. In a medium bowl combine feta and kefalotiri cheeses. Add the eggs. Mix thoroughly. Melt phyllo dough according to package directions. Brush one sheet of phyllo with the egg mixture. Top with 1/2 the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Repeat process until all the phyllo is used. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Serves 4.

Cut each chicken breast into 1/2-inch cubes. In a small bowl combine the chili sauce and raspberry preserves until well blended. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, brown the chicken pieces for about 10 minutes. Add the preserves mixture and heat through. Serve over rice. Garnish with the pineapple chunks.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Coat a large rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray. Combine corn flakes, sun-dried tomatoes, rosemary, flour and pepper in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add half of the chickenseal bag. Turn to coat well. Repeat with remaining chicken, reserving any remaining seasoning. Add egg to bagseal. Turn to coat well. Transfer coated chicken to prepared sheetdiscard any remaining seasoning. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Turn chicken overcontinue baking 5 minutes or until done.

Remove caps from mushrooms and set aside. In a medium skillet, saut mushrooms in oil over medium heat until tender. Remove from heat and set aside. In a small bowl combine cream cheese and parmesan cheese until creamy. Add minced garlic and season with onion powder and ground cayenne pepper. Fill caps with cheese mixture and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake for 15 minutes at 400f.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onionsaute until softened (4-5 minutes). Remove from heatstir in parsley, bacon and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Spread the butter mixture evenly over each roll. Bake as directed for crescent rolls

Heat oil in large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add tomatoes. Cook 2-3 minutes or until they begin to break down. Add tofu and stir-fry until slightly crispy. Add garlic and scallions. Cook 2 more minutes or until mixture is hot. Add soy sauce and mix well. Add ground coriander, salt and sugar. Serve over rice.

Saute onions and garlic. Add bay leaves and rosemary. Cook until onions are golden brown. Add potatoes and saffron. Sprinkle with paprika. Add water and simmer until potatoes are tender. Remove bay leaves and rosemary. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

In a large pot heat the oil over medium heat. Add the leek and saute until soft. Add the mushrooms and saute until softened. Add the thyme, salt, pepper and broth. Cover the pot and let it simmer for about 15 minutes. Add the peas and carrots and simmer for 3 minutes longer. Add the farfel and simmer for 5 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Place all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Transfer to an ice cream maker and freeze according to the manufacturer's directions.
This recipe is from the book "Cooking for the Vegetarian Family" by Laura Fulton.
To make the ice cream, combine the almonds and water in a blender. Blend until you have a coarse paste.
Pour into a saucepan and cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and becomes golden brown. Stir constantly.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Blend in the maple syrup.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker. Freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.
When the mixture is frozen, remove from the maker and transfer to a freezer container. Freeze until solid.
To make the topping, combine the brown sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. Set aside.
Sprinkle the topping over the top of the frozen ice cream before serving.
This recipe is from the book "Healthy Cooking for One or Two" by Jackie Newgent.

In a small bowl combine flour, cornstarch, and five spice powder. In another bowl combine sea salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Toss in shrimp to coat. Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add shrimp to pan and cook until lightly browned. Add seltzer water and cook until sauce is reduced. Drizzle with oil.
Combine all ingredients and form into a loaf. Bake in the oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour at 350f.

Beat together eggs and milk with 1 tsp of sugar. Pour yeast and 1 tsp of sugar in small amount of warm water and let it dissolve and proof. Add water mixture and stir to make a smooth batter. Stir in flour and butter. Cover and let rise for 45 minutes. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 minutes in preheated iron.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Saute the mushrooms in the olive oil until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the broccoli florets to the pan and saute until crisp tender. Drain the mixture in a colander. Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the flour to the pan and stir until well blended. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Continue to stir for 1 minute. Stir in the sour cream. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the Worcestershire sauce and the mushroom/broccoli mixture. Toss the mixture to combine. Increase the oven temperature to 425 degrees F. Lay each crepe on a baking sheet. Spoon a few tablespoons of the mixture onto each crepe. Sprinkle with the Cheddar cheese. Fold the edges to form a pocket. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve the chicken with the remaining sour cream.

In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and chorizo sausage to pot. Cook until sausage is crispy. Remove from potset aside. In pot, add rice to sausage drippings and saute until rice is toasted. Add broth to ricecook until rice is tender. Season rice with salt and pepper. Remove rice from potset aside. In pot, add can of diced tomatoes and cook until heated through. Stir in cooked rice to pot. Cook until heated through. Stir in black beanscook until heated through. Stir in fresh corncook until heated through. Garnish with green onions before serving.
Black bean corn and salsa dip is a healthy snack that is packed full of protein and fiber. This recipe is perfect for those who are watching their waistline. It is also a great way to use up leftover veggies from the fridge!
1 (15 ounce) can black beans
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese
In a medium bowl, combine the
In a double boiler, melt chocolate. Cool. Beat in cream cheese. Add cool whip. Spread in crust. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare chilies as directed on package. Stuff each with cheese. Beat eggs lightly with a fork. Add milk to egg mixture. In a separate bowl, combine flour with salt. Dip each stuffed chile into flour mixture, coating completely on all sides. Heat oil to 350 degrees. Fry each stuffed chile for 3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Serve warm with salsa or your favorite dip.
The post Mexican Appetizers Recipes appeared first on The Sassy Spoon.

Combine sugar and corn syrup in a saucepan. Cook and stir until boiling. Boil 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter until well combined. Stir in cheerios& rice krispies. Spread into a greased 9x13 pan. Cool. Cut into bars.
Making chocolate peanut butter bars recipe is easy. You can use this chocolate peanut butter bars recipe to make your chocolate peanut butter bars more delicious.

Preheat oven to 375f. Melt butter in skillet. Cook green onion in butter for 1 minute. Add ham and cook until heated through. Combine eggs, half-and-half and salt and pepper. Add to skillet and scramble well. Spread hashbrowns evenly in 9 inch pie plate. Pour in scrambled egg mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 40 minutes.

Prepare vegetables. Bring to a boil and then simmer until crisp tender. Remove vegetables and let cool. Split pita bread in half. Spread dressing on pita. Top with vegetables. Sprinkle cheese. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Split each squash lengthwise with a sharp knife, remove seeds and place each half cut side up in a 2-quart shallow baking dish. In a skillet saute pork with apple until cooked through and no longer pink. Drain off fat and stir in the remaining ingredients except the squash. Spoon mixture over the squash. Cover dish tightly with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Uncover dish and continue baking 10 minutes longer or until squash is tender when pierced with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water until done but still firm to bite, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, heat sauce to boiling in medium saucepan. In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta and sauce. Stir in meatballs and 1/2 cup of ricotta cheese. Spoon into 2-quart shallow baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining ricotta cheese and 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until pasta is bubbly and cheese is golden brown. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley before serving.
Combine brown sugar, milk and cinnamon in a small saucepan over medium heat. Heat until boiling. Remove from heat. Add butter and stir until melted. Serve hot over toasted bread or biscuits.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook onion, green pepper and garlic 5 minutes or until tender. Add curry powdercook 1 minute. Add chicken and cook 2 minutes, turning to brown all sides. Stir in potatoes and 1 cup coconut milk. Add remaining 2 cups coconut milk and stockbring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in salt.
name: laurie s potato curryingredients: onions, curry paste, potatoes, fish sauce, coconut milk, chicken, brown sugarpreparation: Saute onions in oil until soft. Add curry paste. Peel and cut potatoes. Put onions and potatoes in crock pot with fish sauce, coconut milk and meat. Add brown sugar, stir and cook on low for 5 hours. Serve over rice with a dollop of sour cream.
name: green curry with chicken and eggplantingredients: chicken, green curry paste, coconut

In a large bowl add the pumpkin puree, paprika, garlic cloves and ground cinnamonmix well. Add the lemon juice and saltmix well. Add the vegetable oilmix well until the mixture is smooth. Store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In a food processor, combine bread crumbs and pepper. In a large skillet heat butter and oil over med-high heat. Dip the chicken in the seasoned crumbs and brown on both sides. Spread a layer of ham over each breast and top with a slice of swiss cheese. Roll the chicken up and place in a baking dish. Bake for about 35-40 minutes or until done.

Season fish with salt and pepper. Spread top and bottom of each fish with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with parsley and dill. Place on broiler pan and spray with cooking spray. Broil at 400 until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve with lemon wedge.
I've been a member of Tastebook for quite a while now and I'm always so amazed at how much this site has grown and improved. I love seeing new recipes added everyday and seeing how much better this site looks. Keep up the good work!
I just want to say thank you so much for your wonderful site. I love to cook and try new recipes. I have found some of my favorites here. The best part is that I can save them in my own cookbook.
I am a new member and I love this site! I've already made one of the recipes and it was delicious!
Love your site and your recipes are all so good. I have shared your site with friends and family. Thank you for all your hard work and effort in this site.
I love this site! It is so easy to find reci

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease two 8-inch square pans. Mix together first four ingredients until smooth. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until smooth. Add carrots. Pour into pans. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Combine crushed pineapple and juice, sweetened coconut, and 3 tablespoons of sugar. Spread on top. Bake 15 minutes more. Cool in pans.

In saucepan heat oil over medium-low heat. Add onions. Saut until soft. Add curry powder and stir till fragrant. Add tomatoes. Simmer until thick. Add water and spinach. Heat through. Season to taste. Serve over rice or pasta. Sprinkle with nuts.
These are all good and easy recipes! I’ve made the chicken and rice one before and it is yummy! I also like the unstuffed bell pepper skillet! I’ve done something like that before as well.
I think the bell pepper one is my favorite of them all.
I’ve made the salsa before, it’s delicious!! I just made the pepper skillet tonight and it was really good!
I’m always looking for easy meal ideas…thanks for posting this!
These recipes look great! I’m going to have to try some of them.
I love quick and easy meal ideas…. I’m always looking for them!
I like the look of the robin’s salsa. I think I’d like that best.
The un

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and saute until they are lightly browned and slightly golden, about 8-10 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the spinach and saute until it wilts. Stir in the nutmeg and cook until it is fragrant. Transfer the spinach to a serving dish. In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and zest with the olive oil and pour it over the spinach. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper and top with the pine nuts. Serve hot or warm.

Heat oil in 12-inch skillet over moderate heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until slightly golden. Add tomatoes, hot red pepper flakes, zucchini, broth, lemon juice, sugar, salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve immediately.

For the vinaigrette dressing, combine honey, vinegar, mustard, and garlic. Whisk in oils. For the sandwiches, spread 2 tablespoons of dressing on each slice of bread. Arrange the lettuce leaves over the bread. Top with the raisins and chickpeas. Divide the peas evenly between the sandwiches. Spread 1 tablespoon of the dressing over each sandwich and sprinkle with cinnamon. Press the sandwiches together and cut in half.
Combine pudding mix with milk according to package directions. Fill glasses with the mixture (about 1/3 full). Add a shot of vodka, then top off with cool whip. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas Mark 4. Beat the butter with the caster sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift together the flour and bicarbonate of soda and then stir into the mixture with the cocoa powder and the almonds. Divide into two and roll each portion into a long sausage shape on a well-floured surface and place on a baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes and then remove from the oven and mark the shape with a knife and turn the biscotti over to continue baking for another 10-15 minutes until the biscotti are crisp and firm when pressed. Remove and cool on a wire rack. Once cold cut each biscotti in half lengthways and place the cut sides together and return to the oven for a further 10 minutes until crisp. Remove and cool completely on a wire rack before storing in an airtight container.

Brown the ground beef in vegetable oil in large skillet or saucepan over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain the grease. Stir in the onion and cook until tender. Mix in the rice, salt, pepper, sage and water. Remove from heat. Shape the mixture into 1-inch meatballs. Brown the meatballs in the skillet for 3 to 4 minutes on all sides or until lightly browned. Stir in the tomato sauce and water to cover the bottom of the skillet. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes or until the water is almost gone. Serve hot over spaghetti or your favorite pasta.

Cut the potatoes into 1/4 inch slices. Coat a large baking sheet with nonstick spray. Place the sweet potato rounds on the sheet, add a small pat of butter to each slice and toss with the olive oil. Sprinkle with salt. Place the sheet in the oven. Bake for 20 minutes, flip the fries over and return to the oven for another 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine sweetened condensed milk and milk in a saucepan. Heat over low heat just until bubbles appear around the edge of the pan. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and whipped cream. Sprinkle with cocoa if desired. Serve immediately.

In blender container combine orange juice and strawberries. Cover. Blend until mixed. With the blender running, add ice cubes, 1 at a time through lid opening. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses. Garnish on the rim with whipped cream and berries, if desired.
In a large pot add curry paste and coconut milk. Add sweet potatoes and cook until tender. Add pineapple and cook until heated through. Season with salt. Garnish with coriander.

Mix together all the marinade ingredients in a shallow dish. Add the tenderloin to the dish, turning to coat. Cover and marinate in refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 8 hours. Preheat the broiler. Remove the tenderloin from the marinade and place it on a broiler pan. Broil for about 4 minutes per side or until done. Let the meat rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with rice or potatoes and salsa.

In a larger bowl, blend together flour, cheese, sugar, both powders, and italian seasoning. In a medium bowl, add milk, oil, and egg, mixing well. Stir into wet bowl into dry bowl, until moistened. Pour into a greased 9x5-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 f for 50 to 55 minutes or until toothpick inserted near centre comes out clean. When you remove from oven, spread margarine over top with paper towel. Cool for 10 minutes in pan. Remove to wire rack and cool for 10 more minutes, then enjoy.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain. Stir in tuna and yogurt. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour into 13x9x2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Cover and bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Uncoverbake 10-15 minutes longer or until top is lightly browned. Cool slightly. Serve with lettuce leaves if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Place tomatoes in a single layer in a saut pan. Cover with a lid or aluminum foil. Cook for about 3 minutes. Remove lid or foil. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant about 30 seconds. Add the salt and cook for 30 seconds longer. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with arugula. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Serve.

Preheat the broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil. Remove the pith from the rosemary stems. Place the stems and the leaves on a cutting board and cut them into 1/4-inch-wide strips. In a small bowl, mix the rosemary and parmesan. Coat each chicken breast with the rosemary and parmesan mixture. Season the chicken with the pepper and the basil. In a large skillet, heat the butter and the olive oil over medium heat until the butter is melted. Add the chicken and brown for 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Transfer to the baking sheet and broil until the chicken is cooked through and golden brown. Serve hot.

Prepare cake according to package directions adding poppy seeds and coconut extract if desired to batter. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool completely. In a mixing bowl, beat milk and pudding mix on low speed for 2 minutes. Spread over the cake. Spread with frozen whipped topping. Sprinkle with coconut if desired.

Grease 9 x 13 inch pan. Sift together flour, sugar, soda, salt and cocoa. Stir in eggs. Combine milk and oil. Add to dry mixture alternating with milk and oil. Pour into pan. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Cool slightly. Frost with buttercream frosting.

Preheat oven to 350 F degrees. Line a baking sheet with foil and grease foil with vegetable oil spray. Mix together oats, applesauce, brown sugar, honey, vanilla and cinnamon in a large bowl. Add flax seed meal and cashew pieces, stirring to combine. Spread oat mixture on the baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with raisins and stir to combine. Cool completely and store in an air-tight container. Granola should keep for a week in an air-tight container at room temperature. It also freezes well, place in air-tight container and freeze for up to 3 months.

Combine lemon juice and spices. Dredge scallops in paprika mixture. Place on hot grill for 5 minutes. Turn over and grill 2 minutes. Add butter, stirring until melted. Cook scallops in butter for 1 minute. Serve on bed of spinach.

Slice the mushrooms, set aside. In a large skillet fry the onions in the butter until lightly browned. Add the lemon juice and the chopped mushrooms. Add just enough water to cover the mushrooms and the lemon juice. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cover. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. In a small saucepan heat the beef broth just until it boils. In a bowl mix the flour with the sour cream. Gradually stir the flour mixture into the broth until smooth. Add the broth mixture to the mushroom mixture. Bring to a boil then simmer until thickened. Add the chopped dill. Serve immediately garnished with the sliced mushrooms.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 13 x 9 baking dish. Slice the squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds and pulp and place in the baking dish. Cut the apples into thin wedges and place around the squash. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar, flour, butter and salt. Stir in the cranberries and pour this mixture over the top of the apples and the squash. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour. Uncover and bake another 25 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped nuts and serve warm.

Heat 2 tablespoons of oil and butter in a large heavy skillet. Cook the onions until translucent. Add the ham, cook until browned. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Gradually stir in the water. Add the brown sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Simmer uncovered for 3 minutes. Add the whiskey and the salt and pepper. Serve over the ham.

In a small bowl mix cornstarch and flour. In a medium saucepan stir flour mixture with heavy cream and vanilla until smooth. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens and boils. Cool 30 minutes. With an electric mixer beat mixture until it is fluffy and thick enough to hold its shape. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper or silicone baking mat. Let cool completely and store in an air-tight container for up to 1 week.

Heat olive oil in skillet over high heat. Add steak and cook until browned on both sides. Remove steak from skillet. Stir potatoes into pan with oil from meat. Season with garlic powder and pepper. Cook over medium heat until browned and tender. Cut steak into thin slices. Stir steak and bell pepper into potato mixture. Stir in 3 tbsp water to thin sauce if desired. Serve over rice.

Cut off stem ends of jalapenos. Carefully slice peppers lengthwise, remove seeds and veins. Stuff each half with cheese mixture and sprinkle with cilantro. In a small bowl combine corn flakes and honey mustard. Press crumb mixture onto cheese-stuffed jalapenos. Place filled peppers, cut-side down, on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for about 20 minutes or until cereal crust is crisp and golden brown. Serve with sour cream or ranch dressing if desired.

Put water in a large pot and bring to a boil. Peel and cut up carrots and sweet potatoes into small cubes. Drop into water and boil for 15 minutes. Drain and add to the food processor. Add avocado to the pot and mash. Add stevia, water and mix in food processor. Serve warm.
Pumpkin is a squash and is one of the most popular vegetables. It is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae which also includes cucumbers and melons. The most common species is Cucurbita pepo which is native to North America. Pumpkin is an annual plant that generally grows to a height of 10 feet. The plant has large, lobed leaves and yellow flowers. The fruit is a globular shape and ranges in color from orange to grey. Pumpkins are used for food and medicinal purposes.
Pumpkin is a good source of beta carotene, vitamin A, vitamin B1, vitamin B2, vitamin C, vitamin E, potassium and fiber. It is also a good source of calcium, iron and magnesium.

Cook bacon over medium heat until evenly brown. Remove from pan and reserve. Clean the bacon fat from pan. Add diced onions to bacon fat. Saute until soft. Add cauliflower florets to pan. Add 2 cans chicken broth to the pan. Add the brie cheese to the pan. Cook over medium heat until the cheese melts. Add the red pepper to the pan. Blend in the condensed soup. Simmer until heated through. Serve with the bacon pieces. Garnish with the parsley.

Steam broccoli florets until bright green, about 5 minutes. Cool. Chop bacon into small pieces. Toss all of the above together in a large bowl. Whisk together the mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar and mustard. Add to broccoli mixture. Toss to combine. Refrigerate for several hours. Garnish with cheddar cheese.

Cook the bacon until crispy. Drain on paper towels. Slice the onion into thin slices. Peel the squash, slice off the ends, and halve lengthwise. Remove the seeds and stringy pulp with a spoon. Stir together the breadcrumbs and cheddar cheese. Spread the mixture into the cavity of each squash half. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until the squash is soft. Sprinkle with paprika and serve with the bacon on the side.

Toast your english muffins and place them on a baking sheet. Top each with 1 tbs of tomato sauce. Top each with shredded italian blend of cheeses. Top with bacon. Sprinkle with italian seasoning or oregano and bake in oven for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Beat 1 large egg white and 1/4 cup water in a mixing bowl until frothy. Add 3 cups chopped pecan halvestoss to coat evenly. Spread in a single layer on wax paper. Bake in a 250 degree f oven for 1 hour or until crisp and lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool for 30 minutes. Toss together 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar and 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon in a large mixing bowl. Add 2 tablespoons water. Stir until well blended. Pour over nuts and stir until well coated. Spread in a single layer on wax paper. Chill for 1 hour or until nuts are firm. Store in an airtight container up to 2 weeks.

In a small saucepan bring water to a boil. Add ravioli. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until cooked through. Drain. Transfer to a serving bowl. Add the remaining ingredients. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. When cool, cut into small bite size pieces and place in a bowl with the chopped radish, eggs, mayonnaise, yoghurt, and fresh parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place in a lettuce leaf and enjoy!

Slice carrots into rounds about 1/4-inch thick. Steam for 3-5 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain well. Combine the mayonnaise, horseradish and water to blend. Arrange the carrot rounds on a serving platter or shallow bowl. Spoon the mayonnaise mixture over the rounds and sprinkle with the breadcrumbs and butter. Chill until ready to serve.

Place dough in a large bowl. Add the bel paese and mix well. Divide the dough into 2 balls. Roll each ball out to about 8 inches in diameter. Spread the sauce evenly over the top of each dough. Sprinkle with corn kernels and pecorino romano cheese. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve with parsley.

Dip chicken in flour. In a shallow bowl, beat 1 egg. Dip chicken in egg. In a shallow bowl, combine bread crumbs and 1 teaspoon oregano. Dip chicken in crumb mixture. Heat a small amount of oil in a skillet. Brown chicken on both sides. Place 1/2 cup marinara sauce in the bottom of a kaiser roll. Lay a piece of cheese on top of the sauce. Add the chicken. Top with remaining sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut off green beans from the stem, leaving 3-inch section of stems attached to each bean pod. Cut stems in half crosswise. Add to shallots in a mixing bowl. Add garlic and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add 2 Tablespoons of the olive oil and cook for 1 minute longer. Pour green bean mixture into a shallow baking pan. Toss with remaining 1 Tablespoon olive oil and spread in a single layer in baking pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until beans are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with pine nuts or hazelnuts, if desired. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve hot or room temperature.

In a large oven-proof skillet or dutch oven, heat the oil. Sear the quarters on all sides for about 10 minutes. Add the bacon to the pan and cook for an additional minute. Add the potatoes and onions to the pan and toss to coat with the bacon fat. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the quarters on top of the potatoes. Add the fresh thyme and cover the pot with chicken stock. Bring the liquid to a simmer and place the pot in the oven. Cook for 2 hours or until the meat is tender. Serve with freshly chopped chives.

In a large skillet, brown potatoes in olive oil. Add green pepper, onion and garlic clove. Cook over med-low heat until tender crisp. Add broth and cover. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Add cornstarch mixed in water to thicken sauce. Add pepper to taste. Place potatoes in a serving dish. Top with pepper steaks.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the cooking spray in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until hot. Stir in the grits and cook 3-4 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring frequently. Gradually add the water, bouillon cube and garlic powder. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover and simmer 3 minutes or until most of the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the onion, butter, salt and peppercover and cook 5 minutes or until grits are creamy and tender, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat. Stir in the half-and-half and the cheeseheat through. Serve immediately.
name: easy beef and noodle skillet
ingredients: ground beef, egg noodles, mixed vegetables, diced tomato, beef stew seasoning, cheddar cheese, water
preparation:Brown beef, drain. Add water, tomatoes, veggies, seasoning and noodles. Simmer until noodles are tender. Turn off power. Sprinkle

Brown the sausage with the rice. Drain fat. Mix the eggs, milk and soup. Add to the rice and mix well. Add the cheese. Put the rice mixture in the bottom of the 9 X 13 inch pan. Melt the butter and pour over the top. Sprinkle the crumbs over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Serves 8.
