Prepare ramen according to package directions. Crush and set aside flavor packets. Prepare broccoli and bok choy according to package directions. Cool slightly. Toss with green onion, sunflower kernels, almonds, and dressing. Serve in a large bowl. Serves 4-6.

Melt the butter and add the sugar and milk. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Sift the flour and baking powder. Stir into the mixture and add the egg, cardamom and salt. Place mixture into a greased dish and bake for 30 minutes at 180c or until firm and golden brown. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350. Place all ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Beat at low speed with an electric mixer for 1 minute. Beat at high speed for one minute. Pour into a greased 10 inch pie pan. Bake for one hour. Cool. Top with whipped topping.

Melt the butter in a wok or large frying pan over moderate heat until foamy. Stir in the shallots, chili pepper, garlic and carrot. Stir fry for about 3 minutes. Pour in the vegetable stock and soy sauce. Cover the wok or frying pan and cook over low heat for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. Season with salt if necessary. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan combine the water and sugar. Stirring constantly, bring mixture to a boil and cook until sugar is completely dissolved. Remove from heat and add the ginger. Let steep for 15 minutes. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve and discard the ginger. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and water until smooth. Whisk into the citrus syrup and bring back to a boil, whisking constantly until the mixture is clear and thickened. Remove from heat and let cool completely. Transfer to a clean jar and store in the fridge up to 1 week. To serve, shake a bit of syrup into a glass of iced tea. You can also use the ginger citrus syrup to make a refreshing spritzer by combining the syrup with sparkling water and a splash of club soda.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Heat 1 tbsp. butter in a skillet over medium-high heat until foaming. Add steaks and cook for 3 minutes. Turn steaks and brown the other side. Transfer steaks to baking sheet and put in oven. Heat remaining 1 tbsp. butter in skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. Stir in soup and season with thyme, marjoram and salt and pepper. Cook until slightly thickened, 2-3 minutes. Remove steaks from oven. Stir in sour cream and green onions. Serve over cooked noodles.

Combine the first three ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Cut the apples into chunks and arrange in an 8x8 glass or ceramic baking dish. Pour the brown sugar mixture over the apples. Mix the remaining dry ingredients and stir in the melted butter until the mixture is coarse and crumbly. Sprinkle over the top of the apple mixture. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until the top is golden. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

In a blender, combine watermelon, sugar and lime juice until smooth. Pour into 4 glasses or a punch bowl, add rum and serve immediately. Mint leaves can also be placed in glasses and removed before serving.

In a small saucepan combine the wine, water, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add the salmon and simmer, covered for 5-6 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove the salmon from the pan and keep warm. Whisk the yogurt, cucumber, and dill in a small bowl. Season with salt. Serve the salmon with the cucumber sauce. Garnish with a few more dill sprigs, if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash Brussels sprouts and trim stems. Cut in half lengthwise. Arrange on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 20 minutes or until lightly brown. Remove from heat and add grapes. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and toss to combine. Serve on a bed of baby greens and sprinkle with toasted walnuts.

In skillet, brown pork chops on each side. Remove from heat. In same skillet, heat oil over med. heat. Stir in seasoned stuffing mix. Pour apple pie filling over the top of stuffing. Place pork chops on top. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until chops are cooked through.

Mix together the white and wholemeal flour. Add the salt to taste. Add the cream of tartar to the milk and mix into the flour. Add the syrup, knead and form into a ball. Roll into two equal balls. Place on a greased plate. Bake in a moderate oven for 25 minutes. Serve warm with butter.

Place chicken in slow cooker and add salsa, peanut butter, lime juice and soy sauce. Mix well and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Add ginger and cook 15 minutes longer. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with chopped peanuts and cilantro.

Melt chocolate and brummel and brown in small sauce pan over medium heat until smooth. Add condensed milk and stir. Cook over medium heat until smooth and boiling. Cook for another minute. Add vanilla and stir until combined. Remove from heat. Serve warm.

Beat eggs with an electric mixer until light and lemon-colored. Add sugar and beat until thick and pale yellow, scraping down sides occasionally. Add butter and beat until smooth. Stir in lemon juice and lemon zest. Pour into 6 individual serving dishes and chill for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, whip heavy cream in a chilled bowl until soft peaks form. Spoon over mousses and serve. Garnish with mint, if desired.

1 Bring the consomme and water to a boil in a large pot. Add the rice and stir to combine. 2 Cover and cook for about 20 minutes, or until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Fluff with a fork. Serve with the remaining tablespoon of butter and the lemon wedges.

Brown and drain ground chuck and onions. Add green pepper and cook until tender. Stir in rotel and cook 5 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper. Place 3 tortillas in a greased baking dish. Spread 1/2 of the meat mixture over the tortillas. Top with 1 can of ranch style beans. Repeat layers with remaining tortillas, beans, and meat mixture. Combine cream of chicken soup and velveeta and spread over meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve hot with lettuce and sour cream if desired.

Cook egg noodles. Drain. In saucepan combine mushroom soup, onion, tuna (drain before adding), and cooked noodles. Mix well. In 9x13 pan combine ingredients. Sprinkle with cheese, and bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.
Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain. Toss in pan with fennel, oil, capers, lemon juice and parsley. Add fish when cool enough to handle. Serve with parmesan cheese sprinkled over.

Pour water in a pot and boil. Add sugar and stir until it dissolves. Add the orange wedges. Simmer for 5 minutes and add lemon. Add the other two fruits and simmer for another 5 minutes. Add the red candies. Strain. Add the pineapple and cranberry juices. Serve while warm.

Whisk together honey, lime juice, and soy sauce. In a small bowl, combine honey-lime mixture and chopped cilantro. Rub lime-honey mixture over both sides of each chicken breast. Set aside. In another small bowl, combine 1/4 cup chili-garlic sauce and 2 tbsp. red pepper flakes. Thread chicken onto skewers. Place the skewers onto a broiler pan and brush both sides with remaining 1/4 cup chili-garlic sauce. Broil 4 inches from heat for 5 minutes on each side or until chicken is done. Serve with the reserved lime-honey mixture. Serve with rice.

Place cutlets in a baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Add white wine to the dish. Pour soup mix over cutlets. Mix all together. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour. Combine the half-and-half and dry mix. Cook and stir over medium heat until boiling. Stir in the garlic powder, pepper and tabasco. Serve over cutlets.

Prepare chicken as directed on package. In a skillet, saute mushroom stems and pieces in butter until tender. Stir in dressing mix and water until well blended. Add chickencook until no longer pink. Stir in soup, mushroom pieces, oregano leaves and cooked pasta. Heat through. Serve over cooked pasta. Makes 4 main dish servings.

In a medium bowl, combine butter, worcestershire, lemon juice, white sugar and paprika. Divide evenly and spread onto both sides of pork chops. Sprinkle with salt and cayenne pepper. Heat a skillet to medium-high and add butter and chops. Cook until browned. Serve on buns.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook sausage according to package directions. Remove from pan and cut into 1/2" slices. Unroll dough and separate into 8 triangles. Place 1 piece of sausage in each triangle, and sprinkle with cheese. Fold triangles over filling, press edges and seal. Place on greased baking sheet. Beat eggs and milk togetherpour over rolls. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine teriyaki sauce and soy sauce in a bowl and place chicken in the bowl, turning to coat. Cover and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, mix pineapple juice and brown sugar in a small bowl. Place in fridge. Slice chicken breast in half and place in a shallow dish. Drizzle with soy sauce. Place in fridge until ready to grill. In a small bowl combine teriyaki and soy sauce and add to chicken. Place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Meanwhile slice pineapple rings and toss with brown sugar and pineapple juice. Grill chicken until done. Assemble Hawaiian sandwich and top with pineapple slices. Makes 1 sandwich.

Place 1/2 teaspoon garlic and 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper on a small plate. Mix well and set aside. Place chicken pieces on top of garlic mixture and turn to coat both sides of the chicken pieces with the garlic mixture. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add oil. Add the chicken pieces and brown on each side about 4 minutes per side. Remove from pan. Add the roasted red pepper and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon garlic and saute 1 minute. Stir in the sun dried tomato and saute 1 minute more. Add the rosemary and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 20 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Remove the rosemary sprigs and set aside. Blend the cornstarch with a little of the broth and add to the sauce stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Simmer an additional 5 minutes. Add the basil and serve over the pasta of choice.

Combine first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Set aside. Add vinegar to oil in small bowlwhisk. Add pepper. Pour dressing over salad. Add feta cheese to top.
You can also check out these 2 recipes from The Best Recipes for Italian Salads.
You can also check out this 1 recipe from The Best Recipes for Feta Salads.

Cut chicken into 3-4cm slices, season with a little salt and pepper and sprinkle with mixed herbs. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a frying pan with the lemon slices. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan along with the lemon slices and the pesto. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the lemon slices are softened and the sauce has thickened a little. Meanwhile, heat a griddle pan until hot. Brush the chicken slices with a little of the pesto sauce, season with a little salt and pepper. Cook for about 4 minutes on each side or until the chicken is cooked through and has a crispy brown coating. Top with a little cheese before serving with the lemon slices and sauce on the side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine the tomatoes, garlic, vinegar, basil and peaches in a bowl. Mix well. Add the chopped red peppers and season to taste with salt and pepper. Place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 20 minutes until the tomatoes are softened and the peaches have begun to caramelize. Serve on toasted baguette slices.

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Dip in egg whites. Dip in bread crumbs. Place in butter in skillet. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes. Cut in pieces. Top with sour cream mixture. Add chopped parsley. Serve with mayonnaise.
Name: chicken Parmesan alfredoingredients: pasta sauce, alfredo sauce, mozzarella cheese, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, eggs, butter, garlic clove, boneless skinless chicken breasts, parsleypreparation:Cover bottom of 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish with pasta sauce. Layer with cooked pasta, mozzarella cheese. Spread alfredo sauce over top. Lay chicken on top. In small bowl combine breadcrumbs, egg, garlic, butter, parsley and salt. Sprinkle evenly over top. Bake uncovered 20 minutes.
Name: chicken Parmesan alfredoingredients

Combine cocoa, sugar and spices in small saucepan. Stir in milk. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils. Boil 30 seconds. Serve.
Mmmmm. I love cocoa, too.
I love hot chocolate! Thanks for all the recipes.

I have been drinking cocoa too! I just made some with 1 Tbs. peanut butter in it...it was very tasty!

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Spread the spears out on the sheet so they are not touching each other. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until they are crisp tender, about 10 minutes. While the spears are roasting, heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the butter and let it melt. Stir in the soy sauce and the vinegar. Remove from heat. When the spears are done, sprinkle with the sauce. Garnish with parsley if desired.
Cream cheese, butter and green olives together. Add in walnuts and green onions. Form into a ball and chill in fridge for several hours. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel potatoes and dice into 1/2 inch cubes. Toss in a medium bowl with the cornstarch, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Heat vegetable oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat until just smoking. Add potato mixture to the skillet, coating well. Pour in the butter and cook, stirring occasionally until the mixture is lightly browned and crisp in spots, about 8 minutes. Transfer to oven and roast until browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with parsley and lemon zest. Serves 4

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Cut the peeled onions into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Brush lightly with vinegar and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Arrange on a baking sheet, sprinkle with rosemary leaves. Roast until tender, about 20 minutes. Toss with additional vinegar, salt, pepper, and rosemary leaves to taste.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute roast until browned. Add onioncook until tender. Remove roast from skillet. In a large bowl, combine soy sauce and waterstir well. Add roastturn to coat. Pour half the soy mixture into the skilletcook over medium heat until mixture is thickened. Remove roast from skilletkeep warm. Add cabbagecook until tender. Return roast to skillet. Stir in flourcook until thickened. Serve roast over cabbage.

In a large saucepan combine all ingredients. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 35 - 40 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with pepperoni and cheese. Makes 8 servings.

In a 10-inch skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add salt pork. Fry until the pork is crisp and golden. Add the tomato, bell pepper, onion and garlic. Cook until the tomato is soft. Add the flour. Stir until it forms a paste. Slowly add the milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Cook until the mixture thickens.
I had a bit of a problem finding the exact recipe for a sauce that is used at the Panda Inn. I found many sauces that had a similar recipe. I did find one that was pretty close to what they use at Panda Inn. I will say that I did have to make a few adjustments to get the right taste that I remember. This sauce is a little spicy, so if you are not a fan of spicy foods then you will want to adjust the amount of chili paste you use.
In a saucepan add all the ingredients and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once it is boiling turn the heat down to low and let it simmer until it thickens up.
It will

In a medium saucepan, combine water and sugar over high heat until the sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add gingerroot and lemon. Cover and let stand for 2 hours. Drain the liquid and reserve for another use. Pour the tomatoes into hot sterilized pint canning jars. Pack the cherry tomatoes down into the jar. Add 1 tablespoon of the reserved liquid to each jar. Seal the jars immediately. Store in a cool dark place. Makes 4 (1/2-pint) jars.
If you are a fan of pickled vegetables and are looking for a simple recipe to make at home, this is it! The instructions are easy to follow and the recipe calls for simple pantry items.
These are a great side dish to serve with dinner.
You can easily substitute other vegetables if you don’t want to use zucchini.
You can also add any herbs or spices to the mixture that you like.
The recipe calls for zucchini and cherry tomatoes but you can easily substitute
Mix together all the above ingredients and refrigerate over night. Make sure the cream cheese is at room temp before mixing together. Serve with lettuce and tomatoes. Great side or lunch.

In a medium bowl, combine breadcrumbs, scallion, parsley, and seasonings. In another bowl combine flour, egg, and 1 tablespoon of milkbeat until smooth. Dip fish into batter. Drain excess batter and place on waxed paper-covered baking sheet. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Fry fish in oil until golden browndrain on paper towels. Coat with bread crumb mixture and place in baking dish. Bake at 350F for 35-45 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with tartar sauce.

In a skillet heat butter until melted. Add chicken to skillet and brown on all sides. Add tomatoes, celery, onions, parsley, zucchini, soup, sauce and water. Bring to a boil and cook 20 minutes or until done. Serve over hot rice. Garnish with green onions.

Cook meat in a skillet. Add cream of chicken soup, onion powder, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in cooked noodles. Pour mixture into 1-1/2 quart casserole. Combine butter and bread crumbs. Sprinkle over top of casserole. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter one side of each bun. Spread the mustard on the buttered side of each bun. Place the buns buttered side up in a baking dish. Sprinkle the tops of the buns with the swiss cheese. Combine the worcestershire and the garlic salt, pouring this mixture over the buns. Bake for 5 minutes or unil cheese is melted.

Cover peppers with water in a medium pot. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool until you can handle the peppers. Peel the peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. In a food processor or blender combine the peppers and onions. Process until smooth. Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the red pepper flakes and cook for another minute. Add the tomatoes with their juices and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the pepper puree and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce the heat to medium low. Simmer for about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the coconut milk. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Serve warm.

Rinse hen thoroughly inside and out. Combine poultry seasoning with adobo seasoning and dill weed. Sprinkle seasoning mixture inside cavity and inside the hen's body cavity as far as possible. Stuff the neck cavity with the seasoning mixture. Fold wings under hen's back and tuck them behind legs. Place hen on rack in roasting pan. Combine 2 tablespoons butter with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Place hen breast down on rack, spread the mixture on hen's back and sides. Bake at 425 degrees f for 1 hour. Reduce heat to 325 degrees f. Baste hen with pan juices every 15 minutes, turning hen over every 30 minutes. Bake until juices run clear when pricked with a fork. Remove hen from oven. Discard giblets. Carve hen and serve with seasoning mixture mixture.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine 1/2 cup melted butter, 1 cup chopped celery, and 1/2 cup chopped onions. Saute till tender. Beat 6 eggs and 1/2 cup water. Add to celery mixture and stir well. Add 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley and 1/2 teaspoon ground sage. Stir in 2 cups cooked and cooled cornbread. Mix in 2 cups chicken broth. Pour into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until top is golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut serrano peppers into 1/2 inch pieces. Wrap in bacon and cook till tender. Cube chorizo sausage. In a sauce pan combine all of the above ingredients with 1/4 cup of water. Cook until well blended. Pour into an 8 by 8 inch baking dish. Combine remaining water with extra sharp cheddar cheese in a bowl. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir well. Spread over the top of the buffalo turds. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until brown and bubbly. Serve with toothpicks or small plates.

Split french bread horizontally. Spread mayonnaise on bottom half. Add peppers, tomatoes and onion. Top with colby-monterey jack cheese. Spread top half with mayonnaise and place on top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Prepare a small bowl of boiling water. Add the margarine. Add the flour. Beat until the margarine is completely dissolved in the flour. Remove from the water. Add the water (and salt). Add the cheese. Beat until smooth. Add the egg. Beat. Place the batter in an ice cream scoop. Put into greased muffin tins. Bake in preheated oven at 375 for 20 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 12.
Combine peaches, crushed pineapple and sugar. Cook until soft, stirring frequently. Add jell-o mixture and bring to a boil. Cook until thickened. Store at room temperature for up to 3 weeks.

In a bowl mix together yoghurt, red chili powder, ginger-garlic paste and salt. Marinate the chicken with this mixture for 1 hour. Mix all tikka powder in a bowl. Heat olive oil in a pan. Add tikka powder. Stir for 1 minute. Place the marinated chicken legs in the pan. Add 1 cup of water. Cover the pan. Cook for 25-30 minutes.

Sift together flour and sugar. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add egg and mix until dough forms. Press into buttered 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes. Cool. Spread preserves over hot crust. Sprinkle with pecans. Let stand until chilled. Cut into squares.

Mix together in a large bowl the broccoli florets, grapes and celery. In a smaller bowl mix together the yogurt, light mayo, vinegar, sugar and salt. Add to broccoli mixture and gently mix. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight. Serve chilled.
Soak rice paper in warm water until soft. Lay on clean work surface and place 2 or 3 tablespoons filling in center, top with lettuce leaves and carrot sticks, roll up and serve with peanut sauce.

Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in 1 cup of the milk and the vanilla extract. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup of milk. Beat with electric mixer on medium-low speed for 1 to 2 minutes or until frosting is fluffy and smooth.
I had to get some recipes off the internet for my mother for her birthday cake this year. My sister had a great idea to make a 2 layer cake with a center filling of chocolate and a chocolate icing on top of the whole thing!
I hope these recipes help you too!
 chocolate icingingredients: cocoa, shortening, water, sugar, milkpreparation:Combine cocoa and shortening in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly while the mixture bubbles for 1 to 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Remove from heatlet cool to room temperature. Beat together the water and milk in a bowlgradually beat into cocoa mixture at low speed until blended. Beat in confectioners’ sugar at medium speed until blendedbeat in vanilla.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Wash the lemons and cut a thin slice from the end of each one. Cut the lemons into quarters and remove the seeds. Cut the quarters into thin strips. In a small bowl, melt the butter in the microwave for 15 to 30 seconds. Add the honey and stir. Remove the skins from the rosemary sprigs. Peel the garlic cloves. Add the rosemary sprigs, garlic cloves, lemon strips, honey mixture, salt, and pepper to the bowl with the melted butter. Whisk until the mixture is smooth. Place the chicken in a baking dish. Pour the mixture over the top of the thighs. Bake for 45 minutes. Check the internal temperature of the chicken with an instant-read thermometer. It should read 165 degrees. Remove from the oven and allow it to rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
Place the water and lime juice in a blender. Add the sugar and blend. Add the mango, pineapple and rum and blend for 30 seconds. Serve in glasses over ice.

In a large skillet, combine 2 tablespoons of the flour and the butter. Stir over medium heat until butter melts. Dip the chicken pieces one at a time into the flour mixture. Shake off excess. Saute in butter until no longer pink, about 6-7 minutes. Remove from pan and keep warm. Add cream to butter mixture and boil until thickened. Remove from heat. Add crabmeat and asparagus. Top the chicken with the mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Butter an 8x8-inch pan. In a large heavy saucepan, combine sugar and evaporated milk. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add butter, salt and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Add marshmallows and stir. Add chocolate chips. Spread evenly into buttered 8x8-inch pan. Chill until firm. Cut with a sharp knife. Makes about 2 pounds.

Scramble the egg. Fry the ham in a small amount of vegetable oil until crisp. Dice the onion and fry with a little vegetable oil until golden brown. Place the ham in the bottom of a small bowl. Layer in the ham, onion, egg, and potatoes. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 1 serving.

Prepare broccoli as directed on package. Drain. Cook rice as directed on package. Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine soup and mayo. Add lemon juice and curry powder. Add chicken and broccoli. Spoon into a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese and crumb. Bake uncovered 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cut the cabbage into quarters and core out the center portion. Put the cut portions into a pot with cold water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook for 10 minutes or until the leaves are tender but still firm. Drain the potatoes and cut them into small pieces. Heat the bacon drippings in a pot over medium heat and add the potatoes. Cook for 4 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Combine all of the first four ingredients and heat until the sugar dissolves. Add the boneless breasts and simmer 10 minutes. Add the cornstarch and mix well. Add the green peppers and cook 10 more minutes. Add the soy sauce and cook until the chicken is heated through. Serve on a bed of rice.
Puree first 3 ingredients. Add cool whipblend well.

Preheat your grill or broiler to high. Grill your rosemary and garlic cloves in the husk and the skin until you smell the rosemary and it is brown around the edges but not blackened. Grill the mozzarella until the outside is golden brown and the inside is just starting to melt. When the mozzarella is cooked place it in a warm place to keep it soft but not melty. Place the rosemary and garlic in the food processor or a blender and blend until smooth. Brush the insides of your buns with the rosemary and garlic butter and place under the broiler to warm until the butter is bubbling. Stack the mozzarella slices and top with slices of tomato. Season with salt and pepper and serve on the warm buns with a salad.

Soak split peas overnight or at least 4 hours in advance. Rinse well, add turmeric powder, onions and garlic clove. Pour water to cover the split peas by about 3 inches. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer until the split peas are soft and sloppy. Melt oil in another saucepan, add cumin seeds and stir for about 30 seconds. Serve split peas over rice or with peasant bread. Sprinkle with the fried cumin seeds and the pepper sauce.
Boil red potatoes and pepper until tender. Combine butter, garlic powder and salt in a bowl. Pour over the hot vegetables and stir to coat well. Serves 4-6.

Cut eggs in half lengthwise and remove yolks to a small bowl. Mash yolks with a fork and add cream cheese and mayonnaise. Mix in mustard and season with pepper and salt to taste. Fill each egg white with the mixture and top with a bit of parsley and a dash of paprika if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Wash the mushrooms well under running water. Remove the stems and chop them up with the garlic until well blended. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Heat the oven proof skillet over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned. Add the chopped mushrooms and garlic and cook until the liquid is evaporated. Add the milk and let it come to a boil. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Remove from the heat and season with salt and pepper. Stuff the mushrooms with the sausage mixture and sprinkle with the chopped green onions. Bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes until hot.

In a medium bowl, crush the candy bars with a rolling pin. In a medium saucepan, combine the chocolate syrup, butter, milk and candy bars. Heat until melted. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, sugar, vanilla and flour. Add the melted mixture alternately with the buttermilk. Pour into a greased bundt pan. Bake in a moderate oven. For topping: In a small saucepan, combine the remaining chocolate syrup, butter, milk and candy bars. Heat until melted. Pour over cooled cake.
Microwave oven, pie dish, spoon, large bowl, medium bowl, large saucepan, rolling pin, whisk or electric mixer, electric beater.
Ingredient Substitutions : Use 1 cup cake flour for all-purpose or pastry flour. If your chocolate bars are large or too large to fit in a rolling pin, break them up with a knife. Use a pastry blender for all-buttermilk pud

Fry bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Add tomatoes and fry until soft. Add monterey jack cheese and stir until cheese is melted. Spread mayonnaise on top half of each piece of bread. Add bacon, tomato mixture, lettuce and cheese. Close sandwiches and serve. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and slice the root vegetables into large chunks. Toss with a little olive oil and roast for 45-50 minutes or until the vegetables are soft. Remove from the oven and mash together with a potato masher or fork. Add the cheese and butter. Mash together until combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the chives before serving. Serve with a green salad or steamed green beans and a slice of toasted sourdough bread.
You are currently browsing the archives for the Turnip category.
Beat eggs with fork until well blended. Add beer, butter and seasonings. Heat until boiling and pour over toast. Serve immediately.

Sift together dry ingredients. Cream together shortening and sugar. Beat in egg. Beat in milk and vanilla. Fold in dry ingredients. Pour into greased 9 x 9 pan and bake at 375 F for 30 to 35 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar or drizzle with icing.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and line a 10 inch spring form pan. Cream together granulated sugar and margarine. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in flour, ginger and zest. Stir in lime marmalade. Pour into pan. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour or until skewer inserted in center comes out clean. Cool. Spread with lime curd. Sprinkle with sprinkles. Refrigerate. Cut with hot knife. Serve with lime curd.

Steam the potato and sweet potato until soft then mash them together with the curry powder and cumin. Cut up the pumpkin into small pieces and steam until soft then add to the potato mixture and mash everything together. Cook the onions in a pan with the garlic and a little bit of oil until soft then add the stock and bring to the boil. Puree the vegetable mixture and add to the stock. Cook until heated through then season and serve with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease muffin cups with cooking spray. Mix flour with baking powder and salt. Blend in brown sugar and stir in dried cranberries and pecans. Make well in center of mixture. Beat egg and milk with fork until smooth. Add to flour mixturestir just until blended. Fill muffin cups almost to top. Bake for 20 minutes or until tops are golden brown and muffins pass the toothpick test. Cool on wire rack.
The word "cranberry" comes from the word "craneberry", which comes from the Dutch word for "crane". The Dutch colonists thought that the flower of the plant resembled the neck of a crane. The flower has five petals and a large stigma (the sticky part). This is where the berry gets its name "bearberry".
In the wild, cranberries grow on low, vine-like shrubs in wet bogs and swamps. Cranberry bogs have very poor soil. It takes 80 pounds of cranberries to

Cook water to boil. Add scotch bonnet peppers and bay leaf. Add whole allspice, fresh thyme and salt. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add garlic and green onions. Cook 5 more minutes. Add shrimp. Cook 2 more minutes. Drain and serve over rice.

Sauté butter with celery, onion and red pepper till onion is transparent. Add chopped tomatoes, white wine and flour. Let this simmer until thickened. Add beef stock cube, salt & pepper and parmesan cheese and stir well until all is combined. Serve with toast or bread cubes.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, saute onion in oil until softened. Add garlic, coriander and cuminsaute 30 seconds more. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium, and add avocados and green peppercornscook 2 minutes more. Let cool slightly, then puree in blender until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with cilantro leaves. Makes 4 servings.

Place a wire rack in a rimmed baking sheet. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. In a large bowl, mix together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, five-spice powder, vegetable oil, salt and freshly ground black pepper until well combined. Add the chicken wings and turn them until they're coated in the marinade. Add the garlic cloves and stir until combined. Spread the marinated wings out on the wire rack and roast for 15 minutes. Remove the wings from the oven and spoon the sauce over them evenly, then return the pan to the oven. Roast for another 15 minutes, or until the wings are cooked through, golden brown, and crispy on the edges. Serve the wings warm with the sauce spooned over them.
Mix first four ingredients. Add warm water. Knead well. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into desired size. Fry in hot grease.

Mix together salt and pepper and set aside. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the pan and add the orange and ginger. Cook for about 30 seconds. Add the orange juice and vinegar and bring to a boil. Add the chicken and stir until the juice is absorbed. Cook for an additional minute.

Preheat the oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5. Place the peaches in a medium-sized saucepan with the lemon zest, juice, vanilla essence and the sugar. Heat the mixture until the sugar has dissolved. Add the macaroons and stir until the macaroons have all soaked up the juices. Put the macaroons into a shallow ovenproof dish. Cover with the peaches. Dot with the mint leaf. In a large bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff but not dry. Spread over the fruit and bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden.
Pour a shot of Baileys in an 12oz cup of freshly brewed coffee. Top off with some whipped cream and a cherry.
Mix tomatoes, basil and garlic in small bowl. Toss together in large serving bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top with parmesan cheese.

Combine butter and garlic over medium heat until butter melts. Add the vinegar and cook until liquid evaporates. Remove from heat. Add the pectin and sugar, stirring until completely dissolved. Pour into sterilized canning jars and seal.

Remove seeds from green chilies. Place cream cheese in a small bowl. Mix in salsa verde. Spread mixture in the green chilies. Lay steak in the center of each chile. Roll each chile around the steak. Place in a greased casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes.

Spread a few tablespoons of beans in the bottom of a 9-by-13-inch pan. Top with a few tablespoons of salsa. Spread a few tablespoons of guacamole over the top of the salsa. Spread a few tablespoons of the sour cream over the top of the guacamole. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the shredded cheese over the top of the sour cream. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the diced tomatoes over the top of the cheese. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the black olives over the top of the tomatoes. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the green onion tops over the top of the olives. Serve with tortilla chips.
I like it! It sounds yummy!
I am so hungry right now. I’m going to have to try out the corn dip recipe.
I know that recipes like this one are not for everyone. If you’re trying to eat healthy though, you can still do this. It’s all about the amount you use.

Soak peas in water overnight. Drain peas. Combine peas, onion and garlic in a large pot with water to cover. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer until peas are soft and water is evaporated. Add salt and pepper. Purée. Place in a serving dish. Top with oregano. Serve with biscuit.

Combine half-and-half and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in cornmeal and salt. Stirring constantly cook until mixture comes to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and parmesan until melted. Serve with freshly ground black pepper.
name: carolina macaroni salad
ingredients: macaroni &ampcheese dinner mix, butter, milk, miracle whip, hard-boiled eggs, green pepper, onion, sweet gherkin, black pepper, paprika
preparation:Boil the macaroni, drain thoroughly. To the macaroni add the butter, milk and cheese packet mixing well. Add the miracle whip, eggs, pepper, onion, sweet pickles and black pepper. Mix lightly. Sprinkle with paprika, cover and chill several hours or overnight.
name: pepperoncini cream cheese dip
ingredients: pepperoncini peppers, cream cheese, parmes

Mix cream cheese, italian seasoning and mozzarella cheese in small bowl until well blended. Spread evenly in 13x9 inch pan. Top with pizza sauce. Sprinkle with remaining cheeses and vegetables. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.
name: spicy cajun dipingredients: sun-dried tomato, reduced-fat cream cheese, nonfat plain yogurt, chili sauce, green pepper, green onion, garlic clove, celery seed, ground red pepperpreparation: In small bowl, pour 1 cup boiling water over tomatoes. Let stand at room temperature 5-10 minutes. Drain and chop tomatoes. Meanwhile, in another small bowl, combine cream cheese, yogurt and chili sauce. Mix well. Add tomatoes and all remaining ingredients. Mix well. Refrigerate till serving time. Just before serving. Stir dip. Serve with cut up fresh

Peel and pit nectarines. Cut crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Combine marmalade and margerine in small bowlmicrowave on HIGH for 30 to 60 seconds or until marmalade is softened and mixture can be stirred smoothly with a spoon. Combine marmalade mixture and marmalade-margarine mixture. Arrange nectarines on platter. Spoon marmalade mixture evenly over nectarineslet stand for about 5 minutes or until nectarines are coated with marmalade mixture. Spoon chocolate fudge topping over nectarinesserve immediately. Yield: 6 servings.

Combine first six ingredients. Cut scallops into 1/2-inch slices. Combine scallops with remaining ingredients and toss to coat. Heat 1 Tablespoon oil over medium-high heat. Cook 3 minutes. Turn scallops overcook another 3 minutes. Transfer to plate. Discard any remaining liquid. Reheat 1 Tablespoon oil over medium-high heat. Add parsley, cook until wilted. Serve with scallops.

In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the rice and stir to coat with the oil. Add the vermicelli and continue stirring until the rice is golden in color, about 3 minutes. Add the hot broth and stir to combine. Add the salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the rice is tender and the broth is absorbed. Serve.

Whisk together the soy sauce, vinegar, peanut butter, hot water and sesame oil. Put the broccoli florets into a large skillet with the oil. Sear until the broccoli is crisp-tender. Add the tofu. Add the soy-peanut butter mixture. Heat until hot. Garnish with the chopped cilantro or parsley.
Prepare tea as directed on the package. Sweeten to taste if desired. Add fruit juice and icepour over tea to serve. Garnish, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat, cook onion for 3 minutes. Add garlic and swiss chard. Saute until tender. Add basil, salt & pepper. In a separate bowl beat the eggs with water. Add the chard mixture and stir well. Pour mixture into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until firm.

In a large saucepan bring broth to a boil. Add kale and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat heat the olive oil until hot but not smoking. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until fragrant but not brown, about one minute. Add cannellini beans and cook for another minute or two until heated through. Add cooked kale and stir to combine. Toss with cooked pasta, season with salt and serve with parmesan cheese if desired.
Wash berries and remove stems. Combine berries with the sugar and 1 cup of water. Place over medium heat. Cook until berries are tender. Add more water if needed. Add salt. Serve warm.

Thaw rolls as directed. Spread each roll with 1 tbsp butter. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley. Roll up as directed. Place in greased 8x8x2 pan. Sprinkle with more cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 18-20 minutes until golden brown. Makes 12 rolls.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 13×9 inch pan. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and butter until well combined. Beat in the eggs and vanilla extract until smooth. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet and mix well. Spread into the prepared pan and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. While the brownies are baking, melt the vanilla chips and macadamia nuts in a double boiler or in the microwave until melted and combined. Remove the brownies from the oven and pour the vanilla chip mixture over the top. Spread evenly and return the pan to the oven for another 10 minutes or until the top is set. Cool in the pan before slicing and serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.In a small bowl combine hoisin sauce, orange juice, light soy sauce, olive oil. Brush beans with hoisin sauce mixture. Roast 20 minutes. In the last 5 minutes of cooking sprinkle with sesame seeds.Serve immediately.

Mix tuna with coleslaw dressing. Add onion, salt and pepper to taste. Fill a small ziplock baggie. Put a piece of tuna mixture at one end of the nori sheet. Roll up the sheet to enclose the filling. Continue until mixture is gone. Seal ends with water. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large bowl dissolve gelatin in the hot water. Add yogurt and beat at medium speed until blended. Spread over crust. Arrange peaches in rows on top of yogurt layer. Garnish with jam. Chill for several hours. Top with frozen whipped topping.

Cream together the cream cheese and sour cream. Stir in the yogurt until well combined. Add the dill and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the cucumbers. Garnish with the green onion. Chill for up to 2 hours. Serve with your favorite crackers.

In a large pan combine 3 cups of water with 3 tea bags (or use 3 tea bags for each cup of water) and 2 cups of juice. Heat for 5 minutes and remove tea bags (if using). Add 3 cups of sugar, bring to a rolling boil and then add 1 package of liquid fruit pectin. Boil for 1 minute and remove from heat. Quickly pour into sterilized canning jars and place in a water bath canner (or use the stove top method). Let stand until cooled.
name: strawberry margarita jellyingredients: strawberries, lime juice, white wine vinegar, white sugar, fresh squeezed lime juice, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, saltpreparation:Prepare strawberries. Mash with a potato masher. Measure white wine vinegar and lime juice. Add strawberries. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain through cheese cloth into a large bowl. Add 1/4 cup of water. Mash

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add onions and cook until soft and lightly caramelized, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Peel eggs, discarding shells. Chop white and yolk separately. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl. Add cooled onions to bowl and mix until well combined. Chill at least 30 minutes before serving. Serve chilled or at room temperature with crackers or bread slices. Makes 4 cups.

Grate the zucchini and squeeze out the liquid using a clean dish cloth or paper towel. Blend together the zucchini, sugar substitute, oil, and vanilla in a large bowl using a mixer on medium speed until smooth and creamy. Stir in the flours, baking soda and powder, and salt with a wooden spoon or spatula until combined. Stir in the cocoa and nuts by hand. Spread in a greased 10-inch square baking pan. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until set. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Cut into 16 bars and serve at room temperature or refrigerate and serve cold.

drain tuna, add all other ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix well.
I hope you have enjoyed reading my post on how to make healthy tuna salads that are delicious!
I wish you great luck with this!
Please feel free to leave comments about your experience with this recipe or your favorite tuna salad recipe below!
If you like this recipe you can find more recipes on the Recipe Index Page!

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the sherry, ginger and garlic cloves. Cook until ginger is tender. Add the dry crushed red pepper and the brothcook until mixture is reduced by half. Stir in the cornstarch until smooth. Cook and stir until thickened. Add the soy sauce and chili-garlic sauce. Stir until heated through. Serve over cooked noodles.

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt margarine. Add chili powder, garlic salt, and onion powder. Stir to mix well. In a large bowl, pour margarine mixture over popped popcorn. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and toss to coat well.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel and trim beets. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Toss with water in a casserole dish. Cover and bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until tender. Stir occasionally. Mince garlic. Heat oil in skillet. Add garlic. Stir 1 minute or until garlic is golden. Add spinach. Stir until wilted. Remove from heat. Combine spinach mixture with beets. Serve on bed of spinach. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar. Top with goat cheese. Garnish with basil.

Cook chicken in skillet with olive oil over medium heat until tender. Remove chicken. Saute onion & garlic in same skillet until tender. Stir in chicken broth & milk. Heat until bubbly. Add chicken back into sauce. Add cheese & sour cream. Heat until cheese is melted. Serve with hashbrowns.

Cook grits according to package directions using water. When cooked add shredded Velveeta and grits spread. Stir until melted. Stir in garlic spread and shrimp. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients and mix well. Transfer to baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees until brown and bubbly.

In heavy bottomed saucepan, combine all ingredients except nuts. Bring to a boil over medium heat and boil hard for 1 minute. Add nuts and boil for 1 minute more, stirring constantly to avoid burning. Remove from heat and quickly pour onto buttered cookie sheet to cool. Cut into squares with knife dipped in hot water or use scissors to cut. Store in tightly covered container.

In a bowl, combine rice vinegar, sugar, salt and chile, then stir in shallotset aside. Cut off both ends of each cucumber, then slice it lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices. Add to bowl with shallot mixturetoss to coat evenly. Serve immediately topped with chopped cilantro leaves.
Melt butter in skillet. Add onion and brown until tender. Add broccoli and brown. Add remaining ingredients and cook until heated through.

In a large saucepan or pot heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened about 3 minutes. Stir in the rice. Cook for a couple minutes. Stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cover. Simmer until the rice is tender about 35 minutes. Stir in the broccoli. Cover. Simmer until the broccoli is tender about 5 minutes more. Remove from the heat. Stir in the butter and the cheese. Serve.

Rinse and soak the barley in cold water for about 4 hours. Drain well. In a large pot bring the broth to a boil. Add the barley and cook on low for 1 hour. Drain the barley. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a large bowl. Add the cooked barley. Toss well. Serve right away or refrigerate up to 2 days.

Rinse the rice until the water runs clear. Add the rice and the water to a pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to a simmer and cover the pot. Cook for 30 minutes or until the rice is tender and most of the liquid has been absorbed. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool slightly. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the ginger and stir-fry until softened and aromatic. Add the mince and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until browned. Add the oyster sauce and the chilli-garlic sauce and stir to combine. Turn up the heat and add the shallots and stir-fry for 1 minute or until the shallots have softened and turned golden. Return the cooked rice to the pot and add the mince mixture and the sauce to the rice and stir to combine. Add the cornflour mixture and the oyster sauce to a small bowl and mix well to combine. Pour the sauce mixture over the top of the rice and mix well to combine. Heat over medium heat until the sauce has thickened slightly and

In a small bowl whisk together egg and mustard. Dip each side of each lamb chop in egg mixture, then in bread crumbs and sesame seeds to coat both sides. In a skillet over medium heat melt 1 tbsp of butter and saute chops until well browned (about 2 to 3 minutes per side). Transfer to a plate. Add a tbsp of butter to pan and saute vegetables until tender (about 5 minutes), then pour over chops. Add the remaining butter and 2 tablespoons of water to pan and bring to a boil for 1 minute. Whisk together until butter is well blended and sauce is thickened. Pour over chops and serve.

In large bowl, combine milk, vanilla, brown sugar, eggs. In medium bowl, combine bread cubes and apple. Pour milk mixture over bread mixture. Toss gently. Pour into well-greased shallow baking dish. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until firm. Serve warm.

In 12x9x2 pan, layer pasta sauce. Top with pasta. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. In pan, mix together sausages, water, peppers, onion & garlic powder. Spoon over top of pasta. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake 15 minutes more.

Saute chicken with butter in a skillet until cooked. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Add the Parmegiano-Reggiano. Continue to saute until browned. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped parsley. Serve at once. Serves 4.

Combine the granulated sugar and 2 tablespoons water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Let the caramelized mixture boil until thickened and the liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes. Whisk together the soy sauce and orange juice in a small bowl and set aside. Remove the ginger, peppercorns, and cilantro from the hot oil and set aside. Season the fish on both sides with 1/4 teaspoon pepper and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Pour the caramelized glaze over the fish and let stand until ready to cook. Heat the oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until very hot, about 4 minutes. Add the fish in a single layer and sear until browned on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side for medium rare. Sprinkle with the ginger, peppercorns, and cilantro and drizzle with the soy glaze. Serve immediately.
I use to make this dish at home with my kids and now I make it here at the restaurant

Combine breadcrumbs, dijon, salt and pepper. Dredge pork chops in mixture. Heat 2 tablespoons butter in skillet. Add pork chops. Brown on one side. Turn. Add 2 tablespoons butter. Add lemon juice. Cook for 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with capers. Serve.
In a jar with a lid combine the mustard and red wine vinegar. Cover and shake well to mix. Add the olive oil and shake to mix. Add the tomatoes, scallions, capers, parsley and dill. Cover and shake.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain and crumble. Cut up the red onions into small pieces. Cut up the green bell peppers into small pieces. Drain the pork n beans. Cook the red onions and the green bell peppers in the bacon grease until tender. Add the bacon. Add the yellow mustard. Add the light brown sugar. Add the chili sauce. Add the barbecue sauce. Add the spicy barbecue sauce. Add the cajun seasoning. Mix together. Bake at 350 for one hour. Serve hot.
In a large skillet, heat the oil. Add the onion and saute until softened. Add the mixed greens. Stir in the salt. Remove from heat. Add the penne. Toss together. Top with the feta.

In a small saucepan combine all ingredients and bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer for about 10 minutes, or until cranberries pop. Turn off heat and let cool. Cover and refrigerate. Serve chilled.
This is the best sauce I have ever tried. It's sweet and tart and delicious.
Great recipe, but you don't say when to add the dried cherries.
I'm sure it's an oversight.

Place a handful of basil leaves in the bottom of a large serving platter. Place the garlic in a mortar or a food processor. Add the olive oil. Process or crush the mixture into a paste. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Lay the grape tomatoes evenly over the basil. Scatter the chives over the top of the tomatoes. Top with the garlic-oil mixture. Garnish with the remaining basil.
Dissolve cornstarch in cold water in a medium bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients. Heat in a small saucepan on medium heat until mixture thickens and bubbles form. Cool completely. Serve.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and red chilies and saute till the onion is soft. Add the chicken and saute until brown. Add the basil and water. Bring to boil. Lower the heat and simmer until the liquid is almost evaporated. Add the sugar and stir to dissolve. Stir in the coconut milk and the cilantro roots. Stir and cook until the sauce thickens. Serve with cilantro sprigs.

Prepare pie shells according to package directions. In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs. Stir in the half-and-half and salt and pepper. Fold in the ham. Spread the mixture into the prepared pie shells. Sprinkle the mozzarella and cheddar over the top of each. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 to 20 minutes, or until set. Serve warm.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Place in a small bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use. Shake before using.

Place pheasants in a large stockpot with the water. Salt to taste. Bring to boil and skim foam. Add the onion, celery, carrots and mushroom. Bring to boil and cook for 30 minutes. Add the low sodium chicken broth and cook for another 10 minutes. Add the egg noodles and cook for another 5 minutes or until noodles are done to your liking. Remove the pheasant and serve with the broth and the vegetable mixture.
Peel and dice potatoes. Add garlic powder, salt, pepper. Add cider vinegar. Let set until warm. Add red onions. Add oil. Add dill weed. Mix well.

Combine dry ingredients. Add liquid ingredients and oil. Knead lightly for about 5 minutes. Let rise for about 1 1/2 hours or until doubled in size. Roll out to desired thickness and length. Bake in a 400 degree preheated oven for about 15 minutes, until golden brown. Makes 8 large rolls or 16 small rolls.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a 1-quart microwavable casserole dish combine sugar snap peas and 2 Tbsp water. Cover dish with plastic wrap. Cook on high until tender crisp. Uncover. Cook 2-3 minutes longer. In a small skillet heat 1 Tbsp butter and 1 minced garlic over medium heat until melted. Stir in sugar snap peas and lemon juice. Cook 1-2 minutes or until heated through. Season to taste with lemon zest and salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Rub a whole chicken inside and out with 1 tablespoon seasoning salt. Place in roasting pan breast side up. Baste with barbecue sauce. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Sprinkle with remaining tablespoon seasoning salt. Sprinkle with pepper to taste. Cook for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes, basting every 15 minutes with barbecue sauce. Serve with leftover barbecue sauce.

In a saucepan, melt butter. Saut onion in butter until soft. Stir in flour and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Gradually stir in stock. Stir in beef. Cook until meat is tender. Stir in bread. Add cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with hot cooked rice.
1. Wash and quarter the squash. Steam in a skillet or saucepan over water until al dente.
2. Heat the butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Saute the onions until translucent.
3. Add the steamed squash and season with salt and pepper to taste.
1. Heat butter in heavy saucepan. Saut onions, celery, and barley in it. Sprinkle with flour. Gradually stir in hot broth.
2. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer, covered, for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until barley is very tender.
3. Remove from heat and add cream.
1. I a medium saucepan, combine pumpkin,

Preheat oven to 160 degrees celsius. Grease baking tray. Cream together butter, sugar and condensed milk until light and creamy. Fold in sifted self raising flour and dark chocolate chips. Place teaspoons on baking tray and bake for 10 - 12 minutes or until golden brown and firm. Remove and allow to cool before storing in an airtight container.
Mix together in a large bowl all of the above ingredients except the hard boiled eggs. Refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, add the eggs and mix well. Toss in the peas just before serving.

Cut the pork into 1/2-inch thick slices. Put the flour in a bowl. In another bowl, combine the butter, broth, ginger, Dijon mustard, grainy mustard, and scallions. Dip each slice of meat into the flour mixture to coat evenly. Then dip into the broth mixture to coat evenly. Heat the butter and oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the slices of meat in batches, turning once, until browned on both sides. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except pecans and morsels. Drop by tablespoons on a ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Melt semisweet chocolate morsels. Stir in pecans. Drop by teaspoons on top of each cookie. Cool.

In large microwave bowl combine chocolate pudding mix, evaporated milk and sugar. Beat at high speed for 2 minutes or until well mixed and thick. Add melted butter and beat at low speed until well blended. Stir in nuts. Spread in greased 9 inch square baking dish. Refrigerate for several hours or until firm. Cut into squares and serve with whipped cream if desired.

Saute onion and garlic until soft and translucent. Stir in white beans. Cook for about 1 minute. Add tomato sauce and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Add pasta. Cook for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Rub chicken with cooking sherry and balsamic dressing. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Heat grill to medium heat. Grill chicken tenders for 3-4 minutes per side until cooked through. Remove from grill and brush with remaining balsamic dressing. Garnish with italian parsley and sliced red onion. Serve with baguette slices for dipping.
Spread tortillas with cream cheese. Add green onions and garlic and sprinkle with seasoning salt. Roll up and refrigerate. Cut each roll into 1/2 inch pieces and serve with salsa.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook sausage until browned. Add the vegetables and cook until crisp-tender. Add the pasta sauce and stock cube. Bring to a boil. Simmer about 5 minutes. Stir in mozzarella cheese. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with fresh herb. Serve immediately.

Peel baking potato and cube. Saut onion in skillet with a little butter or olive oil, stirring often. Add cubed potato and enough water to cover. Boil 10-15 minutes or until tender. Add cream of potato soup. Add cream of tomato soup. Heat until warm. Stir in curry powder and salt. Serve with grated cheese on top and a small pat of butter or olive oil. Yummy!

In a large bowl, stir together first 5 ingredients. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, heat butter, corn syrup and brown sugar until butter is melted. Remove from heatstir in vanilla. Pour over cereal mixturestir until well coated. Spread onto waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Cool completely. Break into pieces. Store in an airtight container.

In a medium saucepan, saute green onion and mushrooms in butter till tender. Stir in rice and broccoli. Add hollandaise sauce mixstir in water. Heat till bubbly. Add chicken and heat through.
The recipe calls for a 12 oz. Box of wild rice. What is this in cups?

In a 2-quart saucepan, combine the orange juice and curry powder and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Add the mandarin oranges and carrotcook for 5 minutes or until the carrot is tender-crisp. Serve immediately or cool and refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 1 day. Garnish each serving with 1/4 cup grapes and 1 teaspoon lemon juice just before serving. Yield: 4 servings.

Boil new potatoes until tender. Drain. Toss with fat free ranch dressing, lime juice, jalapeno peppers and lime zest. Add jicama, avocados, tomatoes and cilantro. Toss well. Garnish with green onions.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, green pepper and garlic and cook about 3 minutes. Add eggs and cook 3 minutes. Stir in cheese until melted. Add giardiniera and cook about 2 minutes. Spoon into hoagie rolls and top with tomatoes. Serve immediately.
Beat the margarine, sugar, vanilla and liquid together. Add the dry ingredients to the mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper. Bake at 375 until lightly browned.

In a 12 inch skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add pepper and mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large bowl, combine salt and pepper. Add 1/2 cup of water to mixture and stir until smooth. Add steaks and coat with mixture. Return to skillet and heat over medium high heat for 3 minutes on each side or until cooked to desired degree of doneness. Remove and place in a warm place while you prepare teriyaki baste and glaze. In a small bowl, combine all baste and glaze ingredients. Brush glaze over meat and allow to rest for about 3 minutes before serving.

Heat the oven to 400f. Brown the sausages in olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat until just done, about 10 minutes for each kind. Remove from heat, cut open and remove the casing. Cut the bell peppers into strips, then cut the strips in half crosswise. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in another large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, stirring frequently until golden but not brown, about 1 minute. Add the pepper strips and onion slices, stirring constantly until all are browned. Add the cooked sausages, stirring until thoroughly heated. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a 2 quart casserole dish. Bake until bubbly and browned at the edges, 20 to 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla extract and mashed bananas until well blended. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in cinnamon. In another bowl combine flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Gradually add the dry mixture into the batter until well mixed. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and stir in granola cereal. Let cool on cookie sheets for one minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Heat the oil in a large pan and saute the shallots and garlic. Stir in the stock and bring to a simmer. Add the peanuts and cook for another minute or so. Whisk in the soy sauce and molasses. Bring to a boil and simmer for a few minutes. Stir in the lime juice and ginger. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

In a large bowl, combine the baby spinach, apples, and onions. Add the dressing and toss well. Let stand 5 minutes. Add the jalapeño pepper and cilantro just before serving. Makes 6 servings. Per serving (excluding unknown items): 57 calories, 5 g fat (1 g saturated fat), 2 mg cholesterol, 12 g carbohydrate, 3 g protein, 1 g dietary fiber, 217 mg sodium. Calories from fat 33%.

Preheat broiler. Sprinkle both sides of steak evenly with salt and pepper. Brown steaks in hot oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Transfer to plate. Pour off fat from skillet. Add crushed tomatoes, potatoes, onion, and green pepper. Cover and cook until potatoes are tender crisp. Remove from heat. Top potatoes with steak. Sprinkle with basil and red pepper. Broil 1 minute on each side until cheese is melted.

Wash, dry, and devein the peppers. Slice peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes. Place pepper halves in a small saucepan. Add the water. Cover. Bring to a boil and cook for about five minutes or until the peppers are soft. Drain the peppers. Combine the cooked chicken and cream cheese in a medium bowl. Season the mixture with salt & pepper to taste. Divide the mixture evenly among the pepper halves. Place a cherry tomato in the center of each pepper half. Sprinkle the pecans over the top. Bake the poppers at 350 degrees for about ten minutes or until the peppers are crisp-tender. Serve warm or cold.
Cube cream cheese into 36 pieces. Place on serving tray. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour dressing over cheese and toss lightly. Refrigerate at least 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees. Cut each breast half into 3-4 strips about 3/4-inch wide. In a large mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Add breadcrumbs and stir until well coated. Dip each strip into mixture then place in shallow baking dish. Bake 1 hour or until no longer pink in center. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

Chop the shallot and garlic clove fine and place them in the mixing bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Beat the cottage cheese and cream cheese with the shallot and garlic to a smooth paste. Heat the butter over medium heat and add the camembert and paprika stirring to melt the camembert completely and combine with the butter. Stir the seasoning salt and pepper into the camembert and butter and remove from the heat. Beat the mixture into the cottage cheese and cream cheese and combine thoroughly with an electric hand mixer. Serve as a spread or dip with crackers or crudites.

Place fish in a shallow baking dish. Add bay leaf and butter. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Remove from oven. Add scallions, mushrooms and beef stock. Sprinkle with worcestershire sauce. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.
 codfish rollsingredients: cod fish fillets, melted butter, sour cream, mayonnaise, minced onion, lemon juice, parsleypreparation:Place 4 fillets in a 13x9 inch pan. Melt butter in a saucepan. Stir in sour cream and mayonnaise. Heat through. Stir in the minced onion and lemon juice. Spread over the fillets. Cover and chill 1 hour. Combine the remaining ingredients. Spread over the fillets. Roll up and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a sheet pan with foil spray pan with non-stick cooking spray. In a large bowl toss together the chicken wings, lemon juice, garlic salt and kosher salt until well coated. Sprinkle with dried thyme, cayenne pepper and black pepper. Spread the wings on the pan in a single layer. Roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the wings are cooked through and no pink remains when the juices are checked with a fork. Serve warm with extra lemon wedges on the side for dipping.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 13 x 9 inch glass or ceramic baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the asparagus, scallions, cheese, and eggsmix well. Pour into prepared dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the eggs are cooked through. Top with sour cream. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Add mashed potatoes. Add nuts. Add vanilla. Sift together dry ingredients. Add to potato mixture. Add milk. Spread batter in greased pan. Bake 50 minutes.

In a small saucepan combine the sugar, cornstarch and water. Stir and cook until thick and bubbly. Add the cherries and cook for 2 more minutes. Spread in unbaked 9 inch pie shell. Cut butter into flour until it looks like a course meal. Mix in brown sugar and oats. Sprinkle over the top. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes or until golden.

Heat the oil in a large pan and add the garlic cloves and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant and then add the brussels sprout and cook for 3 minutes. Season to taste with the salt and lemon zest and serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the garlic, salt and cayenne. Add the paprika. Set aside. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. Thread 6-8 large raw shrimp onto each of 4 skewers. Brush with olive oil. Sprinkle with the paprika mixture. Grill the shrimp for 3 minutes. Turn and brush with more olive oil. Grill for another 3 minutes. Brush with lemon juice and sprinkle with more paprika. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Sift the ground almonds and cocoa together. Peel the banana and orange and blend together with the cocoa mixture. Add the orange juice and rind and blend until smooth. Divide into small balls and roll in the blanched almonds. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove wings from package, rinse off skin. Place wings in a shallow baking dish. Combine the remaining ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour mixture over the chicken wings. Cover and bake for 1 hour, turning once halfway through cooking time. Makes 4 servings.

Cook potatoes in boiling water for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drainplace in a bowladd the remaining ingredientstoss to coatspread in a greased 13 inch x 9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until potatoes are heated through and lightly browned on top. Serve with additional crushed red pepper flakes if desired.

Place 4 graham cracker halves in an ungreased shallow dish. Broil 10 in. From the heating element 5-8 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Place 1/4 cup miniature marshmallow halves over each cracker square. Broil 1-2 minutes or until marshmallows are puffed and lightly browned. Remove from oven. Place 1 square of semi-sweet chocolate on each cracker half. Arrange 3 raspberries on each chocolate covered cracker half. Chill 15 minutes before serving.
This entry was posted on Wednesday, March 21st, 2007 at 12:01 am	and is filed under Desserts, Recipes. You can follow any responses to this entry through the RSS 2.0 feed. Both comments and pings are currently closed.
I am so happy that you posted these recipes! I love Rice Krispie treats but I think I will try some of your other ones as well!
These look so good, I think I

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt butter. Add garlic cloves and saute until tender. Add the raw shrimp and cook until just opaque. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 1 minute. Serve hot. Serves 2.
In the jar of a blender, combine the banana, orange juice, nectarine and milk. Blend on high speed or ice crush setting for 40 seconds or until smooth. Pour into a glass. Serve immediately.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook for 5 minutes on each side until browned. Remove the breasts from the pan and set aside. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil and the ginger and garlic to the pan. Saute for 1 minute. Add the onions and saute for 5 minutes. Add the red pepper and saute for 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and coconut milk and stir to combine. Add the coconut milk and stir to combine. Return the chicken to the pan. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve garnished with the coriander.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 13x9x2 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In large skillet brown beef and onion over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in taco seasoning and watermix well. Add beans and mix well. Remove from heat. In small bowl mix soup and ranch dressing. Spread half of beef mixture in baking dish. Top with ranch mixturespread remaining beef mixture over top. Sprinkle with cheesebake uncovered 20 minutes or until bubbly and heated through. Remove from ovensprinkle with crushed doritos and bake 10 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with lettuce and tomato slices if desired.

Sift flour, rolled oats, wheat flour, wheat germ, sugar, salt, baking powder in a large bowl. Combine eggs, milk and oil in small bowl. Stir into flour mixture. Stir in pecans. Cook on hot waffle iron. Yields 6 waffles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare brownie mix as directed on box. Bake for 20 minutes. Let cool. Spread with sweetened condensed milk. Top with coconut and sprinkle with butterscotch chips. Add chocolate chips and nuts. Spread over top. Bake for 20 minutes longer. Cool and cut into bars.

Heat 1/2 inch of vegetable oil in a frying pan and fry onions till soft. Add aubergines and fry for 10 minutes. Add chilis, tomatoes and garlic. Simmer until the mixture has become thick. Add cheese and tabasco. Remove from the heat. Place pita bread on the table and allow everyone to fill their own.
Peeled radishes and carrot are julienned or grated. Sugar, vinegar and salt are added to taste. Serve cold.

Place water in bread pan. Add olive oil. Measure flour. Add salt. Measure and add yeast. Measure and add dill. Measure and add garlic. Measure and add milk. Measure and add cornmeal. Select dough cycle. Begin mixing. Remove dough to a greased surface. Knead 3 to 5 minutes. Divide in half and shape into two 10-inch ropes. Place 1 rope on each end of a greased baking sheet. Brush with butter. Sprinkle with dill. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes. Turn breadsticks. Bake 5 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle with dill. Cool on wire racks. Makes 2 loaves.

Cream together butter, brown sugar, and egg. Stir in vanilla, orange zest, and juice. Mix in buttermilk baking mix. Stir in walnuts and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 9 to 11 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine shrimp with seasonings & toss gently. Spread evenly in one layer onto baking sheet. Roast until cooked through. Remove from oven & allow to cool slightly. Combine egg white with 2 tsp of water and beat with fork until fluffy. Brush bread slices with olive oil and sprinkle with seasonings. Top each slice with a layer of shrimp. Sprinkle with green onions & plum tomatoes. Top with brushed bread and sprinkle with cheese. Place in oven and broil until toasted. Serve warm.

In a large skillet, brown meat, onion and garlic powder until meat is cooked through. Drain fat from meat mixture. In a medium pot, combine broth, milk, salt and pepper and evaporated milk. Cook on low for 1 hour or until thickened. Add cooked meat mixture, onion powder, worcestershire sauce, and cook for 20 more minutes. Serve over toast or biscuit.
Melt butter over medium-low heat. Whisk in cream and lemon juice and bring to a gentle boil. Remove from heat. Whisk in shallot and wasabi paste. Let cool to room temperature. Whisk in tamari.

Combine the first four ingredients in a large bowl and whisk until smooth. Stir in the sour cream and mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours or until ready to serve. Stir well before serving. Serves 12-15.

Clean mussels by rinsing them under cold water. Scrub beards off of them. Place them into a large cooking pan. Add lime juice. Add white wine and bring to a boil. Add Thai red curry paste. Add garlic. Add fish sauce. Add white sugar. Add cilantro. Cover and cook until done. Serve with crusty bread.
Wash and hull papaya. Slice papaya in half and remove seeds. Blend papaya with strawberries. Mix in yogurt and milk and honey to taste. Serve immediately. Garnish with mint if desired.

Mix 1 cup of boiling water with 1/2 cup of sugar and 1 packet of instant espresso in a bowl. Let the mixture sit for 2 minutes. Beat 1/4 cup of cold water into the espresso mixture. Stir in 3/4 cup of cold water. Beat in 1/2 cup of heavy cream and 1/2 cup of milk and pour into an ice cream maker. Beat in 1 teaspoon of rum and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Let churn in the maker for 15-20 minutes, or until thick and frozen. Remove the ice cream from the maker and freeze until firm. Sprinkle with walnut halves and serve immediately or transfer to an air-tight container and freeze until needed.

In a small saucepan, combine sour cherries, water& cinnamon stick. Bring to a boil& simmer for 15 minutes or until cherries are tender. Add cornstarch& sugar, stirring until mixture thickens. Add brandy& simmer for 1 minute. Stir in lemon juice & cool to room temperature before serving. Serve warm or cold over icecream or pound cake.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse catfish and pat dry. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice and olive oil. Season with Cajun seasoning and thyme. Arrange fillets in a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish and brush each with the oil mixture. Sprinkle the pecans and Parmesan over the top of the fillets. In a large bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and parsley. Pour the oil mixture over the crumbs. Mix well. Spoon the crumb mixture over the fillets and bake for 25 minutes or until the topping is golden brown. Serve with your favorite vegetables or over a bed of rice.

Peel, core and slice the apples and place them evenly in a square baking dish. Sprinkle the brown sugar, oatmeal and spices on top. Melt the butter and pour it over the top. Bake at 375 degrees F for 45 minutes or until the top is brown and the apples are tender. Serve warm.

Bring a pot of water to a boil and add spaghetti. Cook until al dente (according to package instructions). Drain and set aside. In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the sesame seeds and stir-fry until they turn golden. Set aside. In another pan, add the remaining oil and heat. Add the garlic and saut for about 1 minute. Add the soy sauce and sugar and let it boil. Add the water and spaghetti. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add the sesame seeds and stir-fry until the spaghetti is coated with the soy sauce. Serve garnished with the green onion.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix stuffing mix with water and butter until well blended and set aside. Cut the top off the bread and hollow it out to form a pocket and then stuff with turkey and gravy, then put the top back on the bread and press together to seal it.
