In a small bowl, combine the juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, and Tabasco sauceset aside. In a large resealable plastic bag or other large container with a tight-fitting lid, combine the chicken wings with the sauceseal the bag and turn to coat. Chill for 2 hours. When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the chicken wings on a baking sheet, and bake for 30 to 45 minutes, or until cooked through. Drain the wings, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the cranberry sauce with the reserved cooking liquidcook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Serve with the chicken wings.
Melt butter. Add flour and stir constantly. Add broth and water gradually. Add chipotle peppers. Season to taste. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream. Serve over your favorite taco salad.

In a large stockpot bring the tamarind paste and water to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened to desired consistency. Remove from heat and stir in palm sugar and tomatoes. Season with the fish sauce and red chile. Add the celery and simmer for 1 minute. Add the cod and simmer until the fish flakes easily. Serve with bean sprouts and mint.
In a medium bowl combine Braunschweiger, onion, chili sauce, mayonnaise, cream cheese and green olives. Shape into a ball and refrigerate for 24 hours. Serve with crackers.

Toast the peppercorns in a skillet over medium heat until fragrant and lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a spice grinder or mortar, then add the corn syrup, lime juice and dried mint and grind into a smooth paste. Rub into the cut side of the pineapple wedges, then let sit 10 minutes. Heat grill to medium-high (or preheat broiler). Grill or broil until browned on one side and tender, about 3 minutes per side for grilling or 30 seconds per side for broiling. Sprinkle with lime zest and serve with fresh mint.

Lightly coat each filet with the seasoned flour. In a large nonstick skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the sole and cook about 4 minutes per side or until golden brown and flaky. Set aside. In the same skillet, add the fresh lemon juice and cook until mixture thickens. Add the fresh parsley and stir. Pour over the sole and serve.

Beat eggs in a bowl. Place crescent roll dough on a cookie sheet. Spread with egg mixture. Layer with slices of salami and cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.
name: creamy pumpkin cheesecake pieingredients: graham crackers (for crust), pumpkin puree (1 14 oz can), eggs (2), heavy cream (1 1/2 cups), mascarpone (1 8 oz), sweetened condensed milk (1 14 oz can), vanilla extract (1 tsp), whipping cream (1/2 cup)preparation:In a food processor or blender, combine the crushed graham crackers with the melted butter. Press the mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until the edges are lightly brown. Let cool.In a medium bowl with an electric mixer beat the pumpkin puree until smooth. Add the condensed milk, eggs, mascar

Brown the sausage with onion and garlic until cooked through. Drain fat and add greek seasoning and mayonnaise and cook until heated through. Stir in the parmesan cheese and artichokes and serve with tortilla chips.
In a medium bowl, combine the first 4 ingredientsset aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook beef and onion until beef is no longer pinkdrain. Stir in next 3 ingredients. Spoon beef mixture over breadtop with cheese and sprinkle with chilies. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until heated through.
Cut chicken into 1/2 inch cubesplace in a plastic bag and freeze until ready to use. Combine cornmeal and next 7 ingredients (through onion). Place beef cubes in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Pour 1/2 cup dressing over beef cubes. Top with cornmeal mixture and 1/2 cup dressingsprink

Season rib eyes with garlic powder and herbs. Heat a little oil in a non-stick skillet and place steaks in pan. Cook over medium-high heat 3 minutes per side. Remove from pan and drizzle each steak with a little lemon juice and sprinkle with feta. Serve steak with a few olives.
Preheat oven to 450 F degrees. Place olive oil in a bowl. Roll peas around in oil coating them well. Place on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes. Serve with chives sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare brownie mix as directed on package. Spread in a greased and floured 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely. In a medium bowl, beat ice cream until soft. Fold in powdered sugar and nuts. Spread over cooled brownie layer. In a double boiler, melt chocolate and butter. Stir in evaporated milk and vanilla until well blended. Pour over ice cream layer. Chill until firm. Store in refrigerator.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water until tender yet firm to bite. Add broth and cook 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes more. Add carrots, green pepper, broccoli, tomatoes, dried tomatoes. Heat through. Season to taste with salt, basil and parmesan. Serves 4.
In a large bowl combine cream cheese, milk and pie filling. Fold in the marshmallows. Fold in the nuts. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Fold in the cool whip. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain. In a sauce pan, bring 1 cup water to a boil. Add sauce mix, stirring until thickened. Stir in cream. Serve over ravioli and top with parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in medium saute pan over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until translucent. Add mushrooms and wine. Cook until liquid is reduced by half and mushrooms are tender. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add penne and cook until al dente. Drain and return to pan. Add mascarpone and parmesan. Toss to combine. Serve with extra cheese.

Cook spinach according to package directions. Drain well and set aside. In a skillet, saute onion and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in spinach, lemon pepper, salt, and fresh nutmeg. Heat through. Top with parmesan cheese.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine garlic and mayonnaise. Whisk until smooth. Add lemon juice, parsley, salt & pepper to taste and whisk until well combined. Remove from heat. Set aside to cool to room temperature. In a large bowl, add potatoes and toss with enough olive oil to coat them evenly. Pour into a single layer onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and toss to coat evenly with aioli. Return to oven for another 5-10 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Serve warm.

Mix ground beef with the next 7 ingredients. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter. Add ground beef mixture. Cook, stirring often until no longer pink. Drain off excess fat. Add cornstarch and water to thin. Stir in frozen hash browns. Heat through. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with salad.

Slice onion, green pepper, & celery into small dice. Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add onion, green pepper & celerysaute for 3 minutes. Add tomato sauce & stewed tomatoessimmer for 10 minutes. Add chili powder & salt. Heat through. Place swordfish steaks in skilletcook for 5 minutes per side. Serve over rice.

In medium mixing bowl beat cream cheese at medium speed of an electric mixer until softened. Add the beef bouillon cube dissolved in the boiling water and the garlic powder. Stir well. Serve with crackers or vegetables.
name: vanilla fruit dip
ingredients: light cream cheese, brown sugar, lemon juice, vanilla essence
preparation:Beat cream cheese and sugar together until well combined and smooth. Blend in lemon juice and vanilla essence. Spoon into a serving dish. Refrigerate until needed. Serve with any fruit you choose.
name: pepperoncini cream cheese dip
ingredients: pepperoncini peppers, cream cheese, parmesan cheese, sour cream
preparation:Position knife blade in food processor bowl. Add first 3 ingredients. Pulse several times or until smooth. Stir in sour cream. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers.
name: philly cream cheese dip
ingredients: cream cheese,

In small bowl, whisk together oil, red wine vinegar and balsamic. Add dijon and tarragonwhisk. Season with salt and pepper. Place mushrooms in individual bowls. Drain watercressarrange over mushrooms. Top with chives. Drizzle salad dressing over salads. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 12 muffin cups with nonstick spray. Cut sandwich bread slices into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Place 2 rounds of bread on bottom of each muffin cup. Top with 1 teaspoon cheese and 1 teaspoon ham. Add an egg to each cup. Cover with remaining bread slices. Bake about 20 minutes or until tops are golden brown and yolks are set. Serve warm.

Pour 2 ounces of gin into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Fill the rest of the glass with ginger ale. Garnish with a fresh cherry on top of the glass. Drink the contents of the glass through the cherry, which will act as your straw. Repeat until the drink is gone.

Poke holes in the biscuits with a fork. Place biscuits in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 1 minute. Dip each biscuit hole into orange juice. In a small bowl mix together 2 tablespoons granulated sugar and 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon. Roll each biscuit hole into sugar mixture. Makes 24.
 easy peasy quick chocolate orange cakeingredients: caster sugar, margarine, flour, egg, baking powder, cocoa powder, vanilla essence, orange, juice and zest ofpreparation:cream the butter and sugar together. Add the egg and the flour and baking powder. Add the orange rind and juice coco powder and vanilla essence. Mix well and pour into microwavable dish. zap for five minutes in the microwave on medium. serve with custard.

Cream together butter and sugars until light and creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Combine dry ingredients and add to butter mixture. Mix well. Spread in a well greased 9×13 pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Cool on pan. Sprinkle with white chocolate and toasted macadamia nuts. Cool to room temperature before cutting into squares.
i don’t have any of my own recipes (i just get them from blogs), but i do have a question – did you do a post on the chocolate mousse? i remember seeing it on your blog a few months back, but i can’t seem to find it on your blog or on google. can you repost it? thanks!
I love all of these recipes! I am going to make the protein bars for sure!
YUM!!!! These all sound delicious!
The chocolate peanut butter bars look awesome. And I have been meaning to try the Chocolate Chip Coconut Cookies from the Taste of Home magazine for ages now!

1. In a wok or deep pan add 3/4 inch of oil. Heat until hot enough to fry. 2. Add 5 to 6 egg roll wrappers at a time. Fry until golden brown on both sides. 3. Place on paper towel to drain. 4. Add cabbage mixture to the pan. 5. Add the rest of the ingredients. 6. Stir until mixture is heated. 7. Fill the wrapper with a spoonful of the cabbage mixture. Roll the wrapper. 8. Place on a serving dish. 9. Serve hot or cold with duck or sweet and sour sauce.

Place bacon in crock pot. Cook on high until fat is rendered. Drain fat from crock pot. Saute onions until tender. Add other ingredients. Cook on low 6 to 8 hours. Remove any fat from top of bean mixture before serving. Serve over hot dog buns or french bread slices topped with sliced dill pickles.
Heat oil in heavy skillet. Add vegetables. Cook and stir until vegetables are crisp tender. Add tomato sauce, sugar, vinegar, salt, pepper. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in mustard.

Combine flour, eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, applesauce and pecans. Beat until well blended. In separate bowl combine pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, and baking powder. Add to applesauce mixture. Stir in sour cream. Pour into greased and floured 9x5 loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50-60 minutes. Makes 1 loaf.

In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish spread margarine evenly over bottom of dish. Combine Bisquick, sugar, milk and eggspour over the margarine evenly in the dish. Bake for 50 minutes or until center is set. Meanwhile brown sausage, drain fat. Stir into casserole in the last 5 minutes of baking. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into 8 pieces. Serves 8.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9×9 inch baking dish with foil or parchment paper. Combine the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Add the wet ingredients. Stir until a dough forms. Press the dough into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool. Cut into 10 squares. Store in the fridge.

Mix peas and rice together. Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. Meanwhile brown the pork in the oil. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for 2 minutes. Stir into rice and simmer until heated through. Garnish with green onions.
Mix first 4 ingredients. Shape into 4 patties. Cook and brown 5 minutes on each side. Place on buns. Top with lettuce, tomato and onion. Makes 4 sandwiches.

To make the dressing, heat the oil and garlic over medium heat. Cook until garlic is golden. Add the mustard and let the mixture bubble for one minute. Stir in the vinegar. Cool completely.To make the salad, mix the dill and radicchio in a serving bowl. Add the artichoke hearts and toss. Drizzle with the vinaigrette. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. In a large bowl, cream together the brown sugar, sugar and shortening until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda, salt, toffee bits and mini chocolate chip. Stir into the creamed mixture just until combined. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for a few minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
Here are 10 great chocolate chip cookie recipes for you to try!
The easiest way to find the most delicious cookie recipes is to search for them on the web.

Mix the ice cream and cereal together in a large bowl until thoroughly mixed and coated. Add the shortening and mix well until all the cereal has been coated. Add the white chocolate chips and stir until all the chips are melted and the mixture is sticky and pliable. Refrigerate for 1 hour and then roll into balls and place on a wax paper-covered baking sheet. Refrigerate for 10 minutes until firm. Melt the remaining white chocolate in the microwave and use it to dip the balls into. Place on a wax paper-covered baking sheet to set and cool. Makes 20 to 25 balls.

In a large bowl combine soup and milk. Stir in ham and onion. Add potatoes and stir. Spread into a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with swiss and cheddar cheeses. Bake uncovered at 350 for 40 minutes or until bubbly.

In large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in 2 cans of sweetened condensed milk. Add 4 cups lemonade concentrate. Blend well. Fold in whipped topping. Spread into graham cracker crust. Refrigerate. Drizzle on colored whipped topping before serving.

Cut bacon into 2 inch strips. Cut prawns in half lengthwise with shell on. Thread 2 strips of bacon onto each skewer followed by 2 prawn halves. Brush with olive oil. Season with black pepper. Grill over hot coals or on a gas grill for 3 minutes or until pink and crisp bacon is cooked through. Squeeze lemon juice over them just before serving. Serves 4 as an appetizer. Serves 2 as an entree.

Boil the potato and mash until smooth. Add flour, nutmeg, egg and salt. Make into a dough. Roll out on floured board to 1/2 inch thick. Cut into 1 inch squares. Boil in salted water. Add butter and parsley. Serve.
Mix first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Spoon into 4 tall glasses. Garnish with mint sprigs if desired.

To prepare the crust combine 6 cups of crushed graham crackers with 1/4 cup melted butter and 1/4 tsp of cinnamon. Press into a 9 inch pie dish. Combine 1 package of instant vanilla pudding mix with 1 1/4 cups of milk. Beat with a mixer until smooth. Beat in 1 1/2 cups of cool whip. Combine 1/3 cup of fat free cool whip with 2 tsp of vanilla and 2 tsp of Splenda. Beat with a mixer. Fold into the cheesecake. Layer the pie with sliced bananas and the remaining 1/2 cup of cool whip. Refrigerate for 6 hours.

Wash strawberries, remove stems, peel and slice. Remove seeds from kiwi fruits and peach slices. Set aside to drain. Combine 1/4 cup boiling water with 1 1/2 tsp nutrasweet. Cool. Add 1 cup water to make 2 cups. Combine kiwi and strawberry slices with nutrasweet water. Pour into 4 paper cups. Freeze 4 hours or overnight. To serve, insert wooden popsicle sticks. Garnish with peach slices, if desired. Serve immediately or store in freezer.

Heat oil in a pan. Add chicken and cook until golden. Remove from pan. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Return chicken to the pan and simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Serve with sour cream and sprinkle with smoked paprika.
Combine raisins, nuts and honey. Mix well. Spread on a flat tray. Sprinkle with coconut. Store in an airtight container.

Marinate wings overnight. When ready to cook, heat oil. Add gingerroot, green onion, and garlic. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add wings and cook 20 to 25 minutes. Add remaining ingredients, cook 15 to 20 more minutes. Turn wings to brown evenly. Serves 4.

Cream the butter and sugar together until light & fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla essence. Sift in the flour, a little at a time, until the mixture is soft enough to roll into balls. Chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Roll into balls and place on a tray lined with baking paper. Flatten slightly with the base of a small drinking glass dipped in a little flour. Bake in a hot oven (200c/400f/gas 6) until golden. Sprinkle with the mixed fruit while still hot.
In food processor, mix ground pork with eggs and breadcrumbs. Add onion flakes and parsley. Dip meat mixture into flour and brown in skillet. Add garlic and cook 2-3 minutes. Serve with potato salad.

Combine the water, Splenda and lime juice in the blender container. Peel the watermelon and cut it into 1 inch cubes. Peel the cucumber and cut it in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds from the middle of the cucumber. Cut into 1 inch cubes. Blend watermelon and cucumber cubes in the blender. Pour into bowl and serve. Makes 4 servings.

Boil potatoes. Drain and return to pan. Add butter and milk and mash until smooth. Stir in Dijon and seasonings to taste. Fill each potato skin with 1/4 cup broccoli and 1/4 cup ham. Top each with cheese and bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and potato tops are crispy.

Bring 3 quarts salted water to boil. Cook shells 8-10 minutes or until tender but firm. Drain. Cool slightly. In a large bowl mix crabmeat, shrimp, celery, onion, pimiento, salad dressing, cheese, salt, and pepper. Stuff each shell with the crab mixture. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight.
Jumbo seafood salad stuffed shells recipe by Diane S., is from Grandma's Cookbook , one of the cookbooks created at FamilyCookbookProject.com. We'll help you start your own personal cookbook! It's easy and fun. Click here to start your own cookbook!
This recipe was entered by Diane S..

Combine the butter and all the other ingredients in a small bowl. Put the butter in a plastic bag and then put the fish in the bag and seal tightly with the fish in the bag. Refrigerate overnight to marinate. Grill the fish 4 to 5 minutes on each side and serve with the almonds on top.

Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Spray a 2-quart round casserole with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine rice and boiling waterstir until water is absorbed. In a small bowl combine butter, oil, and saltmix well. Add to rice mixture and stir until moistened. Spread mixture into casserole. Cover with foil. Bake for 40 minutes. Uncoverbake for another 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in ricecover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in carrots and onion. Beat egg and stir into mixture. Stir in 1/2 cup cheese. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased 13x9x2-in. baking pan. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 375° for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Slice open red pepper and remove seeds. Place in a bowl. Add garlic and balsamic vinegar and let stand 10 minutes. Drain off liquid into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain and chill liquid until cold. Discard peppers. In a blender combine liquid, basil, and parmesan cheese. With blender running, slowly add olive oil and water. Blend until smooth. Season to taste.
The only way to enjoy a ripe tomato is to make a tomato sandwich.
I love tomato sandwiches. I love to make them. I love to eat them. I love to watch other people eat them. I love to read about them and I love to hear other people talk about them.
I love tomato sandwiches so much that I wrote a book about them.
And it seems that I’m not alone.
Throughout the South, people of every age and from every walk of life are obsessed with tomato sandwiches. In fact, for many Southerners a tomato sandwich is far more than a sandwich

Add the milk and broth to a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Gradually add the polenta and whisk to prevent lumps from forming, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring often and adding the salt and pepper to taste, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the polenta is tender and creamy. Remove from the heat and stir in the herbs and 1 cup of the butter and the cheese, and stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c).In a bowl combine eggs, cream cheese and garlic powder. Add tomato sauce and mix well. Stir in the italian seasoning. Lay out 4 pieces of parchment paper. Place a piece of parchment on a baking sheet. Divide the tomato sauce mixture into 4 equal portions. Spoon the mixture onto the parchment. Sprinkle with the parmesan and romano cheeses. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 4 equal wedges. Serve warm or cold.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add salt to taste and cook pasta according to the package directions for al dente. Drain pasta and set aside. In a medium frying pan heat 2 tbs of butter over medium heat until bubbly. Add kasseri cheese and mizithra cheese. Stir until melted. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine the cooked pasta with the melted cheese and 2 tbs of butter. Toss to coat completely. Serve hot with a sprinkling of fresh parsley for garnish.

Clean the mushrooms by wiping them with a damp paper towel. Saut them in a heavy saucepan with a little butter and the onion. When they are browned add the flour, mix well and then add the bouillon cubes. When the soup begins to thicken add the milk a little at a time until the desired consistency is reached. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat the broiler to high. Place the cheese on a sheet pan and broil until it starts to brown. Let cool slightly. In a small bowl, whisk the oil and vinegar until emulsified. Season to taste. Arrange the arugula on a serving plate and drizzle the dressing over the top. Divide the cheese among the plates and top each portion with a spoonful of quince paste.

Grind green gram to fine powder in a blender. Soak it in water for 10-15 minutes. Grind green chilies and ginger-garlic to fine paste in a blender. Take the soaked gram in a bowl and add spinach, green chilly paste, ginger-garlic paste, baking soda, salt to taste. Mix well. Add rava (semolina) slowly to the batter. Mix well. Add 1-2 tsp of oil to the batter. Pour 1 tbsp of batter each in waffle iron and cook for 1-2 minutes until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney or tomato ketchup.

Boil cauliflower, carrots, celery, water until tender. Melt margarine in saucepan. Blend cauliflower mixture. Add evaporated milk, salt. Stir until hot. Add cheddar cheese. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in frozen peas. Heat through.

In a medium bowl, stir together honey and butter until blended. Stir in egg yolk until combined. In a large bowl combine flour, oats, baking soda, and saltstir well. Stir flour mixture into honey mixture just until dry ingredients are moistened. Fold in pecans and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes or until light golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rackcool. Store in airtight container. Makes about 5 dozen.
Simmer brussels sprouts in beer with a dash of salt and pepper for 10 minutes. Drain and saute in a pan with a little more butter for a minute or two. Serve with bacon or without bacon.

Prepared pizza crust according to package directions. Spread with oil. Top with onions and cheese. Bake as directed. Remove from oven and add roasted peppers. Sprinkle with oregano and thyme. Add basil. Cut into 8 wedges and serve.

Place a crescent roll into a 10-inch pizza pan. Spread with butter. Arrange sliced mushrooms over crescent roll. Sprinkle with red onion. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with herbes de provence. Sprinkle with garlic powder and cracked black pepper. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 13-15 minutes or until crescent roll is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Cut into 4 wedges. Serve hot with a side salad.

Boil water and cook the pasta according to package directions. Heat the olive oil and add the carrots and green onions and cook until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in the pasta and toss to combine. Add the Alfredo sauce and the Parmesan cheese and toss to combine. Top with fresh basil and season with salt and pepper.

In a small bowl, combine water and vinegar. Bring to a boil and stir in sugar until dissolved. Stir in fish sauce and cayenne. Stir in the carrot. Cook until the carrot is tender. Transfer to a blender and add the mint and chili. Blend until pureed. Pour through a strainer into a bowl. Sprinkle with the chopped peanuts. Serve cold.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and shallot. Cook for 4 minutes. Add the broth, sherry, pepper and salt. Cook until the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add the broccoli and cook for 1 minute. Serve immediately.
Spread evenly the yellow cake mix in a buttered 2 qt. Pyrex dish. Sprinkle with crushed pineapple and applesauce. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 375f degrees. Crush the gingersnaps in a food processor until it resembles fine crumbs. In a medium bowl, mix together the gingersnap crumbs and butter until it comes together as a dough. Spread the dough into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Slice the pears and arrange in rows on top of the dough in the pie plate. Drizzle the lemon juice over the pears and arrange the walnuts over the top. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes and serve warm.
Whisk together first 4 ingredients until smooth. Add 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar. Whisk again. Add salt and pepper to taste. Store, covered, in refrigerator up to 1 week. Shake well before using.

Preheat oven to 375. Cream oil and sugar. Add vanilla and bananas. Combine dry ingredients. Add to wet mixture. Add eggs and chips. Fill muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake 18 to 20 minutes.

Tear off 4 squares of parchment paper. In each square place 1/4 of the vegetables in a single layer. Add a sprinkling of the feta cheese. Drizzle each square with 1 teaspoon of the oil. Sprinkle each square with 1/8 teaspoon each of the basil and oregano. Fold the sides of the paper to form a pouch. Bring up the ends of the paper to form a top. Bring the ends together. Secure with kitchen twine. Place the packets on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the peanut oil in a wok or large saut pan over medium high heat. Add the gingerroot and garlic. Cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant but not browned, about 2 minutes. Add the choy sum leaves and stir fry until they are just wilted but the stems are still crunchy, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the water chestnuts and cook until they begin to soften a bit, about 1 minute. Add the soy sauce, chicken broth and sugarstir well and cook until the broth has thickened a bit, 2 to 3 minutes more. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Beat sugar, butter and eggs until smooth and creamy. Add milk and blend. Sift dry ingredients together. Add dry and wet together. Fold in nuts and carrots. Divide into 12 muffin cups. Bake for 25 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

In large bowl combine raspberry puree, sugar and lemon juice. Beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add sugar to egg whites, beating until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into raspberry mixture. Pour into a 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 45 minutes or until center is set. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 4 hours.
Sift flour, sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, milk and onions into a mixing bowl. Mix well. Drop by the spoonful onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

Boil potatoes until they are just tender. Drain them and pour over them some of the bacon fat and caraway seeds. Let this mixture cool while you cook the cauliflower in the remaining bacon fat. When the cauliflower is crisp tender add the chopped onion and cook for a few minutes. Drain the cauliflower mixture, reserving the fat. Mash the potatoes with the cauliflower mixture, adding enough fat to make the mixture smooth. Add the hard cooked eggs, the bacon, chopped green onions and the remaining bacon fat. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper and mayonnaise. Mix well and serve chilled.
Sift together the dry ingredients. Mix the wet ingredients. Stir into the dry ingredients. Spoon into well greased paper lined muffin cups. Bake 350 for 25 minutes.
Cook spaghetti according to directions. Drain. Combine cream cheese, sour cream, spaghetti sauce in a saucepan. Add spaghetti and stir until heated through. Serve with parmesan cheese on top.

Peel and core apples, leaving stems attached. Cut each apple in half lengthwise. Divide figs and nuts among apples. Brush each half of apple with lemon juice. Add brown sugar and cinnamon to apples. Bake for 30 minutes or until the apples are tender when pierced with fork. Serve warm.

Cut the crusts off the bread. Split it in half. Spread some mayonnaise on each half. Cut the crusts off the bread. Split it in half. Spread some mayonnaise on each half. Top one half with a layer of tomatoes, bacon, lettuce, salt, pepper, and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. Close the sandwich and slice it into 4 wedges. Dip each wedge into the breadcrumb mixture before frying.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce and garlic salt. Brush each breast with butter mixture. Press breadcrumbs onto each breast. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until done. Top with remaining 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Broil on high 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Combine dark sesame oil, light olive oil, minced garlic cloves, hot pepper flakes, firm tofu and cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Add soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, turbinado sugar and cook for 5 minutes more. Add pasta and toss with sauce. Add broccoli florets. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Add chicken, poultry seasoning and cook 2 to 3 minutes until chicken is golden brown. Stir in dried cherries. Cook 2 to 3 minutes longer until cherries are heated through. Serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In 10-inch skillet, cook bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. In 1-1/2-quart casserole or skillet, combine cream, water and parmesan cheeseheat until just boiling. Add egg, stirring to blendreturn to boiling. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer, uncovered, 4 minutes or until egg is just set. Remove from heatstir in bacon, green onion, mustard greens, pepper and salt to tastecover tightly with aluminum foil and place in 350 degree F oven for 5 minutes to heat through. Remove from oven and place on serving platter. Drizzle with olive oil flavored cooking spray to serve.
Peel and pit the avocados. Cut the onions into small chunks and add to the avocado. Add the tomatoes and hot sauce. Salt to taste. Gently mix. Garnish with the cilantro.

Preheat grill to medium heat. In a small bowl mix together all the above ingredients. Brush mixture onto both sides of fish. Grill fish 3-4 minutes per side. Remove fish from grill when cooked through. Serve immediately.

Cream together peanut butter and butter. Add powdered sugar and brown sugar, beating until fluffy. Add chocolate chips. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper. Let cool, then store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, heat olive oil. Saut garlic clove for 30 seconds. Add parsley and stir. Add drumsticks and brown for 3 minutes. Add white wine vinegar and stir well. Place in oven and bake 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve with pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 425f. In saucepan, melt butter. Add flour and mustard powder. Add milk and cook until smooth. Add cheddar and vegetables and simmer until tender. Spoon mixture into unbaked 9-inch pie crust. Sprinkle with chives and bake at 425f for 25-30 minutes. Serve warm.
i've never had the veg all pot pie before. sounds yummy.
you're right! that sounds really good!
i love that pot pie. we've had it many times.
wow! that looks awesome. i love the pot pie.
You are so organized. I am going to have to try that green chili. I love the recipes you're sending me.

Put the first 6 ingredients in a large teapot and cover with 4 cups boiling water. Steep for 10 minutes. Add tea bags and steep an additional 5 minutes. Strain the mixture into 4 mugs and add maple syrup and soymilk to taste. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine the sour cream and taco sauce. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Coat with cooking spray. Cook the chicken until no longer pink. Add the beans and cook for 2-3 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the sour cream mixture. Cook until heated through. Serve on the tortillas topped with the cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Combine first 5 ingredients in medium bowl. In a large bowl, combine dry milk powder, egg whites, syrup, vanilla, and walnuts. Beat 2 minutes or until well blended. Add to flour mixture. Beat just until dry ingredients are moistened. Spread in prepared pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack.

In a large bowl combine all of the ingredients except for the strawberries. Mix to combine. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes to an hour or until the dip is firm enough to scoop out of the bowl. Remove the bowl from the fridge and scrape the dip into a serving bowl or a small casserole dish. Place the strawberries on the bottom of the dish or bowl. Spread the dip over the top of the strawberries. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 48 hours before serving.

Mix the water and the cornmeal in an iron skillet or saucepan. Add the salt and mix well. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 5 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve hot with syrup or butter.

Combine milk, heavy cream, white chocolate chips, pure vanilla, and pumpkin pie spice in a small saucepan over low heat. Heat until mixture is hot but not boiling. Remove from heat and serve with a dollop of whipped cream.

In blender container combine orange drink mix and sugarblend on medium speed until smooth. Add tea and blend. Add lemonade mix and blend well. Add cherry drink mix and blend well. Add cinnamon and nutmegblend well. Serve over crushed ice. Garnish with cherry and orange slices.

Cook pasta according to directions. Melt butter in large skillet. Add flour and stir well. Add milk and stir. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Add salt and pepper and stir. Cook for 1 minute. Add cheeses and stir. Cook over low heat until cheeses melt. Stir in lemon juice. Stir in pasta and serve.

In a medium saucepan, combine the chocolate with the condensed milk and stir over low heat until the mixture is smooth. Remove from the heat. Stir in the salt and vanilla. In a small saucepan over boiling water, heat the water until it begins to boil. Add the boiling water to the chocolate mixture and stir. Remove from the heat and add the ground cinnamon. Serve in a bowl or mugs and top with whipped cream.
Brown meat and drain. Saute garlic. Mix all other ingredients. Simmer 2 hours. Makes 4 pints.

Preheat oven to 375. In a 13x9 baking dish place chicken in pan. Salt and pepper to your taste. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and turn chicken over and pour wine over it. Pour mustard over chicken and sprinkle with brown sugar. Bake uncovered for 30 more minutes.

In a blender, combine milk, cool whip and pudding mix. Blend for a few seconds, then add coffee and blend for a few seconds more. Place in the freezer and let freeze for a few hours or overnight. Scoop into bowl and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Slice french bread lengthwise and remove a thin slice from each side. Place bread slices on baking sheet. In a bowl combine the cream cheese and mozzarella. Spread evenly over bread. Mix green onion with garlic salt. Sprinkle over mozzarella. Bake 15 minutes until melted. Serve immediately.

Mix butter, Worcestershire, garlic, jelly and mustard in a small bowl. Marinate the chicken in the mixture for 1 hour. Grill or bake. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and use as a glaze for the last 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Rub butter over beef. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with rosemary and thyme. Roast uncovered for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 325f and continue baking until a thermometer inserted into the center of the beef registers 130f for medium rare or 140f for medium. Transfer to a carving board. Carve into thick slices. Yields 1 slice per serving.

Preheat oven to 425 F 220 C . Make short crust pastry and chill while making filling. In a skillet saute onion in a small amount of olive oil until tender but not brown. Add carrot, stir to combine. Add beef, sausage and black pepper to taste. Add mixed vegetables and enough milk to moisten. Stir until well mixed. Roll out the shortcrust pastry on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thick. Cut into 5 inch circles with a biscuit cutter or drinking glass. Place 1/4 cup filling in center of each circle. Fold dough in half to form a half moon shape and pinch edges together to seal. Crimp edges with a fork or cut out leaf shapes with a pastry wheel. Brush top with a light coat of milk or beaten egg and sprinkle with coarse sea salt if desired. Place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough. Bake in a preheated oven for 20 minutes. Makes 8 pasties.

Prepare greens as directed in recipe. Melt butter in skillet. Add bouillon cube. Stir over low heat until dissolved. Add nutmeg, summer savory and pepper. Add greens. Cook 30 minutes. Add vinegar. Stir to mix. Add flour. Cook 5 minutes. Add sugar and cook 5 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet brown meat in oil. Drain. Add onions soup mix. Stir to combine. Add vegetable juice and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add vegetables. Simmer until veggies are tender. Serve over rice.
name: easy hamburger stewingredients: lean ground beef, garlic, onion, potatoes, carrots, kernel corn, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt and pepper, worcestershire saucepreparation: Saute ground beef, garlic and onion. Add potatoes, carrots and corn. Stir in soup, water and seasonings. Cover and simmer until veggies are tender. Serve over steamed white rice.
name: good gravy beef stewingredients: stew meat, flour, vegetable oil, beef broth, condensed cream of mushroom soup, onion, potatoes, baby carrotspreparation: Coat meat with flour and brown in oil. Drain. Add soups. Simmer 30 minutes. Add vegetables and simmer

Preheat oven to 400f. In a medium bowl stir together flour, cornmeal, sugar and salt. In another medium bowl whisk together buttermilk, eggs and sweet corn. Add wet mixture to dry ingredients and mix gently just until combined. Spoon batter into paper-lined muffin cups. Bake until tops are golden brown and a cake tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 18 to 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat large pot filled 1/2 full of water to boiling. Add linguine. Cook 2 minutes less than package directions. Add frozen shrimp. Cook until shrimp are pink and cooked through. Drain. Add olive oil. Toss to coat. Add garlic and basil. Toss. Drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Serve immediately.

Melt margarine in 9 inch cast iron skillet. Remove from heat and sprinkle in flour. Add the cornmeal and brown sugar and mix well. Beat together the egg and the buttermilk in a small bowl and mix into the dry ingredients in the skillet until just moistened. Spoon the batter into the prepared skillet and smooth the top with the back of a spoon or spatula. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly before cutting into wedges to serve warm or at room temperature with prunes on top and margarine or honey to spread on the prunes.

Whisk together soy sauce, lemon juice, olive oil, dried oregano, and garlic in a small bowlset aside. Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Toss pork with half of the marinade in a small bowllet stand for 10 minutes. Thread pork, bell peppers, and onions alternately onto 8 skewersbrush with remaining marinade. Grill until pork is no longer pink in center, about 5 minutes per side. Serve warm with pita bread and tzatziki sauce.

Cream together butter and sugar. Blend in well-beaten egg yolks and milk. Sift together flour, salt, and baking powder. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture and beat until smooth. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold into the mixture just until blended. Bake in a well-oiled waffle iron.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel and dice potatoes. Combine with butter, paprika, garlic powder and pepper in a bowl. Spread into a greased baking dish. Bake for about 1 hour or until fork tender.

Spread butter on the inside of bread slices. Combine beef, egg, onion, soup, salt and pepper to taste. Spread mixture evenly on bottom half of each bread slice. Top with a slice of sharp cheddar cheese. Top with the remaining bread slices. Melt in microwave oven on high for 30 seconds or until cheese melts. Serve immediately.
Put a few ice cubes in a glass and add 2 oz. of vodka. Add a stuffed olive and a slice of lemon or lime. Stir well. Repeat. Add more ice cubes to each glass. Serve with a toothpick.

Place pork in 3- to 4-quart slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowlpour over pork. Cover and cook on low until meat is tender, about 8 hours. Remove roast from cookershred with 2 forks. Return meat to cooker. Stir until well combined. Serve with hot rice.

Toast a slice of bread. Spread a layer of pepper jelly on the toasted side. Put a thin layer of meatloaf in the center. Spread a layer of mayo on the other side. Spread another layer of pepper jelly over the meatloaf. Top with the other piece of toasted bread.
Pasta is the Italian word for paste, which is the name of the food that is the basis of this dish. In Italy it is a popular dish for lunch and dinner. It is a main dish that is served with a variety of vegetables and meats. It is a very easy dish to prepare, and it is usually cooked in less than 10 minutes.
Pasta is a type of food that is cooked by boiling water. It is made from flour that is ground into a fine powder. It is usually served with a sauce.
Pasta is a type of food that is made by boiling water and then adding a variety of vegetables and meats. It is a very popular dish in Italy. It is usually served with a variety of vegetables and meats.
Pasta is a food that is made from fl
Combine steel cut oats and water in a slow cooker. Add the cinnamon and salt. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 3 hours. Stir in dried fruit before serving.
Soak the wafer crumbs in the coffee and mix with the other ingredients. Press into the bottom of a springform pan. Bake at 350 for 5 minutes. Cool.

In a large saucepan combine chicken stock, couscous, oil, sugar, vinegar, thyme and sultanas. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer till almost all liquid is absorbed. Add carmelised onion. Mix well. Sprinkle with toasted pistachios if desired. Makes 6 servings.

In a large bowl combine the milk, egg, sugar, butter and salt. Whisk until smooth. Add pasta and toss to coat. Sprinkle in cheddar cheese, tossing to coat. Spoon into an 11x7-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 35 minutes or until hot in center, uncovered. Cool slightly before serving.

Combine the corn, beans, and chilies in a large bowl and mix well. In a separate bowl, combine the laughing cow light swiss cheese and cream cheese and mix well. Pour the vegetables into a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish. Pour the cheese mixture over the vegetables and spread evenly over the top. Bake for 30 minutes at 375 degrees. Serve hot.

Cut off tops from jalapenos. Scoop out seeds and membranes. Fill cavity with 1/2 teaspoon of jelly. Add a pinch of cumin. Top with a slice of bacon. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until bacon is crisp and top is golden. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar.

Mix together apple juice and corn syrup in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove from heat and stir in dried oranges. Cool completely. Spread apple slices with applesauce. Sprinkle vanilla over the top of each slice. Roll up each slice and secure with wooden skewer. Drizzle with orange mixture.
Mix berries with sugar, rind and salt. Cook until thick. Pour into unbaked pie shells. Cover with top crust. Seal and flute edges. Bake in moderate oven until done.

Heat the olive oil in a large sauce pan. Saute the onion until golden. Add the garlic until fragrant. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Add the tomatoes. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the basil. Add the parmesan cheese. Stir to combine. Serve hot.

Place fennel and garlic in a heavy duty plastic bag. Pound to break apart. Add thyme. Combine with mustard and spices. Toss to coat meat. Place in baking dish. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours. Remove meat from marinade. Place in roasting pan. Bake uncovered 45-50 minutes. Internal temperature 145 degrees. Let rest 10 minutes. Carve and serve.

In a medium bowl beat together 1 egg, 1/2 cup of milk and 1/4 cup of water. Add 1/3 cup of all-purpose flour and 1/8 tsp of salt. Stir until smooth. Cook on a hot griddle. Pour a little batter on the griddle. Cook until brown on the bottom. Turn and brown the other side. Serve hot. Serve with jam or syrup and powdered sugar.

Slice eggplant into 1/4-inch rounds. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Place on a baking sheet and bake 20-30 minutes until tender. Remove from the oven and let cool. In a bowl add the eggplant, olives, parsley and oregano. Drizzle with more olive oil and toss. Serve at room temperature.

Mix cake according to box. Pour into bundt pan. Bake as directed on box. In a bowl combine pudding and warm water. Mix until smooth. Cool slightly. Pour over warm cake. Chill several hours. In a microwave safe bowl combine chips and cream. Microwave 1-2 minutes until melted. Add corn syrup. Drizzle over cake. Let stand several hours to set.

In large bowl, mix fruit with 1/2 cup of sugar. Pour in dry red wine and lemon juicemix well. Refrigerate overnight. To serve, place fruit mixture in bottom of tall glassestop with whipped cream. Garnish with mint sprigs or fruit slices. Serve chilled.
Place all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings if desired. Serve with tortilla chips or use as a condiment.

Put cashews in bowl of food processor. Add 2 cups of water and process until nuts are very fine. Transfer to large bowl and add dates. Process again until mixture is very smooth. Add cinnamon, nutmeg and butterscotch. Process for 1 minute. Add water and process again. Spoon mixture into individual glasses and chill. To serve, garnish with kiwi.
name: chocolate mousseingredients: evaporated milk, vanilla extract, sugar, chocolate chips, salt, heavy whipping cream, chocolate curls, fresh strawberriespreparation:In blender, combine the milk, vanilla, sugar, chocolate and salt. Cover and process until smooth, about 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl. In small mixing bowl, beat cream until soft peaks form. Fold into chocolate mixture. Spoon into dessert dishes. Refrigerate until serving. Garnish with chocolate curls and strawberries, if desired.
name: lime mousseingredients: whipping cre

Cut watermelon into 2-inch chunks and place in blender with 1/3 cup water. Puree until smooth. Add honey and 1/2 teaspoon of the lemon juice and blend until combined. Pour into an ice cube tray or mold and freeze. When cubes are solid, remove from mold and store in an airtight container for up to 2 months. Make 30 ice cubes.
Brown ground beef with chopped onions. Add tomatoes. Add salt. Add noodles. Let cook 10-15 minutes. Add cheese. Serve with crackers.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients together. Spread into a greased loaf pan. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes or until done. Cool before removing from pan.

Pick through and trim turnip greens and okra. Combine all ingredients except greens and water in small bowl. Stir well and set aside. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat and saute garlic until golden. Add jalapeno peppers and onion and saute 2-3 minutes. Add pine nuts and cook until nuts are golden and mixture is dry. Add greens and cook until tender. Add water and bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 5 minutes more or until greens are tender and liquid is evaporated.
Place a small amount of cream cheese in center of each tortilla. Sprinkle with banana pepper and red bell pepper. Roll up and serve with salsa.

Put water into the mixing bowl. Add yeast and sugar and stir until dissolved. Set aside 5 minutes. Add shortening and salt to water mixture and stir until smooth. Add 2 cups of flour and stir until combined. Add 2 more cups of flour, stirring until well combined. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until smooth. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to coat all sides of dough with oil. Cover with plastic wrap or greased wax paper. Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Punch down the dough with your fist. Divide into 12 equal portions and shape each portion into a ball. Place 1 inch apart on greased baking sheets. Cover with plastic wrap or greased wax paper. Set aside for 30 minutes or until doubled in size again. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and place on wire rack to cool. Makes 1

Combine all ingredients except club soda in large saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Remove from heatcool completely. Add club sodarefrigerate for at least 1 hour. Pour over ice cubes in tall glasses and serve immediately.

Combine sour cream and mayonnaise in small bowl. Blend in mustard and oregano. Blend in blue cheese until smooth. Add lemon juice and garlic oil. Season to taste with black pepper. Add to fresh spinach and toss.
This is the perfect salad for those who don't like fruit in their salads!
1. In a screw top jar combine vinegar, honey, oil, poppy seed, dry mustard, fresh spinach, papayas, grapes.
2. Shake well to mix.
3. Combine spinach, papaya or pears, and grapes.
4. Shake dressing again and pour over salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.
1. Melt butter in skillet and brown walnuts & ramen noodles.
2. Cool on paper towels.
3. Combine browned noodles and walnuts with broccoli, lettuce, and onions in large serving bowl.
4. Whisk remaining four ingredients together in mixing bowl.
5. Dress sal

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine the chicken breasts and 3/4 cup water. Bring to a boil over high heat and then cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool for 5 minutes. Remove chicken from liquid and shred into small pieces. In a large pot add the remaining 3 1/2 cups of water. Add the seasoning mix and stir until dissolved. Add the cannellini and black beans and bring to a boil. Add the mushroom soup and stewed tomatoes and stir to combine. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the shredded chicken and heat for 10 minutes. Stir in 1/4 cup sour cream and heat for 1 minute. Serve hot and garnish with cheese and sour cream. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Pour the melted butter into the bottom of the baking dish, then sprinkle with garlic powder, then parmesan cheese. In a large bowl toss the potato halves in olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place the potatoes cut-side down over the parmesan cheese in the baking dish. Bake for about 40-45 minutes, or until tender.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium bowl. Beat until blended. Add pecan halves and toss to coat. Let stand for 1 hour or until mixture is dry. Heat oven to 250 degrees f. Spread mixture onto a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour or until mixture is dry and nuts are fragrant. Let cool completely and store in airtight containers.
A large proportion of Americans consume chocolate every day. One of the most popular is the chocolate chip cookie, which is served in homes and restaurants throughout the year.
Most chocolate chips are made from chocolate liquor, a mixture of cocoa solids and cocoa butter, which is sold as chocolate bars and is made into chocolate chips. They are also made from chocolate liquor mixed with vegetable oil or shortening and sold in chips and chunks.
The original chocolate chip cookie was created in 1937 by Ruth Graves Wakefield who was running Toll House Inn at the time. The inn was very successful and Ruth ran it with her husband, Kenneth. She was

Spray 13x9x2 inch baking dish with non stick spray. Cut each roll into 4 piecesarrange in baking dish. In small bowl, combine brown sugar, butter, vanilla pudding mix, 1 cup milk and 2 tablespoons walnuts. Spoon over rolls. In same bowl, combine 1 cup milk with remaining 2 tablespoons walnutssprinkle over top. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake in 350 degree oven for 35-45 minutes or until top is lightly browned.
Today I was going to make a chocolate chip cookie for my blog but it never made it to my blog because I had a guest today so I thought I would share my other recipe with you instead because I know you will like this one too.
This is a recipe I got from my aunt. It is her favorite recipe for a quick bread.
I thought I would share it with you today since I have been making so many breads lately. I am sure I will be back to sharing cookies soon so stay tuned

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl mix together mayonnaise, dry mix, milk, and garlic powder. Cool slightly. Add pasta to mixture. Add in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate overnight for best flavor. Serve cold.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the orange juice concentrate and soy sauce until smooth. Add the lemon pepper and garlic, and whisk until the mixture is smooth and fragrant (about 2 minutes). Preheat the grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle both sides of the chicken breasts with the seasoning blend. Place the chicken on the grill, cover, and cook until the meat is cooked through (about 6 minutes per side). Whisk the honey into the sauce and continue to cook while whisking until the sauce has thickened slightly (about 2 minutes). Serve the sandwiches on the rolls with the arugula and a drizzle of the sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine butter and sugars. Beat well. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Combine flour and baking powder. Add to butter mixture and beat well. Beat in lemon juice and zest. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes. Cool and frost with icing. Icing: Combine butter and 2 cups of powdered sugar. Beat until smooth. Add lemon juice and zest. Beat until smooth and spread on cooled cake. Decorate top with fresh cranberries.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly coat a baking sheet with olive oil and spread the carrots out in a single layer. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 15 minutes, or until they begin to get lightly browned around the edges. Remove from oven and drizzle carrots with olive oil and paprika and return them to the oven for 5 minutes more. In a medium bowl, whisk together the orange juice and lemon juice, then add the butter and whisk until it is completely melted and incorporated into the liquid. Whisk in the paprika and season with salt and pepper. Add the hot roasted carrots and toss thoroughly to coat them in the sauce. Serve immediately.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a 8x10 inch glass or ceramic baking dish. Whisk together 3 egg yolks, 2 cups milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon white pepper in a blender or food processor until smooth. Beat 4 egg whites with 2 tablespoons water in another bowl until stiff peaks formset aside. Pour egg yolk mixture into dish over melted buttersprinkle with 1/2 cup grated Jarlsberg cheese (about 1/4 cup) and 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmegspread evenly. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until set (but still moist). Top with 1/2 cup prosciutto slices and remaining Jarlsberg cheesesprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon white pepper. Bake at 350 for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with beaten egg whitessprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon ground

Sift together the whole wheat flour and the unbleached white flour. In a separate bowl combine the baking powder and the salt and set aside. Beat together the eggs, milk and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients to the milk mixture alternately with the melted butter. Fry in a hot well greased griddle or waffle iron.

In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients. In a smaller bowl combine the buttermilk egg and melted butter. Stir into the dry ingredients until just mixed. Drop by teaspoon on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash and peel the garnet yam. Cut into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. Place yam rounds on a baking sheet. Place in oven and cook for 1 hour. Remove from oven and set aside. In a 10-inch skillet, melt 4 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute 5 minutes. Add pecans and saute 1 minute. Stir in maple syrup and cinnamon. Bring to a boil and cook 2 minutes. Stir in cooked garnet yam rounds. Stir well to coat. Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon of butter. Serve hot.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add beef and cook until browned. Stir in onion. Drain hash browns and stir into mixture. Add eggs and mix well. Season to taste with salt. Cook until mixture is firm and browned on the edges. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa.

Mix together eggs and garlic salt. Spray skillet with cooking spray, pour egg mixture in the skillet and cook until done. While the egg is cooking, cut the mozzarella in half. Flip the egg over and place half of the mozzarella on the egg. Fold the egg over and place the other half of the mozzarella on top. Let the egg cook for another minute or two until the mozzarella is melted. Cut the egg into four slices and serve.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease an 11-by-7-by-1-inch pan. Separate the dough into three sections. Roll each section into a square. Place two dough squares into the pan and sprinkle with half of the chocolate and half of the corn syrup. Repeat the layering and place the remaining dough square on top. Bake until golden brown, about 1 hour. Cool completely. Cut into squares. Melt the remaining half of the chocolate and the butter and stir until smooth. Drizzle over the bars. Sprinkle with the remaining orange zest. Refrigerate until set.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). In a large bowl, combine the graham crackers and butter until well blended. Spread half of the mixture into an 11 x 7 inch baking dish and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and spread the cream cheese over the bottom crust. Bake for an additional 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the cinnamon and the remaining crushed graham crackers. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and spread the blueberry pie filling over the top. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely before serving with ice cream.
name: blueberry cheesecake pieingredients: graham cracker pie crust, cream cheese, sugar, eggs, blueberry pie filling

Cook bacon and set aside. Cook onion, potatoes, carrot, and celery until tender. Add cream of potato soup. Simmer until hot. Add milk and american cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Stir in cooked wild rice and bacon. Serve hot.

Place macaroni in a 6-quart rice cooker. Stir in the chicken broth and cream. Season with salt, mustard, paprika and pepper. Add the cheeses and stir. Cover the rice cooker and press the cook button. When the cooker is done cooking, stir and serve.

Heat olive oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat. Add garlic cloves and saute until lightly browned. Cut off tops from rolls. Place a slice of ham in each roll top and a slice of tomato in the bottom. Add a slice of cheese to each sandwich. Drizzle with olive oil to coat. Put the rolls back together and wrap in foil. Serve warm.

The sandwich is a food item that is prepared by placing food items between two or more slices of bread, or an alternative such as buns or tortillas.
A sandwich is a food item that is prepared by placing food items between two or more slices of bread, or an alternative such as buns or tortillas.

'Sandwich' is featured as a movie character in the following productions:

Combine berries, sugar, water and lemon zest in a large saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in cornstarch. Cook 1 minute or until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in almond extract and brandy. Chill thoroughly before serving.

Fry onion and mushrooms in margarine until tender. Mix the fish fillets with the onion-mushroom mixture, add the pepper and wine. Put the mixture into a 2-quart baking dish. Combine the milk and flour, stirring until smooth. Stir in paprika. Pour the milk mixture over the fish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat barbecue or broil pan. Cut fillets into strips about 2 inches wide and thread onto skewers alternating with sweet peppers and tomatoes. Brush kebabs with olive oil and sprinkle with cumin, turmeric and red pepper. Broil until meat is medium-rare and vegetables are tender but still firm. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Combine hazelnuts and balsamic vinegar and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Add honey and whisk until well blended. In a large bowl combine dressing, crystallized ginger, bartlett pears and lemon juice. Toss to coat. Place lettuce on plates. Spoon dressing over and sprinkle with hazelnuts.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Cut off both ends of each acorn squash. Cut each half in half lengthwise. Scrape out seeds. Rub the inside of each half with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Rub with 1/2 tablespoon of olive oil. Place cut side down on a baking sheet. Roast until tender when pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of pepper, 3 garlic cloves, 2 teaspoons of lime juice, 1/4 teaspoon of dried chili pepper flakes, and 1/2 teaspoon of cilantro. Mix well. Drizzle over roasted acorn squash. Serve with cilantro leaves for garnish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. In a large bowl, combine oats, salt, orange zest, and nuts. In a small saucepan, melt butter and combine with maple syrup. Stir into dry ingredients. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.
I love these healthy breakfast recipes and ideas! I will be trying the granola yogurt berry parfait! Yum!

Place beans in slow cooker with 8 cups water. Cover. Cook on high for 4 hours. Add remaining ingredients. Stir well. Cook on low for 3 hours or until baked beans are tender. Remove ham hock. Shred meat. Return to slow cooker. Cook for 15 minutes. Serve with the ham.

Cube the winter squash. Saute the winter squash in the butter until it is tender. Add coconut milk and brown sugar. Add vanilla extract and cook for an additional 3 minutes. Salt to taste. Garnish with parsley.
Amazing article! Thanks for sharing.
This is my favorite soup recipe!
This is an amazing recipe. I have tried this recipe and my family loved it.
Thanks for sharing. This looks yummy.

Cream shortening and sugar. Add molasses and egg. Add sifted flour, salt and soda. Then add spices. Dough will be very soft. Roll into walnut sized balls and roll in sugar. Place on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 f for 8 to 10 minutes. Cookies will flatten out while baking.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9 x 13 pan. In large bowl beat 1 pkg cake mix, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 cups water and 1 tsp vanilla. Pour into pan. In another bowl beat 12 oz cool whip until fluffy. Fold in 1 pkg instant vanilla pudding mix with 1 1/2 cups milk and 1/2 cup pineapple juice. Spread over batter. Spread 1 can crushed pineapple over top. Bake 45-50 minutes. Cool. Beat 12 oz cool whip, 1 tsp vanilla with 8 oz cream cheese. Spread over top of cake. Sprinkle with walnuts.
Dear Annie: I am 34 years old. I am recently divorced and my ex-husband has moved on. We were married for seven years. I have two boys, 7 and 3.
We were not a happy couple. I didn't realize that until he left me. He was un

Slice eggplant lengthwise and cut into 1/4 inch slices. Lay slices flat on cutting board. Cut through slices at an angle from each end to form strips. Cut strips into 1/2 inch pieces. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add pepper and eggplant. Cook until pepper is crisp-tender, stirring frequently. Drain. Stir in mint and salt. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve hot or chilled.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9×13 inch baking dish with some of the oil. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatcook and stir mushrooms in the hot oil until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in chili powder. Add the chicken breasts to the skilletcook until no longer pink in the center, stirring occasionally, 12 to 15 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes and mushroom mixturecook until thoroughly heated through, 1 to 2 minutes more. Remove from the heat and set aside. In a small bowl, toss together the rice with the garlicspoon half of the mixture onto the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Spread the chicken mixture over the ricetop with the remaining rice mixture. Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, 20 to 25 minutes.

Combine all ingredients except for chicken in a large zip top plastic bag and mix well. Add the chicken and refrigerate overnight. Place the marinated chicken on the grill. Grill for 3-4 minutes per side and then transfer to a large baking pan and place in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes.

Slice the blood oranges into wedges and place in a bowl with the fennel bulb slices. Drizzle with the white wine vinegar, then sprinkle with the fresh basil and garlic. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Drizzle with olive oil just before serving.

In a large sauce pan combine white sugar, corn syrup, and chunky peanut butter. Cook over low heat until peanut butter is melted. Stir in chocolate chips and rice crispies until well mixed. Press mixture into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Refrigerate until set, then cut into squares. Makes 20-24 bars.
Cook noodles to taste. Drain. Put noodles in serving bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Toss. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Boil or steam the green beans until tender. Rinse in cold water. Drain well. In a small bowl combine the oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Add the green beans to the dressing mixture and toss to coat well. Chill for at least 3 hours. Stir in the onions. Just before serving, sprinkle with the olives.

Dissolve the dry yeast in the warm water. Add the buttermilk and brown sugar. Let stand 5 minutes. Add the butter, the salt, the caraway seeds and the remaining 1 cup of the flour. Beat 2 minutes at medium speed of electric mixer. Add the remaining 3 cups of the flour and beat 2 minutes more. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board. Knead in enough of the remaining flour to make a moderately soft dough that is still slightly sticky.

Preheat oven to 200c. Grease an oven tray well with vegetable oil. Wash and cut potatoes into wedges. Combine egg white and spices into a large bowl. Mix well. Add potatoes and coat well. Bake potatoes skin side down for 40 minutes or until tender and golden brown. Serve with a relish or as a side.
name: easy special supper potatoesingredients: potatoes, water, sweet onion, garlic clove, butter, dill weedpreparation: Boil potatoes, onions and garlic, dash of salt, till potatoes are soft. Drain. Add butter and dill. Salt and pepper to taste. Stir. Serve.
name: spicy mashed potatoesingredients: potatoes, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, milk, butter, sea saltpreparation: Partially peel the potatoes and then cut in half. Boil potatoes in slightly salted water until cooked. Drain potatoes and blend to desired consistency with a mixer or pot

In a small bowl, combine everything but the prime rib. Rub the spice mixture all over the roast and refrigerate for 4 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the roast in a roasting pan. Roast for 2 1/2 hours. Add the water to the pan. Roast for another 2 hours. Let sit for 10 minutes before carving.
Toast muffin. Spread with cream cheese. Spread with liquid honey. Top with dried figs. Sprinkle with sunflower seeds.
Mix cake mix according to package directions. Add pudding mix (dry) and eggs. Add water. Pour into greased 9x5x3-inch pan. Sprinkle with poppy seeds. Bake at 350 for 50-55 minutes. Cool.
Place in a wok over high heat. Saute chicken. Add broccoli. Add mango. Add soy sauce. Cook until done. Add snow peas. Add cilantro. Add scallions.

In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the pumpkin and the soymilk and mix well. Add the raisins and mix well again. Refrigerate dough for about an hour. Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Drop the dough in teaspoon size rounds onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for about 12-14 minutes until lightly browned on top. Remove from the oven and cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before removing from the pan.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken into small pieces. Blend milk, cream cheese, seasoned croutons and onion. Add chicken. Divide crescent rolls into 8 portions. Place a portion on each piece of waxed paper. Roll each piece into a ball. Place on baking sheet. Press into round shape. Bake until golden brown. Remove and place on a serving dish. Spoon mixture on top. Sprinkle with pepper.

In a large soup pot, over medium heat, saute onion, carrot and celery in butter until tender. Stir in pearl barley and broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until barley is tender. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in cream and red pepper flakes and heat until thoroughly heated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve topped with fresh parsley if desired.
Slice summer squash into 1/2" rounds. Saute in butter until tender. Sprinkle with salt & pepper to taste.

Mix together first 4 ingredients. Whisk in peanut butter until smooth. Add vinegar to taste. Serve over rice or noodles or use as salad dressing.
It seems to be an unwritten rule that when you take away a dog from a shelter or rescue, you must change the name. There are many reasons for this, but I believe one of the most important reasons is the fact that most dogs that are left at shelters or rescues have had their names changed multiple times.
Think about it this way: If your dog came to you with the same name he had when he was born, would it really be his or her name? Probably not. A dog’s name is his or her identity. It is the one constant thing in his or her life.
So why would we want to take away our dog’s identity? Why would we want to take away our dog’s sense of security?
I believe that if you really love your dog, you will not change his or her name. If you really love your dog, you will keep his or her name as it is.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, onions, and bacon. Cook until bacon is crisp. Add broccoli. Cook until tender. Stir in stock. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Puree with potato masher. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve with croutons.

Line a 15x10-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the corn syrup and butter. Heat until the butter is melted and the mixture is smooth. Stir in the cerealmix well. Pour into the prepared pan and press firmly into the bottom of the pan. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler over low heat. Pour over the cereal mixture and spread evenly over the top of the cereal layer. Refrigerate until the chocolate is firm, about 2 hours more. Cut the cereal into 1-1/2-inch squares and place the miniature eggs in the center of each piece of cereal. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a heavy medium skillet over medium-high heat, combine the shallots and 1/4 cup orange juice. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the carrots and the remaining 3/4 cup orange juice. Cook until the liquid evaporates and the mixture begins to caramelize. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Stir the honey into the remaining 1/4 cup orange juice. Pour the mixture over the carrots. Toss until the carrots are coated.

Pulse the cream cheese and jack cheese in the food processor until smooth and fluffy. Add the jalapenos and pulse to combine. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in the garlic and green onion. Season the filling with salt and black pepper. To assemble the wontons, place a wonton wrapper in the palm of your hand and place a heaping teaspoon of the filling in the center. Fold the wrapper over the filling to form a triangle. Press the edges together to seal. Repeat with the remaining wonton wrappers and filling. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the wontons, being careful not to crowd the pan. Brown the wontons for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden. Sprinkle with additional black pepper before serving.

Pour the pineapple, juice and vinegar into a large saucepan. Heat to boilingstir until sugar dissolves. Simmer until reduced to 10 cups. Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Simmer uncovered for 2 minutes. Ladle into 4-6 hot sterilized 1-quart glass jars. Wipe the rims, then seal tightly. Process the jars in a boiling-water canner for 10 minutes. Remove and let stand in the canner until cool.

In a bowl dissolve yeast in warm waterlet stand 5 minutes or until foamy. Stir in buttermilk, oil, sugar, salt, and 1/2 cup of the flour. Stir in enough of the remaining flour to make a soft doughturn onto a lightly floured surfaceknead until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowlcover with plastic wraplet rise in a warm place until doubled in size 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Punch dough downturn onto a lightly floured surfacedivide into 24 pieces. Shape into rollsplace in greased muffin cupscover with plastic wraplet rise in a warm place until doubled in size 30 to 45 minutes. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

ingredients: eggs, buttermilk, salt, sugar, flour, baking soda, baking powder, vegetable oil
