ingredients

Preheat oven to 450 F. Place the leeks in a pot of boiling water over medium high heat and cook for about 3 minutes until bright green and slightly wilted. Drain the water and set the leeks aside to cool down a bit. In a small bowl combine the lemon juice and the zest and set aside. In a separate bowl combine the oil, the lemon juice mixture and the seasonings. Rub the salmon all over with the seasoning mix and place the fish in an ovenproof baking dish. Roast the salmon for about 15 minutes or until it is firm to the touch and flakes apart easily when tested with a fork. Place the cooled leeks over the salmon and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until the leeks are lightly browned and crisp. Serve the fish atop the warm leeks and garnish with a lemon wedge.

Combine the flours, sugars and spicescut in the shortening or margarine until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the rhubarb and milk and mix just until the dough comes togetherdo not overwork the dough or the scones will be tough. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead just until smooth. Pat or roll the dough into a 1-inch-thick circle. Cut the dough into eight wedges. Place the wedges 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake the scones at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until browned and firm. Cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve the scones warm with butter or margarine and preserves.
name: scottish bran scones
ingredients: self raising flour, baking powder, caster sugar, natural bran, salt, butter, milk
preparation:Sieve dry ingredients. Mix in butter with a fork. Use as much milk as required to make a very soft dough. Shape into

Before opening noodles, crush into 1 inch pieces. Open packages and set aside flavor packets. Place noodles in bottom of large serving bowl. Top noodles with broccoli slaw, then sprinkle with almonds and sunflower kernels, and green onions. In a separate bowl combine sugar, oil, vinegar, and flavor packets from noodles. Pour over slaw, cover and chill up to 24 hours. Toss before serving.

On a lightly floured surface with a floured rolling pin, roll the prepared crust to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut into 12 squares with a sharp knife or pizza cutter. In a small bowl combine the ricotta, mozzarella and 1/2 cup tomatoesmix well. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1/4 cup tomatoes with the oil and oreganomix well. Arrange the crust squares on an ungreased baking sheetbrush with the oil-tomato mixture. Top with the tomato-cheese mixture and turkey pepperonisprinkle with the parsley. Bake at 425 for 10 minutes or until golden. Serve warm. Makes 12 servings.

In a large frying pan or pot heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef steak. Brown the beef all around. Add the onions. Cook until softened. Add the garlic cloves, tomatoes, parsley, bay leaf, salt and black pepper. Cover. Cook over medium heat for 1 hour. Uncover and add the coriander. Cook for 15 minutes more. Serve over rice or pasta. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a shallow bowl, toss the sweet potatoes with the spray and place them in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 25 minutes or until tender. Heat the butter and garlic in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the asparagus and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and capers. Brush the sweet potatoes with the lemon sauce and sprinkle with the spinach. Top with the chicken.
Mix all the ingredients except for the crackers and form into balls. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Serve with crackers.

Cover chicken breast with the soy sauce, vinegar, and spices. Refrigerate for 10 to 20 minutes, turning the chicken once or twice. In a heavy skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the chicken breast and cook until no longer pink (about 10 minutes per side).

Preheat over to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 15 x 10-inch baking pan with butter. Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwisescoop out seeds. Place cut-side down in prepared pan. Pour 1 cup apple juice into each half. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Remove from ovenlet cool for 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Wash Kale and remove any thick veins. Stack a few leaves on top of each other (cut larger leaves into smaller pieces if desired). Sprinkle with salt. Place in dehydrator at 95 degrees F for 6 hours or until crisp.

Cut tenderloins into 3/4-inch pieces. Combine first 6 ingredients in a resealable plastic bagadd tenderloins. Seal bag, and turn to coat. Refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. Remove tenderloins from bagdiscard bag. Grill tenderloins 6 minutes or until done.

Combine carrots and onion in a large mixing bowl. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and the spices. Pour the dressing over the carrots and toss to coat.
Boil juice, water and cloves for 3 minutes. Add fruit and simmer 10 minutes. Add cinnamon. Pour into a serving bowl. Pour the lemon juice over the fruit. Serve the macaroons with the fruit.

Combine the butter, honey and brown sugar in a large saucepan over medium heat and stir until smooth. Add the baking soda and stir until dissolved. Stir in the popcorn and pecans, mixing well and transfer to a large bowl. Spread out on a waxed paper-lined baking sheet and allow to cool completely before breaking into pieces. Store in a tightly sealed container.

Peel fruitcut into 1/2-inch chunksset aside. Mix cornstarch with lemon juice until smooth. Add fruit and toss to coat. Set aside for 30 minutesdrain excess juice. Heat butter over medium heatadd fruit mixturestir to combine. Reduce heat to lowcook for about 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally.

Brown meat over medium heat. Stirring occasionally. Crumble meat. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes. Then add pepper. Cook about 2 minutes longer. Stirring occasionally. Then add all other ingredients except pork and beans and cook about 2 minutes longer. Stirring occasionally. Then add pork and bans and cook about 2 minutes longer. Stirring occasionally. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Separate wonton skins into 2 inch squares. Place a piece of crabmeat on each square. Place on baking sheet and bake 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Mix breadcrumbs with sesame oil. Sprinkle over top of puffs when finished baking. Serve as an appetizer.

Combine first 5 ingredients. Stir well. Place tuna in marinade. Cover. Refrigerate for 1 hour or more. Remove from marinade. Discard marinade. Broil or grill 4 to 5 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily. Garnish with green onion. Serve with rice.

Soften butter in mixer with paddle attachment. Add flour & salt. Mix well. Add cream cheese & mix until blended. Refrigerate dough for 1 hour. On wax paper, form dough into 2 inch balls & roll in powdered sugar & place on cookie sheet. Bake in 350f oven for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Drizzle with chocolate glaze. Melt chocolate over low heat or in microwave. Dip cooled cookies in chocolate & let set.

In a small bowl, combine egg white, cold water and 1/4 tsp of salt. Whisk until frothy. Add sugar and cinnamonstir until well blended. Add nutsstir until nuts are well coated with mixture. Place on a baking sheet that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until mixture is crisp and nuts are lightly browned. In medium bowl, mix together all ingredients except buns. Form into 4 burgers. Grill 3 - 5 minutes per side. Serve with bun, lettuce, tomatoes and onion.
Beat first four ingredients until smooth. Blend in pumpkin. Spoon into crust. Chill throughly. Top with whipped topping.

Prepare cake according to package directions. Cool completely. Melt together marshmallows and white corn syrup in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in vanilla. Cool slightly. Spread over bottom of pan. Sprinkle with nuts and rice krispies. Pour over top of all the other ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into squares. Makes about 24.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into quarters or sixths. Boil the potatoes for 20-30 minutes or until soft and falling apart when pierced with a fork. Drain the potatoes and return to the hot pan over medium heat. Stir the garlic into the hot potatoes and stir occasionally for 2-3 minutes or until the garlic is cooked. Add the butter and stir for another minute or two. Add the cream and mash the potatoes with a hand mixer for another minute or so to make them fluffy but not lumpy. Add the cheese to the potatoes and mix well. Mash the mixture with the hand mixer for another minute or two. Taste and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Saut the onion and carrot in the olive oil over medium-low heat until tender. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Turn the heat to low and add the crunchy peanut butter and spices. Cook until the stock has thickened. Stir in the dry-roasted unsalted peanuts. Serve hot.
Arrange the slices of tomato on a platter or in a bowl. Squeeze the lemon over the top. Sprinkle with the lemon pepper. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the capers. Serve immediately.

Combine flour, baking soda and powder in a bowl. Cream together oleo and sugar. Add eggs and combine. Add flour mixture and mix well. Stir in dates and pecans. Drop by teaspoonsful onto wax paper. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool 1 minute. Spread with frosting. Drizzle with cherry syrup.

Slice the peppers in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds from the inside of the peppers. Drizzle the cut side of the peppers with the olive oil. Sprinkle the garlic over the top of the peppers. Bake in a preheated 400 degree F. oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle the top of each pepper with the feta cheese. Return to the oven for another 5 minutes. Sprinkle the basil on top of the peppers. Serve immediately.

Cook wild rice as directed. Remove from heat. Stir in sausage links. Add onion, celery salt. Cook 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and water. Cook 10 minutes. Add soup and salt and pepper. Heat through. Serve.
Cook pasta as directed on box. Drain & mix with other ingredients. Bake for 30-35 min in a 350 degree oven. Serves 4-6.
Mix the lamb with the egg. Then add the garlic and the salt and pepper to taste and the olive oil. Mix until combined well. Form into small balls and brown in oil.
Put all the ingredients in the pan in the order given, according to your machines directions. Select setting for whole wheat bread. Select setting for crust type. Hit start. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine dry ingredients except for butter and water and cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add water and mix until dough is moist enough to hold together when pinched and rolled. Roll out on floured surface until 1/4 inch thick. Cut into desired shapes or use cookie cutters to make shapes and place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely before storing. Store at room temperature for up to 1 week or freeze up to 3 months. Makes about 100 crackers.
Makes about 100 crackers. Can be frozen for up to 3 months or stored at room temperature for up to 1 week.
Makes 3 cups. Store at room temperature for 1 week or freeze for up to 3 months.

Place the chicken in the slow cooker. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, soup, paprika, parsley and pepper. Pour over the chicken. Cover. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve over toast points or on rolls. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds and fry for a few seconds. Add the onions and fry for 5-6 minutes over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned. Add the garlic and fry for another few minutes. Add the ginger and fry for 1 minute longer. Add the lentils and water and bring to the boil. Add the curry and chili powders, the salt and milk and stir. Lower the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Serve with rice and garnish with coriander leaves and lemon wedges if desired.

Cook hot dogs according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine cabbage and carrots in a large bowl. Add sun-dried tomato. Mix well. Add mayonnaise, ketchup and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve slaw on buns with hot dogs.

Cut up the green pepper and green onion. Mix all the other ingredients together and pour into the crockpot. Cut the pork into 2 inch cubes and place in the crockpot. Cover and cook on high 4-6 hours. Take out the green onions and green peppers. Combine the flour and water together and pour over the pork cubes. Turn on to high for another 1/2 hour. Turn off.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drainreserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the potato mixturestir until heated through. Stir in the pasta and reserved cooking liquid. Cook 3 minutes or until hot. Stir in the pepperoniheat through. Serve immediately.

Combine honey mustard and buttermilk together in a shallow dish or plastic bag. Dip the chicken into the mixture and then roll in the breadcrumbs. Heat a small amount of cooking spray or olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Pour barbecue sauce over the chicken when it comes out of the pan. Serve with a side of steamed broccoli or other low calorie vegetables.
