Put cinnamon stick in saucepan with milk. Bring just to boil. Stir in cornstarch dissolved in cold water. Cook until thickened stirring constantly. Remove cinnamon stick. Add sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat yolks in a bowl until light and lemon colored. Add a little hot liquid at a time stirring well to prevent curdling. Return all to saucepan and cook until thickened stirring constantly. Cool and store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Rub the fish with the lemon juice and then season it with the garlic powder and capers. Put the fish in the baking pan and bake for 15 minutes. Add the butter substitute and the diced tomatoes. Return fish to the pan and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until done. Serve with rice and a vegetable.

In a large mixing bowl combine the yogurt, syrup and lemon juice. In a small bowl toss the nuts and set aside. Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Cut the sprouts in half and add to the water. Cook for 5 minutes or until slightly tender. Cool and toss in a large mixing bowl with the apple. Drain the nuts and add to the bowl. Toss to combine. Add the dressing and mix well. Taste for seasoning and adjust as needed. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Cook macaroni as directed on box. Meanwhile, in a skillet melt butter with onion. Stir in salt, water, and macaroni and toss. Add tomatoes, green peppers and hot dogs. Simmer for 5 minutes or until hot dogs are heated through. Sprinkle with american cheese before serving.

Cook the noodles. While the pasta is cooking, chop the bell peppers in to small pieces. In a medium bowl add the bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, parsley and feta. Salt the mixture. Drain the noodles. Add the mixture to the noodles. Mix well. Garnish with sliced ripe olives.

Cook the water, milk and oats until thick. Mix the filling and sugar together. Add to the cooked oats and stir until thoroughly blended. Add the cream and butter and blend. Stir in the vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix first 4 ingredients. Stir together egg and honey. Add wet ingredients to dry ingredientsmix just until moistened. Stir in orange juice and orange zest. Spoon into 12 paper-lined muffin cups. Bake 20-25 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Melt chocolate and butter in a large saucepan over low heatremove from heat and add granulated sugar and light brown sugarstir until mixture is smoothadd vanilla and saltbeat in the eggs one at a time until batter is smoothbeat in the flourfold in the chocolate chips and miniature marshmallowspour into a greased 11 x 17 inch baking panbake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees Fallow to cool completelycut into bars.
This is the perfect cake for a picnic. The cake is easy to make and very moist. You can decorate the top of the cake with fruit and nuts or just a sprinkle of powdered sugar.
To make the cake: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly spray an 8 inch springform pan with cooking spray. Line the bottom of the pan with parchment paper and then lightly spray the top of the parchment paper with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine the

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Place the eggplant and garlic on the baking sheet. Drizzle with the olive oil and toss to coat the vegetables evenly. Roast for about 40 minutes, stirring once or twice until the vegetables are soft and lightly browned. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool for about 10 minutes. Combine the cooled vegetables in a food processor with the balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Puree until the vegetables are completely smooth. Transfer the roasted vegetable puree to a bowl and stir in the cheese until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Serve at room temperature with crusty Italian bread or crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together 1 cup softened unsalted butter, 1 cup sugar, 1 large egg. Beat well. Sift together 2-1/4 cups self-rising flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda. Add sifted dry ingredients to creamed mixture. Beat until smooth. Grease 2 - 9 inch round cake pans. Pour batter evenly into pans. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely. For frosting: Beat together 1/2 cup softened unsalted butter, 1 cup confectioners sugar. Beat well. Spread frosting between layers and on top and sides of cakes. Decorate top of cake with 1/2 cup chopped chocolate. Add 1/2 can (10.5 oz.) apricot preserves. Press 1/2 cup candy orange slices around edge of top. Press

In large frying pan add 2 to 3 tablespoons of olive oil and over medium low heat add the parsley and garlic and cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Add the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper and hot pepper and cook for 20 minutes stirring occasionally. Serve hot with bread or pasta.

Dip chicken breasts in flour, then dip in beaten egg. Sprinkle with dry mustard. Fry in hot oil. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. In a crockpot, combine chicken broth, chicken soup, water. Add fried chicken. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or on high 2-3 hours. Serve over rice or orzo pasta.

Spread each half of your bread slices with margarine or butter. Layer with a spoonful of baked beans. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Place under a preheated grill for 2-3 minutes until the cheese has melted. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, warm olive oil. Add the garlic and cook until golden. Add the green pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the chopped onions and cook for 5 minutes. Add the thyme. Add the quinoa and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and stir. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Add the chopped chorizo and cook for 3 minutes. Serve and sprinkle some fresh parsley.
I am so excited to get started cooking these recipes. Thanks for posting these.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cream together butter and sugars until creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Blend together the pudding mix and milk until smooth then add to creamed mixture. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda, and nuts. Blend dry ingredients into the creamed mixture alternately with the milk, beating well after each addition. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire rack. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

Mix pudding and milk. Fold in cool whip. Spread in crust. Refrigerate. Top with more cool whip, then chocolate chips. Melt shortening for glaze. Spread on top.
 peanut butter pie iiiingredients: chocolate sandwich style cookies, butter, creamy peanut butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar, non-dairy whipped topping, vanillapreparation:Blend cookies and butter in food processor. Spread in pie plate & freeze. Mix together remaining ingredients. Blend well & pour into frozen chocolate cookie crust. Chill well and serve.

Combine 3 cups corn & creamed corn & spread in 9x13" baking dish. In saucepan combine Jiffy mix, 1/2 cup sour cream & 1/2 cup milk until well blended. Spread over corn & creamed corn mixture. Top with shredded cheddar cheese & sprinkle with parsley. Bake at 350* for 30 minutes.

Dissolve milk in cold water in large bowl. Stir in pudding mixes and almond extract. Fold in whipping cream. Layer 1/2 of cake cubes in bottom of 13x9-in. glass baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Spread with jamtop with 1/2 of the whipped cream mixture. Repeat layering. Top with remaining whipped cream mixture. Chill at least 8 hours or overnight. Decorate with chocolate curls and mint. Makes 6 servings.

Toast crumbs in oven. Blend with coconut, jam, liqueur and water, and refrigerate to set. Roll in coconut, cocoa or apricot jam. Dip balls in melted white or dark chocolate. Put on waxed paper to set.

In a microwave safe container melt the chocolate with the cream on high for 2 minutes or until melted when stirred. Stir in the almond extract and allow to cool for 5 minutes or until thickened. Dip each strawberry into the chocolate mixture allowing the excess to drip off the sides. Place on wax paper and sprinkle with chopped nuts or coconut or sprinkles or drizzle with the opposite color of chocolate. Allow to harden. Place in foil cups if desired. Serve that day or place in the refrigerator for storage for a day or two.
Strawberry is a very useful fruit for the treatment of diarrhea, dysentery, ulcers and other liver diseases. It is a good source of iron and vitamin C. The juice of strawberry is good for the treatment of piles and wounds. It is also used as a gargle to cure sore throat.

In medium saucepan over medium-low heat, melt butter and add flourstir until well blended and smooth. Add heavy whipping creamstir until thickened and smooth. Stir in sour creamadd remaining ingredientsheat throughremove from heatserve immediately over hot cooked pasta or rice, or use as a dip with crackers or vegetables.
If you are using the large green chiles you will need to roast them first. I like to do this in the oven on a cookie sheet and cover them with a little tin foil to keep them from drying out. You can roast them under the broiler in the oven or on the stove on a burner as well. I like to put about 1/2 cup of water in a small bowl and put the chiles in it and then put it in the oven for about 10 minutes or until the skin is really soft and the chiles are cooked through. Just pull the skins off and discard and then chop the rest of the chile up.
I like to add about a teaspoon to a tablespoon of chile powder

Bring about 2 cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan and add the lemon peel and juice. Simmer the peel for 2 minutes and then remove it from the water and let it cool slightly. Stir the shrimp into the boiling water and simmer until they are pink and firm, about 2 minutesdrain the water and let the shrimp cool slightly. Fold the cream cheese and horseradish into the shrimp until blended and then spread the mixture into a thin layer over the halved rounds of the melba toast. Arrange the lemon slices over the top and serve immediately.

Sprinkle duck breasts with salt. In a bowl mix together 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1/4 cup orange juice, 1/2 tablespoon worcestershire sauce, and 1/4 teaspoon chili oil. Pour over breasts and marinate at room temperature for 1 hour. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a skillet. Add duck breasts and cook over high heat for 4 minutes. Turn and cook for 3 minutes more. Transfer to a serving platter. In another skillet combine remaining tablespoon soy sauce with 1/3 cup water and 1/2 teaspoon orange rind. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced to 1/3 cup. Pour over duck breasts. Garnish with chives. Serve.

In a large skillet brown onions and garlic with olive oil until tender. Add wine, rosemary and salt to taste. Simmer until sauce thickens. Add chicken to skillet and simmer until tender. Serve over hot pasta with grated parmesan cheese.
Mediterranean Chicken W Rosemary Orzo
1 pound orzo pasta (1 box)
1/2 cup plum tomatoes, diced
1 fresh rosemary sprigs
In a saucepan combine the margarine, Italian salad dressing, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and rosemary. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat, stirring, until margarine is melted.
Pour the sauce over the orzo. Cook until orzo is tender, stirring occasionally. Add zucchini and tomatoes to the orzo. Stir in salt. Cook 1 minute more or until zucchini is crisp-tender.
3/4 teaspoon dried rosemary leaves
2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breast
2 plum tom

Brown ground beef with taco seasoning. Add baking mix and water. Mix well. Spread into a 9x13 inch baking pan. Spread refried beans on top of meat mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Take out of oven and top with green chilies and salsa. Top with shredded cheese. Return to oven for 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with your favorite toppings.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl stir together rice, chicken, milk, cheese, eggs, red onions, 1/4 cup cilantro, 1/2 teaspoon of cumin, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Spread mixture in a 13 by 9 by 2 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cilantro and 1/4 teaspoon of cumin. Bake 10 minutes longer. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Boil water, add sugar and stir until completely dissolved and boiling. Add the limes and boil for 2 minutes then add the coconut cream and stir until well mixed. Cool completely and blend until smooth. Pour into freezer containers and place in freezer to freeze overnight. Before serving thaw a little bit and add a scoop of mixed berry ice cream and sprinkle with mint leaves if desired.

Cook the macaroni according to directions. Add eggs and milk. Add cheddar cheese. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a greased 1-1/2 quart baking dish. Melt butter. Sprinkle over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Remove wing tips from chicken wings. Rinse the wings under cold water for 1 minute. In large bowl combine water, ketchup, sugar, vinegar and garlic powder. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add wings and refrigerate 1 hour or until ready to cook. Place wings in baking dish and cover with sauce. Bake uncovered for 1 hour at 400f stirring occasionally. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Combine cornstarch, soy sauce and water until well mixed. Add flour, chili powder and pepper. Mix well. Dip chicken tenderloins in egg. Then coat in cornstarch mixture. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes until cooked through and golden brown. Serve with ranch dressing.

Soak the rice in water for 2 hours. Drain the rice and put it into a large pot. Add water and 2 tablespoons of cooking oil. Bring to the boil and simmer for about 20 minutes. Add the carrot and cook for 10 minutes. Add the dried oyster and scallop. Add a little more water if the soup becomes too thick. Add the spring onions. Season. Serve immediately.

Cut livers in half. Heat skillet. Add livers. Cook 5 minutes or until brown on each side. Add onion. Cook until tender. Add broccoli. Cook until tender. Drain. Combine liver mixture, 1/2 cup water, and seasonings. Cook pasta in boiling water until tender. Drain. Add broccoli mixture. Toss. Serve immediately. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Heat oven to 350F. Lightly grease 13 inch x 9 inch baking pan. Cook rice in saucepan of boiling water 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes, green pepper and 1/2 cup of water. Cook until vegetables are tender. Stir in shrimp and cook 3 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Remove from heat. Stir in butter. Add rice and season with salt and pepper. Spread into prepared pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Mix together the graham cracker crumbs with the sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix. Mix together the evaporated skim milk with the reduced-calorie whipped topping and almond extract. Blend well. Spoon half of the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 baking pan. Spread over the crumb mixture. Mix together the sugar-free instant coconut pudding mix and the evaporated skim milk. Spoon over the crumb mixture. Spoon the canned peaches over the coconut mixture, arranging the peaches neatly. Spoon the mandarin orange slices over the peaches, arranging the fruit neatly. Refrigerate for several hours before serving. Cut into 6 squares. Store covered at room temperature.

Sauté mushrooms and garlic in a heavy skillet in 2 tablespoons of butter until tender. Add lemon juice and toss to coat. Set aside. In a saucepan of boiling salted water, cook pasta until tender. Drain pasta and return to pot. Add reserved mushroom mixture and remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Toss and add scallion and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Beat together tofu, milk and egg substitue. Dip bread slices into batter. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and cook the french toast until browned on each side. Serve with maple syrup.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir in lemon juice and 3/4 cup sugar until dissolved. Refrigerate until partially set (about 1 hour). Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in remaining sugar, lemon juice and vanilla. Blend in 1/4 of the whipped topping. Gently fold in gelatin mixture and remaining whipped topping. Pour into a 13x9 inch pan. Refrigerate until firm (about 4 hours). To serve: Garnish with a dollop of whipped topping and a slice of lemon.

Line bottom of 9x13 pan with graham crackers. In a medium bowl mix together pudding and half-and half until well blended. Fold in cool whip and pour into pan. Cover top layer of graham crackers and refrigerate. When ready to serve spread the top layer with the chocolate frosting and sprinkle on more graham crackers if desired.
Dreams can be interpreted as a subconscious expression of thoughts and feelings. Dreams may also be interpreted as a way for the mind to process information and experiences from the day.
The interpretation of dreams is a complex process that involves understanding the symbols and metaphors used in the dream. Dreams can be interpreted in a variety of ways depending on the context and the individual’s own personal experiences and beliefs.
Some common themes and symbols that may appear in dreams include:
Water: Water can represent emotion and intuition.
Darkness: Darkness can represent fear or the unknown.
Animals: Animals can represent aspects of the self or represent certain qualities or characteristics.
Objects: Objects in dreams can represent specific aspects of the dreamer

Cream shortening, butter, and crunchy peanut butter. Add white sugar, light brown sugar, and eggs. Beat until well blended. Combine dry ingredients and mix with shortening mixture. Mix well. Chill at least 4 hours. Roll into balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned on edges. Cool on wire racks. Yields about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Line a baking dish with aluminum foil, then grease with the butter. In a large bowl, mix together the apples, dried cranberries, brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg. Lay 4 slices of the acorn squash on a cutting board, and cut each slice into 2 halves. Scrape the seeds out of each half with a spoon. Fill each squash half with the apple mixture, then lay the halves back on the cutting board. Pinch the edges together to close the squash halves, then place in the baking dish. Pour the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter over the top of each closed squash half. Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven.

In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup of the butter with the parsley flakes. In a shallow bowl combine the bread crumbs with the remaining 1/4 cup butter. Place the chicken between 2 pieces of plastic wrap. Pound to 1/2-inch thickness using a meat mallet or rolling pin. Dip in buttered parsley mixture. Dip in bread crumb mixture. Place in a single layer in a 13x9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Combine the remaining 1/4 cup butter with the cheeses. Stir well. Pour over the chicken. Bake at 375 for 1 hour or until done.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease muffin tins with cooking spray or butter. Beat eggs and Splenda Granular with oil and banana extract until well blended. Stir in flour and cinnamon. Fold in beans and walnuts. Divide batter among muffin tins and bake 20 minutes or until muffins are lightly browned. Cool on wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 10-inch tube pan or a 9x13 pan with 1 tablespoon of the butter. In a medium bowl combine the egg yolks, the rind of the lemon, and the vanilla extract. Beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Set aside. Beat the egg whites in a large bowl until stiff peaks form. Beat the egg yolk mixture into the egg whites with the butter and flour. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until the cake is golden brown. Remove from oven, cool. Arrange the grapes in decorative patterns on top of the cake, filling the pan completely. Spread the chocolate glaze over the top of the cake, allowing the glaze to drip down the sides of the pan. Refrigerate the cake until the glaze is set. Carefully loosen the cake from the sides of the pan with a long thin knife. Cut into slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray miniature muffin tins or paper cupcake cups with cooking spray. Prepare cake batter according to package directions using a medium-sized ice cream scoop to fill each cup about 3/4 full. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. While the cakes cool, prepare the pudding. In a small bowl, combine the instant pudding and pie filling and mix well. Add the milk and whisk until smooth. Let stand for 2 minutes or until thickened. Frost cupcakes while warm. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Serve cold or at room temperature.

In large bowl, whisk eggs, powdered sugar and 1/4 cup maple syrup. Add milk and whisk until smooth. Add cinnamon and nutmeg. In nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Dip each slice of bread in egg mixture and place in skillet. Cook 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Transfer to plate and keep warm in 200 degree oven. Repeat with remaining butter. Serve with remaining 1 tablespoon maple syrup.

Combine all ingredients except nuts in a bowl. Form into a ball then roll in nuts. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until firm enough to handle. Cut into 12 slices and place in a large serving dish. Sprinkle with the remaining nuts. Serves 8 to 10.

Cream the butter and sugar and add flour and vanilla and salt. Knead the dough and place in the refrigerator to rest overnight. Roll dough out and cut into 1/2" rounds and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for about 15 minutes or until they are lightly browned. While still warm place about 2 teaspoons of filling on half of each cookie and press the other half down on top of the filling and press firmly to make the kolaczki sealed. Serve cold.

Beat cream cheese, butter, and shortening with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Beat in raspberry preserves, raspberry liquer, and powdered sugar until smooth. If desired, color with a few drops of food coloring. Frost cake as usual.
Melt both chocolates. Add condensed milk and stir until smooth. Add nuts and mix well. Pour into 13 x 9 pan. Cool and cut into squares.

In a large bowl toss the cabbage, carrot and peppers together. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Toss the dressing into the cabbage mixture. Chill for 2 hours before serving. Serve garnished with the crushed peanuts.
Cole slaw is a salad made from shredded raw cabbage or cabbages. It is usually mixed or tossed with a dressing, typically vinaigrette.
Most people know that cabbage is good for the health. They are also aware of the benefits of coleslaw. But do you know why? Cabbages have long been used as a healing food. In fact, they were first used to treat stomach problems in ancient Egypt. Today, they are still used for their medicinal properties. Cabbage is rich in vitamins A, C, K, B6, folate, potassium, iron, magnesium, calcium, fiber, protein, omega-3 fatty acids, phytonutrients, antioxidants and more.
Cabbage is a very versatile vegetable. It can be

Preheat oven to 375f. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper or grease well. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt into a medium bowl. In a large bowl cream butter until smooth. Beat in sugar, then add brown sugar and continue to cream together until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until light and fluffy. Fold dry ingredients into butter mixture until just combined. Stir in vanilla. Fold in walnuts and chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared sheets. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

In a shallow bowl, combine cracker crumbs, honey and mustard. Dip each chicken breast in milk. Press into cracker mixture. Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese during the last 5 minutes of baking.

Place new potatoes in a large saucepan with cold water to cover by 1 inch. Bring water to a boil, reduce heat, cover and cook until tender when pierced with the tip of a paring knife, about 10 minutes. Drain well, rinse under cold water until cool enough to handle. Cut each potato in half lengthwise, then slice into thin slices. Whisk together mayonnaise and lemon juice in a small bowlset aside. Whisk together hot water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon sugar in a medium nonreactive bowl. Add potatoes and garlictoss to coat. Cover and chill at least 4 hours or up to 2 days before serving. Just before serving, stir in chives and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Makes 4 servings.

Put mint sprigs in a small saucepan with cold water. Bring to a boil. Add chilies. Cook for 1 minute, then drain. Rinse under cold running water until cool. Drain. In another saucepan combine vinegar and onions. Bring to a boil. Add mint mixture. Boil for 1 minute. Add sugar. Return to boiling. Simmer for 1 minute. Add salt.
Pour vodka over ice in a glass. Add lemonade. Garnish with lemon wedge.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse chicken inside and out. Pat chicken dry inside and out. Rub outside of the chicken generously with olive oil. Sprinkle inside the cavity with the salt and pepper. Place the parsnips inside the cavity. Tuck the onions under the skin of the breast. Rub the outside of the chicken liberally with the herbes de provence. Tie the drumsticks together. Roast the chicken for 15-20 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven. Pour the chicken broth into the bottom of the crockpot. Add the parsnips and onions. Add the tied drumsticks. Add the chicken to the crockpot. Cover. Cook on low for 3 to 5 hours. When done the chicken will be falling off the bone.
Toast the sumac and coriander seeds until brown. Blend all the above ingredients with a mortar and pestle. Store in an airtight container for a few weeks.

In large bowl mix together flour, sugar, powdered milk, salt and baking powder. Cut shortening into flour mixture with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Store in airtight container in a cool dry place for up to six months.

In medium skillet melt butter. Add chicken and turn to coat. Sprinkle with dijon mustard and breadcrumbs. Cook over low heat until browned. Combine lemon rind and juice in small bowl. Stir in black pepper. Pour over the browned chicken. Serve over fettuccine.

Preheat oven to 425. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with foil or parchment paper. Arrange asparagus on the pan in a single layer. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 to 15 minutes or until crisp tender. In the meantime melt the butter in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Stir occasionally until the butter has turned a golden brown color. Remove from the heat and add the soy sauce and vinegar. Stir until well mixed. Toss the sauce with the cooked asparagus and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Coat an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange fillets in the baking dish. Combine lemon juice and remaining ingredients. Spoon mixture over the fish. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serves 4.

In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine sugar and spices. Add apple juice. Stir until sugar dissolves. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Strain to remove spices. Serve in mugs with orange rind twists.

Rinse chicken and pat dry. In a large bowl combine milk, egg and salt and pepper. Dip chicken into milk mixture and then into crackers. Place chicken on baking sheet and bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until done.
Mix all together. Place in pizzelle iron. Cook until lightly brown. Remove and cool on wire rack. Cool on wire rack. Dip in chocolate if desired.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Grease a 12 hole muffin tray. Sift the flour and caster sugar into a bowl. Make a well in the centre and beat in the egg. Add the milk and stir until smooth. Add the cheeses and mix well. Spoon the mixture into the muffin trays. Bake for 20-25 minutes until firm. Serve warm or cold. Serves 12.

Sauté garlic in oil for 1-2 minutes until fragrant but not browned. Add tomatoes and stir for a couple minutes. Add water and salt to taste. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for about 25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and has absorbed the liquid. Remove from heat and let cool slightly before serving.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a ziplock bag. Add the pork and make sure the meat is well coated in the marinade. Marinate in the fridge for 2-8 hours. Preheat the grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat. Remove the marinated meat from the ziplock and discard the marinade. Place the meat on the grill and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium doneness. Sprinkle with slivered almonds and cilantro.

Melt chocolate and water over low heat. When chocolate is smooth and shiny, remove from heat. Dip slivered almonds into chocolate and place on wax paper to set. Repeat with remaining almonds and store in refrigerator until ready to serve. Makes about 100 pieces.

Boil water in large saucepan for pasta. Cook pasta to desired texture. Drain pasta in a colander. Heat olive oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat. Add diced tomatoes, oregano, onion powder, salt and pepper. Simmer until mixture reduces by about one-half. Add basil and let reduce. Drain pasta. Toss with tomato mixture and parmesan cheese to serve.

In a shallow dish, combine the lime juice and the cumin. Place the chicken in the dish and turn to coat. Set aside. In a large skillet heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook for 3 min. Turn and cook for 3 min more. Remove from heat and set aside. Slice the bell pepper into thin strips. Drain the juice from the dish with the chicken. Add the lime juice to the chicken and stir to combine. Serve on top of cooked rice. Garnish with the lime slice and the bell pepper.

Place tomatoes and zucchini in a large bowl. Add the sweet onions and toss to combine. In another bowl, combine the monterey jack cheese and the basil. In another bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil and mustard. Pour the balsamic vinaigrette over the vegetables and toss to coat. Add the cheese and toss again. Season with pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 pan. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. In a small bowl beat together eggs, milk, oil, bananas, cherries, and vanilla. Add to dry ingredients and beat well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 35 minutes or until done. Cool on a rack.

Combine sugar and port wine in heavy small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Stir in ginger and cinnamon sticks. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Stir in cranberries and heat through. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator.

Slice eggplants. Boil in salted water until soft. Mash and drain. In a sauce pan combine mashed eggplants, onion, butter and eggs. Season with black pepper. Add crumbs and melted butter. Press into baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with oregano and cheddar cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes. Add sliced tomatoes and bake 5 additional minutes.

Bring water to a boil in a teapot. Add tea and steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Strain into a large pitcher filled with ice cubes. Add apple juice and orange slices. Add a sprig of mint for garnish. Serve in tall glasses with a mint sprig and an orange slice.
Cook beans in boiling water until tender. Drain. Combine with remaining ingredients. Toss and chill.

Boil broccoli, onion, peppers in enough water to cover for 10 minutes or until tender, drain. In a large bowl combine broccoli mixture, 1 cup of the cheddar cheese, the flour, skim milk, salt and pepper. Beat in eggs just until moistenedpour into a greased 9 inch pie plate. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheddar cheese. Bake at 375 for 45-50 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook pepper in butter in large skillet over low heat 30 minutes or until tender. Cool peppers in liquid. Dice pepper, onions and tomatoes. Beat eggs in medium bowl with milk, curry powder and pepperset aside. Press pie crusts into pie pansbake for 10 minutes. Layer vegetables evenly in bottom of panspour egg mixture over vegetables. Bake for about 30-35 minutes until golden brown. Let stand for about 2 minutes before cutting.

Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium high heat until very hot but not smoking. Add the salmon and cook for 3 minutes, turning once, or until the fish is just cooked through. Remove the salmon from the skillet and set aside. Meanwhile, in a small bowl whisk the honey and soy sauce together until well mixed. Add the ginger and cook over low heat for 2 minutes, or until the ginger has softened and the mixture has thickened slightly. Stir in the green onions and the lime juice and zest. Serve the fish on a platter and spoon the glaze over the top. Garnish with lime wedges.

In a small bowl stir together the soy sauce, brown sugar and ginger. Set aside 1/4 cup of this mixture. In a large nonstick skillet combine the remaining mixture with the oil. Cook over med-hi heat for 2-3 minutes or until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Place the steaks in a shallow baking pan. Pour the remaining marinade over the meat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Thread the beef onto skewers. Grill for 5-7 minutes or until done.

In a 9x13 baking dish, lay the bread cubes in a single layer. Beat the eggs with the milk, chicken broth and mustard. Pour the mixture over the bread. Cover the bread with sliced mushrooms. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Cover the dish and refrigerate overnight. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve hot with sour cream.

In a large skillet brown the chicken, onion, celery flakes and seasoning. Add the can of soup to the skillet. Heat through. Pour into the pie shell. Bake at 450 for about 20 minutes or until top is browned.
These are great! I like to put a little bit of parmesan on top.
You can use any kind of vegetable you want in this recipe. I love to use any veggies I have left over in my fridge!
This is a great recipe. I made it last night for my family. They all really enjoyed it. I will make this one again!
I love this recipe. It is sooo good!
I love these recipes. I am going to try them all.
In a small bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. Gradually whisk in water. Add salt to taste. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Thaw broccoli. Cook frozen chopped broccoli in saucepan until tender. Drain. Add milk, cream of mushroom soup and tarragon to the drained broccoli. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Mix flour with water. Stir into boiling mixture. Cook 1 minute. Stir in butter. Salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Combine chickpea flour with almonds in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Transfer to a large bowl. Cream butter and cardamom in a separate bowl. Add egg yolk and mix until blended. Gradually add dry mixture and mix until incorporated. Roll dough into small balls. Place on baking sheet. Bake until set about 12 minutes.
Cut roast into 1 inch chunks. Place in crockpot. Add remaining ingredients. Cook on high for 5 hours or on low for 7 hours. Shred roast with a fork. Serve on bun.

Slice the potatoes lengthwise into strips about the thickness of a nickel. Place the potato slices in a bowl and add the butter and the paprika. Mix well. Place the strips in a single layer on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees F for 10 to 15 minutes until the potatoes are lightly browned. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Cream 1/2 cup margarine or crisco. Add 1 cup milk or water. 1/2 cup flour and 2 tablespoons milk or water. 1/2 teaspoon salt. 1/2 cup sugar. Beat well with a mixer for 3 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. 1/2 cup more milk or water. 2/3 cup more sugar. Beat until very fluffy. This is the best ever!

Bake the potatoes in their jackets in a 350 degree oven for about 1 1/2 hours. When they are done, allow them to cool enough to handle. Carefully cut the tops off the potatoes and scoop the insides out into a bowl. Put the insides in a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Return to the bowl and add the sour cream, cheese, bacon bits, broccoli florets, and a little black pepper. Mix well. Put the insides back into the skins and replace the tops. Broil for a few minutes until the cheese is melted and the tops are golden brown. Serve with a salad.

Preheat oven to 325. In a medium-sized bowl, combine the first four ingredients. Set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the remaining ingredients. Stir constantly until the mixture comes to a full boil. Pour the oat mixture into the saucepan and stir to combine. Spread mixture into a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and spread miniature chips over the top. Let cool before cutting into 16 squares.

In a large frying pan or wok, saute beef in oil until no longer pink. Add carrots and celery and saute until crisp-tender. Add onion and saute until translucent. Combine soy sauce and water in a small bowl. Add to the frying pan or wok and stir well. Bring to a boil and add the rice. Stir until well blended and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 13x9 inch pan. Bake cake mix according to package directions. Cool. Prepare pudding according to directions on box. Spread evenly on bottom of prepared pan. Sprinkle with mandarin oranges. Top with cool whip. Spread with crushed pineapple. Spread with pudding. Sprinkle with chopped pecans. Refrigerate. Cut into squares.

Mix chocolate pudding according to package instructions. Add milk. Layer 1/2 of pudding in serving glasses. Top with 1/2 of the strawberries. Add 1/2 of the banana. Top with remaining strawberries. Top with remaining pudding. Top with white chocolate chips.
Mix all ingredients and refrigerate. Stir before using. Serve with any salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the eggs, butter, water and dry milkadd the dry ingredients and stir until smooth. Spoon the batter into a greased 12 cup muffin pan or popover molds. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve hot drizzled with syrup. Makes 8 servings.
name: fat free pancake
name: rose s world famous pancakes
name: cornmeal molasses pancakes
name: rich pancakes and waffles
name: pat s buttermilk pancakes
name: spicy country pancakes
name: breakfast eggcake
name: popover oven pancake
I love these pancakes. I had the pleasure of tasting them while visiting my sister in North Carolina. We always have them at my dad's birthday party when they are in season!
My name is Kara and I live in Charlotte, NC. I'm a native of the area

Toast tortillas. Spread olive oil over tortilla. Add goat cheese. Sprinkle with black pepper. Top with tomatoes. Add black greek olives. Top with fresh basil. Roll up tortilla. Cut into 4 pieces. Serve warm.

Place green beans in boiling water for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cover for 2 minutes. Drain and immediately place into cold water. Remove beans from water and place into salad bowl. Mix together honey, butter, and almonds. Add to salad and toss well. Serve immediately.
In blender container, combine all ingredients except ice cream. Blend until smooth. Add ice cream. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

Place chicken thighs in a large zip-lock plastic bag. Add the soy sauce, honey, garlic cloves, cilantro and ginger and seal the bag. Turn it around a few times to coat all the chicken evenly. Place the bag in the refrigerator for 3 hours or overnight. Drain the marinade from the bag and discard it. Grill the chicken for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Cut the limes in half. Squeeze the lime over the chicken. Sprinkle with pepper. Serve warm on a bed of lettuce with rice on the side.

In a greased casserole dish place a layer of muenster cheese. Layer spinach on top of muenster. Repeat until the cheese has been used up. Beat eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and garlic powder together. Pour egg mixture into casserole dish. Sprinkle with parm. Bake at 350 until custard has set, about 30 minutes.

Soak the beans overnight. Rinse them well. Add the dried beans to the slow cooker. Add the onion, ground pepper, short rib of beef, water, and barbecue sauce. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Cook on high for 4-5 hours. Serve with cornbread.

In a large skillet heat peanut oil over medium heat. Cook chicken until browned. Add peppers and stir-fry 2 minutes. Add vinegar and stir to combine. Add peanut sauce and cook 2 more minutes. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with green onions and set aside. Heat oven to 450. Lay out pizza crust and spread with peanut sauce. Top with mozzarella cheese and the cooked pepper-chicken mixture. Bake 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown. Cut into 8 slices.

Cream together the butter and brown sugar. Add the egg yolk and vanilla extract. Stir in the tea and all-purpose flour. Mix well and then chill for 2 hours or overnight. Roll into 1-inch balls and roll in powdered sugar or dip into melted chocolate. Store tightly covered in the refrigerator for up to 1 week or freeze for longer storage. These cookies are wonderful for dipping in coffee or tea.

Place bread crumbs in a shallow dish. Dip each spear in butter to coat, then in bread crumbs. Arrange in a single layer in a greased 1-qt. baking dish. Bake at 375 f for 20 min or until tender. Sprinkle with garlic powder and parmesan cheese.
You may have noticed that I posted this recipe for the first time yesterday. Well I have to say that I was a bit disappointed because I made these for dinner last night and my family did not eat them.
They did not eat them because they were too spicy for their taste.
The only thing I can think of is that I used hot pepper flakes and they are not used to that.
So I decided to try it again today. This time I used only half of the hot pepper flakes that I did yesterday. I also used a little less of the cajun seasoning that I did yesterday.
They loved them. They ate every single one of them.
If you are looking for a way to get more vegetables in your diet then these are the perfect thing for you.
They
Mix all the ingredients except raisins in a bowl. Add raisins and mix gently. Chill for at least 1 hour. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease 2-9 inch round pans. Sift together dry ingredients. Beat butter at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Add eggs 1 at a time beating well after each addition. Add sifted dry ingredients alternately with sour cream, beginning and ending with dry ingredients. Stir in prune juice. Pour batter evenly into pans. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely in pans on a wire rack. Drizzle with prepared sauce. Serve with whipped topping if desired.

Boil the fingerling potatoes until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and cool slightly. Cut into 1/2″ chunks. Whisk together the yogurt, mustard, olive oil, vinegar and a little salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add the celery ribs, red bell pepper, and red onion to the yogurt mixture and toss to combine. Add the potatoes and gently toss to combine. Chill before serving.

Cook macaroni and drain. Saute onion in butter. Add eggs and seasoning. Add milk and light cream. Pour over macaroni and mix. Add stuffed olives and parmesan cheese. Put in a 10 cup bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until set. Sprinkle with parmesan and american cheese. Bake for another 10 minutes.

Cook ground beef and drain excess fat. Mix brown sugar with soy sauce in a small bowl and allow to cool slightly. Beat together eggs and breadcrumbs in a separate bowl. Add the cooled soy sauce mixture to the ground beef and mix well. Add breadcrumb mixture and stir gently until just combined. Shape mixture into golf ball size balls and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake for approximately 25 minutes in a preheated oven at 400 degrees or until cooked through. Turn once while cooking. Makes 2 dozen balls. Serve with ketchup or applesauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a shallow baking pan with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray. Slice the sweet potatoes in half and scoop out the seeds. Place the cut side down in the pan. Spray with cooking spray. Drizzle with the olive oil. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Mix together the Cajun seasoning, cayenne pepper and salt. Sprinkle over the top. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Check at 45 minutes to see if they are done. If not cook for another 15 minutes. If they are done remove from the oven.

Beat together cream cheese and honey until smooth. Mix in eggs and vanilla until blended. Pour into a greased 9-inch springform pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50-60 minutes. Cool and refrigerate. Serve with fresh fruit and whipped cream.

Toss together the new potatoes, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the garlic, thyme, and rosemary. Roast in the oven for 45 minutes or until tender. Stir the potato mixture halfway through. Season with the nutmeg, balsamic vinegar, and salt and pepper.

Boil potatoes in lightly salted water until tender, 15-20 minutes. Drain potatoes and toss with oil, vinegar, and salt and pepper in a large bowl. Mix together the ranch dressing mix and the dijon mustard in a small bowl. In another small bowl, combine the pancetta with the mayonnaise. In another small bowl combine the basil with the cheese. Add the basil mixture to the pancetta mixture and mix thoroughly. Add the pancetta mixture to the potato mixture along with the red peppers. Serve in a bowl or in a lettuce leaf.
Mix all together. Drop by spoonfuls into hot oil. Fry on both sides. Sprinkle with powdered sugar or cinnamon and sugar.

In a small bowl, combine ground round, parmesan cheese, egg yolks, salt and pepper together in a small bowl. Add butter and onion to skillet on medium heat and saute until the onion is translucent. Increase heat to high and add the ground round mixture to the pan. Cook 2 minutes. Form into 4 patties. In a small bowl combine the cream, balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon of olive oil and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over patties and serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and dice. Cook in salted water for 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. In skillet heat oil. Add gingerroot, mushrooms, green onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add potatoes. Add 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce. Add sugar and cook for 1 minute. Serve.
Combine all except salmon in a bowl. Mound on rounds. Arrange salmon on top and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve with a glass of white wine.

In a large stockpot with a tight fitting lid, heat olive oil, cumin seeds, cinnamon sticks and cardamom pods over low heat for 10 seconds. Stir in basmati rice. Add the stock. Cover the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 20 minutes. Uncover the pot and stir in the corn. Cover the pot and cook for 10 minutes longer or until all the liquid is absorbed. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice. Cover the pot and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork. Serve.
In a double boiler over medium heat, combine the chocolate, 1/3 cup water, heavy cream, vanilla, and kahlua. Stir frequently until mixture is smooth.

Preheat oven to 160 degrees celsius. Grease a baking tray and line with paper. Mix together the first 6 ingredients. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in the golden syrup. Remove from heat and add the boiling water. Stir in the bicarb. Pour into dry ingredients and stir to combine. Stir through the chocolate. Spoon onto the lined tray, pressing with the back of a spoon to form a flat round shape. Bake for about 10 minutes or until firm. Allow to cool on the tray for a couple of minutes before transferring to a rack to cool completely. Can be stored in an airtight container for up to a week.

Wash potatoes and boil until fork tender, about 10 minutes. Peel potatoes and cut into wedges or cubes. Place in a mixing bowl with the cumin, paprika and salt to taste. Toss until well coated. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spread potatoes in a single layer in a baking pan. Bake until browned, about 25 minutes. Turn once during baking. Serves 4.

Dice and mince chiles and garlic. Puree 1/2 of the chiles and garlic with sugar and tomatoes in a blender or food processor. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and 1/4 of the shrimp paste. Set aside. Slice papaya and put in a bowl. Add shrimp paste and rest of dressing. Toss and serve.

Cut pork loin into thin strips. Cut bamboo shoots into 2 inch pieces. Heat wok. Add sesame oil and stir-fry bamboo shoots for 20 seconds. Add pork and rice wine. Stir-fry until pork is tender. Set aside to cool. Mix cornstarch with egg white. In a large bowl mix together meat mixture and cornstarch mixture. Add the salt, sugar and white pepper. Stir in 2 tablespoons water. Place 1 teaspoon mixture in center of each wonton skin. Dampen edges with water. Fold over to seal and press edges to seal. Bring water to boil in a large kettle. Add wontons. Cook for 2 minutes or until wontons rise to the surface. Remove from water and drain well.

Saute onion in butter until tender. Add potatoes to onion and butter and mix well until potatoes are brown. Add remaining ingredients, except sour cream, to potato mixture. Remove from heat and pour into casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Pour sour cream on top of potatoes right before serving.

Zest and juice the lime. Cut the chicken breasts into strips. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken. Stir in the garlic. Cook until no longer pink. Add the lime juice. Toss to coat. Serve the chicken over the hash browns. Garnish with the parsley. Sprinkle with the black pepper. Serve immediately.
Slice eggs in half lengthwise and remove yolks. In blender combine eggs yolks, vinegar, sugar and juice. Process until smooth. Fill egg whites with yolk mixture. Top with sprinkled paprika.
Brown ground beef in a skillet with onions. Add baked beans and salt. Add Velveeta cheese and stir to melt. Spoon mixture onto the bun. Serve.

Combine poundcake crumbs and 1/4 cup of melted butter in medium bowl. Press firmly onto bottom of 9 inch springform pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Beat remaining butter in large bowl. Add milk, eggs and vanillabeat well. Stir in 2 cups white sugar, orange juice, and cinnamon until well blended. Spoon 1/2 of the cake batter over crumbs in pan. Spread 1-1/2 cups peach halves in syrup over batter. Spoon remaining batter over peaches. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until cake is golden brown and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool cake in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove side of pan. Serve cake warm or cold. Garnish, if desired.
name: easy and fast fruit n cream waffles
ingredients: waffles, cream cheese, canned peaches, brown sugar, wh

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a ziplock plastic bag. Place the meat in the bag and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven broiler. Drain the meat and discard the marinade. Broil 4 inches from heat for 8-10 minutes or until the pork is golden brown and done. Remove from the heat and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 9-inch spring-form pan. Combine cream cheese and preserves in large bowl. Beat until smooth. Add poundcake mix, sour cream, half-and-half cream, eggs and almond extract. Beat until smooth. Pour half mixture into prepared pan. Combine remaining cream cheese mixture with dried apricots. Spread over batter in pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from spring-form pan. Cut in wedges. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve with Vanilla icing.

Beat margarine and sugar in a bowl until light and creamy. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Sift together the flour and cocoa powder in a separate bowl and add to the creamed mixture alternately with milk. Beat until smooth and well blended. Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 13-inch baking pan and bake at 350F for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over hot water. Remove from heat & stir in butter & sugar until smooth. Let cool to room temperature. Beat eggs & add to mixture. Fold in pecans. Pour into unbaked pie shells & bake in a 375f oven for 30-40 minutes until set. Cool to room temperature & chill overnight before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a cookie sheet with butter. In a large bowl, beat egg white until stiff peaks form. Beat in the splenda and the cinnamon. Spread the pecans out on the cookie sheet and toss with the egg white mixture to coat the pecans evenly. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, and stir once while baking. Spread the pecans out again and bake for 10 minutes longer or until lightly toasted. Repeat with the walnuts and the almonds, baking until toasted.
Pecans, Walnuts and Almonds, the Perfect Blend of Flavor!
Pecans are very easy to prepare for use in your recipes and require little special treatment except for soaking for 24 hours.
The best way to soak pecans is in cold water. Place the pecans in an airtight container and cover them with cold tap water. Cover the container with plastic wrap and let the nuts soak for 24 hours. After 24 hours d

Mix together butter and peanut butter. Add powdered sugar, mixing as you add. You may need to add more sugar if mixture is too sticky. Roll into walnut-sized balls. Place in fridge. When hard, melt chocolate in microwave. Dip egg in chocolate. Return to fridge. Serve at room temperature.

Cook and drain onion. Mix with cheese, onion, mayonnaise and soups. Fold in broccoli. Spread into well greased 13 x 9 dish. Combine cracker crumbs and butter. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until golden.

Combine rum, cognac, sweet cream, and whole milk in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring frequently to prevent sticking. Reduce the heat to lowcook until the mixture is heated through but not boiling, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heatstir in the eggs, 1 at a time, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until the mixture is thickened slightly and a thin film forms on the surface when you run your finger over it. Remove the pan from the heatstir in the powdered sugar until well blended. Spoon into bowlsgarnish with nutmeg.
Toss lettuce with carrot, sun-dried tomatoes and walnut halves. Sprinkle with cheese and drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar and sesame seeds. Salt and pepper to taste.
Combine all in a bowl. Serves 2.

Thaw sprouts. Cook in 1 tablespoon butter in saucepan until tender-crisp. Add rest of butter. Add vinegar, sugar, seasonings, and mushrooms. Cook for 1 minute. Add pimiento. Serve over hot rice or toast.

In a bowl cream together peanut butter, cream cheese, shortening and vanilla extract until smooth. In a separate bowl mix together the powdered sugar and nestle semi-sweet chocolate chips until all chips are coated. Take 1-teaspoon portions of the peanut butter mixture and roll into egg shapes (or any shape you like) on the palm of your hand then roll into the chocolate mixture. Place on a sheet of wax paper until completely hardened in the fridge or freezer (if you like the eggs softer place on a plate in the fridge). For a thicker shell just use less powdered sugar in the mix or roll in some crushed peanuts. Store in the refrigerator or freezer.
Boil the cabbage and water until tender. Drain. Mix the remaining ingredients. Combine the dressing with the cabbage and refrigerate. Add the apples and nuts just before serving.

Bring 3 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Peel carrots, then cut into 1/2-inch slices and add to boiling water along with cinnamon sticks and spices. Reduce heat to mediumsimmer until very tender, about 25 minutes. Drain wellset aside. Meanwhile, combine honey and lemon juice in a small bowl and stir until blended. Pour honey mixture over carrotstoss to coat well. Let cool slightly before serving. Makes 8 servings (2 cups)

In a large bowl, combine the dry pudding mix with the milk and the can of evaporated milk. Beat until well blended. Add the coconut extract and the coconut. Stir well. Chill for one hour or until ready to use. Gently fold the chilled Cool Whip into the chilled cream mixture. Spoon the mixture into the prepared unbaked pie shell. Cover and chill for at least three hours or until ready to serve. Garnish with additional shredded coconut, if desired. Store in the refrigerator.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the wild rice with enough water to cover by about 2 inches. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low, cover, and cook for about 30 minutes. Add the butter and onion, and cook until tender, about 1 minute more. Stir in the cranberries and brothcover and cook for another 15 to 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent stickingadd more water by 1/4 cupfuls if necessary to prevent sticking. Season with salt and freshly ground white pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Grease and flour 9 x 13 inch pan. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and butter. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add sour cream and beat. Combine the flour, baking soda, and saltstir into mixture. Fold in bananas. Bake in preheated oven for 45-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool. Spread with frosting. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serves 12.
The 30 Day Diet: The Easiest Diet in The World!
Combine water and tea bags in teapotlet steep for 5 minutes. Strain into large bowllet cool slightly. Stir in apple cider, honey, and orange slice. Serve over ice cubes or chilled.

Beat eggs and milk together, add vanilla and beat again. Mix powdered sugar with cream cheese and spread onto bread slices. Add preserves to the mixture and spread on top of the cream cheese. Cook on each side in a buttered skillet or griddle over low heat. Turn once and serve with strawberry syrup.

In a large Ziploc bag combine honey and mustard. Add fish and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to broil. Place fish on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the fish begins to flake when tested with a fork. Spoon some sauce over the fish. Serve with additional sauce. Makes 4 servings.

Heat 1 tbsp. olive oil in a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Add couscous and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and all liquid has been absorbed, about 6 minutes. Add chicken broth, parsley, tarragon, rosemary and lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover tightly and cook 5 minutes or until liquid has been absorbed, stirring once or twice. Remove from heatlet stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a plattertop with remaining tbsp. olive oil. Makes 4 servings.
In a food processor combine all ingredients except parsley. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Sprinkle with parsley.

In a large skillet cook chicken over medium high heat 5-6 minutes per side or until a meat thermometer reads 165 degrees. Set aside. In a small bowl stir together mustard, honey, garlic, and pepper. Slice chicken into thin strips. In a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Cook chicken strips 1 minute on each side or until crisp. Sprinkle evenly with remaining mustard mixture. Arrange carrots evenly on a baking sheet. Bake at 425 degrees F for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Toss carrots with the brown sugar. Serve chicken with the glazed carrots. Serves 4.

Brown the meat in butter. Then add the asparagus and saute for 2 minutes. Now add the sugar, the white wine and the stock. Simmer for another 2 minutes. Serve with the white asparagus tips. Slice the eggs and serve them with the asparagus. Add the creme fraiche and the pickle. Garnish with the chervil.

Brown meat and onions in large skillet. Add seasonings. Stir in egg noodles and water. Cook for 10 minutes. Add bread crumbs and mix. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in sour cream and heat through. Serves 4-6.

Cook beef and onion over med. heat until meat is browned. Add spices and cook for about 3 minutes. Add taco sauce and tomato sauce. Cook for 3 minutes more. Add beans and simmer for about 30 minutes. Serve over tortilla chips and top with shredded cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream shortening and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat until thoroughly combined. Add vanilla and milk and mix well. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking soda and saltstir well. Add to creamed mixture and stir just until blended. Stir in cereal and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large skillet heat the margarine on medium heat until melted. Dip the chicken in the mixture then place the coated chicken on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Serve over a bed of tortilla chips. This recipe can also be served over rice.

Combine strawberries, raspberries and blueberries in a blender. Cover and process until smooth. In a large bowl combine sugar, flour and baking mix. Cut in butter with a pastry blender until the mixture is crumbly. Stir in cereal and nuts. Spread evenly in an ungreased 15-in. X 10-in. X 1-in. Baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Combine the yogurt and the juice in a large bowlstir until smooth. Spread over crispsprinkle with extra nuts if desired. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. Store leftovers in refrigerator.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/gas 4 and line 2 or 3 small baking trays with baking parchment. Mix the butter and sugar until pale and creamy. Add the flour and water, then bring together to form a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly dusted work surface and knead gently until smooth and elastic. Roll out to a thickness of 5mm/¼inch and use to line the trays. Prick the base with a fork and chill for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, grease and line a 23cm/9in deep pie dish with the pastry. Drain the juice from the tinned fruit and place it in the pastry-lined pie dish. Roll out the pastry remaining from the tarts to fit the top of the pie dish and lay over the fruit. Crimp the edges together and chill for 30 minutes or until needed. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the pastry is golden and the filling is bubbling up through the holes. Cool on a wire rack and serve at

Slice up cheese crackers, set aside. In a medium bowl mix together the shredded cheese, onion, green peppers, and chili sauce. Stir in the milk and eggs until well blended. In a separate bowl mix together the salt and pepper with the ground beef. Slowly add the beef mixture to the cheese mixture until well combined. Roll the mixture into 8 loaves, place in a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Pour the remaining 1/2 cup of chili sauce over the top of the loaves. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the top with the cheese cracker crumbles. Bake for an additional 20 minutes. Serve with the remaining sauce.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Lay the bacon strips on a baking sheet. Bake until crisp. Remove the bacon strips from the baking sheet. Drain the bacon fat from the sheet into a skillet. Add the salt and pepper to the skillet and stir until combined. Place the bacon strips on paper towels to drain. When the bacon is cool, slice into thin strips. Place the oysters on the baking sheet and pour the bacon grease over the top. Sprinkle the salt and pepper over the top of each oyster. Sprinkle the slices of bacon over the top of the oysters. Sprinkle the chopped parsley over the top of the oysters. Place the baking sheet in the oven and bake for 3 minutes. Remove the baking sheet from the oven. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, boil 1/2 cup water. Add the seasoning. Stir in the crawfish tails. Cook uncovered 4 to 6 minutes. Drain and rinse in cold water. In a large bowl combine the rice mix, tomatoes and soup. Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. Combine the rice mixture with the crawfish tails in the prepared dish. Bake uncovered 20 to 30 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with the cheese. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/gas 4. Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in the baked beans, red kidney beans and sweetcorn. Mash up the bread and stir into the mixture. Season with pepper. Spoon the mixture into a greased 1-litre (2-pint) dish. Cover with grated cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with salad.
Cut baguette into 1 inch slices. Toast in the oven until light brown. Spread the brie cheese on each slice of bread. Drizzle the honey over the cheese. Sprinkle on the walnuts. Serve.

In a large bowl combine the oats, flour and cinnamon. Stir in margarine until crumbly. Press into the bottom and up the sides of a pie pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Combine apples, lemon juice and sugar. Spoon into the partially baked shell. Sprinkle with the cloves. Bake until apples are tender and filling is bubbly. Let cool. Makes a delicious dessert.

In a large pot over medium heat add olive oil and saute the garlic and onion until tender. Add carrots and potatoes and saute until tender. Add the broth and simmer until tender. Blend or process in a food processor until smooth. Add the cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Heat through and serve.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add onion and garlic and cook until onions are tender. Add the seasonings and cook 3 minutes. Add the beef and cook until browned. Stir in the tomato sauce and water. Heat until boiling. Stir in the beans. Simmer for 5 minutes. Spoon mixture onto heated flour tortillas. Top each taco with shredded lettuce. Serve with fat free cheese and taco toppings.

Saute onions in oil until soft. Add tomato paste and cook until thickened. Add tomatoes, garlic and spices. Bring to a boil, reduce heat. Cover and simmer until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in chicken, heat through. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with parsley if desired.

Spray 2 slices of bread with cooking spray and place in 2 frying pans. Top 1 slice with sliced tomato and cheese. Break an egg over the top and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook on medium heat until done. Top with another slice of bread and flip over. Repeat with remaining slices of bread and egg. Serve with skim milk.
Combine all ingredients except ice cubes in the blender. Blend until smooth. Add ice cubes to the blender and process until smooth. Pour into tall glasses and serve.

Grease muffin tin or line with paper baking cups. In large bowl combine quick bread mix, cocoa, and coffee granules. Add toffee pieces and chocolate chips. Stir until well blended. In small bowl combine buttermilk, oil, and eggs. Add to mixture and stir until moistened. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool. Store in an airtight container.

Cook onion in butter until tender. Drain vegetables and add to onion. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Makes 6-8 servings.

Season salmon with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until lightly browned. Remove to paper towel-lined platter to cool. Slice into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. In a small bowl combine onion, mustard and honey. Toss with fettuccine and enough lemon juice to moisten. Serve with salmon and chives.

Heat oil in a medium-size skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and onion. Cook until tender. Add sherry. Increase heat to medium-high. Add flour. Stir until mixture forms a paste. Slowly add milk and chicken broth. Stirring constantly. Bring to boil. Cook and stir until mixture is slightly thickened. Add frozen potato pierogies. Cook and stir until heated through. Stir in sour cream. Serve over pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan with butter or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Combine dry mix, eggs and milk in a large bowlstir just until moistened. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Pour into prepared pan and spread evenlydo not over-bake or the edges will be dry and the center will be soupy. Bake for 25-35 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for a few minutescut into squares and serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 8-12

Beat together cream and cream cheese until creamy. Add eggs and beat until just smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Butter 4 individual baking dishes and divide mixture evenly between dishes. Place dishes in refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Bake until puffed and golden brown on top, 40 to 50 minutes. Sprinkle with chives and serve immediately.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, cumin, oregano. Cook until garlic is golden. Add rice and stir to coat. Add stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Stir in pine nuts. Serve.

Place 1/2 cup of cheese in center of each breast. Fold over. Push down to form a tight seal. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight. Remove from refrigerator about 20 minutes before cooking. Heat oil in a skillet. Fry breast 4 minutes on each side. Baste with lemon juice during cooking. Salt and pepper to taste.

Steam the green beans for 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mustard, salt and pepper. Stir constantly until the mixture is smooth. Add the green beans, tossing well to coat the green beans thoroughly. Serve immediately.

Combine first 3 ingredients in medium saucepan. Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add baking soda. Stir until mixture foams. Quickly stir in cereal. Spread onto wax paper. Cool 20 minutes. Store in covered container.

Put orange juice in small sauce pan. Heat on medium heat until juice is almost boiling. Turn off heat. Put in gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Add pineapple and nuts. Cool to room temperature. Add the fresh berries. Chill until firm. Serves 12.

Bring a small saucepan of water to boil. Add the brussels sprouts and cook for 2 minutes or until bright green and slightly tender. Drain and run under cold water. Drain and pat dry. In a large bowl combine the sprouts, pecans, butter, and oil. Add the lemon juice and mustard and toss. Add the salt and pepper to taste.

Place gelatin in a bowl. Add 1/2 cup boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add the sour cream and continue stirring until the mixture is smooth. Fold in the salmon. Pour into a 10-inch pie plate. Refrigerate until set. Mix the lemon juice, salt, and dill in a small bowl. Spoon the mixture into a pastry bag. Pipe the mixture in the center of each cracker. Serve with the salmon mousse. Serves 6.
Salmon is not just a fish, it is also the common name given to different species of fish of the Salmonidae family. Salmon is an oily fish that has a rich, buttery taste. It is a fish that has been consumed since ancient times.
Salmon has long been considered by the Ainu people of Hokkaido as an important food source. It is said that the Ainu people would leave the head and bones of the fish to feed the spirits of the sea. It has been said that salmon can live up to 30 years. It is believed that the longer the salmon has lived the better it

Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Slowly stir in the sour cream. When smooth, add the egg and stir well. Stir in the corn. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring frequently to blend all the ingredients together. Remove from the heat and stir in the corn muffin mix until it is well blended and moistened. Spread the mixture into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Mix the rum with the peach and shake well to combine. Add the 7-up and mix well again. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Top with the champagne or sparkling wine and the sangria and stir gently. Garnish with the orange slice and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a medium bowl, stir together the milk, green onion, egg substitute, mustard, pepper and bread cubes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in the ham, and pour into a greased 10 inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with the Gruyere cheese and top with the bacon. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool 5 minutes before cutting into 9 squares. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a small heavy-bottomed pot over medium-low heat, stir together the milk, peanut butter, water, vanilla extract, salt, and cornstarch until well-combinedcook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the mixture thickens slightlyremove from the heat and stir in the vanilla extractpour into an 8x8-inch pan lined with parchment paper or wax paperlet cool, then cut into squaresmelt the candy coating according to the package instructionsin a small bowl, toss the peanuts with the melted coating until evenly coatedlet set for 30 minutesbreak the coated peanuts into pieces of any desired sizeplace 1 piece of candy coated peanuts in the center of each square of peanut butter mixtureserve.

Soak tart apples in water for two hours. Drain the liquid and drain the apples. Add sugar and spices to the apples and let sit over night. The next day add the oil, eggs and vanilla and mix well. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Pour into an ungreased tube pan. Bake at 350 for one hour and ten minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for ten minutes and turn out on a cooling rack.

Boil water in large pot. Add bouillon cube. When bouillon cube is dissolved, add the potatoes and boil for about twenty minutes or until tender. Add cumin. Drain water from potatoes and add milk. Mash with hand. Add pepper and salt to taste. Add arrowroot and milk. Cook until thick. Cool. Serve with sour cream and sprinkle with chervil.
