In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the chicken stock to a boil. In a bowl, beat the eggs with the parmesan cheese. Add the eggs to the soup. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the parsley and season with the salt and pepper. Serve in bowls. Garnish each serving with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese.

In a medium saucepan, heat the water over high heat. Add the pasta and stir well to separate the strands of pasta. Cook for 4 minutes or until tender. Drain in a colander over a bowl and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking. Add the egg to the saucepan and whisk over medium heat until scrambled. Stir in the mustard, then pour in the hot water to make a cream sauce. Add 3 cups of the pasta to the saucepan along with the cheddar, salt and pepper. Stir to combine, then add the remaining pasta. Transfer to an 8x8 inch baking dish and sprinkle with croutons. Bake for 20 minutes, or until lightly browned on top.

Toast 3 slices of the French bread to desired crispness. Rub tops of toasted bread with cut cloves of garlic. Spread each toasted slice with 1 tablespoon of the Mayonnaise. Top each slice with 1/3 of the chopped crabmeat. Top each slice with 1/2 cup of the chopped spinach, and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the seafood seasoning. Spread each slice with 2 tablespoons of the egg mixture. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the scallions and top with 1/2 cup of the mozzarella cheese. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven until the tops of the sandwiches are lightly browned and the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 10 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into wedges to serve.
Combine butter and marshmallows. Press into a ball. Roll in honey bunches of oats. Dip into dipping chocolate. Let set. Store in refrigerator.
Butter an 8 or 9 inch square pan. Mix all ingredients except cottage cheese. Pour into pan. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until well puffed. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Garnish with bacon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray two 9-inch round cake pans with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Divide batter between the two pans. Bake 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool completely. In a large bowl, beat together the powdered sugar and the softened cream cheese until smooth. Add the butter and beat until light and fluffy. Spread 1 layer of cake with about 1/4 of the frostingtop with second layer of cake. Spread top and sides of cake with the remaining frosting. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
In large skillet brown meat with salt, pepper and broth. Drain excess fat. Add garlic powder and onion. Heat thoroughly. Serve on buns with pickle slices and mustard, if desired.

In a small bowl, mix together the mustard, lime juice, cilantro and 1 tsp of the sea salt. Rub mixture over both sides of the chicken. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the chili powder and cook for 30 seconds. Add the chicken and cook for 2 minutes. Add the water, cover the pan and reduce heat to medium. Cook for 10 minutes or until the juices run clear. Sprinkle the remaining sea salt over the cooked chicken. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Peel and dice sweet potatoes and toss with butter, honey, whisky, brown sugar, salt and pepper to taste. Spread onto a greased baking pan. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until tender. Sprinkle with toasted walnuts and serve immediately.

Core apples and cut into quarters. Remove seeds if desired. Combine sugar and spices into a small pot. Add water and bring to a boil. Add apples and cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Transfer apples to a jar or plastic container (for freezing) and pour the hot spice mixture over them. Store in the refrigerator. Can also freeze or dry.

Combine cherries and plums with lemon juice. Add 1 part wine to 2 parts sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until fruit is soft but not mushy, about 20 minutes. Add spices, salt and rose water. Cool completely before jarring. Makes 3 half-pint jars.

Melt margarine in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the onions and cook for 10 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in the puree and broth and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in the peanut butter and milk. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place a slice of french bread butter side down on a baking sheet. Spread feta cheese evenly over top. Sprinkle olives and oregano over cheese. Place another slice of french bread butter side down over feta. Bake until crisp and golden brown. Serve with additional feta if desired.

In saucepan combine margarine, sugar, and corn syrup. Boil over medium heat for 5 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Stir in soda. Pour over popcorn and stir to coat evenly. Spread on jelly roll pan. Bake at 250 degrees for 1 hour or until lightly browned and crisp. Let cool. Store in airtight container.
Add all ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth. Pour the drink in a glass with ice cubes and garnish with a slice of fresh pineapple and an orange wedge on the side of the glass.

In a large mixing bowl combine the cheeses and the peppers. In a separate bowl combine the eggs and the cayenne pepper and beat well. Add the eggs to the cheese mixture and stir to combine well. Pour into an 8x8 baking dish and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until center is firm. Let cool and cut into squares.
Learn the recipe to make the best green chili cheese fries! Crispy fries coated in green chili and melted cheese.
A simple green bean casserole recipe that uses canned green beans and canned cream of mushroom soup.
This easy Mexican casserole is made from a simple combination of canned vegetables, cheese and tortilla chips.
A recipe for an easy-to-prepare casserole that includes ground beef, tomatoes and cheese.
This Mexican casserole uses ground beef and canned vegetables and is topped with melted shredded cheese.
A casserole recipe that uses creamed soup and canned green beans in a

Cook onions in 1 tbsp. Butter until transparent. Add rice and cook stirring for 2 minutes. Add 1/2 cup water and simmer 15 minutes or until water is absorbed. Add 1/2 cup milk and 1/3 cup swiss cheese stirring until melted. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Serves 4 as a side dish or 2 as a main dish.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the orange zest and juice and the asparagus and cook until tender, about 5-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Put sugar in saucepan and add karo. Put on top of stove at med-high heat. Let boil without stirring. Brush sides of pan with wet pastry brush. Take off heat when it gets soft ball stage. Add white karo slowly and stir constantly until it cools. Add peanut butter, then add 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract. Stir and then add egg whites. Beat egg whites with blender or mixer. Spread on a sheet of greased wax paper. Put on cookie sheet and let cool. Peel off of paper and cut into strips.

Mix all ingredients in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Cool and use on any of your favorite bbq items. Store in the refrigerator up to 3 weeks.
What a great collection of recipes! I'll be bookmarking this page for later use!
Yum! I love this collection of recipes!!
Wow! There are so many great recipes here. I'm pinning this.
Thank you for posting this collection of barbecue sauce recipes! I am always looking for more to try out!

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat butter until it melts. Add in onion and minced garlic cloves. Saute until onions begin to turn golden brown. Add in basmati rice. Saute for 2 minutes. Add in bay leaf and thyme. Add in turmeric. Add in broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover saucepan and simmer until rice is tender. Serve.

Bring the rotel to a boil in a sauce pan and reduce to medium low heat. While it is boiling add the corn chips until they are all broken up into the tomatoes. Once the tomatoes are mixed in add the sausage, cheese, cilantro, jalapenos, onion powder and garlic powder. Let it cook for another 10 minutes or until the mixture thickens up a bit. Pour into a serving dish. Scramble the eggs in a skillet with the butter. Once the eggs are fully cooked add them to the serving dish with the tomato mixture. Serve with toast or tortillas.

In a large non stick skillet, cook and stir hash browns and bacon until crisp. Remove from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, saute the green peppers. Pour egg mixture over top. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Broil about 3 inches from heat until lightly browned. Cut into wedges to serve.

Peel and cube the eggplants. Rinse with cold water and squeeze dry. Add to 1 cup of flour, salt and 1 beaten egg. Mix well. Add 1 cup of powdered sugar and mix well. Heat oil in a large frying pan. Drop the mixture by the spoonful into the hot oil and fry until golden brown. Drain and sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving.

Combine all the marinade ingredients except for the prawns in a bowl. Add the prawns and marinate for about 30 minutes or until firm to touch. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan or wok and add onions. Cook until softened. Add the tomatoes, garlic and sweet peas. Cook until the mixture is quite thick. Add the prawns and cook until they are pink. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over boiled rice.
Brown meat and set aside. In a skillet over medium heat, cook green pepper and onion in oil for about 3 minutes. Add to meat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer uncovered for 2 hours. Serve hot.

Heat together the cocoa, sugar and salt in a medium heavy-bottomed saucepan. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens and forms a thin paste. Stir in the milk and heat until it boils. Pour into a large pitcher. Stir in the light cream and vanilla. Add the orange zest. Serve warm topped with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9x13-inch baking dish, place brisket flat side down. In a medium bowl, combine ketchup, grape jelly and soup mix. Spoon mixture over brisket. Cover and bake for 2 hours. Turn brisket overbake for 2 more hours. Top with onions. Bake until done.

Place fish fillet on baking sheet. Brush with half of soy sauce. Sprinkle with half of gingerroot and sesame seeds. Broil 6 inches from heat for 3 minutes. Turn fish over and brush with remaining soy sauce. Sprinkle with remaining gingerroot and sesame seeds. Broil for another 3 to 4 minutes. Serve with cooked rice.
Beat together cream cheese and 1/4 c. of the cheddar cheese. Fold in remaining cheeses and seasonings. Cover and refrigerate until firm. Roll in chopped nuts. Serve with crackers.

In a food processor combine the garlic cloves and honey. Process until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and process until well blended. Place the chicken in a bowl. Pour the garlic mixture over the chicken and mix well to coat. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the chicken in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.

In large nonstick skillet over medium heat, warm 1 tablespoon oil. Add onioncook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook 30 seconds longer. Add broccoli coleslaw mix and 3/4 teaspoon saltcook 3 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Stir in brothcook 2 minutes or until broccoli is crisp-tender. Stir in hoisin sauce, honey and ground ginger. Remove from heatkeep warm. In small bowl, combine cornstarch and remaining 1/4 teaspoon saltstir into broccoli mixture. Remove from heatkeep warm. In same skillet over medium-high heat, warm remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add chickencook for 5 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in center. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons brothcook for 1 minute or until heated through. Remove from heatkeep warm. Serve chicken mixture on tortillas with broccoli mixture and coleslaw. Sprinkle with chopped green onions.

In a heavy saucepan, heat the heavy cream and the white karo over medium heat until it boils. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract and butter. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens enough to mold into balls. Cool for 15 minutes. Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll the balls in the chopped pecans. Wrap individually in waxed paper. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 36 balls.

In a medium bowl, whisk the curry paste and wine. Add the chicken. Turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the butter. When the butter is foaming, add the chicken. Saute for 3 minutes per side. Reduce heat to medium. Add 1/3 cup of the water. Cover and cook for 15 minutes. Add the rest of the water and the remaining curry paste. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the sour cream. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with rice.

Combine currants and cold water in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer gently until the currants are softened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve. (You should have about 1 1/2 cups syrup.) Combine the syrup and the lemon juice in a large pitcher. Add the white sugar and stir until dissolved. Stir in the cold water. Serve immediately or chill. To serve, pour into glasses filled with ice and garnish with the sliced lemons.
This is a good recipe. I had to double it though to get the right taste. I love the spices in it.
This is a great recipe. I had to double it though to get the right taste. I love the spices in it.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Using a pastry blender or your fingertips, work the butter into the dry mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Set aside 3/4 cup of the mixture for the topping and press the remaining mixture into the bottom of an ungreased 9x13-inch baking pan. Arrange the apple slices over the bottom layer so they just touch. Sprinkle the top with the reserved topping mixture and pat down gently to secure the topping to the apple layer. Bake for 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Cool for 20 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream.

Beat the eggs with the water in a large bowl with a hand mixer until foamy. Heat the margarine in a large skillet over medium heat until melted. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and cook until the eggs are just set. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Serve with toast or biscuit.

Peel gingerroot and slice into 1/8 inch rounds. Combine vinegar, sugar and salt in medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour over gingerroot, cover and chill overnight before serving.

Place potatoes in a large saucepan with just enough water to cover. Add 1/2 tsp. Salt and cook until tender. Drain water from potatoes and return to saucepan. Add 3/4 cup butter, fresh garlic, chicken broth, black pepper and light cream. Mash with a potato masher. Transfer to a serving platter. Top with fresh chives or parsley. Makes 4 servings.
Boil the green beans and onion. Brown the mushrooms. Boil the smoked sausages. Put everything into the oven and bake.
Drain tunaadd mushroom soup, kernel corn, and potato chipsbake at 350 for 1 hour. Top with sour cream. Serve with crispy bacon bits.

In a bowl, combine first 3 ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or up to 1 day before serving. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon for 3 minutes or until crisp. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Fold the bacon into the blue cheese mixture. Fold in the parsley. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 425. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium high heat. Add the garlic and cook until aromatic. Spread the garlic oil over the crust. Top with the mozzarella cheese and arrange the heirloom tomatoes and basil in a pretty design. Drizzle the balsamic vinegar over the top. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the cheese is melty. Garnish with more basil and fresh mozzarella.

In a mixing bowl combine all of the above. Let marinate for a couple of hours. Then add the chicken breast halves to the bowl and let marinade for 1 more hour. Grill the chicken for 12-14 minutes. Serve with lettuce, tomatoe and a slice of mozzarella cheese.

Boil the beets with a small amount of water in a non-aluminum pot until tender. Drain the cooking liquid and save for later use. Let the cooked beets cool. Peel the skin off the cooked beets and discard. Cut the beets into chunks and add to a large pot. Add the lemon juice, lemon zest, ginger and 2 cups of sugar. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to low and cook for about 15 minutes or until the mixture is thick enough to coat a spoon. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar and the almonds. Bring to a boil again and cook for 1 minute or until the mixture is thick enough to coat a spoon. Cool completely in the pot then store the preserves in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.

In a medium saucepan heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add onion and cook 2 minutes. Stir in broth and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Add sprouts. Reduce heat to lowcover tightly. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in pecans. Makes 4 servings.
This is a wonderful recipe. I made it exactly as written, except I used canned chicken broth instead of homemade. I also didn't use cider vinegar in my homemade broth. I'll definitely make this again. It's delicious.
I made this for Thanksgiving. I found it was a bit strong in flavor. My husband said he couldn't taste the chicken broth. I would probably cut back on the cider vinegar.
I love Brussel Sprouts! This recipe was great. I added some diced red peppers.

Brown the meat in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the seasoning mix and stir. Add the remaining ingredients except the onions. Stir together and let simmer for about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Top with onions. Serve over hot pasta or rice. Sprinkle with extra cheese if desired.

Place the oil in a skillet. Add onions. Sauté the onions for 2 to 3 minutes. Drain the grease. Mix the mustard with the catsup. Add the catsup mixture to the skillet. Add the Pork & Beans. Mix well. Add the brown sugar, Tabasco Sauce and Barbecue Sauce. Stir well. Place into 2 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Broil ham steaks for 5 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. In small saucepan, combine brown sugar and next 4 ingredientsbring mixture to a boil over medium-high heatboil 2 minutes or until mixture is reduced by half. Strain through fine strainer into a medium bowl, discarding solidslet stand for 2 minutes or until slightly thickenedspoon mixture evenly over ham steaks. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Bring 1 cup of water and apple and cranberry juices to a boil. Add tea bags. Steep 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 3 cups of cold water and lemon juice. Add pumpkin pie spice. Serve over ice.

Chop the red and yellow capsicums into 3/4-inch pieces. In a large pan over medium heat add olive oil spray. Add the capsicums and stir. Add the garlic and thyme and stir. Add the anchovies and stir. Season with pepper. Add the tomatoes and stir. Cook for 5 minutes. Take off the heat. Add the goats cheese and stir. Serve hot or cold. Serves 4.

In a large skillet brown the onion in butter for 5 minutes. Then add the sliced potatoes to the skillet and cook over low heat until tender about 10 minutes. Stir in the cheese and season with salt, pepper, and dry mustard. Beat the eggs lightly with the milk. Add the egg mixture to the skillet along with the garlic powder and paprika. Stir gently until thoroughly mixed. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees until the center is firm about 40 minutes.

In a medium bowl combine garlic with tomatoes. Cook over medium heat until garlic is golden brown. Add ham. In another bowl combine half-and-half, thyme, ham mixture. Cook over low heat. In a casserole dish combine pasta and ham mixture. Top with mozzarella. Bake at 350 degrees until bubbly. Top with feta. Serves 4.

Brown meat with onion, celery and garlic. Add parmesan cheese and cayenne. Add cans of soup, mix well. Pour over tater tots. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 deg. In a small bowl combine the olive oil, worcestershire sauce, cajun seasoning, seasoning salt, ground cayenne pepper and pumpkin pie spice. Place the seeds on a baking sheet and coat with the oil mixture. Bake for about 30 minutes until seeds are brown and slightly crisp. Remove from oven and toss to coat. Allow to cool and serve.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine sugar, light corn syrup, and jalapeno. Bring to boil. Continue boiling until mixture reaches soft ball stage (240 degrees F). Remove from heat. Add baking soda and vanilla. Pour into a 12 x 12 glass baking dish. Sprinkle with chopped nuts and then add butter. Spread nuts and butter to cover entire surface. Let stand until mixture becomes hard. Break into pieces. Store at room temperature in an airtight container.

Melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add potatoes and onion. Cook until potatoes are tender and golden brown. Remove from heat. Add eggs and mix well. In another skillet, melt remaining butter. Add prosciutto. Cook until browned. Divide potato mixture between two 8-inch ovenproof skillets. Top with prosciutto mixture. Sprinkle with basil. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into wedges to serve.

Preheat the broiler. Combine 1 teaspoon of the dijon mustard with the lemon juice and olive oil. Mix well. Season the fish with salt and pepper and the dill. Broil the fish until it flakes easily with a fork or skewer. Transfer to plates and sprinkle with the remaining 1 teaspoon dijon mustard. Serve the fish with the lemon wedge and the bay leaves.

In a medium bowl, beat together the softened butter and cream cheese until smooth and creamy. Add the red velvet cake mix and mix until completely combined. Add the brown sugar and mix until thoroughly combined. Roll into a ball and place on a plate. Roll the ball in the mini chocolate chips until coated.

Bring apple juice to a boil in a saucepan. Add soy sauce and ginger. Mix cornstarch and water. Add to the mixture and bring to a boil. Add fish and simmer 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and add butter. Serve over rice.
Melt all the ingredients together. Stir well. Drop by spoonfuls on wax paper or aluminum foil. Allow to cool until firm. Cut into bars.

Slice the tomatoes in half and squeeze out the seeds. Sprinkle with oregano and a little salt and pepper. Add a slice of feta cheese to each tomato half and top with a cucumber slice. Drizzle with oil and vinegar.

Wash blueberries, add water and lemon juice. Bring to a boil and let boil for 5 minutes. Add low-sugar pectin, let boil for one minute more. Remove from heat and skim off foam. Ladle into hot jars and seal.

In a saucepan, combine the sugar and cocoa. Add the boiling water. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Add the butter and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Cool. Serve over ice cream or pudding. Serve in small bowls.

Prepare snow peas according to package directions. Drain, rinse and set aside. Cut cream cheese into small cubes. In a small bowl, combine cream cheese cubes with basil, chives, dill weed, caraway seed, lemon pepper seasoning and lemon juice. Stir until blended. Stuff each pea with cheese mixture. Arrange on lettuce leaves or on an attractive serving plate. Garnish with parsley if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Place cleaned and rinsed berries in a pot. Add 1 cup water. Add sugar and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook until thick. Mix cornstarch with 1 tablespoon cold water. Stir into berry mixture and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let cool. Pour into serving dish.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Add the udon noodles and cook until tender but firm to the bite, about 2 minutes. Drain the udon noodles and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, add 1 teaspoon of the walnut oil. Add the broccoli florets and cook for 3 minutes. Add the red bell peppers and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the udon noodles and 1 tablespoon of the walnut oil, and toss well to coat. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool for 3 minutes. In a small bowl, stir together the tofu and the remaining 1 teaspoon walnut oil. Add the maple syrup, and season with the sea salt and black pepper. Spread the tofu mixture evenly over the udon noodle mixture and toss well to coat. Divide the udon noodle mixture among 4 large plates. Top each plate with the pomegranate seeds and the green onions. Garnish

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a 9 inch pie plate with cooking spray. Heat oil over medium high heat. Add scape and saute until tender-about 4 minutes. Stir in chard and squash. Continue to saute until wilted-about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. In a large bowl beat eggs with milk. Add scape mixture. Stir in cheese. Pour mixture into pie plate. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until center is set. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Slice into wedges.

In a large pot, bring the water to a boil. Add the salt. Add the ti leaves. Place the pork butt in the pot. Cover the pot with the lid. Cook on low for 8 to 10 hours. The pork is cooked when the internal temperature reaches 190 degrees F.

In a large frying pan, saute chicken breasts, until golden brown on both sides. Add penne and sun dried tomato halves, and cook for 1 more minute. Add basil pesto and light cream, cover the pan tightly, and simmer for 2 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

Combine the tapioca and milk together. Bring to a boil on the stove over medium heat, stirring frequently to prevent the mixture from sticking to the bottom of the pan and burning. Cook until the mixture thickens and becomes transparent and a little thicker than a raw egg. Remove from heat and add the sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt. Stir until well blended. Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled before serving.
In a large mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients and mix well. Heat oil in a kadai and deep fry the mixture till light brown. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve as an appetizer.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt margarine and saute onions until soft and translucent, 15-20 minutes. Add the cranberries and stir gently to combine. Add the sugar and stir until the onions are coated. Add the balsamic vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl.
Place fish on greased shallow pan. Combine mayonnaise and horseradish. Mix with parmesan cheese. Spoon over fish. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes. Broil 5 minutes longer. Serve with lemon wedges.

Beat cream cheese, ricotta and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs. Stir in flour and anise. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Let cool. Drizzle with melted chocolate. Chill.

In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise with mustard until well blended. Stir in cheese. In a large bowl, combine tuna, bell peppers, onions, mayonnaise mixture, and cheese. Season with salt. Place 2 lettuce leaves on each of 6 platestop each with 2 tablespoons tuna mixture. Roll up wraps and serve immediately.

Combine oatmeal, water and raisins in a pot over medium heat. Stir constantly until mixture comes to boil, then turn heat to low and cook for 1 minute or until water is absorbed and oatmeal is tender. Stir in apples and cinnamon. Cook for another 5 minutes or until apples are tender but not mushy. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine the flour and the milk. Stir until smooth. Pour the milk mixture and the remaining ingredients (except the milk and the bacon) in a crockpot and stir until well combined. Place the crockpot lid on top of the crockpot and cook for 8 hours on high. After cooking for 8 hours add the bacon and the milk and stir gently to blend. Heat an additional 30 minutes on high or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in skillet. Saut onion and celery until tender. Stir in parsley and season with black pepper and sage. Crumble cornbread into the skillet. Add broth and salt. Cook until slightly thickened. Cool and refrigerate until serving time. Serves 6.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Wash new potatoes. Pierce each potato in 2 to 3 places with a fork. Arrange the potatoes on a foil-lined baking pan. Drizzle lightly with olive oil. Sprinkle lightly with salt substitute. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. In a large saute pan heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the Brussels sprouts. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add oregano. Toss to coat. Add potatoes to pan. Toss well to mix. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan over low heat, combine the water and sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and add the eggs. Stir until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the flour. Continue to stir until mixture is smooth. Let the mixture cool. Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the egg mixture and continue to beat. Add the pasta. Fold in the fruit. Add the Cool Whip and the nuts. Place in refrigerator to chill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 9 x 5 loaf pan. Combine applesauce and cherry pie filling. Cream butter or margarine and sugar until light and fluffy, blend in egg. Combine 1-1/4 cups of the flour, baking powder, baking soda, nutmeg, salt, maraschino cherries, and applesauce-cherry mixture. Beat at low speed of electric mixer until well-blended. Stir in remaining flour to make a soft dough. Turn out onto lightly floured surfaceknead gently about 6-8 times or until smooth and elastic. Shape into loafplace in pan. Bake for 55-60 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutesremove from pan to cooling rack.

In a small bowl, combine sugar, onion and horseradish. Beat until well blended. Stir in cream cheese until well blended. Stir in cranberry sauce. Refrigerate 1 hour or until ready to serve. Serve with crackers.

Combine flour, salt, baking soda. Sift. Combine eggs, vanilla and sugar. Add buttermilk. Combine the dry ingredients with the wet. Pour into unbaked pie crust. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool.
Recipe for the best pumpkin pie.
Its a delicious cake that my dad always make me.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease a 13x9 baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the cottage cheese, sour cream, onions, and chiles. Beat together the flour, baking powder, and saltcut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the cottage cheese mixture. Stir in the eggs until blended. Pour into the baking dish. Top with the sausage, cheeses, and parsley. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until set. Serve warm.
name: baked eggs in cheese sauceingredients: 4 oz. sharp cheddar cheese, 2 cups milk or water, 4 oz. extra sharp cheddar cheese, 4 slices white or wheat bread, 2 large eggs, 2 tablespoons margarine or butter or olive oilpreparation: Grease 13x9 inch baking dish. Mix together milk or water with 4 oz. sharp cheddar cheese.

Combine dates& water in saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boiling point& reduce heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes. Mash mixture in bowl with fork. Add butter& mix well. Add sugar& mix well. Combine flour, oats& baking soda& salt in bowl. Mix well. Stir flour mixture into date mixture& stir til well blended. Spread mixture in buttered 11x7x2-inch baking pan. Bake in 350 oven for 20 minutes. Cool. Cut into bars.

Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add shallot. Saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Add shiitake mushrooms. Saute for 3 to 4 minutes. Add 2 teaspoons olive oil. Add steak. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Add low-sodium soy sauce. Cook for 1 minute or until steak is medium rare. Serve.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Place salmon on a broiler pan and brush each side with half of the brown sugar mixture. Sprinkle onions on the bottom of the broiler pan. Place salmon on the onions and brush both sides with the remaining brown sugar mixture. Broil for 12 minutes or until done (firm to touch) and brown on top. Serve with garnish and rice.
I was in the mood for some tasty fish today. I decided to make a tasty Glazed Salmon recipe that my family loves.
I found a recipe online that I thought would be delicious for our dinner tonight.
I was able to make the Glazed Salmon very easily and it was tasty.
My family loved this Glazed Salmon recipe and ate it all up.
It was a great meal to serve for my family and I enjoyed making it as well.
If you love a good Glazed Salmon recipe then you will love this one!
It is a great recipe to make for a family dinner or to take to a potluck for a meal.
Boil potatoes in lightly salted water until tender. Drain and cool. Combine the remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add the potatoes and celery. Chill before serving.

Mix all together in a greased 13x9x2 pan. Bake at 375 for about 25 minutes or until done. Cool and cut into squares. Drizzle with sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large pot place the coleslaw mix and the onions. Sprinkle with caraway seeds and a pinch of salt. Pour the chicken broth over the top. Add the diced polish sausage. Cook covered for about 30-40 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

Boil the cauliflower florets for a few minutes and then drain. While they are hot and still wet, spread the cauliflower in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the garlic. Roast in a 400F oven until the cauliflower is browned and tender. Remove from the oven and place the cauliflower in a serving dish. To make the aioli, place the egg yolks and the garlic in a food processor. With the motor running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil and process until emulsified. Add the lemon juice and mix. Taste and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve the cauliflower warm with the aioli.

Bring sugar and water to a boil and cook for 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 2 minutes. In a bowl beat the almond extract and eggs together. Add the flour mixture and beat until smooth. Place the tortillas in a greased casserole dish. Pour the almond mixture over the tortillas. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for a few minutes. Melt the butter in a small pan and stir in the brown sugar. Pour over the almond layer and bake for another 25 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for a few minutes. Pour the peach pie filling over the top and allow it to set in the refrigerator. Top each slice with a mint sprig and vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine ground cumin, paprika, ground red pepper, and salt in a small bowlrub over both sides of salmon. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Place a spoonful of yogurt cheese on each serving plate. Spoon a little of the sauce over top of it. Place a slice of cooked fish on each serving plate, place a slice of cucumber on each serving plate, garnish with dill.

Heat olive oil in a pan and add the garlic to cook until fragrant but not brown. Add the curry powder and cook for 1 minute to bring out the flavours. Add the yoghurt to the pan and stir well to combine. Season with salt and freshly cracked black pepper. Add the lamb to the pan to coat well. Cover the pan and place in the oven to cook for 15 minutes. Check to see if the lamb is cooked through to your liking, if not add back to the oven for another 10 minutes. Serve with rice and.

Pour boiling water over gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add pie filling and juice. Pour into 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Refridgerate until set. Stir in soda and crushed pineapple. Spoon on whipped topping. Sprinkle with pecans and cheese. Chill until ready to serve.

Separate eggs and beat white until foamy. Combine yolks with cream of tartar and creambeat until thick and lemon-colored. Beat egg whites until stiff and gradually add 1 cup of the sugar and cream of tartar and almonds. Fold into the cream mixture. Bake in a loaf pan in a 350 degree oven for 50 minutes. Spread with lemon-flavored frosting and sprinkle with remaining sugar and almonds.

Preheat over to 400 degrees f. In a small bowl combine the olive oil, garlic cloves and garlic powder. Rub over both sides of the chicken breast halves. Place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Roast for 45 minutes or until no longer pink in the center. In the meantime prepare the pasta according to the package instructions. Drain and add to a large bowl. Add the garlic-olive oil mixture from the roasted chicken, the sun-dried tomato and the parmesan cheese. Toss to combine. Serve the chicken and the pasta together.
Cover bottom of baking dish with mashed potatoes. Layer onion, sugar, margarine, meat, peas, gravy, parmesan cheese, paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 min. or until heated through.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the whole broccoli florets and the whole chicken breasts. Cook for 45 minutes. Remove the chicken breasts and allow them to cool. When cool enough to handle, shred the meat with a fork. Discard the broccoli stems. Add the diced broccoli to the chicken. In a small bowl mix together the lemon juice, salt and pepper. Add the mayonnaise and the sour cream and mix. Fold in the dill. Gently mix the mayonnaise mixture with the broccoli and chicken. Chill and serve over mixed greens.

In a wok or deep skillet over high heat, stir-fry carrots and garlic until tender-crisp. Add ginger, stirring until fragrant. Stir in cabbage. Cook until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add black pepper to taste. Combine vinegar and canola oil. Add to wok and stir-fry until vegetables are well coated with dressing.

In a small bowl combine all the stuffing ingredientsmix well and set aside. Preheat grill to high heat. Cut each breast half into three pieces and stuff the stuffing mixture into the opening of the pieces. Brush both sides of the breast pieces with olive oilplace on grill over medium heat. Grill for 5 minutes or until the juices run clear when the meat is pierced with a sharp knifeturn over and grill another 5 minutes or until the juices run clear when the meat is pierced with a sharp knife.
In crockpot combine all ingredients. Cook on low for 4 hours or high for 2 hours. Serve with crusty bread and enjoy.
Heat olive oil in a 9x13 pan. Add onion, tomato sauce, cumin & coriander. Cook 10 minutes. Add scrambled eggs and salt & pepper. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until eggs are cooked through.

Combine all the ingredients except the tomato sauce in large bowl and mix well. Form into small balls about the size of a walnut. In large skillet, brown meatballs in oil until no longer pink. Add tomato sauce and worcestershire sauce and simmer for about 20 minutes or until sauce is reduced to desired consistency. Serve over hot cooked rice or pasta.

In a blender combine soy sauce, ginger, garlic and crushed red pepper flakes and puree until smooth. Add the lime juice and sesame oil and pulse until well blended. Transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use. Slice the steaks into 1/4 inch thick strips and place into the container. Toss to coat. Marinate for 1 hour at room temperature or up to 6 hours in the refrigerator. Grill the steak strips 30 seconds per side or until desired doneness is achieved. Serve with hot cooked rice and fresh vegetables.

Cream butter, sugar, and vanilla together until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time until mixed well. Stir in bananas. Sift together the remaining dry ingredients and stir into the wet mixture just until combined. Pour into 9 x 5 inch loaf pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Sprinkle the gelatin on top of the milk. Let it stand for 10 minutes to soften. Stir in the sugar and vanilla. Stir in the sour cream. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.
Combine first 4 ingredients in saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Remove from heatstir in remaining ingredients until well combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool completely.
Cook potatoes in microwave until tender. Place in greased casserole dish. Layer with chicken, italian salad dressing, italian seasoning. Cover with parmesan cheese. Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees F.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Remove top and roots from bulb of garlic and cut bulb in half. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Squeeze cloves from bulb and chop. Combine with olive oil and season with kosher salt and pepper. Pulse together in a food processor until smooth. Add mayonnaise and horseradish. Pulse until incorporated. Chill before serving.

Preheat griddle or pan. Beat eggs and butter until light and fluffy. Stir in sugar and bicarbonate of soda and salt. Stir in the flour and add the buttermilk, stirring until just combined. Pour onto the griddle or pan and cook each side for about 3 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot with butter and jam.

Place sugar with 1 cup of water in saucepan over medium heat. Cook until sugar is dissolved and mixture is clear (about 10 minutes). Allow syrup to cool slightly then add pink grapefruit juice, stirring well. Pour mixture into shallow dish or tray and place in freezer. Freeze about 1 hour or until mixture is just beginning to freeze at edges. Using fork or spatula break up frozen mixture into granita consistency (shards of ice crystals). Add more pink grapefruit juice if mixture seems too firm or grainy. Add more granita syrup if mixture seems too soft or grainy. Add 1 tablespoon of grapefruit zest to granita mixture just before serving. Chill until ready to serve. Serve in 4 chilled wine glasses with 2 tablespoons of granita mixture per glass. Top with squeeze of fresh lemon. Serve immediately.

Spray a 13x9x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Layer half the hash browns in pan. Layer with half the ham and half the onions and green pepper. Add half the egg substitute and half the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until set. Let stand 5 minutes.
Boil rice until tender. Drain liquid. Add onion, drippings, tomatoes, red peppers and sugar. Bring to boil. Add salt to taste. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve hot.

Wash the bananas. Slice them about 1/2 inch thick. Place them in a baking dish. Squeeze lemon juice over them. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for about 30 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Toss onions with olive oil, season with salt and pepper. Place in pie shell. Top with cheese and tomato. Cover with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Remove and top with green onions. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large heavy pot over medium high heat. Saute leek until softened. Add carrots and water. Bring to a boil then reduce heat. Cover and simmer until carrots are tender. Add white beans and season with freshly ground pepper. Puree until smooth. Stir in fresh rosemary. Serve with roasted pear slices.

Mix gelatin and milk in a 2-quart casserole until dissolved. Add tomato soup and cook over low heat 1 minute. Remove from heat and cool. When slightly cooled, add cream cheese, onion and mayonnaise. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Pour into a 9x13x2-inch pan and chill until firm. Slice and serve with salsa.
Mix all together in small bowl. Use to spread onto breads. Makes approx 1/2 cup.

Toss together spinach, red onion, craisins, and bacon. Whisk together lime juice, oil, vinegar, mustard and honey. Pour dressing over spinach mixture. Toss well. Top with crumbled blue cheese.
The Difference Between Cranberry Juice And Cranberry Cocktail?
Cranberry juice is 100% juice from the berries. Cranberry cocktail is 100% juice from the berries plus a good deal of sugar added to it.
I am not a nutritionist. I am not a doctor. I am not a gourmet chef. But I am a regular guy who loves to cook. I don't follow any specific recipe when I cook. I like to experiment with flavors and come up with my own recipes. I enjoy cooking so much that I have been doing it for friends and family for years.

In a medium saucepan combine the onion and garlic and saut in the butter until the onion is golden brown. Add the chicken broth and dry white wine and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and saute until they are pink and cooked through (about 1 minute). Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400. Line 2 baking sheets with foil and spray with cooking spray. Slice challah into 1 inch slices, cut them into halves and place them on baking sheets about 1 inch apart. Put a little bit of mustard in the middle of each piece. Top each piece with a slice of cheddar. In a large bowl, combine eggs and milk and beat until combined. Add salt and pepper and stir to combine. Dip each piece of challah into egg mixture and place it back onto baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Meanwhile, prepare the cauliflower. Steam it until tender and set it aside to cool slightly. In a medium bowl, mix the mayo and prepared mustard and mix well. Add in the cooled cauliflower and mix until well combined. Cut a slit in each piece of challah and fill with the cauliflower mixture. Bake for 5-10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the edges are golden brown. Remove from oven and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Drain the can of beans and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Stir to mix and pour the mixture over the beans. Spread the beans out in an 8 by 8 inch baking dish. Bake for about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Remove stems from mushrooms. Saute onion in butter til tender about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. In a bowl, combine onions, butter, stuffing mix and salt and pepper to taste. Spoon into mushrooms caps. Bake 15 minutes or until done.
Pour all of the liquids into a large pitcher with ice cubes and mix. Add fruit slices and stir again. Garnish with fresh fruit or mint leaves.

Place the popcorn kernels on a microwave safe plate. Spray the plate with olive oil. Microwave on high for 2 to 3 minutes or until the popcorn is lightly browned (1/2 cup kernels will fill 1 quart bag). Add the salt and toss the kernels until evenly coated. Let cool for about 1 minute before serving.

In a large Dutch oven or pot, heat oil over medium high heat. Add smoked sausagesbrown, turning often until browned all over. Remove sausages from Dutch oven or pot. Add onions to Dutch oven or pot. Stir occasionally until softened, about 3 minutes. Add garlicstir for 1 minute. Add salsastir until salsa is combined with onions and garlic. Add cooked beans and waterstir until well combined. Add browned sausages. Coversimmer over low heat for 30 minutes. Stir in cilantro. Serve hot. Top with cheese.

Cut bacon into small pieces. Cut apples into small pieces. In a large non stick skillet over medium high heat, add bacon pieces, onion pieces, apples, and garlic. Saute until apples are tender and bacon is crisp. Remove from heat. Stir in apple cider vinegar, thyme, salt, and pepper. Cool completely. Refrigerate at least one hour or overnight before serving.

Melt butter and oil in a 10-inch skillet over low heat. Add shallot and garlic and saute until soft. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Stir in the sherry and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the liquid has evaporated and the mushrooms are glazed. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.
Combine all the ingredients in a medium glass bowl. Mix well and store in the refrigerator until serving time.

In a large saute pan over medium-high heat, heat olive oil until just smoking. Add onion and saute until it starts to soften, about 3 minutes. Add green beans and saute until bright green, about 2 minutes. Add shallot and saute until soft, about 3 minutes. Add balsamic vinegar, stirring to deglaze the pan. Add the remaining ingredients and toss well to combine. Transfer the mixture to a large serving bowl and serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix the dill, garlic powder, and salt into the softened cream cheese. Pack the mixture into a rectangular container lined with plastic wrap. Refrigerate it for at least 3 hours. Before serving time, set the unwrapped block of cheese on a platter and decorate it with a scallion bow and red pepper polka dots and give tag made from cut red pepper. Serve with choice of crackers or veggies.

Prepare chicken according to directions. Cut into cubes and set aside. In a large skillet over medium high heat saute onions and mushrooms in dressing until tender. Add chicken, tomatoes and parmesan cheese. Heat through. Serve over spaghetti.

Place bourbon in a shaker half filled with ice cubes. Shake well for about 20 seconds. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Fill with ice cubes. Add lemon juice and shake well. Fill with egg white and shake well again. Pour into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a red maraschino cherry on a cocktail stick.

Combine mascarpone and ricotta in a mixing bowl. Mix well. Add espresso, marsala, and cocoa. Stir to combine. Cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Spoon into bowl, garnish with chocolate shavings, and serve with fresh fruit.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Coat bottom of muffin tin with cooking spray. Cut pineapple into bite size pieces. Mix together cake mix and applesauce with water until thick enough to spoon into muffin tin. Bake for 12 minutes or until done. Spoon pineapple on top of each muffin. Bake again until bubbly. Serve with fat free cool whip or ice cream.

Mix all sauce ingredients well. Place chicken in a large zipper top bag. Pour 1/2 the sauce over the chicken. Seal bag securely, refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours. Drain off excess marinade before cooking. Broil or grill the chicken over medium heat turning once or twice during the baking time. Cook for 10 minutes per pound or until done. Baste with the remaining marinade during the last 5 minutes of baking time. Serve with your favorite rice or pasta salad.

Combine first 4 ingredients. Add mustard. Shape mixture into 12 balls. Roll balls in breadcrumbs. Heat oil in skillet. Add ballsbrown 3-4 minutes per side. Spoon preserves over hot balls. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add yogurt and mix well. Add cheese and mix well. Add eggs and mix just until moistened. Fill 12 greased or paper lined muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.
name: apple chocolate chip muffinsingredients: all purpose flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, granulated sugar, eggs, butter, milkpreparation:Preheat oven to 375. Mix flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a large bowl. Beat eggs in small bowl. Beat in milk. Add to dry mixture. Add butter and mix with a fork until

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute onions until soft and translucent. Add ginger and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add pumpkin and stock and cook until softened. Stir in coconut cream and cook until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked pasta with grated parmesan cheese.

I love the pumpkin soup. It looks delicious and healthy!

Cut peppers lengthwise down center. Stuff with mixture of onions, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, garlic. Whip cream until it forms peaks. Layer peppers and onions in pie shell with cream on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Combine cheese, milk and seasoning. Cut up the chicken in small pieces and add to mixture. Warm in the oven. Take out and add onions. Divide mixture in half. In the first half add 1/2 cup shredded cheese. Mix together. Roll out 20-24 wonton wrappers. Place a small amount of cheese mixture in center of each wrapper. Fold over and seal. Bring to a boil in a large pot of lightly salted water. Cook for 10-15 minutes. Take out and sprinkle with paprika.

Combine first five ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until balsamic reduces by half, stirring frequently. Remove from heat and cool completely. Mix mascarpone with milk until smooth and creamy. Fold in balsamic mixture. Serve with fresh fruit.

Caption: It's the last day of summer before school starts. It's still hot outside, so we'll have to make some ice cream!

In skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Place one tortilla in pan and sprinkle with apples. Top with cheese. Fold over and place other tortilla on top. Cook until cheese is melted and golden brown. Serve with syrup or applesauce.

Place 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. When hot, add 1/2 teaspoon of red pepper flakes. When the flakes sizzle, add the garlic and saute until lightly browned. Add the spinach and saute until tender. Add the sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, the pine nuts, 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Season the mixture with 1/2 teaspoon of each of the seasonings. Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain the pasta. Add the spinach mixture and toss. Sprinkle with parmesan.

Heat oil in a large dutch oven or pot over medium heat. Brown the onions for a few minutes. Add the garlic, carrots, rosemary, bay leaves and cook for about 3-5 minutes. Add the corned beef and cook until browned on all sides. Add the wine and stir to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Pour in enough water to cover the meat and bring to a boil. Turn heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 2 hours. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Spray both sides of the pitas with the garlic-infused olive oil. Spread the pesto over both sides of the pita bread. Sprinkle onion over the top and sprinkle with italian seasoning. Top with slices of fresh mozzarella cheese. Lay the sliced tomatoes over the top. Sprinkle with fresh basil. Bake at 400 degrees until crisp and golden brown. Serve with your favorite toppings. Enjoy.

Combine bread crumbs and seasoning salt. Add egg white and milk. Dip sweet onion slices into batter. Press into dry bread crumb mixture. Air-fry at 400 degrees for 2 minutes. Turn over and continue cooking until golden brown. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Cook penne in salted water to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water. Drain and place in a large bowl. Cook onion and bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until onion is translucent. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add reserved pasta water and pasta. Stir to combine. Add tomatoes. Season with pepper. Serve warm.

In a large skillet or pot over med-high heat, add ground turkey and cook until no longer pink in the center. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cook for 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Cover pot and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in cooked egg noodles. Serve.

Simmer beef broth and beer together in a heavy medium saucepan over medium heat until reduced to 3/4 cup, about 40 minutes. Stir in the Worcestershire sauce and thyme. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and add pastrami. Let stand 10 minutes. Toast the buns and divide the pastrami among them. Add the swiss cheese and mustard to each sandwich to taste. Makes 4 large sandwiches.

In a blender or food processor combine the raspberries, water and wine. Puree until smooth. Bring to the boil in a saucepan and then add the cranberry juice. Reduce to medium heat and simmer until the fruit is very tender. Remove from the heat and strain into a large bowl. Add the sugar, spices and lemon juice and stir well. Chill in the refrigerator for several hours or until the soup is cold. Divide the soup between 4 bowls. Garnish each bowl with the sour cream and fresh raspberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, saute sun-dried tomatoes in olive oil until soft. Add garlic and chilies. Saute until garlic is translucent. Add cauliflower and saute for 2 minutes. Add bread crumbs and parm. cheese. Toss together. Place in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine soy sauce, honey, ginger and spring onions in a shallow bowl. Add the chicken. Marinate for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet and brown the chicken on both sides. Add the garlic and cook for 20 seconds. Add the port wine and the 5-spice powder. Cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a serving platter.

Heat lard in skillet until it is very hot but not smoking. Fry the sausage in the lard. When the sausage is browned, remove it from the skillet and set aside. Add the onions to the skillet and fry until they are golden brown. Add the sausage back to the skillet. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crusty bread.

Heat oil in large pot. Fry garlic until golden brown. Add sofrito and cook 1 minute. Add olives and cook 30 seconds. Add pigeon peas and cook 2 minutes. Add rice and cook 2 minutes. Add water and bring to boil. Cover and lower heat to very low. Cook 40 minutes. Serve with yellow or white rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c).In a large saucepan, cover the potatoes with cold water. Cook until brownedabout 1 minute per side.In a large bowl, mix together the mashed potatoes, 1 tbsp of the remaining butter and 1/2 cup of the cheese.Stuff each bacon skin with 1/3 cup of the stuffing and place on a baking sheet lined with waxed paper.Brush with 1 tbsp of the remaining butter and sprinkle with 1/2 tsp of the salt and 1

Pre heat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray 9 inch square baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. In large microwaveable bowl, melt butter and chocolates on high in microwave oven about 1 minute or until smooth. Stir in honey and brown sugar until smoothstir in eggs one at a time just until combined (batter will be thick). Stir in flour and nuts until evenly blended. Spread in pansprinkle with nuts. Bake on center rack of oven for about 18 minutes or until edges are set and center is soft (batter will still be soft when removed from oven). Cool in pan on wire rack for 1 hour or until completely cool. Cut into bars. Makes 16 brownies.
Combine all ingredients in slow cooker and cook on low heat for 8-10 hours. Slice and serve on rye bread with swiss cheese and coleslaw.

Cut the fennel into wedges. Toss with 1 tablespoon oil. Place the fennel on a rimmed baking sheet. Cut the potatoes into wedges. Toss with 1 tablespoon oil. Add the potatoes to the fennel and spread in a single layer. Cut the bell peppers into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Cut the onion into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Add the bell peppers and onions to the fennel. Spread in a single layer. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until the fennel is golden brown and the potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.

Prepare cake according to directions on box. Pour half the batter into a greased and floured 10 inch tube pan. Sprinkle with nuts. Pour remaining batter over nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes. Cool. Spread with peach pie filling. Sprinkle with additional nuts if desired. Serve warm.

In a bowl, toss together greens and dressing. Divide among 4 plates. Top with cheese. Toss together apple and pear slices and basil in a small bowl. Arrange apple-pear mixture on top of cheese. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).Cut baking potatoes into wedges. Toss in bowl with melted butter, chili seasoning mix and salsa. Place in single layer on baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with salsa, sour cream or ranch dressing for dipping.

Place the potatoes in the bottom of a crock pot. Sprinkle the seasoning over the top of the potatoes. Add the sour cream, buttermilk, and salad dressing mix to the crock pot. Add the cream of chicken soup, stirring well to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Uncover and stir the potato mixture well. Turn the crock pot off and allow the mixture to sit for an additional hour or two before serving.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium non-stick skillet over medium-low heatcover. Cook 20 minutes, or until apples are tender, stirring occasionally. Add yogurtcool slightly before serving.

Place chicken in a large pot. Add 3/4 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from pot. Let cool. When cool enough to handle, shred the chicken. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Toss with pasta sauce. Add shredded chicken. Blend in cream cheese.
Combine all ingredients. Cook on low for 8 hours. Strain liquid from chicken. Use as a glaze or broth. Chop chicken into bite size pieces. Serve over brown rice or with tortillas.

Saute onion in 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a small saucepan until very soft and golden brown. Cool. Stir in vinegar, oregano and bay leaves. In a large zip-lock bag, place leg of lamb, crushed peppercorns and onion mixture, and 4 tablespoons of the remaining olive oil. Marinate overnight in the refrigerator. Remove the lamb from the marinade and reserve marinade. Grill the leg of lamb over charcoal briquets for 5 minutes a side or until internal temperature reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), turning once and basting with reserved marinade during last 10 minutes of grilling time.

Place dried figs in a bowl with the water. Let soak for at least an hour. Add olives with 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and let stand for an hour at room temperature. Combine the remaining ingredients in a food processor. Add the soaked figs and olives and pulse until the mixture is chunky but smooth. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with pita chips or crackers

Cream together butter, shortening and sugar. Add egg and cream of tartar and beat until smooth. Stir in Pamela's Ultimate Baking and Pancake Mix. Add cinnamon and roll into balls. Roll balls in sugar. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Brush both sides of each chop with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place chops in a shallow baking pan and bake for 8 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside. Combine lemon juice, butter and garlic in a small bowl. Brush mixture over both sides of the chops and sprinkle with dijon mustard. Return to oven and bake for 8 minutes more. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Bring 2 quarts of water to boil. Add broccoli rabe. Reduce heat and cook until tender-crisp, about 12 minutes. Drain, reserving cooking liquid. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add butter and swirl pan until melted. Add olives. Stir in reserved cooking liquid from broccoli rabe. Taste and adjust seasonings. Makes 2 servings.
Broccoli is a delicious, nutritious vegetable that can be prepared in a variety of ways. Broccoli is rich in vitamin C and fiber. It is also a good source of folic acid, iron, potassium and phosphorus. There are many recipes for broccoli, some more popular than others. Here are some of the most popular broccoli recipes.
Broccoli is a vegetable that is often eaten as a side dish. It is a member of the cabbage family and is related to cauliflower and kale. Broccoli is a good source of vitamins A and C

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and brown on each side about 2 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. Add the onions, garlic and tomatoes to the skillet. Add the chicken broth to the skillet, scraping up the brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Add the frozen artichoke hearts and capers to the pan. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer for about 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Cube the tofu into bite size pieces. Coat the pieces in cornstarch. Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Cook until golden brown on all sides. Stir together honey and soy sauce in a small bowl. Pour over the tofu while still in the pan. Turn off heat and sprinkle with sesame seeds and ginger before serving.
name: spicy tofu sandwichingredients: firm tofu, baby spinach leaves, red onion, spicy brown mustard, light whole wheat bread, cajun seasoning, cooking spraypreparation:Drain and press tofu. Cut tofu lenthwise into two pieces. Coat pan with cooking spray and heat over medium heat. Add tofu to pan and sprinkle liberally with cajun seasoning. Cook until crispy and browned. Serve on toasted bread with mustard, baby spinach leaves and red onion slices.

Brown hamburger in skillet. Add all remaining ingredients except ketchup and water and bring to boil. Add water and ketchup and simmer until thickened. Add more water if desired. Serve over hotdogs. Top with onions if desired.

In a heavy pot, combine the first 5 ingredients. Add water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat to low, cover & simmer until the beans are tender, about 1 hour. Stir occasionally. Remove from the heatstir in vinegar. Cool slightly before serving.

Preheat the oven to 250F. Butter a 12 inch round cake pan or pie plate. In a large bowl, mix the eggs and the all-purpose flour together with the sugar and the butter until the mixture is smooth. Spread half the batter in the pan. Drop small spoonfuls of the cream cheese mixture over the batter. Spread the rest of the batter over the cream cheese. Bake the pancake for 30 minutes in the 250F oven, or until firm and lightly browned. Invert the pancake onto a serving plate. Cut into wedges or squares to serve. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large pot on medium-low heat. Add brown sugar and stir until melted. Add corn syrup, peanuts, salt and vanilla to melted brown sugar. Pour mixture over popcorn and mix until popcorn is coated. Pour onto a cookie sheet or wax paper to cool. Store in an airtight container.
Name: Easy M&M CookiesIngredients: 1 stick margarine 1/2 cup butter 2 cups flour 1-1/2 tsp salt 1/2 tsp vanilla 1 egg 2 cups M&MsPreparation: Cream together margarine, butter, sugar and vanillabeat until creamy. Add egg and beat until smoothstir in flour and salt. Stir in M&Ms. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheetbake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes. Allow to cool completely before icing. Soak the beans overnight (or at least 6-8 hours). Drain beans. In a large saucepan, cook onion and the chili peppers together until soft. Add the beans, cover with water, bring to a boil and simmer until tender (about an hour). Drain beans, reserving liquid. In a bowl beat eggs well, then add the beans and enough liquid to moisten the mixture. Mash with a fork until mixture is thick. Heat oil in a frying pan, spoon mixture into hot oil in small round shapes. Turn once brown on both sides. Serve immediately.
