Brown ground beef and drain fat. Combine beef with enchilada sauce and soup and simmer for 20 minutes on low heat. Sprinkle with taco seasoning and sour cream. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Top with sharp cheddar and crushed doritos.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine cake mix with pudding mix. Add eggs and stir until smooth. Drop dough by tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Remove from baking sheetcool on wire racks. Melt 1/2 cup butter. Pour melted butter over cookiessprinkle with pecans and almond brickle chips.

Heat oil in skillet. Brown chops in hot oil for five minutes a side. Remove from skillet. In small bowl whisk together flour and water until smooth. Add to skillet. Heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Add parsley. Spoon over chops.

Preheat broiler. Cut off the stem end of the plum tomato and slice the other end into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Place the rounds on a baking sheet. Drizzle the rounds with the oil and sprinkle with the kosher salt and black pepper. Broil until the rounds are browned, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Top the rounds with the fresh herbs and the Parmesan cheese before serving.
Southwestern chicken salad: a simple salad made with chicken, black beans, corn, green onions, green bell peppers, green chilies, celery, red bell peppers, cilantro, avocados and lime juice.

Cook gnocchi according to package directions. In large saucepan, heat heavy cream. Whisk in flour. Cook over low heat 1 minute or until thickened. Add salt, pepper and nutmeg. Cook 30 seconds. Stir in baby spinach. In large bowl, combine ricotta and mozzarella. Stir in spinach mixture. Add gnocchi. Gently toss to coat. Spoon into 2-quart baking dish. Top with parsley. Cover and bake 40 minutes. Uncover and bake 5 minutes or until browned and bubbly.

Prepare the couscous according to the instructions on the package. Add vegetable stock powder to boiling water. Add garlic to boiling water. Cook shrimp in boiling water for about 2 minutes until opaque. Drain shrimp. Add shrimp, peas and couscous to vegetable stock and stir well. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, brown ground beef and onion. Drain fat. Add remaining ingredients and heat through. Spoon about 1/3 cup meat mixture onto tortillas. Sprinkle with cheese. Fold over ends and roll up. Serve with salsa and sour cream for dipping.

Mix cottage cheese, caster sugar, double cream and egg whites together and season with lemon juice. Divide into 4 ramekins or souffl dishes and place in bain-marie over simmering water and cook for 10 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before removing from ramekins. Decorate with raspberries and strawberries and serve with single cream.

Boil the potatoes until tender and drain. Rinse in cold water and drain again. Cut into small bite size pieces. In a large bowl, combine the lemon juice and red pepper. Add the potatoes and green onions and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. When ready to serve, stir in the bacon bits. In another bowl combine the mayonnaise and sour cream. Add the hot pepper sauce and blue cheese. Mix until blended. Add the mixture to the potatoes. Toss to coat and refrigerate for 2 hours. Sprinkle with bacon bits and serve.

In a saucepan heat the water with the bouillon cubes until boiling. In a large bowl combine the creme fraiche and mustard and blend until smooth and creamy. Add the bouillon mixture and the spring onion and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the cornstarch and cook for a few minutes until thickened. Serve with the cheese and spring onion.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add yellow pepper and onion. Saute 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in garlic. Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Stir in pasta sauce and cook 5 minutes. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes. Stir in basil. Spoon sauce over noodles. Makes 4 servings.
name: penne with egg noodlesingredients: penne pasta, egg noodles, cream of chicken soup, salt and pepperpreparation:Boil the penne and egg noodles. Mix the egg noodles into the penne. Add the cream of chicken soup and stir until well blended. Serve.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and crushed pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute. Add broccoli. Stir constantly until tender-crisp. Add eggs. Cook until eggs are set. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Serves 2.

Combine sugar & water in a small sauce pan. Stirring frequently, bring to a boil over medium heat. Turn off burner. Add the cranberries. Let cool to room temperature. Combine all other fruit in a bowl. Gently stir in the cranberries. Add the nuts. Serve.
name: cranberry feta and walnut saladingredients: mixed salad greens, dried sweetened cranberries, feta cheese, walnut pieces, balsamic vinegar, honey, dijon mustard, ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oilpreparation:Toss greens, cranberries, cheese and walnuts in large bowl. Mix vinegar, honey, mustard and pepper with wire whisk until well blended. Gradually add oil, whisking constantly until well blended. Pour over salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.
name: cranberry saladingredients: cranberries, oranges, gala apples, crushed pineapple, jello gelatin, rasp
Soak barley in cold water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook until tender. Strain. Add lemon rind and juice. Add sugar. Stir. Cool.
Pour vodka, Cointreau, lime juice and blood orange into a shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a slice of blood orange or a lemon slice.

Combine tapioca and water in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils and tapioca is clear. Remove from heat and add milk and salt. Pour into bowl and cool. Add fruit cocktail. Chill. Whip the cream until stiff peaks form. Fold into tapioca mixture. Spoon into individual bowls and top with a dollop of cream.

Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil. Add pears and simmer for 10 minutes or until pears are tender. Remove pears to a plate and allow to cool. In a bowl, toss spinach with balsamic vinegar. Add pears and almonds and toss. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Combine condensed milk, key lime juice and cream cheese with a mixer on medium speed until blended. Pour into prepared pie shell. Chill at least two hours before serving. Garnish with whipped topping and a slice of lime.

Add boiling water to gelatine in a large bowl, stir until completely dissolved. Add Mountain Dew and stir until completely dissolved. Add crushed pineapple, lemon pie filling and miniature marshmallows. Stir until completely blended. Pour into a 9x9 inch pan. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until firmly set. Whip Cool Whip in a medium bowl until stiff peaks form. Spread over top of the lemon Mountain Dew Salad. Keep refrigerated. Yields 12 servings.
Pour all the liquor into a shaker with the ice cubes. Shake well. Pour into a glass with ice cubes in it. Add the grenadine. Add the maraschino cherry on top of the ice cubes for decoration.

In a large bowl, combine seeds and butter. Sprinkle with salt and pumpkin pie spice. Toss well. Spread evenly on a baking sheet. Bake at 250 degrees for about 1 hour or until crisp and golden brown. Stir occasionally. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Add thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Add chicken and cook until browned. Stir in jam and balsamic vinegar. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook 5 minute, until done.

Peel and slice potatoes into thin rounds. Heat 2 Tbsp. olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook spring onions and dill in the hot oil 1-2 minutes or until softened. Remove spring onion mixture from skillet using a slotted spoon, and set aside. Mash feta cheese in a small bowl with a fork. Beat the cheese mixture with the egg and lemon juice until smooth. Place the flour in a shallow bowl. Dip each potato slice in the flour, then in the egg mixture and then back into the flour, coating both sides of the slice. Working in batches, fry the coated potato slices in the hot oil 3-4 minutes per side or until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels. To serve, top each fried potato slice with a dollop of the spring onion mixture and a sprinkling of freshly ground black pepper. Garnish with a sprig of fresh dill and serve immediately.

Crush crackers into crumbs in food processor or put into a plastic bag and crush with rolling pin. Melt butter and pour over crumbs and stir well. Press into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Mix pudding with milk and pour over hot crust. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and add vanilla ice cream. Refrigerate for 2 hours before cutting into squares and serving.

In a slow cooker, combine the ham, broccoli, and cheese soups and chicken broth. Cook on low for 3 hours. Remove the ham and broccoli and set aside. Add the paprika and the potatoes and cook for another hour. Add the ham and broccoli back in and cook another hour or until the potatoes are tender. Serve with shredded cheddar cheese.

Mix all the dry ingredients except the raisins. Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg. Stir in dry ingredients. Blend in applesauce and mix well. Stir in raisins. Spread evenly in a greased 15 x 10 x 1-inch jelly roll pan. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into squares. Serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Combine milk and egg in a medium bowlstir well. Add milk mixture and butter to dry ingredientsstir until just combined. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) for 10 minutes. Sprinkle muffin tops with cheesecontinue baking until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes more. Cool 5 minutes in pan on a wire rack. Serve warm. Makes 12 muffins.

In a large bowl, combine the first 4 ingredients, set aside for about 15 minutes. In a small bowl, combine the remaining dry ingredients. Mix well and add to the buttermilk mixture. Knead dough in the bowl 5-8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap or a clean towel, let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or till doubled in bulk. Punch down dough. Divide into 4 loaves and form into loaves. Place in greased bread pans. Cover with plastic wrap or a clean towel, let rise in a warm place for about 40 minutes or till doubled in bulk. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for about 40 minutes or until the tops are golden brown and the bread sounds hollow when tapped. Remove bread from pans and cool on wire racks. Makes 4 loaves.
Brown beef in oil. Add broth. Stir in rice. Simmer until rice is tender. Add mixed veggies. Simmer until tender. Stir in tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Combine the gelatin and water in a 2-quart glass measuring cup. Mix well and stir until completely blended. Add the cinnamon and cranberries. Stir until blended. Add the mandarin oranges. Stir until blended. Chill until firm. Unmold onto a serving platter. Cut into squares and serve.

Spread one side of the bread with the mayonnaise. Place the cashews on the uncovered side of the bread. Spread the cream cheese over the mayonnaise. Place the turkey on top. Sprinkle with the dried sage. Lay the dried cranberries on top. Spread the lemon juice on the other side of the bread. Cover the bread. Place the bread in the oven for 5 minutes, or until the bread is toasted. Serve.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add marshmallows to the melted butter and stir until smooth and melted. Stir in peanut butter until smooth. Remove from the heat and add vanilla. Stir in the Rice Krispies until evenly coated. Spread into a 13x9 inch pan and press down firmly. Allow to cool completely before cutting into squares. Frost as desired.

Wash shrimp and drain. Dry thoroughly and salt and pepper. Dust shrimp with flour. Beat egg whites and brush over each piece of shrimp. Roll the shrimp in coconut and place in a deep fryer or pan with hot oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towel and sprinkle with pineapple preserves. Serve with Pina Colada drink mix or other tropical juices.

Soak beans in water overnight. Drain beans and add edamame to pot. Cover with water and add 3 bay leaves. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until beans are tender. Remove from heat. Drain beans and edamame. Add shrimp to the pot. Cover with water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until shrimp is done. Remove from heat. Drain beans and shrimp. Combine beans, edamame, shrimp, tomato, onion and jalapeno. Chop cilantro. Combine with remaining ingredients. Toss to coat well. Serve at once.

Heat oil in a large casserole or Dutch oven. Add meat and brown on all sides. Add onions and saute until softened. Add curry paste and saute until aromatic. Stir in tomatoes and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until meat is tender. Add stock and simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens. Add coriander leaves and yoghurt and stir well to combine. Serve immediately. Serve with rice or bread.

Beat egg whites until stiff. Add sugar and beat until stiff. Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by teaspoon on waxed paper. Let dry. Melt almond bark over low heat. Stir until smooth. Dip each cookie in almond bark. Let dry on waxed paper.

In a large bowl combine beans, celery ribs, bell pepper, cashews, green onions and ketchup. Mix well. Add garlic powder. In a separate bowl combine balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Drizzle over salad. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Toss before serving. Serve chilled.

In large bowl, cream together butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg yolk, vanilla, and flour. Spread on bottom of greased 15 x 10 x 1 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nuts. Bake at 325 for 25 minutes or until set. Cool in pan on wire rack. Break into bars. Makes about 24 bars.
I have been using this recipe for many years. Everyone who has tried it loves it! It is quick and easy to put together and always comes out perfect every time! I love it with chocolate chips...yum!
Awesome recipe! So simple and so delicious! I've made this recipe for years! I used to make this for the holidays and give it as gifts! I've even made it for my son's teachers! The recipe has been passed down from mother to daughter for many years! It's wonderful!
This recipe is fabulous! I make this every year for Christmas and everyone loves it!
This reci

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Remove the tops from the tomatoes and set aside for later use. Cut the tops into triangles and use them to fill the tomatoes. Add a few leaves of basil to each one.In a small bowl combine prosciutto with the olive oil and a little salt and pepper. Divide the mixture among the tomatoes and then crack an egg into each one. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.Serve with toasted bread on the side.

Heat oven to 375f. Cream butter and sugar, add eggs, milk and vanilla. Sift together flour, baking powder, salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Fold in miniature semisweet chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoon onto greased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden. Cool 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
In a small saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Add brown sugar and spices. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Stir in coffee. Remove from the heat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Cut yucca root in half lengthwise. Rub with olive oil. Sprinkle with dried herbs. Dust with onion and garlic powder and cumin. Season with salt and pepper. Place yucca root on a baking sheet and bake until tender to touch and golden brown. Sprinkle with fresh lime juice.

Pour the melted butter into an 8-inch round cakepan. Sprinkle onion, garlic, basil or dillweed, and poppy seeds evenly over the butter. Set aside. Place the parmesan cheese in a large heavy duty, zip-lock plastic bag. Cut each biscuit into 4 pices. Add the biscuit pieces to the bag and shake them to coat. Arrange the coated biscuit pieces in the prepared pan. I like to turn mine over a bit so all sides have a little bit of the seasoning. Sprinkle with any remaining parmesan cheese from the zip-lock bag. Bake at 400 degrees for 14 to 16 minutes or until golden brown.

Cut the tomatoes in half and scoop out the seeds. In a saute pan heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and shallots and saute until fragrant and lightly browned. Add the water chestnuts and saute until tender. Add the tomatoes and stir to combine. Add the fish sauce and stir to combine. Add the cornstarch and water mixture to thicken the sauce. Remove from the heat and season with black pepper. Fill the tomatoes with the mixture and bake in the oven for 15 minutes or until the tomatoes are soft. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425. In a medium bowl combine the water and biscuit mix. Add the cheese and stir until blended. Drop batter by scoopful onto a greased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden. Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Stir in garlic and parsley and cook for about 1 minute. Stir in more butter to make a thick sauce. Dip the warm biscuits into the sauce and serve hot.

Heat oven to 350f. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. Combine first three ingredientsset aside. In a small saucepan combine the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Boil and stir for two minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the chocolate chips. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake at 350f for 30-35 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Cut into squares. Store in an airtight container.

In a 9-by-13-inch baking dish, spread the light cream cheese spread evenly over the bottom of the dish. Spread the splenda brown sugar blend evenly on top of the cream cheese spread. In a large mixing bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat in the ground cinnamon, 1/4 cup at a time. Add the nonfat milk and beat well. Spread evenly over the cream cheese spread and sprinkle with the semi-sweet chocolate baking squares. Cover loosely with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle the top with the remaining semi-sweet chocolate baking squares. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the custard is set and the top is bubbly. Serve warm with low fat or nonfat frozen yogurt or whipped cream if desired. Serves 10.

Cut pita pockets in half. Spread with mayonnaise. Layer with apple slaw and cheese. Top with smoked turkey and sprouts.
name: turkey and cheese pinwheel appetizersingredients: deli smoked turkey, cream cheese, butter or margarine, seasoning salt and ground black pepper, whole-wheat crackers, sliced applepreparation:Spread each cracker with 1/2 teaspoon cream cheese. Top each with a slice of turkey and 1/4 teaspoon seasoning salt and black pepper. Top with apple slices and 1/2 teaspoon cream cheese. Roll up crackers and cut in half.
name: turkey meatloaf with fruit relishingredients: ground turkey, egg, fat-free milk, fat-free evaporated milk, egg white, seasoning mix, bread crumbs, cranberries, raisins, pineapple tidbits, pecanspreparation:Preheat oven to 350. Spray a 9 x

Preheat oven to 425f. Wash potatoes thoroughly. Slice in half lengthwise. Place in a baking dish and drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and add garlic cloves. Drizzle with vinegar and sprinkle with sugar. Return to oven and roast until tender, about 10 more minutes. Remove garlic and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Cover eggs in a pan with water, bring to a boil and simmer for 12 minutes. Drain and cool under running water. Peel and mash eggs. In a bowl combine eggs, anchovies, capers, olive oil, wine vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix well. Add tarragon and mix. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a bowl, combine cream cheese and italian seasoning. Remove crust from 4 slices of french bread. Top crusts with pepperoni and marinara sauce. Top with cream cheese mixture and then sprinkle mozzarella and provolone on top. Place top of bread on top of sandwiches and bake 8-10 minutes.

In medium saucepan, melt squares and butter over low heat, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in evaporated milk and sugar. Cool to room temperature. Pour mixture into prepared crumb crust. Cover and freeze 6-8 hours or overnight. Top with whipped topping and pecans.

Place washed and sliced zucchini into a large bowl and toss with the remaining ingredients until thoroughly coated. Place zucchini in a greased 9 x 13 glass baking dish and bake at 350 for approximately 30 minutes or until tender and browned on top. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Rinse the clams in cold water to remove any sand or grit. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the margarine. Stir in the garlic and cook until lightly browned. Stir in the clams and the clam juice. Cook until the shells open. Stir in the parsley. Cook the linguine in boiling salted water to al dente. Drain and add to the clam mixture. Toss well and serve immediately. Serves 4 to 6.
In large bowl combine potatoes, water, hidden valley ranch dry mix, celery, green onions, and bacon. Fold in mayonnaise. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour before serving.

Rinse and hull fresh strawberries and blueberries. In large bowl, mix together berries, wine and seasonings. Marinate in refrigerator at least one hour. Serve in glass bowl over ice cream or cake for dessert. Serve with powdered sugar on side for sprinkling.

Puree together the jalapenos, cilantro, garlic and lime juice. Add water to thin the mixture. Add sesame oil and toasted sesame oil. Taste and adjust seasonings. Add in salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Toast marshmallows over a campfire, or in a toaster oven or microwave until light golden brown. Arrange on a plate to cool slightly, or eat while warm. Serve with toasted coconut, mini marshmallows and warm chocolate chip cookies.

Cut leeks into 1/2 inch pieces. Saute in a skillet with a bit of oil until softened. Drain leeks and squeeze out excess liquid. Place leeks in a bowl with beaten eggs, salt, pepper and herbs. Blend well. Form mixture into small patties. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook patties for about 3 minutes per side until golden brown. Serve hot.

1. Cream the butter with the cocoa and honey until smooth and light. Add the flour and baking powder and mix well. Spread in a 9 inch square greased baking tin. Bake at 180c (fan) for about 15 minutes or until it springs back when touched in the centre. Allow to cool and cut into squares when set.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Line a baking sheet with aluminum foilcoat with cooking spray.Place all vegetables in a single layer over the baking sheet and spray with cooking spray.Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven until tender and beginning to brown, about 30 minutes.In a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine vegetables with 1/4 cup of the balsamic vinegar and garliccook and stir until the vegetables are tender and the liquid is evaporated, 5 to 8 minutes.Remove from the heat and stir in 1/4 cup of the cooking liquid and the remaining balsamic vinegarcook and stir until the liquid is evaporated, about 3 minutes.Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

For cream sauce, blend all ingredients in food processor until smooth. Mash kumara with a potato masher. Heat oven to 150degC. Tenderise meat with a mallet. Grill over a medium hot barbecue until browned. Spread kumara over pork and pour over sauce. Bake until done.

Place a 5-pound boneless ham in a slow cookeradd water to cover ham. Cover and cook on high for 5 to 6 hours or until meat is fork tender. Remove ham to a cutting boardlet stand 15 minutes. Remove skin, cut into slices, and serve with rhubarb sauce.Combine rhubarb, water, sugar, orange juice, orange rind, dry mustard, and cinnamon stick in a 3-quart saucepancover and cook over medium heat until rhubarb is tender. Remove from the heatdiscard cinnamon stick. Cool slightlypuree in a blender or food processor. Strain mixture through a sieve into a bowlstir in cream. Serve warm with ham. Yield: 5 to 6 servings.

Combine all the ingredients in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for about 1 hour or until the stock is reduced by 2/3rds. Strain the stock through a fine-mesh strainer and discard the solids. The stock can be used immediately or cooled down and stored in the fridge for up to a week or in the freezer for up to a month.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Place in large serving bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients. Toss well. Serve at room temperature.

Peel the skin off the sweet potato with a vegetable peeler or a sharp knife. Cut the sweet potato into 1/4-inch slices and boil them in a large saucepan of salted water over medium heat until tender when pierced with a fork or skewer, about 15 minutes. Drain the sweet potatoes and transfer them to a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Process the potato chunks for 1 minute or sothey will not be perfectly smooth, but they will be mashed up well enough to be able to add the half-and-half. Add the half-and-half, the extract, the orange zest, the butter, the salt and the pepper to the food processorprocess for another 1 minute or so, until smooth and creamy. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a serving bowl.
Cook leek, zucchini and red pepper in oil 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes. Add egg substitute to pan. Sprinkle with thyme and black pepper. Cook until firm. Cut into wedges.

Bring broth and cornstarch to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in carrots and cook and stir for 3 minutes or until heated through and tender. Stir in olive oil and cook and stir for 1 minute or until heated through. Add butter and season with salt.
Fresh, sweet, and delicious! Carrot is an extremely nutritious vegetable and is packed full of essential vitamins and minerals like vitamin A, vitamin C, calcium and potassium.
Baby Carrot is a small, tapered and brightly coloured vegetable which is a sweet and nutritious addition to any meal. Carrot is a rich source of beta-carotene and vitamin A which is great for vision and the immune system.
The Carrot is a root vegetable that is grown for its edible and nutritious taproot. The Carrot is native to Europe and Southwestern Asia. It is an annual plant that grows up to 30 cm in height and is cultivated throughout the year.
Car

Combine brown sugar and corn syrup in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently until mixture boils and bubbles vigorously around the edges (about 5 minutes). Cook until mixture is light brown (about 6 minutes). Remove from heat. Gradually whisk in creamboil until mixture is thick enough to lightly coat the back of a spoon (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat. Gradually whisk in butter until melted. Let cool 15 minuteswhisk in amaretto until smooth. Store chilled up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 200c. Rub butter all over the bird. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in a roasting pan. Roast for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 180c and roast for a further 50 minutes. Allow to rest for 10 minutes before carving.

Mix first 4 ingredients and beat until creamy. Add eggs, one at a time. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes, scraping bowl often. Add flourbeat on medium for 2 minutes more, scraping bowl often. Stir in nuts and chips. Pour into greased 12-cup fluted tube pan. Bake at 350 for 55-60 minutes, or until top springs back when touched lightly. Cool 10 minutesremove from pancool completely on wire rack.

In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugars until smooth. Blend in the vanilla and egg whites. Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Mix the flour mixture into the creamed mixture until just incorporated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dough for 1 hour or overnight. Heat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Remove the dough from the refrigerator and roll into small balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes in the preheated oven, until edges are lightly browned. Allow to cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two 12-cup muffin pans or line with paper liners. In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, cinnamon and saltset aside. In a saucepan combine half-and-half and butterheat until butter melts and mixture is warm (about 120 degrees F). In a small bowl whisk together egg, rum and vanilla. Add egg mixture to warm butter and half-and-halfstir until smooth. Stir into flour mixture just until moistened. Stir in raisins and mix until blended. Divide batter evenly among prepared cups filling each about three-fourths full. Bake 25-30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the centers comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutesremove from pans and cool completely on wire racks. Combine frosting ingredients in a bowl with a mixerbeat until smooth and of spreading consistency. Spread between layers and on top and sides of cake.
The first thing

In a food processor pulse sun-dried tomatoes until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl. Stir in garlic and basil. Divide mixture into 1/4 cup portions. Place each portion on the center of a chicken breast and roll up tightly. Secure with a toothpick. Repeat with remaining breasts. In a skillet heat 1 tablespoon oil until very hot. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Remove from skillet and place in a shallow baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes, turn and bake 10 minutes longer, until no longer pink. Remove toothpicks and serve.
name: greek pastaingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, black olives, red onion, green pepper, plum tomato, feta cheese, vinaigrette, cooked spaghettipreparation:Cut chicken into chunks and stir fry in olive oil until cooked. Add olives, red onion, and green pepper. Fry until softened. Add spaghetti,

Wash turnip and boil with water until tender and drain. Add water with a few drops of lemon juice to make the turnip juicy. Add the rest of the ingredients and let it boil until the water is evaporated. Put it in clean glass jars or any other container and seal it with plastic wrap or put it in the fridge.

Fry the bacon crumble. Add the onions and cook until tender. Add the corn and red pepper. Saute 5 minutes, or until tender. Add the parsley and remove from heat. In a saucepan, combine the milk, salt and pepper. Stir in the corn mixture. Serve immediately or refrigerate for several hours. Serve with melted cheese or sour cream.
Heat milk and white chocolate chips together until white chocolate is melted. Add brewed coffee. Stir. Add cinnamon. Top with whipped cream. Drizzle with caramel topping if desired.

Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Add flour, baking powder and salt and mix well. Roll dough thin on floured board and cut with cookie cutters into shapes. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.
Ingredients:Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Add flour, baking powder and salt and mix well. Roll dough thin on floured board and cut with cookie cutters into shapes. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.
Combine the sugar, butter and milk in large saucepan. Let boil stirring frequently at medium heat until soft ball stage. Add chocolate chips. Remove from heat. Stir until chips dissolve. Add marshmallows, walnuts and vanilla. Stir well. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Put in refrigerator to cool. Cut

Combine all ingredients and pour into unbaked pie crust. Bake at 425 degrees F. until juice bubbles. Remove from oven and spread topping over pie. Return to oven and bake at 350 degrees F. until topping is golden brown. Cool and serve. Topping:Mix sugar and cornstarch. Add enough boiling water to make a thick glaze. Spread over cooled pie.

In a 9 x 13 inch baking dish, combine the white and wild rice, turkey breast, mozzarella cheese, evaporated milk, red bell pepper and green bell pepper. Beat eggs and black pepper in a medium bowl and pour over the rice and turkey mixture. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes or until golden brown and heated through.
Butter chicken breasts and sprinkle with dry mustard and garlic powder. Dip in dry breadcrumbs. Let stand 10 minutes. Sprinkle with tarragon, salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Boil together the mangoes and the crushed pineapple with the evaporated milk and the cool whip. Add the red food coloring and the yellow food coloring. Blend in the nuts and the coconut. Chill the mixture until it is very cold and then pour into your favorite ice cream container. Freeze until solid.

Dissolve stock powder in boiling water in a saucepan. Add couscous and bring back to the boil. Stir in the butter and spring onion. Add the corn and cook for 5 minutes longer. Stir in the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve in bowls or molded in individual serving dishes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large sauté pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onions and sauté 5 minutes. Add the squash and garlic. Sauté for 2 minutes. Add the soy crumbles, sage, salt and pepper. Stir together. Add the stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the quinoa. Mix well. Transfer the mixture to an 8-by-10-inch baking dish. Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil. Bake 40 minutes. Remove the foil. Bake for another 10 minutes. Sprinkle the top with the parsley. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Heat oil in large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until golden. Add stock and simmer until reduced by half. Stir in tomato paste and cook one minute longer. Season with salt and red pepper flakes. Cook pasta al dente, drain and add to sauce. Toss and serve garnished with parsley and romano cheese.

Peel potatoes and slice into 1/2 inch slices. Heat oil in skillet. Add potatoes and onions. Cook for 5 minutes. Add water and cook covered for 10 minutes. Mash with potato masher. Add eggs and mash together. Cook in skillet covered for 5 minutes.

Mix together eggnog and liqueur. In a separate bowl beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold into eggnog mixture. Chill at least 8 hours or overnight. Serve with whipped cream sprinkled with chocolate sprinkles and nutmeg.
Place all ingredients in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 12 to 15 hours. Serve garnished with lemon wedges and celery.
Preheat oven to 400f. Grease muffin tin. Sift the flour and salt together. Beat the eggs and milk together. Stir into dry mixture. Bake in greased tins for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve hot.

In a wok with high sides heat the olive oil and add the chilies and the garlic. Then add the shrimp. Add salt and serve.
name: garlic lover's shrimpingredients: garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, butter, crushed red pepper flakes, large shrimp, coarse salt, cracked black pepper, toothpickpreparation: Process garlic in food processor to finely chop. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add oil and butter. Add garlic and crushed pepper flakes to oil and butter. Season shrimp with salt and toss to coat. Add shrimp to the pan and cook, stirring frequently, until pink and heads curl to tails. Add black pepper, to your taste. Serve immediately.
name: ebichiri shrimp with chiliingredients: shrimp, garlic, hot sauce, saltpreparation: Fry in a wok the cleaned shrimp. Put aside the shrimp and fry the garlic in the wok. Add the hot

Cook beets until tender (about 1 hour), drain and set aside to cool. Cook potatoes in their jackets in boiling water until tender, drain and set aside to cool. Dice beets and potatoes together with the apple. Peel and slice the pearl onion lengthwise. Soak in cold water to remove the bitter taste. Dice the onion into small pieces. In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, maggi seasoning, mustard, vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper to taste. Add the apple, potatoes, beets, onion, and pearl onion to the bowltoss to combine. Serve at room temperature or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with the chopped parsley and serve with hard-cooked eggs.

In a medium saucepan, combine sugar, water and cranberries. Stir well until mixture comes to a boil over medium heat. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until berries pop. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. Add lemon juice, marmalade, nuts, if desired, and cook for 10 minutes longer or until sauce thickens. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly before serving or chilling. Will keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.

Combine cream cheese and butter in a bowl and beat until well blended. Add sugar, orange zest and beat until fluffy. Add eggs and beat until well blended. Add food colors and beat. Sift together flour, cocoa and saltadd to batter. Stir just until blended. Spread batter evenly into prepared pan. Bake as directed on package. Cool completely. Cut into 2-inch squares. Store tightly covered at room temperature.

In a small bowl combine the marmalade and the extract. Reserve. Peel and core the peaches. Cut each in half and slice into bite sized pieces. Peel the kiwifruit and slice into bite sized pieces. Peel and core the melon and slice into bite sized pieces. Cut the strawberries in half and slice into bite sized pieces. In a large bowl combine the peach, kiwi, melon and strawberries. Add the marmalade mixture and toss well. Serve immediately or chill to serve later.

Soak guajillo chilies in hot water. Drain. Blend with onion, garlic and butter. Brown chicken in skillet. Add broth. Add guajillo mixture. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Salt to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 8 x 12 dish with nonstick vegetable spray. In a medium bowl combine the corn muffin mix with the other ingredients except the sour cream and the butter. Beat until the mixture is smooth and well blended. Pour into the dish and bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of sour cream. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese and the green onions. Serve warm.
Add boiling water to dates. Blend with butter. Cool slightly. Stir in other ingredients. Bake in loaf pan for about one hour.
Mix all but the frozen coconut. Frost with whipped topping and sour cream and top with frozen coconut. This is a great treat for summer days!
Beat egg until well combined. Add milk, vanilla, and sugar. Whisk well. Add salt to taste. Serve warm with any bread or crackers you choose.

Peel eggplants and slice length-wise to a thickness of 1 cm. Add salt and pepper and fry eggplant on both sides on medium heat until golden. Add half a cup of hot water to tomato paste and mix well. Add to eggplants and cook over medium heat for about 4-5 minutes. Peel onions and slice thinly. Fry in oil until golden. Also fry dried mint in oil for a few minutes. Alternatively, fresh mint can be used. If so, wash and finely chop mint, then fry in oil. Pour kashk evenly over eggplants, follow with onions and mint. Mash ingredients together with a fork, then serve.
Potatoes have been cultivated in the Americas for at least 7,000 years. The potato is a native of the Peruvian-Bolivian Andes and is thought to have been domesticated more than 8000 years ago. After the Spanish conquest of Peru, the Spanish introduced the potato to Europe in the second half of the 16th century where it immediately became a popular foodstuff. It was

Place chicken in the bottom of a 4-quart slow cooker. In a large bowl, combine gravy, paprika, salt and soy sauce. Pour over chicken. Cook on low for 6 hours or until tender. Remove chicken from gravy mixture. Cover with alumnimum foil and place in preheated 200 degree oven for 1 hour or until heated through. Remove chicken from bone and shred. Return to gravy mixture. Serve over rice.

Cook the potatoes in boiling water until just tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a bowl whisk together the mustard, dill weed and oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the orange juice and zest and toss with the potatoes until coated. Flake the salmon over the top of the potatoes with the capers. Serve at room temperature.

Combine first 6 ingredients. Form into 4 patties. Saute patties in butter until browned. Combine remaining ingredientsheat until thickened and pour over patties. Cook for 1 minute longer or until hot.

In a skillet, sauté turkey and mushrooms in oil until lightly browned. Stir in flour, then the skim milk until slightly thickened. Stir in garlic powder, onion powder, worcestershire sauce. Cook for a few minutes until gravy thickens. Serve over rice or noodles.

Unroll crescent rolls. Spoon about 1 tablespoon cheese mixture onto each crescent roll. Top with artichokes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Roll up jelly roll fashion. Place in ungreased 9×13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. In a bowl, combine sour cream and garlic powder. Spread over hot rolls. Bake 10 minutes longer or until light brown. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm.
Drain fruit. Add marmalade, liqueur, lemonade. Mix well. Refrigerate. Serve in glasses.

Combine half-and-half, egg yolks, sugar and rum in small saucepan. Cook over low heat until thickened. Do not boil. Stirring constantly, add pineapple chunks and cook for 1 minute. Cool slightly. Garnish with mint sprig and serve immediately.

Combine cabbage, carrot, and celery seed in large bowltoss well to coat with vinegar. Set aside. In small bowl, combine sugar, pepper, and 1/4 cup of the vinegarstir well. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup of vinegar, stirring constantly until mixture is smooth. Add oilstir well. Pour over cabbage mixturetoss gently to coat evenly. Yield : 8 servings (2-1/2 cups)

Cut shortening into flour. Mix in baking powder and salt. Add white sugar. Blend in beaten egg. Add enough cold water to moisten. Roll out dough.
Cream together the lard and the margarine, and then mix in the egg yolk. Add enough caster sugar for your tastes and then gradually add the flour. Slowly add enough water to make dough. Bring together and form into a ball. Wrap in cling film and chill for an hour before using.
Cut crisco into flour. Add everything else and mix until dough rolls up into a ball. Pinch off pieces and roll into 1-inch balls. Roll out and add 2 tablespoons of your favorite filling. Fold dough over filling. Seal with water and fry in hot oil. Make sure dough is sealed or filling will ooze out during cooking.
Combine the nuts, salt and flour in a medium bowl or in a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Cut in the butter with a pastry blender. Drizzle in water and mix until dough

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Unroll phyllo dough. Brush each sheet with butter. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Unroll the next sheet of dough. Brush with butter and layer on top of first sheet. Repeat until all phyllo dough sheets are used. Cut the phyllo sheets into 3-inch squares. Spread 1 teaspoon raspberry jam on each square. Top each with 1 teaspoon cheesecake. Roll the top of each square into a cone. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 6 to 8 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Drizzle with raspberry jam and serve.

In a medium saucepan stir together water and pudding mix to a boil. Remove from heat and add the jello until dissolved. Set pan aside and let mixture come to room temperature. Place the berries in the bottom of a deep dish pie plate. Add cooled pudding mixture over the strawberries. Refrigerate until chilled. Let it set in well before slicing.

Clean and pit peaches. Combine all other ingredients. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until thick. Pack into hot jars leaving 1/2 inch head space. Seal and process 10 minutes in boiling water bath. Makes 18 pints.
Brown ground beef and drain. Add onion. Cook until tender. Drain. Add green beans. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add cottage cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Cut the plums in half lengthwise and remove the pit. Place the plums cut side down into a baking dish and sprinkle with lemon juice. Combine the sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over the plums. Dot with butter and bake 30-45 minutes until the plums are tender and juicy and the liquid has thickened into a syrup. Cool before serving.

Combine ground chicken, onion and garlic in a skillet. Cook and stir until no longer pink. Drain. Add taco sauce and continue cooking and stirring until heated through. Add mexican blend cheese and stir until melted. Spoon mixture into taco shells. Sprinkle with lettuce and top with black olives and chopped tomato. Serve with sour cream and hot sauce if desired.
In a 13x9 baking dish, combine all the ingredients. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until crust is browned.
Combine all ingredients together in a bowl and serve immediately.
Mix together sour cream, mayonnaise and seasonings. Add spinach. Stir in artichoke hearts and tomato. Stir in cheeses. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Place basil leaves in bottom of a large glass baking dish. Lay chicken pieces on top of basil. In a small bowl whisk together water, lemon zest and juice and a generous pinch of salt. Pour liquid over chicken. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 6 hours or overnight. When ready to grill, remove from marinade and discard. Place chicken on medium hot grill. Grill covered until done, about 10 minutes on each side. Serve hot with more fresh basil leaves. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients except for milk. Beat well until smooth. Add milk, beat until smooth. Pour into a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until set. Cool slightly and serve.
The only reason I know anything about cooking is because I grew up in a family full of women who were very good at it. My mother is one of the greatest cooks I have ever known. She is so good at it that she rarely uses recipes. My mother and grandmother passed this gift on to my sisters and me. I am not a great cook by any means, but I do know a little about cooking. I learned a lot from my sisters, too.
I thought I was the only one who was a lousy cook until I met a woman who told me she could not cook anything except for a couple of dishes. I was shocked that I knew anyone who could not cook well at all.
I think it is a skill that has been lost in our generation due to all the fast foods and prepackaged foods that are sold in our stores these days. I
Pour oatmeal into saucepan. Add broth. Bring to boil and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with curry powder. Stir in olive oil and parsley. Add pepper and salt to taste. Serve hot.

Combine beans, tomato paste, lime juice, cumin, cayenne pepper in a food processor until smooth. Transfer to a serving bowl and stir in the sour cream, green onions and cheese until well blended. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with chips, crackers or vegetables.

Combine the dry ingredients, set aside. Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat well. Add the milk and beat well. Add the dry ingredients to the wet and mix well. Add the apple and cinnamon and mix well. Spread in a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until done.

Preheat oven to 350°. Combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Melt butter and add to mixture. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Combine orange juice, marshmallows and whipping cream. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Pour over baked crust layer. Top with frozen raspberries and chill for 1 hour. Serve with whipping cream or vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine all the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the butter and eggs. Beat in the vanilla and almond extract. Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and mix well. Divide into two logs and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Cut each log into 1/2 inch slices and place back on the baking sheets. Bake for another 15 minutes. Cool on wire racks.
Another great recipe from my friend!
I love the taste of these biscuits and I have been making them for a couple of years now.
The recipe for the original version came from a magazine but the original recipe had more sugar and I’ve cut it back.
This recipe is really easy to make and I use the same method for a lot of my sweet treats.
I also make a savory version with bacon and cheese.
I’m so glad I found this recipe and I can’t

Preheat over to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt in a large bowlmix well. Beat butter and sugar together in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in egg yolks one at a time. Beat in flour mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour mixturemix well after each addition. Beat in egg whites until stiff peaks form. Stir in pineapple and cornfold in cheese. Pour batter into a greased and floured 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve with butter or margarine. Makes 16 servings.

Preheat oven to 375F. Rinse chicken and pat dry. Place in a 9x13 baking pan. Cut limes in half. Squeeze one half over chicken. Scrub cilantro. Roughly chop. Sprinkle over chicken. Squeeze other lime half over chicken. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour half of the remaining lime juice over chicken. Place in oven. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until juice is clear when a piece is pierced with a fork.

Mash bananas. Add honey, yogurt, eggs, and 1/2 cup of the flour. Mix well. Add remaining 1 1/2 cups flour. Add remaining ingredients. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper. Let cool.
Name: No Bake Cookies (Recipe Source: Southern Living)
Servings: 4 dozen (48)
1 can (12 ounces) evaporated milk
Combine first four ingredientsbring to a boilboil one minute. Remove from heat. Add peanut butter and stir to melt. Add oats and vanillastir thoroughly to mix. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto nonstick surface. Transfer to refrigerator and cool until set.
This recipe for No Bake Cookies (Recipe Source: Southern Living) is from The Benson Family Cookbook Project.

Combine sugar and cornstarch. Add boiling water and stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in jello. Spread on bottom of crust. Add fruit and spread over top. Chill. Top with cool whip.

Cook beef in a large skillet until no longer red. Remove from skillet, using a slotted spoon so as to save liquid in the skillet. Cook macaroni, onion and green pepper in drippings until macaroni is yellow. Return meat to skillet along with tomato sauce, water, salt, pepper and worcestershire sauce. Cover and simmer 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 170c. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. Using a pastry brush, brush each pastry sheet lightly with oil. Cut each sheet into 4 equal strips. Cut each strip in half to make 8 triangles. Place 1 triangle on each baking tray. Spoon 1 tbsp pumpkin mixture onto the centre of each pastry triangle. Sprinkle with bacon. Fold the triangle over the filling to form a triangle shape. Press firmly on the edges to seal. Repeat with remaining pastry triangles. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until pastry is golden and pumpkin is tender. Stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 16 mini quiches.
In a large bowl combine eggs, whipping cream, tabasco, tarragon& chicken base. Whip until smooth.
Arrange the pie shell in a 9 inch pie pan. Add the grated swiss cheese, spinach, ham and parmesan cheese.
Pour the egg mixture over all and bake

Puree watermelon in a blender until smooth. Strain through cheesecloth. Refrigerate for an hour. Combine sugar, lime juice, and tequila in a pitcher. Add watermelon puree and stir well. Add crushed ice. Garnish with mint sprig.
name: pink lemonadeingredients: fresh lemon juice, sugar, water, pink lemonade concentrate, ginger alepreparation:Combine sugar and lemon juice in a 2 quart pitcher. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved. Stir in pink lemonade concentrate. Add ice cubes. Pour ginger ale over ice.
name: pineapple basil lemonadeingredients: fresh pineapple, fresh lemon juice, fresh basil leaves, sugar, water, ginger ale, pineapple slicepreparation:Combine pineapple, lemon juice and basil leaves in a blender. Puree until smooth. Strain through cheesecloth. Refrigerate for an hour. Combine sugar, water and stra

In a 12 inch skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic. Saut until fragrant about 1 minute. Add anchovies. Continue to saute until fish begins to flake. Toss in parsley, cheese & salt & pepper to taste. Pour sauce over spaghetti and toss well. Serve immediately with fresh lemon wedges on the side.

Dissolve chile in water. Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until thick. Serve over enchiladas or tacos, or use as a base for soups or stews.

The dried chile should have been crushed prior to soaking. It should also have been rinsed well after being soaked. You may also want to add a little more salt before adding the garlic and onion.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil. Combine the tomatoes and the artichokes in a bowl. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons oil and sprinkle with the oregano, 1/2 teaspoon pepper and salt to taste. Lay the chicken on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon pepper and salt to taste. Roast for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink. Transfer the chicken to a cutting board and cut into strips. Toss the chicken with the tomatoes and the artichokes. Toss with the remaining 1/4 cup oil and the vinegar. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix the gelatin in the boiling milk. Set aside. Beat the eggs well. Add the cake mix to the eggs. Beat well. Add the milk mixture. Mix well. Pour into a greased and floured 8 inch spring form pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 - 45 minutes. Cool before removing from the pan. Dissolve the kumquat puree in the glaze. Spread over the cake while still warm. Cool. Dust with icing sugar.

Peel cucumbers with vegetable peeler to remove seeds. Cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Toss together shallot, dill, 1/2 teaspoon each of the salt and pepper, and 3 tablespoons of the cider vinegar in large bowl. Add cucumber slicestoss gently to coat. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Stir together remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper and remaining 1 tablespoon vinegar in small bowldrizzle over cucumbers. Toss gently to combine. Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill. Add salt to taste before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Combine honey, soy sauce and olive oil in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add salmon and seal bagturn to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour, turning bag occasionally. Preheat broiler. Remove salmon from bag, discarding marinade and place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Broil 8 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with kiwi relish and mango salsa. Kiwi Relish: Combine kiwi and mango in a bowl. Add lime juice and cilantro. Stir well. Mango Salsa: Combine mango and next 5 ingredients in a bowlstir well. Makes 4 servings.

Combine the water, cornstarch and sugar in a saucepan. Stir in the butter. Bring to a boil and stir constantly for 3 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in coconut milk. Chill until firm.

In a large bowl, add all the dry ingredients and mix well. Add water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with a damp cloth and leave to rest for half an hour. Divide into 3 equal parts and roll each into a roti. Heat a heavy frying pan and add a little ghee. Fry each roti on both sides until golden brown. Serve hot with curry of your choice.

In a large bowl, mix together sourdough starter with warm water and 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and sugar. Add 1 tablespoon melted butter and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Let stand in a warm place for 4 hours. Add 2 cups sifted all purpose flour to mixture and beat well. Add 2 cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour and beat well. Add 2 more cups sifted unbleached all purpose flour

Place flour and oats in a shallow bowl and set aside. Beat the egg yolk with margarine and mix until well blended. Add flour and oats and mix until crumbly and well blended. Press crumb mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9 inch pie dish. Pour the blueberry pie filling over the crumbs. Sprinkle with the remaining crumb mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for 40 minutes or until the filling is bubbly and the crumbs are lightly browned. Cool on a rack. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a medium baking dish. Add the oats and boiling water to a heatproof mixing bowl. Pour in the milk and stir. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle the salt over the top. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle the dried fruit and apples over the top. Drizzle with the heavy cream. Bake for another 5 minutes. Spoon into bowls and serve hot with a drizzling of the cream and a sprinkling of the cinnamon.

In a blender combine raspberries and white grape juice. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large pitcher and stir in sherbet and water. Stir in lemon juice and chill thoroughly before serving. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses, garnished with fresh mint, if desired.
Ice Cream And Shakes
This is a great way to use up summer berries and get a cool treat for the family. This is the perfect treat for kids and adults alike.
1. In a large bowl combine milk and cream cheese.
2. Add cream cheese and milk and mix well.
3. Add the ice cream and mix well.
4. Place in the freezer for about an hour or until it is frozen solid.
5. Serve immediately or let sit for another hour to let the flavors meld together.
The recipe can be made ahead and frozen until ready to serve.
You can use any type of berries you like. I like to use strawberries and blueberries together because they both have a nice tart flavor.
This can be served as a dess

Beat the margarine, eggs and parsley. Add the bread crumbs. Add the pimentos. Salt to taste. Divide the mixture in two. Make the shape of an oval. Put a pimento stuffed olive in the middle. Bake in 350 degrees F oven until brown.
Place kielbasa into deep fryer. Cook 5-7 minutes. Drain. Place the rice into a bowl with the kielbasa. Mix the beans into the rice. Pour the barbecue sauce over the rice. Mix well. Serves 3.

Place the sherry, coconut milk, bay leaves, and whole peppercorns in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to a simmer. Add the chicken and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the chicken from the saucepan. Stir the chiles into the sauce. Return the chicken to the saucepan. Simmer for 2 minutes. Garnish with lime wedges. Serve with rice. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Butter 9 x 13 inch pan. In 2-quart saucepan, combine apples, 1 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Cook and stir until mixture is thick. Remove from heatstir in 1/4 cup raisins and set aside. In 10 inch skillet, melt butter. Add bread cubes. Cook and stir over medium-low heat until lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. In same skillet, combine 2 cups sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamoncook and stir until melted and smooth. Stir in apple mixture and 1/2 cup raisinsspoon into prepared pan. Spoon bread mixture evenly on top of apple mixture. Bake 20 minutes or until top is golden brown and bubbly. Cool slightlyspread with whipped cream and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup raisins and 1 tablespoon chopped walnuts. Refriger

Beat together brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, salt, and baking soda. Add sour cream, butter, eggs. Pour into greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool. Mix together brown sugar and cinnamon for topping.

Spray 9 x 13 casserole dish with cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In mixing bowl combine stuffing mix, soup and onion until blended. Season chops with thyme, then place on stuffing mixture in casserole dish. Top with sliced cheese. Bake uncovered for 30-35 minutes or until cooked through.
Combine all the above ingredients in a casserole. Bake at 180c for 20 minutes.

Add dry ingredients to bowl and whisk together. Pour in water and oil. Whisk until combined. A few lumps are ok. Spray non-stick spray in skillet, and pour batter in until pancake is desired size. If adding anything like chocolate chips or blueberries, now is the time, just sprinkle them on top of the pancake. Cook on first side until bubbles form, then flip to other side. When second side is golden, remove from pan to plate,. Top with your choice of ingredients. Devour pancakes, take nap.

Roll out the puff pastry to a 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 4 equal rectangles. Place 2 cherry tomatoes in the center of each rectangle. Top with 1 teaspoon sugar, 1 teaspoon feta cheese and a basil leaf. Brush the edges with beaten egg. Fold the pastry over and press the edges to seal. Brush with beaten egg. Bake in a 450 degree F. oven for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Top with parmesan cheese and serve.

Bring water to a boil in large saucepan. Add macaroni and return to a boil. Cook uncovered 8 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and chill for 24 hours. Serve on lettuce leaves.
These are so easy to make and very good!
Very good. I added some peppers and some diced green onions. I also used a low fat cream cheese.
In a blender, combine water and fruit. Puree until smooth. Transfer to a pitcher and stir in lime juice. Pour into glasses and serve immediately. Garnish each glass with a strawberry slice.

Saute garlic and worcestershire in oil. Add beef and brown. Stir in soup mix and water. Simmer covered until meat is tender. Dice onions. Spread on half of each roll. Top with meat mixture. Add onion slices. Close sandwiches.

In a 3-quart saucepan, bring broth to a boil. Add the salt and the couscous and cook according to the package directions. Fluff with a fork and transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle on the pistachios and mint. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice and sprinkle on the pepper. Serves 4.
Cut eggplant into 1/2 inch slices. Heat oil in a wok or frying pan. Add flour and fry eggplant until crispy brown. Add black bean sauce. Cook 2-3 minutes. Serve over rice.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the lemon peel and garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through. Season to taste with the crushed red pepper flakes and salt and pepper. Remove the shrimp and set aside. In a large pot, cook the pasta in boiling water until tender but firm. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Heat the reserved pasta water in the same skillet over medium-high heat. Add the leeks and cook until softened. Add the dry white wine and cook until reduced by half. Add the shrimp and pasta and toss until well combined and heated through. Add the parsley and toss again. Serve immediately.

Brown hamburger. Add vegetables and stir until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add ramen noodle packet. Stir until noodles are heated. Pour over hamburger and vegetable mixture and heat through.
You're going to love this recipe.
I'm not sure if you've ever tried making egg rolls from scratch before. You'll find that it's a lot easier than you think.
These are really easy and are great for lunch!
I'm not sure what the word is that best describes this recipe. It's not really a stew and it's not a soup. It's a little bit of both.
I've been making these for years. I make them for the kids when they were little and still make them today for the grandkids.
I'm a huge fan of anything with chicken. I've made this recipe at least a hundred times and it always comes out perfect.
I love making this recipe for my family.
The best part about this recipe is that it's so easy to make. I make it at least once a week for dinner
Combine first 6 ingredients in a blenderprocess until smooth. Add next 4 ingredientsblend well. Add remaining 3 ingredientsblend just until combined. Cover and chill 2 hours. Makes 3 3/4 cups.
Mix together the spinach leaves, mandarin oranges, red pepper, green onion and cream cheese. Add the chopped turkey. Divide evenly among the tortillas. Roll up tightly. Cut into slices.

In a heavy saucepan combine sugar, evaporated milk, butter and maple extract. Bring to a boil and boil hard for 5 minutes. Add white chocolate chips and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallows and nuts. Spread in a buttered 8x8 pan. Chill until firm. Cut in squares. Top each square with a walnut half.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 13x9x2 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Combine chicken, salsa, corn, black beans, rice and 1 cup cheese in prepared dish. Cover with remaining cheese. Bake 20 minutes. Remove from oventop with tortillas. Return to ovenheat through 5 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with toppings such as lettuce, chopped tomato, olives and green onions.

Steam the broccoli in a pot of boiling water for 3-4 minutes or until slightly tender. Remove the broccoli from the pot and let cool. In a large pot of boiling water cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain the pasta in a colander. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves, crushed red pepper flakes and the cooked broccoli to the skillet. Saute for 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain the pasta. Add the broccoli mixture to the pasta. Toss to combine. Serve.

Slice the potatoes thinly and soak in water to prevent browning. Saute the green bell pepper, onion, pimientos and olive oil in a large saute pan until tender but not browned. Drain the potatoes well. Combine the cooked vegetables with the potatoes and season with the salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Serves 4 to 6.
Mix all ingredients except breadcrumbs in a large bowl until well blended. Pour into a 9-inch-square baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 1 hour or until done.
Serve in a hamburger bun with sesame seeds and grated cheddar cheese on top. Serve with a pickle and tomato slices on the side, and top with lettuce and mustard and ketchup.

In a small saucepan, combine pudding and milk. Cook and stir over low heat until mixture thickens and boils. Cool completely. In a large bowl beat cream cheese, butter and sugar until blended. Add pudding and milk mixture and beat until well blended. Fold in Cool Whip. Spread into pie crusts. Top each with 1/2 cup of Butterfingers and press lightly into crust. Cover and chill at least 2 hours before serving. Garnish with additional Cool Whip if desired. Serves 6-8.

Wash then hull the strawberries. Slice in half. Place in the jar of a blender or food processor. Pour in the milk and syrup and optional ice cubes. Whirl on high speed or crush setting for 30 seconds. Serve immediately.

Whisk eggs, add sugar and milk. Add butter, salt, and vanilla, mix well. Sift the dry ingredients into the mixture, mix just till incorporated. Cook in a griddle or frying pan over medium high heat for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown. Serve hot with butter or syrup or berries or whatever you like.

Mince the cloves of garlic in a food processor or blender until they are very finely chopped or until they turn into a paste. Add the bread crumbs to the processor or blender and continue to mix until the crumbs are fine. Add the olive oil and vinegar to the processor or blender and blend until the mixture is smooth. Add the lemon juice and water and continue blending until the mixture is smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature with grilled vegetables or meats, or as an appetizer dip with crackers or breadsticks.
Bring the water to a boil over high heat. Turn off the heat and add the rest of the brine ingredients. Cool to room temperature before adding the chicken. Cover and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat butter until foaming. Add onion and garlic, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes or until onion is translucent. Add cabbage and stir frequently for 5 minutes or until cabbage is limp. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in zucchini. Cover the pan and simmer for 15 minutes or until zucchini is tender and cabbage is very tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Slice peaches and combine with tofu. Stir honey into soy milk until dissolved. Stir into peach mixture. Refrigerate 1 hour or longer. Stir mint sprig into mixture before serving. Makes 2 servings.

In a small bowl combine soy creamer and cornstarch. Beat in soy milk. In a shallow dish combine flour and cornmeal. Dip each piece of bread into the liquid mixture and then into the flour mixture. Melt 1/4 cup vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place the soaked pieces of bread into the skillet and cook until golden brown. Serve with a fruit topping.
name: french toast
ingredients: butter, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg, all-purpose flour, milk, white bread
preparation:Place bread in a single layer on a baking sheet and place in a 350 degree oven for 5 minutes. Meanwhile in a medium bowl beat together the butter and the eggs. Beat in the spices and flour until the mixture is smooth. Remove the bread from the oven and brush each piece with the egg mixture and return the pan to the oven. Bake 5 more minutes or until golden brown. Serve with fruit.
name: chocolate chip french toast
ingredients

Peel and seed the tomato. Cut it into small chunks. Peel and slice the white onion. Remove the seeds and ribs from the jalapeo peppers. Cut the chiles into strips. Roughly chop the cilantro. Sprinkle the mixture with salt and the juice of one lemon. Add the garlic salt.

Rub the chicken all over with the oil. Season with the spices and a few grinds of freshly ground black pepper. In a large roasting pan, toss the onions with the remaining oil and season with salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Place the onions around the bird and roast in the oven for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the juices run clear and the thigh is easily pierced with a knife.

Add all of the beans and water to a large pot. Bring to a boil and boil for 15-20 minutes. Add all of the other ingredients and continue boiling until the beans are tender and creamy. Mash the mixture with a potato masher. Serve with corn chips.

Heat the grenadine in a saucepan with a pinch of salt until boiling. Add the black peppercorns and remove from the heat. Leave to cool. Divide the mascarpone between two bowls. Add some of the cooled grenadine. Grate in some strawberry liqueur, stir in some vanilla extract. Add the single cream. Add some of the cooled grenadine. Grate in some strawberry liqueur, stir in some vanilla extract. Add the single cream. Add some of the cooled grenadine. Grate in some strawberry liqueur, stir in some vanilla extract. Add the single cream. Add some of the cooled grenadine. Grate in some strawberry liqueur, stir in some vanilla extract. Add the single cream. Add some of the cooled grenadine. Combine cereal, oats and raisins in a large mixing bowl. Add light corn syrup and light brown sugar and stir until well mixed. Pour mixture into a greased 9x13x2-inch pan. Bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees f or until mixture is set and golden. Combine peanut butter, vanilla and water and beat well with electric mixer until smooth. Add powdered milk and beat until smooth and well blended. Pour over baked mixture. Sprinkle with milk chocolate chips and press lightly into mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes more or until chocolate is melted and well blended with mixture. Cool and cut into bars.
Mix all ingredients in a pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thick. Stir frequently so it doesn't burn. Cool and store in the refrigerator.
Mix egg with cake mix and cool whip. Chill for several hours and shape into balls or roll into balls and roll in powdered sugar.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add green onions and cook until soft. Add smoked sausage. Cook until browned. Add garlic powder. Cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes with their juice. Stir in bell pepper. Cook 5 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Stir in kidney beans. Add water. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer covered about 5 minutes or until kidney beans are tender. Season to taste with black pepper. Garnish with cilantro, if desired.

Slice chicken breasts in half lengthwise. Cut them in chunks. Place in crockpot with wine and broth. Season with salt, paprika, thyme and pepper to taste. Cook 6-8 hours or more on low. Add the veggies and cook 1 hour or more. If you are adding the veggies 1-2 hours before serving you may not need to add any liquid to the crockpot. Serve over rice or noodles or mashed potatoes. You can also use any kind of meat in this recipe.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Cool slightly then dice. Cook the beets until tender then cut into small cubes. Combine the potatoes, beets, onion, garlic clove, gherkin, yogurt and curry powder together in a medium-size serving bowl. Serve garnished with the hard-boiled eggs and fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 425f. Cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds. Cut into 1 inch cubes. Toss all vegetables in a large bowl with oil. Transfer to a baking sheet in a single layer and roast for 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven, drizzle with syrup and toss to combine. Sprinkle with toasted chopped walnuts.

Place egg yolks in blender container. Add salt and freshly squeezed lemon juice. Beat until blended. With blender running slowly add sweet butter until blended. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to one day. Heat for 10 seconds in microwave before serving.
1. If you do not have a double boiler or electric blender, you can use a stove top double boiler for this recipe.
2. The key is to keep the eggs and water from getting too hot.
3. If you use a stove top double boiler, you can keep an ice cube in your other hand while you whisk.
4. If you do not have a stove top double boiler, you can also use a metal or glass bowl on top of your pot on low heat.
5. If you have an electric blender, you can also use it for this recipe.
6. If you are using a stove top blender, you can use your electric blender for this recipe if you do not have one.
