Stir the wet into the dry until just combined. Heat a waffle iron until very hot and spray with non-stick spray. Place 1/4 cup of batter in the center of the hot iron and close the lid and let cook for about 3 minutes or until the waffle is golden brown and crisp on the outside and cooked through on the inside. Makes about 3 4-inch squares or 3 3-inch squares.

Boil water in a large saucepan for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vegetables and cook 2 more minutes or until tender-crisp. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to the package directions. Drain the noodles and stir them into the vegetable mixture. Add eggs and stir well. Serve hot.
Mix all the ingredients except fresh cream and serve in a tall glass with ice. Top with fresh cream and a dash of cinnamon.

Pour cold water into a medium bowladd cornstarch and mix with a wire whisk until smooth. Add the balsamic vinegar and mix thoroughly. Stir in the salt, sugar, egg, prepared mustard, and unsalted butter until smooth. This is your famous sauce. Serve immediately or refrigerate for later use. Serves 4-6.

Put cocoa and sugar into a blender. Add warm water and blend until smooth. Add milk and blend until smooth. Add chocolate and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
Pour into glasses and serve.
1. In a medium saucepan, stir together the cocoa and sugar.
2. Add the milk and heat until it just begins to boil.
3. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla or liqueur.
4. Top with ground nutmeg or cinnamon, whipped cream or marshmallows.
1. In a large saucepan, stir together the cocoa and sugar.
2. Add the water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
3. Allow to boil for two minutes, still stirring.
4. Add the milk and heat to serving temperature.
5. Add the vanilla and serve.
1. In a large bowl combine bread cubes and milk.
2. Melt margarinemix with cocoa and syrup.
3. Pour over bread and stir to coat.
4. Serve with sprinkled

Cut livers into slices and cut each slice into two strips. Sprinkle both sides with flour. Heat olive oil over medium heat, add sliced onion and saute until lightly browned. Add strips of liver and cook until brown. Add mushrooms and cook until tender, then add the dry red wine and the spices. Stir to dissolve spices and reduce the liquid by half. Add the livers and cook until heated through. Serve over rice or noodles.

In large bowl combine poundcake mix, eggnog, nutmeg & cinnamon. Beat until smooth. Divide batter among 2 greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pans. Bake at 350 for 40 to 45 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Remove from pans to cooling rack. Drizzle with rum. Makes 2 loaves.
Eggnog has a rich history of its own. The word itself is of Dutch origin. It means a drink made from milk and eggs. The oldest record of the word is a Dutch recipe for milk punch called nogg, which was made for the Dutch colony in the West Indies in 1655. The English word eggnog first appeared in 1775. It was in the form of an alcoholic drink.
The eggnog we know today has its roots in medieval Europe. People then believed that the yolk of an egg was a symbol of the sun. Since the egg was believed to possess supernatural powers it was often used in pagan rituals. Eggnog is also used in some parts of Asia in a ritual called

Combine blueberries, strawberries, sugar, butter and water. Mix well. Combine dry ingredients. Spread half of fruit mixture into a 13x9 pan. Sprinkle dry mixture on top. Spread remaining fruit mixture on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until fruit juices bubble. Serve with a dollop of light whipped topping.
Name: Blueberry Apple CrispIngredients: Blueberries, Apples, All-Purpose Flour, Brown Sugar, Oatmeal, Ground Cinnamon, Ground Nutmeg, MargarinePreparation:Combine the blueberries and the apples in a bowl and sprinkle with about 1 tablespoon of the flour. Toss. Spoon into 6 custard cups. Combine the remaining flour and sugar in a bowl. Cut in margarine until mixture is crumbly and resembles coarse meal. Add oats, cinnamon and nutmeg. Sprinkle flour mixture over the fruit. Bake at
Cook pasta to al dente in boiling water. Drain. In a large frying pan or pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add pasta, tomatoes and water. Toss. Serve immediately. Add salt to your liking.
In a large bowl, combine the carrots, pineapple, orange and apple. Toss gently. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the fruit and toss again. Serve chilled.

Mix mayonnaise, cheese, diced pimiento, and bacon in small bowl until blended. Spread mixture on bread. Cook in skillet over medium-high heat 3 minutes or until hot and melty. Flip and cook 3 minutes more or until bread is browned and cheese is melted. Makes 2 servings (2 sandwiches).

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add bananas and egg beating well after each addition. Add vanilla and yoghurt and stir well to combine. Combine dry ingredients, sifting into the bowl. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x5 loaf tin. Bake 60 to 70 minutes at 350 degrees until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes then remove from pan to cool completely on a wire rack.

Bring water to boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in tea and mint until thoroughly blended. Refrigerate at least one hour or overnight. Serve over ice in tall glasses. Stir in lemon juice to taste. Garnish each glass with a mint sprig.

Cook ground turkey until brown. Drain excess fat and return to pot. In a separate bowl, combine soup mixes and add to ground turkey mixture. Heat through. Spread tater tots evenly on bottom of casserole dish. Pour ground turkey mixture over tater tots. Sprinkle cheese on top of ground turkey mixture. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until cheese is melted.
Name: turkey sausage pattiesIngredients: ground turkey, egg, seasoning salt, garlic powder, onion powderPreparation:Combine all ingredients together. Mix well. Form into patties, then place on a baking sheet or wax paper covered plate and chill for 1 hour. Broil on each side for 5-6 minutes or until browned.
Name: cheater s chiliIngredients: oil, lean ground turkey, stewed tomatoes, hot chili beans, chili powderPreparation:Heat oil in skillet. Crumble turkey and cook over medium-high heat until no longer p
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and let cool slightly. Mash potatoes and combine with remaining ingredients. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Slice and core apples. Combine filling ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Spoon into crust. Dot with margarine drops. Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes or until apples are tender. Cool for 20 minutes before serving.
Combine soymilk, egg white, honey, vanilla and spices in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth and frothy. Pour into glasses or mugs. Garnish with nutmeg if desired.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and stir fry 2 minutes. Add pineapple and cook until heated through. Add lime juice and crushed red pepper flakes. Toss well. Add green onions and ginger. Toss. Serve at once.

Prepare 1 box of chocolate instant pudding mix as directed on the box. Cool completely. Beat 1 box of dream whip as directed on box. Fold in 1 container of COOL WHIP. Place pudding filling into prepared graham cracker pie crust and spread evenly over the bottom of the pie shell. Top the pudding layer with the COOL WHIP mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/gas mark 4. Peel and finely slice the onions. Wash the Savoy cabbage and cut the stalk out so that it lies flat. Dice the Savoy cabbage and toss with the finely sliced red onions and 2 tsp of water. Place the Savoy cabbage in an ovenproof dish and cover with foil. Bake for 5 minutes or until tender, stirring half way through cooking time. Heat the butter and oil in a wok until hot. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds, stirring frequently. Add the pork and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until cooked through. Stir in the Chinese five spice powder and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the Savoy cabbage and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until piping hot and lightly coated with the sauce. Serve immediately sprinkled with spring onions and the remaining 2 tsp of water.

Rinse an old-fashioned glass with herbsaint (an anise-flavored liqueur) to coat the glass. Discard excess liquid. In a cocktail shaker, muddle the rye whiskey, sugar and bitters until dissolved. Add ice. Cover and shake until chilled. Strain into glass and garnish with a lemon peel.
A few months ago I was at my daughters home when I found this in her bookcase. I was so happy that I found it. It is full of recipes for cocktails that do not contain alchohol. I have been making cocktails for years, but I did not know about this book until recently.
I've been trying out some of the recipes from this book. I found that some of them were really good and that others were just so-so.
The one that I liked the best was the Mango Mojito. I used some fresh mango that I cut up and added to it instead of using canned mango. I also added some fresh mint leaves to it as well as fresh limes. I thought that it was really good.
I

Combine wild rice, onion, celery and mushrooms in saucepan. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer covered for 40 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add sausage. Heat through. In saucepan over low heat, combine milk and flour. Cook and stir until thick and bubbly. Stir in buttered bread crumbs. Spoon over rice and sausage. Garnish with worcestershire sauce.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, saute the vegetables in butter until tender. Stir in the soup, milk and seasonings. Add the tuna and mushrooms. Stir in the pasta and sprinkle with the pimento. Transfer to a greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

Shell prawns and set aside. Cut red, yellow and green bell peppers into strips. Place bell peppers in a glass dish. In a bowl, combine lemon juice, olive oil, basil, rosemary, peppercorns and salt. Pour mixture over bell peppers. Place bell peppers on grill to heat through. Add prawns to the bowl of lemon juice mixture, cover and marinate for 15 minutes. Thread prawns onto skewers. Grill prawns for about 5-7 minutes or until firm and pink. Serve with grilled bell peppers.

Cook noodles according to package directions and drain well. In a saucepan over medium heat add butter and pot cheese. Stir until melted and smooth. Add the drained noodles and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper if desired. Serve warm or chilled.
Place water, rice and salt in saucepan. Bring to boil and cook for 15 minutes. Add butter and sugar.

In large frying pan over medium heat cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Cook onion and green pepper in bacon fat until tender, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle sugar over onion and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in remaining ingredients except bacon and tomatoes. Simmer covered for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and bacon. Simmer covered for 10 minutes more or until tomatoes are tender. Serve over hot cooked rice, garnished with green onion springs and bacon strips.

Drain hash browns and place in 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Mix sour cream and soup together in large bowl. Stir in cheese and butter until well blended. Spread over hash browns and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until thoroughly heated through and bubbly. Sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.

Beat eggs and water with a mixer until frothy. Stir in cake mix. Press into 10-inch round pans sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until done. Cool. Melt 1 cup butter and peanut butter together. Drizzle over cooled cakes. Top with toffee pieces and chocolate chips. Melt 1/2 cup butter for frosting. Spread over cooled cakes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Soak the garbanzos overnight. In a large pot, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and the onions. Saute for 2-3 minutes. Add the rosemary and the bay leaf. Add the chorizo. Brown the garbanzos for 3 minutes. Add the tomato sauce, the chorizo liquid from the canned chorizo, the garbanzos, the water, the salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 45-50 minutes. Add the spinach. Cook for 3 minutes. Serve in bowls.
Name: chicken chorizo skewersingredients: chicken thigh fillets, olive oil, garlic cloves, ground oregano, sweet paprika, lemon juice, brown sugar, chorizo sausagespreparation: combine chicken, oil, garlic, oregano, paprika, lemon juice and sugar in a bowl. place in the fridge for 2 hours to marinate. evenly thread the chicken, alternating with chorizo, among the skewers. heat a char-grill pan or bar

Slice zucchini into 1/8 inch slices and saute with onion and garlic until golden. Add fresh tomatoes and 1 tsp. of tomato paste. Add herbs and seasoning. Add water and simmer until sauce is thick. Cook pasta according to package. Add zucchini mixture to pasta and toss to blend. Serve immediately.

Bring 2 quarts water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook chicken in skillet over medium heat 10 min. or until browned. Drain and return to skillet. Add soup, milk and 1/4 tsp. pepper. Bring to a boil. Stir in broccoli and pasta. Toss until heated through. Serves 4.

Slice chicken breasts into 1/2 inch medallions. Melt butter in a skillet and saute onions in butter until tender. Combine seasoned breadcrumbs with cheese and dried bay leaves. Place onion and breadcrumb mixture in a large plastic bag. Add medallions and toss to coat. Remove chicken from bag and arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until done. Serve with pasta.

Slice and cook onions in 2 Tbsp. olive oil until soft. Lay slices on bottom of crock. Add 2 Tbsp. olive oil. Mix sour cream with soup and pour over onions. Add 1 1/4 cups water and baking potatoes. Place chops on top. Cover and bake 4 to 6 hours on low. Stir and let stand 10 minutes.

Combine sugar, milk, butter & 1/4 cup hot water. Add remaining 2 cups cold water. Boil for 5 minutes. Cut off kernels from each ear of corn & add to syrup mixture. Return to boiling point & cook until thickened slightly. Spoon into 9" x 13" greased baking dish & spread evenly. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until hot & bubbly. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, saute the onion, garlic, red bell peppers, zucchini, summer squash and lima beans in the butter over moderate heat, stirring occasionally for 4 to 5 minutes. Add lima beans. Cook for 1 minute. Add the corn kernels. Cook for 1 minute. Add the sage. Stir to combine. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Boil red potatoes until tender. Mash them with butter, garlic, dried chives, salt and pepper.
Place all in crock pot except the rice. Cook for 6 hours on low, serve over the rice.

In a large skillet, saute onion in the oil until tender. Add the marjoram, rosemary, turmeric and a little salt. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the rice and the orzo. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Cover the skillet and cook over low heat until the rice is tender.

Cut chicken into small pieces. Combine chicken with dressing, prosciutto, pepper, spring greens and parmesan cheese in a bowl. Spread pesto sauce on each roll. Top with chicken mixture and sprinkle with more parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Add the sugar, cocoa, and flour to the mug. Stir well. Add the milk and the egg. Add the oil. Stir well and microwave for about 90 seconds. The cake may rise above the rim of the mug. The cake is done when a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

Cream together the butter, sugar and eggs until light and fluffy. In a seperate bowl combine the flour with the baking soda. Stir the flour mixture into the creamed mixture. Shape into small balls and roll in chopped walnuts. Place on a greased cookie sheet, press a thumb print into the center and fill with strawberry jam. Bake at 350F for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Cook rice as directed on package. Cool. Add tuna, pimento, onion and pepper to rice mixture. Stir well. Spoon into a lightly greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Blend soup and mayonnaise. Pour over top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Combine breadcrumbs in a bowl. Add milk and stir until the mixture is soft but not soupy. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients except the mozzarella cheese. Gently knead the mixture until smooth. Shape into 3/4-inch balls. Press a small piece of mozzarella cheese into the center of each. Cover, refrigerate until ready to cook. In a large skillet heat 2 inches of oil to 375 degrees F. Add the meatballs in batches and fry for about 3 to 4 minutes until golden brown. Drain and serve hot.

Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside. Prepare the skewers by soaking them in water for 30 minutes. Preheat grill to 350 degrees. Drain the skewers and thread each with the meat mixture. Place the skewers on the grill and turn often until browned and the meat is no longer pink in the center. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, cream the margarine and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla and egg and beat until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, cocoa and baking powder in a small bowl and sift together. Add the sifted mixture and mix well. Stir in the salt and chocolate chips. Spread the mixture evenly in a deep-dish pie plate or a 10 inch round pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 1 hour. Serve with vanilla ice cream if desired.

Heat peaches with sugar, cinnamon and water to boilingstirring constantly until thickened. Chill until cool enough to serve over vanilla ice cream. To serve, spoon peaches over a dish of ice cream and add a few drops of rum or a splash of lemon juice to each serving.

Place water in a small bowl. Heat in the microwave for 1 minute. Add tea bags and let steep for 1 minute. Add apple cider and let cool to room temperature. Add orange juice and cranberry juice. Stir in sugar and orange slices. Cut out the center of the oranges to make room for the cloves and cinnamon sticks. Thread the cloves and cinnamon sticks onto the sliced oranges. Place the red-hot candies on top. Serve in chilled glasses.

Heat water to boiling in large saucepan. Stir in rice mixture. Coverreduce heat. Cook 20-22 minutes or until rice is tender. Meanwhile, in small saucepan, heat butter until melted. Stir in marmaladeheat through. Remove from heat. Drain snow peascut crosswise into thin slices. Drain water chestnutscut into thin slices. Combine rice mixture with snow peas, water chestnuts, marmalade mixture and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Melt cottage cheese in skillet with italian seasoning. Add zucchini and cook until tender-crisp, about 7 minutes. Stir in tomato. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Serve pasta on top of zucchini mixture.

Cut the potatoes in cubes and place in the bottom of the crockpot. Cut the celery, carrots and onions and place in the bottom of the crockpot. Cut the garlic and place in the bottom of the crockpot. Season the ground beef with the garlic salt and salt and pepper. Brown the beef and drain off any fat and place the browned beef in the bottom of the crockpot. Add the can of soup and 1 can of water to the beef. Add the carrots, celery and onions to the top of the beef and water mixture. Add the frozen peas to the top of the carrots and celery and onions and place the lid on the crockpot and put on high for 5 hours or until the meat is tender. Serve the hamburger mixture over the mashed potatoes and enjoy!

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut the lemons in half. Place a 1/2 cup of water in a 2-quart baking dishplace the fish in the baking dish in the middle of the dish. Place a lemon half on each side of the fish. Squeeze the lemons over the fish. Season with butter, pepper and salt. Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork (10 to 12 minutes). Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray 9×13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Place tater tots in pan and bake for 12 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven- let cool. Crumble tots. Combine ground beef, taco seasoning and water in large skillet over medium heat. Cook until done- stirring occasionally. Drain off excess grease. Add tater tots- stir well. To serve- place crumbled tots in individual serving bowls- top with meat mixture then add desired toppings of your choice.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, brown beef in a skillet. In a bowl, mix the egg and milk together. Add beef to egg mixture. Add tomato sauce to the skillet. Add the onion and green pepper to the skillet. Stir in the mushrooms. In a separate bowl mix together the pasta and beef mixture. Add the pasta and beef mixture to a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Cover with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
mushroom is a common food for every one.I also like to eat this.

Melt dark chocolate with syrup and butter in a heatproof bowl set over a pot of simmering water (make sure the bottom of the bowl doesn t touch the water). Stir until combined, then stir in puffed rice cereal. Drop by teaspoonsful onto parchment paper to set. Makes about 36 crackles

Boil eggs for 10-12 minutes. Remove from boiling water immediately, run under cold water and crack shells on both ends to ease removal of shell. Remove shells and rinse well under cold water. Cut eggs in half and remove yolks. Place yolks in a medium bowl and mash with a fork until creamy. Add the remaining ingredients except eggs, mix well and refrigerate until ready to use. Place each half egg on a toothpick. Fill egg whites with red beet yolk mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cook the pasta in plenty of boiling water for about ten minutes. Drain well and add the olive oil. Stir through the cooked pasta. Cut the avocados into chunks. Squeeze the lemon juice over the avocados. Season with salt and pepper. Add the cream to the pasta mixture. Divide the mixture among four serving dishes, then top with a little shredded parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saut until fragrant (about 1 minute). Add water, crushed tomatoes, bouillon cubes, sage, shells and frozen chopped spinach. Stir to combine. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the pasta is tender and the flavors have combined. Add the beans to the pot and continue to cook for 10 minutes more or until heated through. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve with warm bread.

Prepare a broiling pan by putting it on a rack on a cookie sheet. Dip the chicken in the lemon-rosemary marinade. Spread the marinade on the broiling pan and place the chicken on the marinade. Broil the chicken for 10 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve with the vegetables.

Heat oil in skillet. Add onion and saute until transparent. Add pepper. Stir in garlic and cook until tender. Add salt and herbs. Place mixture into 2 1/2 quart baking dish. Layer eggplant over vegetables. Top with sour cream. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes.

Combine the first five ingredients. Add the vanilla and egg mixture. Sift together the dry ingredients and add to the liquid mixture. Add the apples and mix well. Bake in a 9 by 13 inch pan at 350 for one hour or until done.

Sift together the all-purpose flour, whole-wheat flour, salt, and baking powder. In a large mixing bowl cream together the butter and sugar until light. Beat in the eggs one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract. Beat in the mashed bananas. Sift the dry ingredients over the mixture and stir just until they are incorporated. Fold in the chocolate chips. Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray or butter. Spread the batter evenly in the pan and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 60 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing the bread from the pan.

Heat oil in pan. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Add onion and garlic. Drain fat. Stir in soup, milk, ketchup, salt and pepper. Pour into 1-quart casserole. Top with refrigerated biscuits. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until biscuits are lightly browned.

Mix together cream cheese, sugar and vanilla. Add beaten egg yolk. Unroll the crescent roll dough and separate into four rectangles. Spread the filling down the centre of each rectangle. Roll up and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Combine water and sugar in blender containerprocess 1 minute or until sugar is dissolved. Add frozen lemonade, frozen peaches, vodka, lime juice and carbonated lemon-lime beverage. Blend well until smoothpour into two glassesserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 13x9-inch pan with cooking spray. Combine butter and sugars. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in bananas. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowlstir into butter mixture. Spread mixture into pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Stir together chips and nuts. Spread over top of bars.

Mix together the frozen corn with the cream and evaporated milk in a saucepan. Add salt and sugar to taste. Heat slowly until warm and thicken with flour and butter mixed together. Add pepper to taste. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Combine all the ingredients except the oil and mix well. Marinate the chicken for several hours or overnight. After the chicken has been marinated, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place the chicken pieces on the skillet and brown on all sides. Remove the pieces from the skillet and pour the marinade into the skillet. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and return the chicken to the skillet. Cook for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve.

Defrost spinach and squeeze out excess liquid. Add all remaining ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth. Divide mixture evenly between 4 ramekins and sprinkle with a little grated cheese if desired. Bake for about 20 minutes or until set in the middle.

Prepare pasta according to package directions. Cook chicken in italian dressing until no longer pink. Remove from sauce. Add potatoes to sauce. Cook until tender. Pour over pasta. Top with chicken and sprinkle with parmesan. Serves 4.

Bring all the sauce ingredients to a boil in a large pot over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the wings to the sauce and simmer for another 10 minutes or until the wings are cooked through and the sauce is thick and gooey.

Combine the tomatoes with the feta cheese and olives. Spread the tzatziki on both sides of the naan bread. Place the chicken on one slice. Top with the tomato mixture. Add the other slice on top. Place under the broiler and cook until the bread is toasted. Serve with a side of lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Mix mustard, honey-roasted ham, cheese and egg in small bowl. Divide mixture into 12 pieces. Place each piece on a small piece of foil. Brush foil with oil. Fold foil over meat mixture. Bake for 10 minutes or until done. Cool slightly. Unwrap meat mixture. Cut each piece in half. Place on toothpicks. Serve with toothpicks.
Cream together cream cheese, honey, and butter. Beat well. Add lemon rind. Mix to combine. Spread over hot cross buns. Decorate with 2 maraschino cherries. Serve with tea.

Preheat the broiler with the rack 4 inches from heat. Peel and devein 1 pound of jumbo shrimp, reserving the tails. Cut each tail in half lengthwise and set aside. Brush the inside of 2 12-inch-long pieces of aluminum foil with 1 tablespoon of the canola oil and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the minced fresh cilantro leaves. Divide the reserved tails between 2 pieces of foil. Divide the reserved tails between 2 pieces of foil. Spread 1 teaspoon of the preserves on each piece of foil, then divide the shrimp evenly on top of the preserves. Drizzle each piece of foil with 1/2 teaspoon of the canola oil, then fold over to enclose tightly, sealing the edges with a toothpick or string. Broil until cooked through, about 5 minutes. Squeeze 1/2 of each lime over the foil-wrapped packages, then sprinkle with 2 teaspo

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a 9×5 loaf pan.In a large bowl, combine the flour, whole wheat flour, light brown sugar, baking powder, kosher salt, baking soda, caraway seeds, and 1 cup of the buttermilkstir just until combined. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead gently, just until the dough comes together. Turn the dough out into the prepared loaf pan, smoothing the top.Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Remove from the ovenlet stand for about 10 minutes before cutting the bread into slices.
name: soda breadingredients: flour, baking soda, salt, butter, sour milkpreparation:Preheat oven to 400. Stir flour, baking soda and salt together. Cut in butter, until mixture resembles crumbs. Pour in sour milk. Knead dough, cut

In a large bowl beat the first three ingredients with a mixer until blended. Stir in the cooled whipped topping until blended. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Top with the remaining half of the whipped topping, then the vanilla wafers and the sliced bananas. Cover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours. Garnish with a few of the banana slices if desired before serving.
Spread potato mixture on bottom of crust. Spread stuffing and turkey gravy over potatoes and top with turkey and cheeses. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Garnish with cranberry sauce.
Bring to boil in large saucepan. Stir in brown sugar and spices. Simmer covered for 20 minutes. Strain to remove spices. Serve. Garnish with sliced apples and cinnamon stick.

In food processor or blender mix graham crumbs with milk. Let stand until thickened and gelatinous. In another bowl mix meat with onion and eggs. Add ketchup and mix well. Combine meat and crumbs. Press into 8x4 loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 1 1/2 hours. Let cool before cutting and wrapping for freezer storage.
I know this is a really old thread but I just wanted to comment on your meatloaf recipe. I have made this recipe many times and I have never had anyone complain that they didn't like it. It really is delicious and I love that you can freeze some for later or take some to work for lunch. I have never had any issues with my meatloaf falling apart either. I think you did just fine with this recipe!
This is awesome! I need more freezer meals in my life!
I love this! I will try this recipe out!

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water until tender but firm. Drain and return to pot to keep warm. Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browned. Add peppers and onion. Cook 8 to 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add plum tomatoes, tomato sauce and basil. Stir. Serve pasta over sauce. Sprinkle with asiago cheese. Serve immediately.

Cut up cauliflower into 1-inch chunks. Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the cauliflower and cook over medium-high heat until tender and browned. Add the salt. Add the butter. Add the onions. Cook until soft. Add the curry powder. Cook until the flavor is released. Add the water. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the chicken broth. Simmer for 10 minutes. Puree the mixture in a blender. Serve with fresh parsley.

Cook noodles according to package directions. In the meanwhile brown meat. Add in the spaghetti sauce mix. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Stir in the water and the tomato paste. Cook until water has evaporated. Add the cottage cheese and stir until incorporated. Add the mozzarella cheese. Spread in the bottom of a 9 x 13 baking pan. Put down a layer of noodles. Spread the meat mixture evenly over the noodles. Top with more noodles. Repeat until all the meat mixture is used up. Top with the rest of the mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parsley. Let cool for 5 minutes. Cut in squares and serve.

Soak bread cubes in water for about an hour or until soft. Drain excess water. Place soaked bread cubes into food processor along with other vegetables. Process until smooth. Heat oil in skillet on med hi. Form mixture into balls with wet hands. Brown on both sides. Serve warm. Serve with sauce if desired.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the scallions. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the white wine and cook until almost evaporated. Add the peas and cook until heated through. Add the spinach and cook just until wilted. Stir in the butter and season with salt and pepper.

Bring the water to a boil. Add the potatoes. Reduce heat and cook until tender. Add the garlic and olive oil. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add the cabbage and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the salt and pepper to taste.

Dissolve 2 packages of yeast and 1/2 cup of sugar in 4 cups of warm water, and let stand for about 5 minutes. Then add 1/4 cup of vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons of salt and 10 cups of flour. Work with your hands until it becomes a nice ball of dough. Knead it until it becomes smooth and elastic. Let it rise for 30 minutes then roll it out to desired size and use toppings of choice. Bake at 350 for 10 - 15 minutes.
Puree all but the ice cubes in a blender until smooth. Pour into glasses, add ice cubes, and serve immediately.

Cook pasta in boiling water. Drain, but reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid. In a saucepan, melt the butter over low heat. Whisk in the flour until smooth. Slowly stir in the milk, whisking constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Turn heat to low and cook until the mixture thickens slightly. Add the reserved cooking liquid, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Stir in the macaroni. Spread in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Combine the breadcrumbs and paprika. Sprinkle over the pasta. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Top with the cheese. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until melted.

Marinate prawns with oil and seasonings for 30 minutes before grilling. Grill over medium heat for 4-5 minutes per side or until pink and cooked through. Serve with freshly cut lemon wedges and your favourite salad.

Place plums in a large pot and cover with water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer for about 20 minutes, or until plums are tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. Drain and reserve the poaching liquid. In a large sauce pan combine the drained plums, poaching liquid, honey and maple syrup. Bring to a boil and cook over high heat for about 8 minutes or until the plums are slightly softened and the mixture is reduced to about 2 cups. Remove from the heat and add the cinnamon stick and star anise. Cover and let sit for about 30 minutes for the flavors to meld. Discard the cinnamon and star anise and transfer the plums to a bowl. Add the balsamic vinegar and stir to combine.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a bowl, toss together the potatoes, 1 tablespoon canola oil, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Spread into a shallow roasting pan. Bake 15 minutes or until tender. Top with sour cream and blue cheese crumbles. Garnish with chives.
I love the idea of the blue cheese in the baked potato!
I can't wait to try the blue cheese potato. It looks good!
I have made potatoes with blue cheese before (and I love them) but have never used bleu cheese in a salad. I will definitely have to try that!
I love this! I'm a blue cheese fanatic!
My favorite potato recipe is one that is simple... I mash the potato with lots of milk, sour cream, butter and seasonings... then spread some more seasonings on top... yum!
I am not a big fan of blue cheese but the salad does look good!
I love blue che

Cream butter and brown sugar until light and creamy. Add condensed milk. Sift dry ingredients together. Mix with wet ingredients and add coconut, sesame seeds and rolled oats to form dough. Roll into balls and place 3cm apart on lightly greased trays. Bake 150 deg celcius for 15 minutes. Allow to cool on trays before storing in an airtight container.
recipe no: 557 recipe

In a frying pan melt the butter. Add the mushrooms and season with the salt, pepper, and nutmeg to taste. Saute for about 10 minutes or until the mushrooms are soft and the liquid has evaporated. Mash the mushrooms with a fork or potato masher. Combine the flour and the milk to make a smooth batter. Add the egg yolks one at a time to the batter, beating well after each addition. Add the cheese, stirring until well incorporated. Heat the frying pan on medium heat and melt about 2 tbsp of butter. Add about 2 tbsp of batter to the pan for each pancake. When the tops are lightly browned on the bottom, turn the pancakes over and brown the other side. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve immediately.
Mix all together and pour into pie crust. Refrigerate and serve with whipped topping.

Cook bacon til crisp. Reserve bacon drippings. Cut up veal schnitzels into thin strips. Dredge strips in seasoned flour, then drain excess flour off the meat by tapping gently against wax paper or a brown paper bag. Heat bacon drippings or vegetable oil over medium-high heat until hot. Brown meat strips until lightly golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Add onion soup mix or mix to taste and water to desired consistency, stirring constantly until gravy forms. Add apricot nectar and worcestershire to taste. Stir in mushrooms. Serve over hot cooked rice. Garnish with crisp bacon strips and parsley or green onions, if desired.

Combine all ingredients in a medium-sized saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Boil 1 minute. Pour into an ice bath. Strain and let cool to room temperature. Serve at room temperature or refrigerate and serve cold.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the leeks into 2-inch lengths. Cut the asparagus into 2-inch lengths. In a medium bowl, combine the leeks, asparagus, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the mixture onto a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with the balsamic vinegar. Serve hot or cold.

In a large bowl combine the sugar, eggs and oil until well blended. Beat in vanilla and mashed bananas. Combine the flour, cocoa, soda and saltstir well. Add to creamed mixturestir just until blended. Spread batter into a greased 10-in. springform pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour 10 minutes or until wooden pick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Drizzle with chocolate topping. In a small saucepan bring the 1 cup water to a boil. Remove from the heatstir in chocolate until melted. Cool slightly before drizzling over warm bread. Makes 1 loaf.

In a large skillet cook mushrooms in oil over medium heat until they are soft. Then add zucchini and cook until soft. Add anchovy paste. Cook 2 minutes. Then add tomatoes. Cook 3 more minutes. Add the chickpeas and spring onion. Stir together. Cook for another minute. Take off heat and add parmesan cheese and fresh parsley. Then add cooked bow tie pasta to mixture. Mix together and serve warm.

Slice squash lengthwise and then into 1/2 inch wide strips. Cut red pepper into strips as well. Slice onions into 1/4 inch thick strips. Lightly sprinkle both vegetables with salt to draw out water. Put into large pot with enough water to cover bottom of pot. Cover pot tightly and simmer for 35 minutes or until very soft. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Remove from heat. Add eggs, flour, white pepper and salt to vegetables. Combine thoroughly and then add to 9 inch square pan that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until top is browned nicely. In a medium size bowl mix together melted butter, crushed Ritz crackers, milk and parsley flakes. Spread over top of casserole and bake for 5 more minutes or until top is crunchy. Serve warm.
Place chicken in a large pot. Add the carrots, leeks, cold water, salt, and ground pepper. Cook over medium heat until done. Remove from heat. Serve warm or cold.

Sift flour, baking powder and salt together. In another bowl, cream the sugar and applesauce together until smooth. Beat in the peppermint extract and water. Add the dry ingredients slowly and beat well. Chill at least 1 hour or overnight. Roll to 1/4-inch thickness and cut with shaped cookie cutters. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 7-8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In a large mixing bowl, mix dry ingredients together. In a small bowl, combine applesauce, banana and honey. Add to dry mixture. Stir in milk. Spoon batter into a muffin pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Yields 12 muffins.
Prepare the quail eggs according to the package directions. Mix the quail eggs with the mayonnaise, dill and salt & pepper to taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving time.

Cook haricots verts in boiling water until crisp-tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Place in bowl. Add olive oil and shallot. Toss well. Add black pepper and salt. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Toss again and serve.

In a small bowl combine the crabmeat, green onions and paprika. In a medium bowl combine the cream cheese and milk until smooth. Add the crabmeat mixture and the worcestershire sauce and mix thoroughly. Spread in a 11x7x2 inch baking dish and top with paprika and parsley if desired. Bake at 375 for 20-25 minutes. Serve hot with crackers, bread cubes or vegetables.

Slice sweet potatoes thinly with a mandoline or by hand. (I slice mine thinly by hand.) Heat oven to 400F. Place potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil then sprinkle with breadcrumbs, basil, garlic cloves, and a few grinds of black pepper. Bake 25 to 35 minutes until tender. Mix basil butter ingredients in a small bowl. Serve potatoes with butter on top.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Gradually stir in the milk. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in the chicken broth and cook for 2 minutes longer or until thickened. Remove from the heatstir in the sour cream, 1/2 the chives, the chicken broth powder, salt, pepper, and 1/2 the cheese. Spread half the mashed potato mixture in a 13x9 baking dish. Spoon the chicken mixture over the potato mixture. Top with the remaining mashed potato mixture and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake at 350 f for 20-25 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with the remaining chives.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl except the parsley. Gently toss to combine. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Line 15x10x1 inch jelly roll pan with waxed paper and spray with cooking spray. Melt chocolate in medium saucepan over low heat. Add butterscotch chips and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and add cerealmix until all cereal is coated with chocolate mixture. Add peanuts and mix wellset aside to cool slightly. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto prepared baking sheetrefrigerate until firm. Store in airtight container.
This site is for fun and informational use only and should not be used as a replacement for advice from your doctor or health care provider.
In skillet, brown chops in hot oil. Add orange juice. Heat to boiling. Add honey. Stir in cornstarch. Add mustard. Cook 10-15 minutes or until chops are tender.

In double boiler over hot water heat 1/2 cup of milk and 1 1/2 cups of shredded cheese. Combine with 1/4 cup tomato sauce, 1/4 cup butter, 1 tsp. Salt and 1/8 tsp. Pepper and heat through. Place frankfurters into fondue for dipping.

Cook bacon in a large pot over medium heat until crisp, drain on paper towels and set aside. Cook potatoes and onion in hot bacon fat, stirring occasionally until tender. Stir in half-and-half and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes or until potatoes are very soft. Slowly whisk in flour, stirring constantly and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add milk, cheddar cheese and green onions. Heat through. Serve with a sprinkle of bacon bits and garnish with green onions.

In a saucepan combine the first four ingredients. Bring to a boil. Remove from the stove and stir in the Kahlua. Pour into a large mug and top with whipped cream. Garnish with a drizzle of Kahlua and a sprinkle of chocolate shavings.

Dissolve the sea salt in the water. Add all the other spices. Rub the mixture all over the roast. Place in a roasting pan. Cover tightly with foil and roast for 30 minutes per lb. of roast at 350 degrees. When done remove the roast from the pan. Let it rest for 10 minutes. Cut into 1 inch thick slices. Serve on the french baguette slices with the garlic mayonnaise. For the garlic mayonnaise: mix together 2 cups mayonnaise, 2 cloves of garlic, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon capers and 1 teaspoon of cayenne.
pork is so good. i like it all ways.
i love the recipes! especially the one for the roast lamb! i'm so trying that one!
I would love to try all of the recipes!
I'm all over this book!
I'm trying to think of a way to get my husband to try some of these recipes.
Those recipes sound delicious!

Brown sausage in medium-sized skillet over medium heat, stirring constantly to crumble sausage into small pieces. Add butterstir until melted and mixture resembles fine crumbs. Stir in flourcook 1 minute or until mixture is lightly browned, stirring constantly. Gradually add milkbring to boilingboil 1 minute or until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heatstir in salt and pepperserve over hot biscuit.

Place cream cheese in a small bowl. Beat until smooth. Stir in ranch mix. Spread on rye cocktail bread. Top with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with sour cream and dill weed. Serve.
name: cucumber saladingredients: english cucumber, sour cream, mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, onion, dill weed, celery seedpreparation:Peel cucumbers. Cut in half lengthwise. Slice each half into 1/4 inch thick slices. Combine sour cream, mayonnaise and vinegar. Mix well. Stir in dill weed and celery seed. Add onion. Refrigerate at least 2 hours.
name: cucumber salsaingredients: cucumbers, tomatoes, jalapeno peppers, red onion, lime juice, salt, cilantropreparation:Slice the cucumbers into rounds. Cut tomatoes into quarters. Finely chop the peppers. Thinly slice

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, cream cheese, 3/4 cup sugar, and vanilla. Add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. In another bowl, combine the flour and baking powderstir into the creamed mixture just until blended. Fold in the fruit cocktail. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from ovencool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or cold.
Mix first 4 ingredients with electric mixer until blendedshape into a ball and cover with remaining 1/4 cup of pecansroll in pecan halves and refrigerate until ready to serve with crackers.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut crushed garlic for 1-2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce. Add salt, pepper, and basil. Cook pasta according to directions. Drain and toss with sauce. Sprinkle on parmesan cheese.

Dip each fish fillet in beaten egg to coat. Combine bacon, gruyere and seasoningsspread evenly over fillets. Roll up fish like a jelly roll. Secure ends of roll with toothpicks and place in baking dish. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Meanwhile cook bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. Reserve 1 tablespoon bacon drippingsdiscard rest of grease. Add bacon to reserved drippingscook over medium heat until brown, stirring constantly. Add wine and lemon juicecook 1 minute. Blend egg yolks and 1 tablespoon water until smoothstir into bacon mixture. Cook over medium heat until thickened and bubblydo not boil. Stir in asparagus and cayennecook until heated through. Spoon over fish rollsserve immediately.

Cut cake into cubes and place in serving dish. Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until light and fluffyadd milk and vanilla and mix well. Spread over cake. Top with cherry filling and cool whip. Refrigerate overnight to set.

Preheat broiler. Combine brown sugar, mustard and ginger in a small bowl until well blended. Rub evenly over both sides of salmon fillets. Position on a broiler pan and broil about 5 inches from the heat about 6 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Sift together 1 cup flour and 1 cup powdered sugar. Add 1 cup shredded coconut and 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon salt. Stir until combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto wax paper-lined cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes. Cool on the sheet for 1 minute. Remove and let cool on wire racks.

In a blender combine the tomatillos, the chiles and the garlic clove. With the machine running gradually add 1/2 cup of water. Blend until smooth. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook stirring constantly until the onions are translucent and have taken up most of the oil about 5 minutes. Add the potatoes and saute stirring frequently until the potatoes are cooked through about 10 minutes. Remove the potato mixture from the pan and set aside. Season the pork with salt and pepper. Heat the remaining oil in the skillet over medium heat. Add the pork chops and brown them on both sides about 5 minutes. Add the potato mixture and the water stirring constantly until the mixture thickens and the liquid has evaporated about 5 minutes. Add the blender mixture and the potatoes. Cook until the potato mixture has thickened and the sauce has coated the pork about 5 minutes. Serve the pork with the sauce and garnish with fresh cilantro.

Cream shortening and add brown sugar until light in color. Beat until smooth. Add peanut butter, beating well. Blend in well beaten egg. Sift dry ingredients together and add to peanut butter mixture, stirring only to moisten. Shape into small balls on waxed paper. Place on greased cookie sheet at least 2 inches apart. Bake in 375 degree oven for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown around edges. Yield 50-60 cookies.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until onion is translucent. Add in broth and rice. Stir until rice is evenly coated. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in rosemary. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

Remove skin and pit from each peachcut into small pieces. In blender or food processor, combine all the above ingredients. Blend until smooth and pour into a serving dish. Garnish with mint sprigs. Chill in refrigerator. Serve with vanilla wafers.
Dissolve jello in boiling water. Cool. Add crushed pineapple with the liquid. Add pie filling and cool whip. Chill.
Combine lime juice, oil, pepper, and garlic in a large bowl. Add cucumbertoss to coat. Add tomatoestoss. Add strawberries. Toss to combine. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Boil water with 1 cup of salt. Peel and core the pineapples and slice. Add the slices to the boiling water and simmer for 2 minutes. Drain and rinse the fruit with cold water. Mix the oil with the crushed ginger and chili and spread over the fruit. Pour the boiling salt water over the fruit. Leave to cool. When cool, drain the fruit and marinate with the rest of the ingredients. Serve at room temperature.

Place jalapeno, garlic, lime juice and fish sauce in a bowl or jar and stir to combine. Add half of the cucumbers and let stand for 20 minutes. Stir in the remaining cucumbers, red onion and mint. Add a pinch of salt if using plain water in step 1add peanuts. Toss to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning with more lime juice or fish sauce if needed.

In a small bowl, combine the marmalade, bourbon, honey, garlic and chipotle. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large pan or baking dish. Season the chops with salt and pepper. Add the garlic to the hot pan and cook until fragrant and starting to brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the orange juice and marmalade mixture and stir to combinebring the mixture to a boil and cook until reduced by about half and thickened slightly, about 4 minutes. Place the chops in the pan and bake for 20 minutes. Turn the oven down to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Pour the glaze over the top of the chops and bake until the meat is no longer pink at the center and the glaze is thickened, about another 20 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes and broccoli if desired.

Cut chicken breasts into bite size pieces. Cut sausage into bite size pieces. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add chicken and sausage. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until the chicken is browned. Drain. Add broccoli florets. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the stewed tomatoes. Add 1/2 of the water. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Check to make sure that the chicken is cooked through. Add the rest of the water. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes more or until the broccoli is tender. Remove from heat. Serve over cooked rice.

In a small bowl stir together oil and cayenne and cumin. Place tuna steaks in bowl with spices. Turn to coat well. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add a few drops of oil to the pan and lay tuna steaks down. Sear for about 1 minute and turn. Sear other side for about 1 minute. Remove from pan and let cool for a few minutes. Cut into strips. Lay out tortillas on a plate and top with avocado, tuna and cilantro. Drizzle with lime juice. Serve with salsa.

Sift together all dry ingredients in a large bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in egg with a fork until dough comes together. Add beer and stir until blended. Spread into a greased 8 by 4 by 2-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on rack 10 minutes then remove from pan to cool completely. Wrap tightly and store at room temperature.

Fill a cocktail shaker half way with ice cubes. Pour in all of the ingredients. Shake until frost appears on outside of shaker. Serve in a cocktail glass rimmed with salt. Garnish with lime wedge.
name: fuzzy navel drinkingredients: peach schnapps, orange juice, grenadine syruppreparation:Pour peach schnapps into a cocktail glass. Slowly pour orange juice over schnapps. Add grenadine syrup to fill glass. Serve immediately. Garnish with a slice of orange or lemon.

Mix all the dry ingredients and add 1/2 cup water. Mix together until a dough is formed. Add additional water if needed. Form into 1 inch balls and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 30 minutes. While meatballs are cooking, place mashed potatoes in a bowl and add 1/4 cup cream of mushroom soup. Mix together well. Place in a greased baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until potatoes are heated through and browned. Remove from oven and stir in 1/4 cup cream of chicken soup and 2 tablespoons butter. Stir to combine. Top the potatoes with the cooked meatballs and cover with the mushroom mixture. Return to oven and bake 15 minutes longer or until heated through and golden brown on top. Serves 4.

In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, sugar and cinnamon. Set aside. In a 3-quart slow cooker, combine the cooking spray with the sweet potatoes. In a small bowl, combine the pecans and coconut. Sprinkle with the butter and mix well. Sprinkle with the brown sugar mixture and mix well. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours or until the potatoes are tender. Serve with additional topping if desired.

Clean and trim morels, keeping them whole. In large skillet over moderate heat, saute morels in butter until tender and brown. Blend flour with 2 tbsp. waterstir into morels and cook 1 minute. Add remaining water and celery saltheat to boiling and simmer 1 minute longer. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately over broiled lamb chops or steaks.
Place meat in the crockpot and add all the other ingredients. Cook on low for 7-8 hours. When done the meat should easily pull away from the bone. Serve with your favorite bbq sauce.

Place 2 cups of popped corn in a large mixing bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of butter and the dried chives and lime zest and toss to coat the corn evenly. In a small bowl mix together the ground cumin, chili powder and the salt and pepper. Pour the cumin mixture into the corn and toss to coat. Sprinkle with the jack cheese and toss lightly to coat with the jack cheese. Store in an air tight container or cover with foil or wax paper until ready to eat.

Combine the chocolate chips and the vegetable oil in a large bowl. Microwave on 50% power for 30 seconds. Stir well. Continue cooking for 30 seconds at a time until the mixture is completely smooth and melted. Stir in the marshmallows. Add the almonds. Pour into an 8×8 inch baking pan. Refrigerate until hardened. Cut into bars.

Beat eggs in bowl. Add milk, all-purpose flour, butter, white sugar, buttermilk, light corn syrup, baking soda, vanilla extract. Bake in greased 8-inch square pan at 375 for 20-25 minutes or until center is set. Cool slightly and cut into squares. Serve warm with buttermilk sauce.

Cut biscuits in half. Place sugar, cinnamon and oil in shallow dish. Dip biscuits halfway in sugar mixture, place on cookie sheet or waxed paper. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until light brown. Makes about 60.

Heat the oil in a deep frying pan or wide saucepan, add the onion and green pepper and cook gently for 5 minutes until soft. Add the rice and cook for a further 2 minutes. Pour in the stock, a ladle at a time, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon to prevent any lumps forming. As the rice begins to soften and absorb the stock, add the soy sauce and sweetcorn. When the rice is almost ready, add the green beans and cashew nuts. When the rice is cooked, season with freshly ground black pepper. Serve straight away.

Preheat oven to 350f. Drain artichokes and combine with yogurt and 1/2 cup of the Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. Season with salt and pepper and toss well. Pour into an ovenproof baking dish and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbly and lightly golden on top. Garnish with basil and serve warm with slices of french bread.

Place edamame in colander to drain. In a serving bowl, combine edamame, green onions, nori, rice wine vinegar, olive oil and sea salt to taste. Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate. Sprinkle with nanami togarashi before serving.

Bring wine and berries to boil in saucepan. Reduce heat to low and cook about 10 minutes. Stir occasionally until berries are tender. Strain mixture into serving bowls. Add sour cream to each and chill.

Heat milk and condensed milk to boil on the stove and boil for 3 minutes, take off and add eggs, stir well and leave to cool down a bit. Put some dough in a glass and sprinkle some sugar on it and put a slice of apple on it and sprinkle some more sugar on it and put some more dough on it and put another slice of apple on it and so on till you have used all your dough and all your apples. Bake it for about 20 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit and serve with some whipped cream on top

Butter a 10-inch skillet or saute pan. Melt 4 tablespoons of the butter in the pan over medium heat. Add the onions, shallots, and garlic clovesaute until the onions are soft and translucent. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Whisk in the wine to deglaze the pan, then add the beef stock. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook until slightly reduced, about 10 minutes. Add the bacon, then add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and stir to combine. Add the pepper, then crack in the eggs, being careful not to break them up too much. Cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. Serve immediately over slices of toasted bread.

Cook sausages in skillet until lightly browned on all sides, about 8 minutes. Remove sausages from skilletset aside. In same skillet, cook onion in butter over medium-high heat until onion is golden brown and tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in garliccook 1 minute longer. Stir in tomatoes and all other ingredients in skilletbring to boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer gently 1 hour, uncovered. Stir occasionally to prevent mixture from sticking to skillet. Remove cooked sausages from skilletstir into stew mixture just before serving. Makes 6 servings (2 quarts).

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Butter a baking dish. In a large saucepan over medium heat, cook the potatoes and salted water until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, cook bacon and onions until brown. Sprinkle half of the bacon and onions in the bottom of the baking dish. Place half of the potatoes in a layer over the bacon and onions. Top evenly with half of the swiss cheese and half of the cream. Repeat layering. Sprinkle the remaining bacon and onions evenly over the top and bake until the cheese is golden brown and the potatoes are bubbly, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top. Return to oven and bake until the cheese is golden brown, about 5 minutes more. Yields 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl stir together muffin mix, bread crumbs, buttermilk, 2 tbsp. of cilantro, garlic powder, and onion powder. Season with 1/4 teaspoon of each of the spices and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Combine well. Dip each chicken piece in mixture coating well. Place in a 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Spray with cooking spray. Bake uncovered for 1 hour 15 minutes or until juice of chicken is clear. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon of each of spices. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Garnish with remaining 1/4 cup of cilantro.

Heat the sunflower oil in a large ovenproof frying pan. Season the chicken pieces with the dried herbs. Brown the chicken in the pan over a medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side until cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat. Whisk together the crme fraiche, dijon mustard and coarse grain mustard. Pour over the chicken. Bake in the oven for 8-10 minutes. Serve sprinkled with extra herbs. Serves 2.

Put butter, castor sugar, eggs and self raising flour in a bowl and beat until smooth. Add the milk and beat again until smooth. Add the juice and zest of 2 lemons. Pour into 4 serving dishes or ramekins and sprinkle with the white chocolate chips. Pour the boiling water over the top so it comes half way up the dishes. Leave for 15 minutes then turn out onto serving plates.

Mix together the two types of flour, the wheat germ and the yeast. Stir in the milk. Turn out onto a floured board, and knead until the dough is smooth and elastic. Divide the dough into three equal pieces. Roll each piece into a long sausage shape. Cut each into six pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Put each ball into a greased muffin tin. Cover with a clean cloth or plastic bag. Leave for about 15 minutes. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C / 400°F for 40 minutes.

Slice tempeh into 1/2 inch strips and place in a medium bowl. Add olive oil, red bell pepper, red onion, thyme, salt and pepper to taste. Mix well and heat in a medium nonstick pan over medium heat until browned. Add the chopped swiss chard and stir until wilted. Serve on a whole wheat pita with mustard, sour cream and lettuce or on a slice of whole wheat toast with ketchup.

In a large saucepan combine merlot, honey, pure vanilla extract, and the dried fruit. Simmer over medium heat, covered for about 30 minutes. Uncover and cook about 10 minutes or until the liquid is reduced to a syrup consistency. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Spoon into dessert bowls. Top with non-fat vanilla frozen yogurt and a sprinkle of ground cinnamon. Serve immediately.

Cook bacon in large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Cook corn in boiling water 1 minutedrain. Heat butter in large skillet over medium heatstir in red bell pepper, green pepper, and onion. Cook 5 minutes or until tender-crispstir in corn. Heat half-and-half cream in small saucepan over low heat until hot but not boilingstir in cream cheese until blended. Stir into vegetablescook 2 minutes or until cheese is melted, stirring constantly. Sprinkle with baconstir until well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. If desired, sprinkle with sugar.

Brown sausage and ham in a large skillet. Add onions and saute. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Add parsley. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Add potatoes. Simmer for 30 minutes. Remove and drain. Add more water if needed. Stir in salt and pepper and simmer until tender.

In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, apple juice, vegetable oil, soy sauce, and ground ginger. Rub this mixture over both sides of the pork chops. Let sit at room temperature for 15 minutes. Heat a grill pan or grill over medium-high heat. Cook the chops until browned and cooked through. In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water. Add the mixture to the pan juices from the grilled chops. Stir until the liquid thickens. Remove from heat. Add the salt and pepper. Drizzle over the pork chops. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).In a large bowl, combine all of the vegetables and mayonnaise and toss to mix well. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, ginger, and pepper. Add the mixture to the vegetables and toss well. Transfer vegetable mixture to a 9x13 inch baking pan and bake at 400 degrees F for 30 minutes. Serve warm with a drizzle of ginger-lime dressing and some cilantro for garnish.

Cook pasta according to package directions until al dentedrain & return to pot. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd onions & garlic & cook 5-10 minutes until softened. Add tomatoes & cook until most liquid has evaporatedremove from heat & let cool slightly. Stir in oregano & season to taste with salt & pepper. Pour tomato mixture over cooked pasta & stir to combinetransfer to a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over top & bake 20 minutes until heated through & cheese has melted.
I want a book on cooking that I can actually use... I like this one!
I love your pasta dishes! I can't wait for my daughter to get home from college so I can make some for her!
I'm a big fan of pasta and love your recipes! I'm going to try them out.
I love all your recipes, but I've gotten some really great ideas from your blog. I love your blog!
Great recipes! I'm going to

Boil the macaroni till its tender and drain. In a separate pan melt the butter and mix the flour with it. Add the milk slowly and stir. Season with a bit of salt and pepper. Add the grated cheese and mix well. Pour the mixture on the macaroni and mix well. Top with some bread crumbs and place in a greased baking dish. Bake in the oven at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook cauliflower until tender. Drain and set aside. In a medium bowl combine soup and mayonaise. In a shallow bowl combine the cheddar and the breadcrumbs. Dip the florets into the soup mixture and then roll them in the breadcrumb mixture. Place the florets on a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees F. for 20-30 minutes until lightly browned. In a small bowl melt the butter. Add the curry powder and stir until blended. Drizzle the sauce over the florets. Makes 4 servings.

Combine rice, water, butter and salt in a large microwave casserole. Cook on high for 5 minutes. Remove cover and stir well. Cook on medium for another 15 minutes. Remove cover and fluff well with fork. Let stand for two to three minutes. Serve.

Bring the water to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the sugar, ginger and lemon peel. Let stand for 20 minutes. Remove the solids. Pour the liquid through a strainer into cups or a teapot. Place the tea bags in the liquid and let steep for 5 minutes. Stir in the lemon slice. Serve hot or cold.
name: iced green tea with gingeringredients: water, fresh ginger, green tea leaves, sugar, lemon juice, ice, lemon balm leavespreparation:Measure water into a saucepan, add ginger and bring to boil. Add tea leaves. Brew 1-3 minutes. Add sugar and lemon juice, strain tea. Allow to cool and add ice. Garnish with lemon balm leaves.
name: mint julep sweet teaingredients: fresh mint leaves, lemon, sugar, tea, bourbon, ice, mint sprigpreparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a 2 quart pitcher. Press mint leaves against sides of pitcher with back of spoon

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Place thighs in a glass baking dish. Brush mustards over top. Sprinkle with marjoram. Bake in the preheated oven until done to your liking (about 40 minutes). Serve hot.

Mix together flour and lard, and sprinkle with red paprika and caraway seeds. Mix with hands to form crumbs. Add a little bit of cold water to the flour and knead into dough. Roll out into thin dough and cut into 2″ squares (or rectangles). Cook in boiling broth for 10-15 minutes until dough is soft and tender. Remove from broth with slotted spoon and place in a bowl to cool a bit. Add egg white beaten with a little milk to the broth and bring to a boil again. Cook for 2-3 minutes longer. Add the dough and cook 2 more minutes. Serve in deep bowls with a bit of bread on top.

In a large saut pan over medium heat, warm 2 tablespoons of olive oil with half of the sage leaves until the sage crisps up, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, sprinkle the calf's liver with 1 teaspoon of kosher salt. Lay each slice of liver flat across the palm of your hand, then fold in half lengthwise twice, creating a package about 1/2-inch thick. Transfer the calf's liver packages to the pan with the sage leaves and cook until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Transfer the liver packages to a plate, cover them with foil, then set them aside while you make the sauce. Increase heat to medium-high, then add the remaining sage leaves to the saut pan. When they begin to crisp up, add half of the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and half of the remaining sage leaves along with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of kosher salt. Cook until the sage leaves have crisped up, about 2 minutes longer. Add the vinegar and cook until reduced by half

In a large bowl combine 3/4 cup olive oil and 1 tablespoon rosemary. Place dough in the bowl and turn to coat. Cover and set aside at room temperature 30 minutes or until dough doubles in volume. Punch dough down. Divide dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 5-inch round. Press cornmeal into a pie dish or pizza pan. Place 4 rounds into pan. Spread 3/4 cup mozzarella cheese over dough. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons chopped green onion over each. Top each pizza with 2 tablespoons sliced olives and 1/3 cup feta cheese. Bake at 400 degrees F. until crust is brown and cheese is melted, 12-15 minutes. Turn pizzas over. Top each pizza with 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms. Bake 8-10 minutes more. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons oil and 1 teaspoon rosemary. Brush pizz

Heat butter and saut the flour until it's lightly browned. Add the broth and stir until it's smooth and bubbly. Then add the milk and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add the salt and pepper to taste.

Dissolve sugar in 1/2 cup of the milk and heat on stove until dissolved and bubbly. Add the butter and continue to heat until butter melts and mixture is smooth and bubbly. Cool to room temperature. Put 1/2 of the milk mixture and 1 cup of the boysenberries in blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Repeat with the remaining 1/2 of the mixture and berries. Put graham crackers in the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish. Pour 1/2 of the boysenberry mixture over the crackers and spread evenly. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the miniature marshmallows. Repeat with the remaining crackers, boysenberries and marshmallows. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes. Cool and garnish with nutmeats and lemon juice to taste and whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Line a baking pan with foil. In a large bowl combine kale, olive oil, garlic, sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Add kale to a single layer on the lined baking pan. Bake in preheated oven until crisp, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Stir in the flour and cook over low heat until golden. Gradually stir in the milk. Bring to a boil and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the horseradish, sour cream, sugar and mustard. Cook 1 minute longer. Stir in the vinegar, salt and pepper and heat through. Place the chicken in a shallow baking pan and pour the sauce over it. Bake 350 until the juices run clear. Serve over rice or noodles.
Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Heat butter over medium heat. Add carrots. Saute until crisp-tender. Remove from heat. Stir in sage, salt and pepper. Toss with noodles.

In a small bowl combine butter and brown sugar until blended. Add rum, stirring until blended. In a large pot combine apples, apple cider, cloves and spices. Simmer, covered for 10 minutes. Stir butter mixture into apples. Heat through. Serve warm.

Prepare cake mix according to directions. Press into an 8x8x2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15-20 minutes. Cool. Meanwhile beat powdered sugar and lemon juice. Spread over cooled cake. Sprinkle with nuts. Chill. Cut into bars. Makes 12 bars.

Scrub baking potatoes well and pierce a few times with a fork. Cook in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender and easily pierced with a knife, about 30 minutes. Drain potatoes and place in a large bowl. Mash potatoes with a fork until fluffy. Add all remaining ingredients and mix well. Transfer potatoes to a baking sheet and bake in a 375 degrees F oven until crisp and golden, about 20 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a large mixing bowl combine applesauce, nonfat milk, flour, sugar, baking powder, vanilla extract and cinnamon. In a small bowl combine water and egg whites. Stir into applesauce mixture. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the apples, sugar and lemon juice. Add to the applesauce mixture. Pour into a 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes.
I've been meaning to post this recipe for a while. It is a family favorite and always makes a great breakfast. I hope you enjoy it as much as we do.
Mix together and pour into a 9x13 dish. Bake at 350 for about 35 minutes.
We like it to be a little crunchy on top so we usually take it out about 5 minutes early.
I made this today and my husband said it was the best he's ever had. Thanks for sharing this recipe!
I made this for breakfast this morning. It

Place butter in a heavy skillet and saute the onion and garlic until soft. Add chicken and brown on both sides. Remove from pan and keep warm. In the same pan add the salsa verde. Bring to a boil. Add the broth and tomato. Bring to a boil again. Return the chicken to the pan and heat through. Garnish with fresh tomato and cilantro or parsley.

Combine mayonnaise, dressing mix, and milk in a small bowlstir well. Place chicken in a shallow dish. Combine bread crumbs, pepper, paprika, and parsley in a second shallow dishmix well. Dip chicken into the mayonnaise mixturecoat with bread crumb mixture. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400° for 25 minutes. Serve with additional dressing on the side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a skillet saute the chicken in butter until no longer pink. Add the soup and stir in the sour cream. Remove from heat. Place the chicken into a 1 1/2 qt. baking dish. In a small bowl combine the panko, butter and margarine. Sprinkle over the top of the chicken. Bake uncovered for 30-35 minutes.
I have to try this recipe for my family. Thanks for sharing!
Thank you for the recipe! I love sour cream!
Thanks for this recipe! Sour cream is my favorite food.
Thank you for the recipe. I can't wait to try this recipe out.
I love sour cream. This sounds so good. I will have to make this one. Thanks for the recipe.
I love this recipe. I am definitely going to try it.
This sounds so delicious! I love the idea.
I am going to make this tonight. We love sour cream and the way you have combined the flavors in

Heat stock to boiling. Add shallotscook over low heat for 3 minutes. Stir in carrot. Covercook 5 minutes. Add garlic powder, ground cumin, margarine. Cook 5 minutes longer. Add couscouscover. Cook 5 minutes. Stir. Serve immediately. Garnish with chopped parsley.

Combine butter, sugars, vanilla and eggs well. Mix together dry ingredients and combine with the butter mixture. Chill dough for several hours or overnight. Chop nuts if desired and add to the dough before chilling. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool for 2 minutes on cookie sheet before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Combine the olive oil, orange juice, Dijon mustard, ginger, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and black pepper in a shallow dish. Marinate the fish in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight. Preheat the broiler or prepare a medium-hot fire in a charcoal or gas grill. Grill the salmon for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork or until desired doneness is reached. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix 3 tbsp. of pumpkin with 3 tbsp. of evaporated milk. Mix in 2 eggs. Add 1 tsp. of vanilla. Pour batter into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle 1/3 cup of pumpkin pie spice over batter. Sprinkle 1/2 cup of pecans over batter. Bake for 50 minutes. Cool. Spread frosting over cooled cake. Spread 1/3 cup of Cool Whip over frosting. Garnish with chopped pecans if desired.
Combine espresso, raspberry syrup and milk in a large mug. Top with the hot cocoa powder and the whipped cream. Garnish with cocoa.

Cut eggplants into 1/2" slices, then into 1" cubes. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a wok over high heat until very hot. Add the ground pork and stir-fry until it is no longer pink and the liquid has evaporated, about 4 minutes. Stir in the soy sauce and vinegar, and cook until the sauce is slightly thickened and the pork is browned, 1 to 2 minutes more. Add the sugar and continue to stir-fry until the sugar is dissolved. Add the garlic, ginger, and hot red peppers and stir-fry until the garlic is golden, about 1 minute more. Add the eggplant and stir-fry until the eggplant is tender and well coated with the sauce, about 5 minutes. Stir in the sesame oil. Serve at once.

Melt butter in a large pot or dutch oven. Add onion and garlic cloves. Cook and stir until tender. Add broth and potatoes and cook until tender. Cut the breasts into chunks. Add to potatoes. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the tomatoes and fresh basil. Heat through.
Cut cheese into 1-inch cubes. Place in a bowl. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over cheese and toss. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Heat a barbecue grill to high or preheat broiler. Mix the onion and garlic in a small bowl. Combine the next seven ingredients in a second small bowl. Thread prawns onto skewers.
