Brush with half of the onion mixture, then brush with half of the spice mixture. Repeat with the remaining onion mixture and spice mixture. Place skewers on the grill or under the broiler. Cook for 3-4 minutes, turning once and brushing with the marinades. Serve with rice.
name: prawns with spicy coconut curryingredients: coconut milk, shrimp, tamarind concentrate, lemongrass, chili peppers, garlic, cumin seeds, bay leaf, fish sauce, olive oil, peanuts, lime leaves, curry leaves, cilantro, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, coriander seeds, garam masala powder, cinnamon sticks, cumin seedspreparation:Peel and finely chop the shallots and garlic and

Combine dry mix with eggs. Add corn & sour cream. Add enough water to make a batter-like consistency. Pour batter into a 1 qt casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour at 350f. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 12 servings.

Place pork roast in bottom of crockpot. Add 2 cups water. Add 2 Tablespoons barbecue sauce. Cook on low for 6 hours. Remove pork roast from crockpot. Shred with two forks. Put meat back into crockpot. Add 2 cups water. Add 1/4 cup brown sugar. Add 1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice. Add 1/2 chopped onion. Cook for 1 hour. Serve on hamburger buns.

Cover bottom of 13 x 9 inch baking pan with 1 can tomato sauce. In small skillet, cook sausagestir in peppers, onion, olives and mushrooms until cookedstir in 1/2 can tomato sauce. Spread over sauce in pan. Top with 2 cups cheese. Top with remaining 1 cup tomato saucetop with 1/2 can biscuits. Bake at 350 for 35 to 40 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown.

Brown meat with garlic powder, and seasonings. Drain fat. Add tomato sauce, water, rice. Stir. Cover. Simmer until all liquid is absorbed. Add carrots. Simmer for a few more minutes. Remove from power. Top with cheese.
I had some leftover chicken from dinner the night before. I was in the mood for chicken soup so I decided to make a simple chicken noodle soup.
1. Cook noodles according to package directionsdrain.
2. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, sauté onions in olive oil until tender.
3. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add noodles.
4. Add cooked chicken, seasonings.
5. Simmer for about 5 minutes or until heated through.
1. Cook noodles according to package directionsdrain.2. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, sauté onions in olive oil until tender.3. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low.

In large bowl combine flour, allspice, baking soda, butter, egg, vanilla, cinnamon. Roll into 1-inch balls. Roll balls in walnut pieces and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until bottoms are lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheets immediately. Place on wax paper.

In a 9-inch round glass baking dish, place 6 challah slices with the cut side facing up. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and ice cream. Pour the egg mixture over the challah slices. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 4 to 6 hours. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Heat the butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Place a challah slice in the skillet and cook for 3 minutes or until the edges begin to brown. Flip and cook for 1 1/2 minutes. Remove the challah from the skillet and sprinkle with the cinnamon. In the same skillet, repeat with the remaining challah slices. Serve the challah with the banana syrup.

Melt butter in a small saucepan. Stir in flour, add milk. Heat to a boil while whisking constantly. Stir in mustard, salt and pepper. Cook until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in chives. Serve warm or refrigerate leftovers.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cool water. In a large bowl toss together the remaining ingredients. Add the tortellini and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine cream cheese and avocado until smooth. Spread avocado mixture on one side of each chicken breast. Top each breast with a piece of bacon and a piece of cheese and place in a baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until bacon is crisp. Sprinkle each breast with green onion and serve with a dollop of sour cream and a few diced green chilies.
I love green chilis on my pizza!
I'm going to make the baby food chicken tomorrow!

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain wellset aside. In a skillet brown the ham and green pepperdrain well. In a bowl combine all ingredients except the noodles and breadcrumbsmix well. Spread half the noodles on the bottom of an ungreased 11x7-in. baking dish. Top with half of the meat mixturetop with remaining noodles. Spread with remaining meat mixture. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbsdot with margarine. Bake uncovered at 375 F for 30 minutes or until bubbly.
Fill each of six small dessert bowls with a scant half cup of yogurt. Top with equal amounts of fresh fruit and granola. Garnish with mint leaves and serve immediately.
Mix mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, carrot and broccoli in a large bowl. Mix in cheddar cheese. Sprinkle in bacon. Stir in onions. Add water chestnuts. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours.

Mix together the pudding mix and water. Add the spices and mix well. Add the pumpkin and mix well. Spoon into the prepared crust and spread evenly. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Cool and refrigerate for several hours. To make the topping, combine the egg whites and cream of tartar and beat until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in the sugar. Beat until stiff peaks form. Spoon over the set custard. Refrigerate until serving. Serves 8 to 10.

Remove all the meat from the bones and cut into small pieces. Soak the ginger in the water for 10 minutes. Pound the meat in a mortar or food processor to make it very fine. Season the meat with fish sauce, sugar and salt. Place the meat and the tomatoes in a bowl and toss. Steam the meat and tomatoes in a steamer for 20 minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray muffin pan with pam. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Fold in berries. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on a wire rack.
name: chocolate and banana cream pieingredients: vanilla wafer cookies, 1 pkg. banana cream pie filling (jello) and 1 pkg. chocolate pudding mix (jello), 1 1/2 cups whipped topping (cool whip)preparation:In a large bowl combine 2 pkg. vanilla wafers crushed to fine crumbs and 1/2 cup margarine. Press mixture onto bottom and sides of a 9 in. pie plate. Set aside. In a large bowl beat 1 pkg. of chocolate pudding mix and 3 cups of milk until smooth. Add 1 pkg. of
Combine all ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth. Spoon into 8-oz glass jar with tight-fitting lid. Cover and refrigerate 2 weeks before serving.
Toss mozzarella with avocado and basil. Spoon onto plates. Arrange tomatoes and avocado on top. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with black pepper.
Mix all the ingredients together. Place chickens in the mixture. Cover. Cook on low for 4-6 hours.

Open crescent doughs. Spread 1/2 cup of softened cream cheese on each crescent roll. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon sugar. Fold each crescent roll over to close and form triangle shape. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool slightly before eating. Serve with whipped topping if desired.

In a bowl combine carrot, gingerroot, sesame seeds and honeytoss well. In another bowl combine soy sauce and orange juiceadd honey and gingerroot. Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heatadd oil and swirl to coat pan. Add carrot mixture and cook 1 minute or until browned lightly on one side. Stir in soy mixture and cook 1 minute or until heated through. Serve sprinkled with sesame seeds.

Cook brown rice in 10 cups water until tender. Reserve 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Peel and cube the sweet potato. Blend the cooked rice and 1 cup cooking liquid in a food processor until smooth. Blend in the sweet potato and olive oil until smooth. Add the flour. Process until smooth. Lightly oil 2 baking sheets. Spoon the batter in 1/4 cup portions onto the baking sheets. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the patties are firm and lightly browned.
Spread pizza sauce over crust. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over crust. Top with chicken pieces and add the tomatoes and herbs. Drizzle with olive oil and bake according to crust directions.
Dissolve powdered drink mix in cold water. Add ice cube, frozen strawberries. Stir. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.

Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a skillet. Saute onion until softened. Add garlic, stir 1 minute. Add green beans and cook for 5 minutes. Add sherry and worcestershire. Cook 2 minutes. Add butter. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over mushrooms.

In a saucepan over medium heat combine olive oil and garlic. Cook until garlic is golden. Add artichoke hearts and cook for 5 minutes. Add broth and tomatoes. Season to taste. Simmer until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in olives and basil. Serve over hot linguine. Sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano.
Fresh Linguine with Pesto Recipe has a rating of 5.0 stars based on 4 reviews.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In 9" x 13" baking pan combine stuffing mix and 1/2 cup water and mix well. Bake for 10 minutes until heated through and lightly browned. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly. Lay bread on top of stuffing and spread evenly with turkey gravy. Top with cooked turkey breast slices and bake another 10 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350. In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heatadd rice and stir until grains are well coated and begin to turn translucent. Add chicken broth, 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. In a small bowl, stir together 1/4 cup of the chicken broth, 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of the zeststir into the rice mixture until combined. Remove from heatlet stand 5 minutesstir again. Stir in the heavy cream, remaining lemon juice and zestseason with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Transfer rice mixture to a greased 3-quart baking dishsprinkle evenly with parsley. Bake until top is golden and crust forms around edges of pan, 15-20 minutes. Ser

Peel banana peppers. Cut tops off. Remove seeds. Mix soft goats cheese, pork sausage, and 1/2 of the basil leaves. Stuff each pepper. Sprinkle with remaining basil. Top with mozzarella cheese. Broil about 5 inches from heat for 1 minute. Serve with pita bread.

Preheat oven to 450f. Peel the new potatoes, then slice into wedges. Heat the oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Saute the rosemary, oregano and parsley for about 1 minute. Turn off the heat and stir in the mustard. Toss the potato wedges with the herb mixture and spread them out over a baking sheet. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes until the potatoes are golden brown.
Mix together the cream cheese, mayonnaise, green chilies, jalapenos & parmesan cheese. Refrigerate until ready to use. Serve with tortilla chips.

Brown the ground beef with the onion in a large skillet or in a large crockpot insert over medium heat. Stir in the sugar and cook until it is brown and caramelized. Stir in the pasta sauce with mushrooms. Add the ravioli, 1/2 the mozzarella cheese and 1/2 the parmesan cheese to the meat mixture. Stir to combine. Transfer the meat mixture to a 6 qt crockpot with a lid. Lay a layer of pasta sauce on the bottom of the crockpot. Arrange half the ravioli on top of the sauce in a single layer, then pour half the meat mixture over the top of the ravioli in an even layer. Lay a layer of pasta sauce on the top of the meat mixture in an even layer, then pour the remaining meat mixture over the top of the sauce in an even layer. Arrange the remaining ravioli on top of the meat mixture in an even layer. Cover the crockpot with the lid. Cook on low for 5 hours or until the pasta is tender. Top with the remaining mozz

Sift together rice flour, ground almonds and sugar. Beat egg white until soft peaks form and add to sifted mixture with honey and extract. Chop blanched almonds and add to mixture. Roll into balls and dip in melted chocolate or icing of choice.

Prepare cake mix according to box directions. Pour into greased and floured tube pan. Bake according to box directions. Cool completely. Beat together sour cream and pudding mix. Fold in beaten eggs and spread over cake. Sprinkle with nuts and top with pineapple. Chill before serving.

Prepare the first three ingredients in a blender. Fill each glass with 4 cups of crushed ice. Pour in the blended coffee mixture and stir. Top with a dollop of whipped topping and a dash of caramel topping.

In a large bowl, mix together flour, brown sugar, butter, maple syrup, eggs and vanilla until a dough forms. Spread half the dough into a greased 8-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with nuts. Spread remaining dough over nuts. Bake in a preheated 350f degree oven for 30 minutes or until firm. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pan. Stir in butter and cheese. Toss to coat. Season to taste with pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Wash beetroots, trim tops then cut into 2cm slices. Scatter into a baking tin with the cumin seeds and lemon juice. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until beets are tender. Mash the beetroot with the oil, salt and pepper. Add the sugar if using. Serve warm or cold as a dip with bread or vegetable sticks.

In a non-stick skillet, pour in some cooking spray or oil. Pour in the eggs. Sprinkle with some jalapeno. Add some salsa to taste. Then add the monterey jack cheese. Add the pepperoni. Cook for a few minutes until the cheese is melted. Cut into wedges when cooled.
name: pizza omeletingredients: eggs, onions, bell peppers, mushrooms, tomatoes, provolone cheese, salt, pepperpreparation:Cook onions and bell peppers in skillet with a little olive oil. Add tomatoes and mushrooms and cook for 1 minute more. Beat in 2 beaten eggs. Top with provolone cheese. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes until top is golden. Cut into wedges to serve.
name: southwest scrambled eggsingredients: eggs, salsa, cumin, onions, bell peppers, mushrooms, tomatoespreparation:In a medium bowl add 2 beaten eggs to a bowl along with 1 tsp c

Combine chips and condensed milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until melted. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice and zest. Stir in nuts. Pour into a prepared 9x13 pan. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into 1-inch squares.
I made this today and it was so simple and so yummy! My 3 year old and I made it together and it was a great activity. I would like to try it with white chocolate next time.
I've been making this recipe for years. It's my all time favorite!
Made this for the first time today and I loved it. Very simple recipe and really tasty!
I've been making this recipe for years and it never fails to please. I love it with white chocolate. I just made it again this morning and it's gone already.
Made this for my daughters school Valentines Day party. It was so good I made it again for my husbands co-workers. They all loved it.
I made this for my daughters school Valentines Day party. It was so good

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy. Beat in oil and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and almond extracts. Beat in grape-nuts cereal and mix well. In a separate bowl, combine flour and baking powderstir into egg mixture. Turn out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead gently 2 times. Divide dough into 2 equal pieces. Roll each piece into an 8 x 12 inch rectangle. Cut into 4 1/2 x 3 1/2 inch rectangles. Transfer cookies to prepared baking sheets. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Turn cookies over onto prepared baking sheetsbake for 10 minutes longer. Remove from oven and let cool completely on baking sheets on wire racks. Transfer cookies to wire rackslet cool completely.

Preheat oven to 450f. Line jelly-roll pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. Cut the squash in half lengthwise. Discard seeds. Place on prepared pan. Rub with butter and sprinkle with brown sugar and spices. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile combine remaining sugar, syrup and rind. Bring to boil and boil until mixture reaches desired consistency. Spread over the squash and bake for 10-15 minutes more. Serve hot.

Boil chicken breasts in water to cover. Add garlic salt and pepper. Boil for 20-25 minutes. Remove chicken, and chop into chunks. Saute bacon in skillet. Add chicken. Saute for 2 minutes. Add veggies. Saute for 2 minutes. Add vinegar. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with hot rice.

In a large skillet, brown beef and onions. Drain off grease. Add soup, milk and sauce. Stir. Add peppers and continue cooking for 15 minutes. Spoon mixture into a 13x9 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Unmold from pan and place in baking dish. Sprinkle with more cheese. Bake for 5 more minutes. Top with toppings of your choice. Serve with warm tortillas.

Cook potatoes until tender in salted water. Drain, mash, and set aside. In saucepan, combine milk, heavy cream, onion and seasonings. Bring to boiling point over med-hi heat, stirring constantly. Stir in frozen peas. Reduce heat to med-low. Cook until heated through, stirring occasionally. Blend in mashed potatoes. Mash again until smooth. Serve with parsley sprigs.

Heat oven to 350F. In 8x8 glass dish, arrange carrots. In small bowl mix cream, stock cubes and hot watermelt in microwave. Stir in bay leaf and salt/pepper. Pour evenly over the carrots. Bake uncovered until heated through, about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Melt butter and add 1/2 tsp each of the salt and sugar to the melted butter. Stir until the mixture is smooth and slightly thickened (like a thin gravy). Remove from heat and let cool for a bit. Cook the green beans and diced onion in a bit of water until tender crisp (I cook them until they are really crisp and then drain them and then mix them back with the water and the other veggies). Drain and add to the butter mixture and stir to combine. Add the sour cream and mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes or until bubbly around the edges. Sprinkle the top with fried onions and bake for another 5-10 minutes until the onions are nice and toasty. Serve with cheddar cheese (I use the shredded kind).

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Mix together Weet-Bix, flour, sugar, baking powder and coconut. Cut butter into the mixture using a knife or pastry blender until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into a 10-inch (25-cm) springform pan or other 10-inch (25-cm) square pan and bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Meanwhile make the filling. Beat together butter, condensed milk and golden syrup until smooth. Spread filling over base and bake for a further 15 minutes or until filling is set and slightly browned. Leave to cool. Make the icing by beating the butter until it is soft. Add icing sugar 1 cup (250 g) at a time until the icing is the desired consistency. Spread over the base and sprinkle with coconut. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Cut into squares to serve. Serves 10-12.

Mix stuffing according to directions on package with boiling water. Add butter, stirring until mixture is crumbly. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a casserole dish with cooking spray or line with cooking spray paper. Place the chicken breasts in the dish. Spread the stuffing on top of the chicken. Sprinkle with paprika. In a small mixing bowl combine soup and milk. Stir until well mixed. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Cut the cauliflower into florets. Put the florets in a large bowl. Add the garlic cloves and capers. Pour the olive oil over the cauliflower. Use your fingers to toss the cauliflower to coat the florets evenly with the oil. Transfer the cauliflower to a baking sheet. Spread the florets in an even layer. Roast for 15 minutes. Toss the florets once. Roast for an additional 15 minutes. The florets should be crisp-tender. Sprinkle with the caper juice. Serve hot.

In a medium bowl combine the first 4 ingredients. Cut the pork into 1/2-inch pieces. Add the pork and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from the refrigerator 1 hour before grilling. Remove the pork from the marinade. Thread the pork onto 4 skewers. Grill 6-8 minutes on each side or until done. Serve warm.

Brown the pork chops in butter. Sprinkle with shake-n-bake seasoning. Pour the spaghetti sauce over the top of the meat. Place mozzarella cheese over the top of the meat. Bake at 350 degrees until the cheese is melted.

Dip each slice in flour. Heat olive oil. Cook meat for 4 minutes on each side until golden. Remove from pan. Cover with a little of the lemon juice. Arrange on a serving dish. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

Heat olive oil in pan. Saute coriander leaves and ginger for a minute. Add garlic and spring onions. Saute till lightly colored. Add green chilies and turmeric powder. Saute for 30 seconds. Add fish sauce. Cook for 1 minute. Take out and set aside.

Preheat the broiler. Cut each breast into 4 pieces. Place in a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil for 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove from the broiler. Meanwhile in a large bowl combine the spinach, radishes, ginger, and seeds. Add the chicken, toss to coat. In a small bowl combine the vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil and ginger. Toss the mixture with the dressing. Serve immediately.

Season the beef with salt and pepper. Place in the slow cooker. Layer the onion over the beef. Mix together the gravy mix with water to make a paste. Spread over the beef and cover with the lid. Cook on low 7-8 hours or until the beef is very tender. When beef is done remove from the slow cooker and shred with two forks. Pour the wine in the slow cooker. Add the ketchup and cook for another 15 minutes. Remove the lid. Add the dijon mustard and worcestershire sauce. Mix well. Add the garlic powder. Turn the slow cooker to high and cook for 20-30 minutes. Serve the beef over mashed potatoes or rice. Pour the wine mixture over the beef. Garnish with parsley.

Drain tuna and flake with a fork. Blend with sweet relish. Spread mixture on hoagie rolls. Sprinkle with cheese. Melt butter on top. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Sandwiches are the easiest and most convenient meal to eat on the go. The first sandwich was made in 1762 by John Montagu. He was the Fourth Earl of Sandwich. He was a member of the Royal Society and a great gambler. He was so busy playing cards that he didn't want to stop for dinner. So he asked his cook to put some meat between two slices of bread. He could eat while gambling. The first sandwich was made.
This is a fun game that the whole family can play together. Everyone in the family is given a sheet of paper. They are to make up their own sandwiches. They can use as many or as few ingredients as they want. They should write down what kind of bread they use and what kind of spread or meat they use. Everyone then gets to guess what the other person's

Boil potatoes. When done put in bowl and add the rest of the ingredients except the mayo and italian dressing. Mix well. Add the mayo and italian dressing to taste and stir. Chill. Add celery and hard boiled eggs when serving.

Rinse okra in cold water and pat dry. Cut pods in half lengthwise. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add all the spices and pepper. Stir for 20 seconds. Add the okra and saute until the pods are golden brown. Add the tomatoes, red bell pepper and stir for 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and stir for 1 minute. Add the green chili and stir for 1 minute. Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Whisk together flour, salt, soda, sugar, thymeset aside. In separate bowl whisk together eggs, juice, and melted butteradd to flour mixture and whisk until smooth. Heat griddle to 400 degreesbrush griddle lightly with oilpour 1/4-cupfuls of batter onto hot griddlebake until puffedturn and bake until done. Serve immediately with butter, syrup, or jam.

Place a package of gelatin into a saucepan filled with 1/2 cup of water. Cook this over low heat until the gelatin is dissolved. Add the condensed and evaporated milk and allow to cool to room temperature. In another bowl add the fruit cocktail and crushed cookies. When the mixture is cooled, pour it into a container and chill until firm. Slice into cubes and serve with whipped cream or crema.

Place 100g caster sugar in a pan with 100g golden syrup and 300g butter. Place on low heat and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat. Add 100ml milk and stir until well combined. Add 100ml natural yoghurt and stir well. Place in the fridge to cool slightly before serving in dishes or as a dip with fruit.
It is quite simple to make your own homemade butterscotch flavored candies or topping from scratch at home. The recipe is very easy to follow and it requires no special cooking skills or expertise to make it. In addition to making it at home, you can also find it in most supermarkets in the form of pre-made and pre-packaged candies or toppings that are made in bulk and then sold at stores or shops near you.
The best way to enjoy butterscotch flavor is to eat it while it is still hot and fresh out of the oven. It will give you a very nice sweet taste and will have an effect on your stomach and intestines that will make you feel

In a large bowl, combine sour cream, taco seasoning, green onion and cheese. Toss well to blend. Serve over iceberg or romaine lettuce leaves or in a large glass bowl. Top with tomatoes and serve immediately.

Toss all together just before serving. You can add the nasturtium petals just before you serve the salad.
Blog Title : Slow Cooker Mini Pot Roast
name: slow cooker mini pot roast
ingredients: onion, minced garlic, mushrooms, minced garlic, rosemary, thyme, chicken broth, potatoes, carrots
preparation: In slow cooker combine first 8 ingredients. Stir in potatoes and carrots. Covercook on low 6 to 7 hours or on high 4 to 5 hours. Serve over rice.
Blog Title : A Sweet Potato Story
name: sweet potato soup with smoked gouda
ingredients: butter, onion, garlic cloves, thyme sprigs, chopped fresh parsley, sweet potatoes, broth chicken, bay leaves, cream, smoked gouda cheese
preparation: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onionsaute 5 minutes. Add garlic, thyme

In medium saucepan over medium heat, saut vegetable oil. Stir in green bell pepper and onion. Cook until soft. Stir in barbecue sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until hot. Serve in hot dog buns.
I don’t think I’ve ever had Sloppy Joes before but I’ve always been curious about them. They seem to be really popular here. I’m not sure if I’m ready to try them yet though. I don’t know what the texture is like.
Sloppy Joe’s is one of my all-time favorite sandwiches. I love it with all the fixings.
I love sloppy Joes! I’ll have to try the sweet version!

Preheat oven to 375. In a small bowl combine spices, garlic and sausage. Arrange the breasts in an ovenproof skillet. Brush with spray. Sprinkle sausage mixture on top. Bake for 20 minutes. Add peppers and tomatoes. Bake for about 40 minutes more or until sausage is browned and chicken is cooked through. Makes two servings.

Brown sausage. Put sausage and eggs in a large bowl. Mix well. Divide into 6 equal parts. Press each portion into a biscuit cup, about 1/2 inch deep. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with syrup or jam if desired.

In a shallow bowl or pie plate combine 1/4 cup of cane syrup with 3 TBSP of the creole seasoning. Place the meat in the mixture and turn to coat well. Cover and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Heat the vegetable oil and butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. When the butter is melted add the meat. Brown the meat on all sides then set aside. In the same pan combine the remaining 1/4 cup of cane syrup with the wine. Cook over high heat until thickened and reduced by 1/3. Add the remaining 1 TBSP of the creole seasoning and the black pepper. Return the meat to the pan and turn to coat with the sauce. Simmer over low heat for about 2 minutes. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine potatoes, butter, corn flake crumbs and paprikamix well. Spread potato mixture in a shallow 1-1/2-quart baking dish. Bake uncovered 45 minutes or until golden brown and tender when pierced with a fork. Sprinkle with additional paprika before serving if desired.

Boil the cabbage for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from water and set aside to cool. Cook the ground meat until no longer pink. Drain any excess fat from the meat. Set aside to cool. Combine the soy sauce, ground meat, cabbage, carrots, onions, and garlic together. Add the bean sprouts. Set aside to marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Take a lumpia skin and place a spoonful of the meat mixture in the middle of the skin. Fold the sides of the skin over the meat mixture. Fry in the oil until golden brown. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon and add pimiento and water. Cook until pimiento is softened. Break up bacon and add back in with bacon drippings left in skillet. Stir in corn and cook until tender. Add green pepper, salt and pepper. Cook until pepper is tender. Break in egg and cook until done. Stir in butter and serve.

Mix steak sauce with lemon juice. Add mayonnaise. Chop olives. Mix with steak sauce mixture. Stir in feta cheese. Form the beef into patties. Cook to your liking. Spread the toasted pitas with steak sauce mixture. Layer with beef, olives, tomatoes and lettuce. Serves 4.

Dissolve raspberry jelatin in boiling wateradd frozen raspberriesstir until well dissolvedadd pineapplestir until well blendedchill until firmmix cream cheese and sour creamspread on top of cooled dessertchill until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 F. In a small bowl, beat the butter until fluffy. Add the sugar and beat until fluffy. Add the lemon zest and the vanilla and mix well. In a bowl of a food processor, combine the flour and salt. Pulse until combined. Add the butter mixture and process until it resembles a coarse meal. Add the egg and process until the dough is smooth. Divide the dough in half. Press half of the dough into a 9-inch-by-13-inch rectangle. Fold the rectangle into thirds and press down. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour. Repeat with the remaining dough. Heat the oven to 350 F. Place a 10-inch square baking dish in the freezer for 10 minutes. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into a 12-inch square. Transfer the dough to the baking dish. Bake the dough until it is golden brown. Let it cool for 5 minutes.

Cook bologna as desired. Lightly butter and toast hamburger bun. Spread green pepper and onion with margarine. Spread top of hamburger bun with mustard. Place cooked bologna and cheese on bottom of sandwich. Place top of hamburger bun on sandwich. Serve as desired.

Bring water to boil in a saucepan. Add onion, carrot and celerycook until tender. Add noodles and cook until tender. Add cabbage leaves and tomato juicecook until tender. Add tomatoescook until tender. Add noodle soup mixturecook until thickened.

Mix together the pomegranate juice and water in a shallow bowl or baking pan large enough to hold all of the racks of lamb in a single layer. Add the rosemary, garlic and shallot. Add the salt and pepper and mix well to blend. Add the lamb and turn to coat all sides in the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or preferably overnight, turning once or twice to coat all sides of each rack of lamb evenly in the marinade. To cook the racks of lamb, remove them from the marinade and pat them dry. Preheat a barbecue grill to medium high heat (400 F to 450 F). Place the lamb racks on the grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side for medium rare or until well browned and the internal temperature is 140 F for medium or until well browned and the internal temperature is 160 F for medium well or until well browned and the internal temperature is 170 F for well done. Turn once or twice during cooking to evenly brown

Combine first 5 ingredients in a pitchercover and chill 1 hour or until ready to serve. Fill 6 glasses with ice. Pour sangria over icegarnish each glass with a slice of orange or lime if desired. Serves 6.
name: summer sangria 2 ww pointsingredients: dry red wine, orange juice, pineapple tidbits, apple, sugar, fresh lime juice, club sodapreparation:Combine the wine, orange juice, pineapple, apple, sugar and lime juice in a large pitcher. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Refrigerate at least 2 hours, up to overnight. Just before serving, stir in the club soda. Pour sangria into 6 ice-filled glasses, being sure to include some fruit.
name: sangria 3 ww pointsingredients: dry red wine, apple juice, grapefruit, orange, lemon, pear, applepreparation:Pour the wine, apple juice, and grapefruit pieces in a large pitcher. Mix well, cover and re
Slice roll horizontally and fill with turkey and barbecue sauce. Top with jalapeno slices and sweet relish. I use mustard instead of mayonnaise.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine water and artificial sweetener. Stirring constantly until dissolved. Add ginger and continue stirring until dissolved. In another pan over medium heat add milk. Add cocoa and whisk together until smooth. Add ginger water mixture and whisk until smooth. Add sea salt and pure vanilla extract. Continue whisking until smooth. Pour into cups and top with ginger candies.

Bring water to a rolling boil, then remove from heat. Stir together boiling water and powdered gelatin in a mixing bowl. Stir constantly until gelatin is completely dissolved. Stir in cold water and alcohol. Pour mixture into, individual shot-size plastic or paper cups. To make the jello easier to consume, buy plastic cups that also have lids. Pour the mix into the cup, add the lid, then turn it upside down prior to refrigeration. Place shots on a tray in refrigerator. Chill until firm. Refrigerate until served.

Cut the lamb leg into 1 inch cubes and place in a baking dish. Add potatoes and carrots and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add onion and feta cubes and top with 2 tablespoons of kefalotiri. Cover and bake for 1 hour at 350f, until meat is tender and vegetables are cooked through. Serve hot or warm. Garnish with celery leaves and lemon wedges.
In a skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Stir in ham. Pour in eggs until done. Sprinkle cheese and worcestershire over top. Garnish with parsley.
In a medium bowl combine the honey and the soymilk. Add the rest of the ingredients, one at a time. Form into 1 inch balls. Refrigerate until firm. Unwrap and serve. Makes 24.

In a large bowl combine the oats, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt. Add the almonds and toss to coat. In a small bowl combine the oil and honey and mix well. Pour the liquid mixture over the oat mixture and stir to coat evenly. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet and bake for 30-35 minutes until lightly browned and crisp, stirring every 10 minutes. Cool completely and store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

Cut rolls in half. Place in ungreased baking dish. Spread chili over rolls. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes. Serve warm.
These look yummy! Thanks for sharing.
I like to use the crock pot for lots of things. My favorite recipe is Chicken and dumplings. I add diced green pepper and celery to the dumplings.
I'm not familiar with the dish you're talking about but I'd love to try it.
I have been making these in my crockpot for years. I have some in there right now. I like to add diced peppers and celery to the dumplings too.

Slice chiles lengthwise, place in shallow dish or roaster pan. Cover with evaporated milk. Place in preheated 350 degree oven 30 minutes or until soft. Cool slightly. In skillet, brown ground beef, onion, salt and pepper. In large bowl, combine beef mixture, chiles, milk, flour, eggs and cheeses. Pour in greased 13 x 9 inch pan or casserole dish. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven 45 minutes.

Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat, add onions and cook until soft, stirring frequently to avoid browning. Add sugar to taste, a splash of water if necessary. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add wine vinegar and stir well, then add wine and grenadine and stir again. Cook over low heat until mixture thickens to a marmalade consistency. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm with meat or fish.
Onions are among the earliest cultivated vegetablesthey were known to the ancient Babylonians as early as 3000 B.C. and were used as an emblem of power by Egyptian pharaohs. The Greeks and Romans used them as offerings to Apollo, god of the sun, and Hera, queen of the gods. In 1772 a French botanist discovered that the bulb was an immature onion plantup until that time most onions grown were leaf (scallion) onions. Today, over 100 varieties are grown, most of which are sweet bulb onionspungent green and yellow onion types

Bring orange juice concentrate to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add soy sauce, sugar, ginger, garlic and sesame oil. Bring mixture to a boil. Add the chicken pieces. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 30 minutes. Add chili flakes. Serve with rice. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Garnish with orange zest.
Combine all the ingredients in a small bowl. Let stand for at least 1 hour to let the flavors blend. Serve as a condiment for indian food.

In small bowl beat eggs with mozzarella, parsley, seasonings and water. Set aside. On lightly floured surface unroll pastry. Cut into 12 squares. Place one teaspoon of cheese mixture in center. Fold pastry over to form triangle and press edges together. Place on greased baking sheet. Brush with egg wash. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes. Drizzle with sesame seeds. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan combine the bacon with the water, sugar, and vinegar. Cook over medium-high heat until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the onions and cook for a couple of minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the onions and cook for a minute or two more. Add the green beans to the mixture and continue to cook over medium-high heat until the liquid has evaporated. Stir in the parsley

Combine the first three ingredients. Stir in the rest. Spread this mixture onto bread rounds. Top with the remaining bread rounds. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate over night. Slice into 1/2 inch slices and serve with crackers. Makes about 1 dozen.

In a blender or food processor, puree cantaloupe until smooth. Strain through a sieve into a bowl, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible. Add honey to taste. Stir in lemon yogurt and cream. Chill at least 2 hours before serving. Garnish with strawberry.

Heat the butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the blue cheese, lemon juice, thyme, paprika and salt and pepper to taste. Cook, stirring for 1 minute. Divide the mixture between the chicken breast halves, smoothing the top of the cheese mixture on the chicken to form a "crust." Sprinkle the top of the chicken with the paprika. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until no longer pink inside.

In a large pot combine milk, butter, pasta roni mix and water. Cook according to package directions. Stir in frozen vegetable mix. Cook for an additional 3-5 minutes. In a large bowl combine cooked pasta with vegetables and chicken. Sprinkle with dried basil. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.
name: cazuela chilean chicken stewingredients: chicken drumsticks, butternut squash, potatoes, corn on the cob, carrots, chicken broth, cooked rice, hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper, fresh cilantropreparation:In a large soup kettle or dutch oven, place chicken, squash, potatoes, corn, carrots and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until chicken is done and vegetables are tender. Serve over rice in a shallow soup bowl. Pass hot pepper sauce, salt, pepper and cilantro or parsley.
name: broccoli and
Combine beef, onion, tomato soup. Stir to combine. Add vegetables and cheese. Simmer for 1 hour or til potatoes are cooked.

Cut the steaks into 2-inch cubes and place in a zip-top plastic bag. Add the thyme leaves, paprika and 1/4 teaspoon of salt to the bag and gently toss to combine. Let the meat marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 6 hours. Remove the steaks from the bag and discard the thyme, paprika and salt. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the steaks and cook until browned and cooked to your desired doneness, 3 to 5 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer the steaks to a platter and let them rest for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Serve with potatoes and vegetables.

Heat the plum pudding in a microwave for 2-3 minutes and then place in the freezer for 15 minutes to cool the pudding slightly. Place the eggs in a large bowl and beat well with an electric whisk until light and fluffy. Add the caster sugar and beat for a further 5 minutes until light and fluffy. Pour the rum into a heatproof glass measure and carefully pour the hot plum pudding into the rum. When the plum pudding has cooled down slightly pour the mixture into the whipped egg mixture and beat well until the mixture is light and fluffy. Place the mixture into a lidded container and place in the freezer for at least 3 hours or until set but still soft enough to scoop with a spoon. Serve as you would any other ice cream with added toppings if desired. Serves 4-6 people.

Place warm popcorn in a large bowl and mist it with olive oil. Toss gently and mist again. Repeat until all kernels are lightly coated with oil. Combine remaining ingredients in a zippered plastic bag. Seal bag and shake until well mixed. Drop in popcorn, a little at a time, seal bag, and shake and turn bag to coat. Continue to add a little amount of popcorn to the bag until all kernels are well coated. Store zippered bag. Shake gently again before serving.
Place all the ingredients into a large bowl. Mix together gently with a large fork. Cover and chill. This dish is best if made a day in advance.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets.Combine flour, baking soda, and saltset aside.Combine butter, sugar, and brown sugar in a large bowlbeat until smooth. Beat in egg and vanilla extract. Mix in yogurt until just combineddo not overmix. Stir in flour mixture until just combineddo not overmix.Stir in dried tart cherries until combined.Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto prepared baking sheets.Bake in preheated oven until edges are firm and centers are set, about 12 minutes.Cool completely on baking sheets before removing.Store covered at room temperature.

Beat eggs in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add cream and parmesan cheese and blend well. Add green onions and stir. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture and cook until just set. Gently stir in spinach and sun dried tomatoes. Remove from heat. Top with feta and sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine mushroom and cheddar cheese soup with milk and heat through. Set aside. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine soup and milk. Heat through. Drain green beans and combine with soup mixture in a 2-quart baking dish. Top with fried onions. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Serve immediately.
name: chicken and rice soupingredients: chicken broth, chicken breast, rice, celery, carrots, bay leaves, thyme, lemon juicepreparation:In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, saute the onion and celery until tender and the celery is translucent. Stir in the carrots and saute until slightly tender, about 2 minutes. Stir in the bay leaves and thyme and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pot and

Preheat grill. Cut vegetables into 1 inch strips. Place vegetables in a small bowl. Add teriyaki marinade. Toss to coat. Add the minced garlic. Set aside. Pound the chicken breasts to 1/2 inch thickness. Thread the chicken on skewers alternating with vegetables. Drizzle with remaining marinade. Grill on the preheated grill until the vegetables are cooked and the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes on each side. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl, combine all dry ingredients. In another bowl combine egg whites, banana, applesauce, and vanilla. Fold wet ingredients into dry ingredients. Pour into greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until tester comes out clean. Cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350f. Peel the eggplant and slice it into 1/4 inch slices. Salt the eggplant slices and place them in a colander for 1 hour. Rinse the salt off the eggplant and pat them dry. Mix the cheeses together and add the basil. Spread 1 tablespoon of the mixture onto each slice of eggplant. Roll the slices up and place them seam side down in a baking dish. Pour tomato sauce over the eggplant. Bake for 30 minutes. Cut into 1 inch slices and serve.

Cook rotini pasta according to package directions in a large saucepan. While pasta is cooking, cook the chicken breast in olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the chicken is no longer pink, about 3 minutes per side. Add garlic powder and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add frozen mixed vegetables and cook for another 3 minutes. Strain the pasta water, reserving 1/4 cup of the liquid. Drain the cooked pasta and put it back in the pan. Add the light cream cheese and light italian dressing to the pan with the cooked pasta. Stir until creamy. Add the cooked chicken to the pan and stir to combine. Add the reserved pasta water 1/4 cup at a time until you have the desired consistency. Add skim milk to thin it out if necessary. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm with your favorite salad or bread.
We’ve been experimenting with noodles in the freezer for a while now and I’ve got to say that we are really impressed with the results! You

Combine paprika, hot chili powder, lemon juice, garlic and ginger. Coat chicken breasts. In a heavy skillet over high heat brown on both sides. Lower heat to med and add water. Cover tightly. Cook until done. About 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Add butter to drippings and stir until melted. Add lemon juice and mix. Add the chicken back into the sauce. Serve with cooked rice.

Peel potato and cut into cubes. Cook cauliflower for 10 minutes, or until soft. Add potatoes to cauliflower for an additional 5 minutes, or until potato is fork-tender. Heat butter in a large saucepan over medium heat until butter melts. Add leeks, potato-cauliflower mixture, water, and season with 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes. Using an immersion blender, puree until smooth (or place in a regular blender until smooth). Add nutmeg and 1/2 cup of the parmesan cheesestir well to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Ladle into serving bowls and top with remaining 1/4 cup parmesan cheese and chives or parsley. Serves 4.
Melt sugar and syrup. Add peanut butter. Pour over cereal. Spread into pan. Chill.

Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beets and saute until soft and they have broken down. Add the sweet potatoes and saute until they have broken down. Add the bacon and stir to incorporate. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a medium-sized pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the lemon zest. Stir in the garlic cloves and cook for 1-2 minutes or until the garlic is aromatic. Add the lentils, the lemon juice, cilantro, salt and pepper to the pot. Add the stock to the pot. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium-low heat. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Remove from the heat. Remove the bay leaves. Stir in the lemon zest. Serve.

Mix margarine, cheese spread and mayonnaise together well. Stir in seasonings. Add the crab meat. Spread 2 tablespoons of mixture on each half of the muffin. Broil 6 inches from the heat 2-3 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet. Stir in the olive oil and saute the garlic and hot red-pepper flakes until the garlic is golden, about 1 minute. Stir in the dry white wine and simmer until the liquid is reduced by half, about 3 minutes. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons butter, the salt and the black pepper and cook until the sauce is thickened and the shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 1 minute more. Toss the pasta with the shrimp and sauce and garnish with parsley before serving.
In a blender container, combine lemonade and lemon. Blend at high speed for 10 seconds. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

Place breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add scrod and cook until golden brown on both sides, turning once. Combine juice of lemon with dried chives and pour over fillets in skillet. Cook for 1 minute more then serve garnished with fresh dill or chives.

Combine half-and-half, lemon juice and honey in saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Stir in cinnamon and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Peel and slice the apples. Combine apple slices and sauce. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Serve cold.

Slice tops off mushrooms and discard. Clean and drain mushrooms and set aside. In a saute pan over medium high heat melt butter and saute minced onions and clams until the clams open and onions are tender. Drain and discard excess water and set aside. Place mushroom caps on serving plate. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, mustard, and minced parsley and mix well. Spoon mixture into mushroom caps and top with green onions. Serve with crackers and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place the porcini in a bowl and cover with the hot water. Let stand until softened, about 15 minutes. Strain the porcini and discard the solids. Cut the potatoes into wedges. Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally until lightly browned all over. In a bowl, combine the oregano, porcini mushrooms, and their soaking liquid, the garlic and the pepper. Pour over the potatoes and toss to coat. Transfer the potatoes to a baking dish and bake for about 25 minutes, or until crisp and browned. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray an 8x8 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Put apples in baking dish. Mix together juice, topping, lemon juice, flour, sugar substitute, and cinnamon in a bowl until smoothpour over apples. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until topping is golden brown. Cool slightly, then serve with Cool Whip free.

Select very yellow-ripe plantains with some black spots visible. Cut ends off plantains & peel remaining shin off. It should peel almost like a banana. Slice diagonally in a slanted cut pattern about 1 inch or a little thicker. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Arrange slices in panadd spices to taste. Cook 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container up to a week.

Drain beans. Saut garlic and onion in oil until translucent. Add beans and frozen spinach. Season to taste. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add tomatoes. Serve over brown rice or pasta.
I have to tell you how much I love your blog.
I am so happy to have found your blog! I am going to make this dish tonight. I am a big fan of anything with pine nuts. I have made many of your recipes. I love them!
I just stumbled upon your blog and I love it. I'm going to try your recipes.
I have been looking for a recipe for sautéd spinach. I never knew it had so few ingredients. Thanks for the recipe!
I've been looking for a spinach saut recipe. I'm so glad I found this blog.
I love spinach and I love this recipe. Thank you for sharing it.
I made this recipe last night. I used spinach instead of broccoli. I loved it! My husband thought it was wonderful also.
I love your recipes. I made the saute

Mix together cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla. Add two eggs and mix well. Add milk and mix again. Spread over crust. Sprinkle with caramels and pecans. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes. Cool and refrigerate.

Prepare broccoli by cooking in boiling water until tender-crisp. Drain. Combine onion and broccoli in a saucepan. Add salt and pepper. Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Pour over broccoli mixture. Pour into a greased 9-inch glass pie pan and bake in a 400 degree oven for 20-25 minutes or until top is lightly browned and set. Cool and refrigerate.

Combine first four ingredients in a medium bowl. Beat with a mixer at medium speed until smooth. Cover and chill at least 3 hours. Shape mixture into a ball. Combine the beef and walnuts. Roll the cheese ball in the mixture. Let stand at room temp at least 30 minutes before serving.

Cut the avocados in half lengthwise, remove the pits, and scoop out the pulp into a bowl. Mash the pulp with the back of a spoon. Add the tuna fish, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste, then mix well. Spoon the mixture back into the shells and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat grill for medium heat. Brush oil over both sides of the salmon. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and dill. Press garlic onto both sides of the fish. Place the fish skin side down onto cedar plank. Grill for 5 minutes, turning once, or until fish flakes when tested with a fork. Garnish with lemon wedges if desired.

Combine shallot with Dijon mustard, vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl and whisk to blend. Gradually add the peanut oil in a slow stream, whisking constantly. Chill before serving. Use as a dressing for fresh lettuce, vegetables or potato salad. Makes 2/3 cup.

Sift together the flour, granulated sugar, salt, baking soda, cocoa powder. In small bowl combine the oil, vinegar and water. Beat with spoon until smooth. Add to dry mixture and beat until well blended. Spoon into paper lined muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 350F for 20-25 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to cooling rack. Frost with chocolate frosting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse spareribspat dry. Cut into 2-inch lengths. Dissolve salt and pepper in hot water. Rinse and drain sauerkraut. Pour over spareribslet stand for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine baking powder, flour, egg and milkmix well. Drain spareribsdip into batter. Brown in hot fat. Arrange in shallow pan. Add water to covercover tightly. Bake for 1 hour. Serve over hot potatoes.
This article is licensed under the GNU Free Documentation License. It uses material from the Wikipedia article "Sauerkraut". A list of authors is available in Wikipedia.

Place feta cheese in a bowl. In a jar with a tight fitting lid, add all the other ingredients and cap jar. Shake until well blended. Pour over the cheese and stir gently as not to break up cubes. Divide mixture between 2 half pint jars with lids. Store in the fridge for up to a week. To serve, let the cheese come to room temp for about 30 minutes. Serve with assorted crackers, chips or crisp breads. Makes 2 half pint jars. To serve as a spread, mash cheese with some of the marinade to desired thickness.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut acorn squash in half lengthwise. Remove seeds with a spoon. Pour brown sugar and bourbon into cavity of each half. Place halves cut side down into a greased 9x13 baking dish or a heavy 9x9 baking dish. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until soft when pierced with a fork. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with orange juice and bourbon. Serve immediately.

Spray microwave safe plate with cooking spray. Microwave english muffin half for one minute. Top with tomato slice. Add egg white. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with remaining english muffin half. Microwave one minute. Top with crumbled bacon and serve.
Brown ground beef with salt and pepper. Add onion and cook until tender. Add soup and noodles. Simmer until tender. Add cheese and bake 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve with crackers or toast.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Pat dry chicken breast. In small bowl, mix seasoning mix, garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Rub over both sides of chicken breasts. Place in shallow baking pan. Bake 20 minutes. Add potatoes and bay leaf. Cover with foil. Bake an additional 30 minutes. Remove bay leaf. If potatoes are not tender yet, bake 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with cooked rice or noodles.

Cook sausage until done. Crumble and set aside to cool. In a large mixing bowl, stir together all other ingredients. Add cooled sausage and mix well. Wet your hands and form mixture into 1-inch balls. Place on cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until brown and baked through.

Combine carrot with salt in a bowllet stand 30 minutes or more until very wet. Drain, discarding liquid. Add vinegar and oniontoss well. Let stand 5 minutestoss again. Stir in garlic and cayennetoss well. In another bowl, whisk together oil and coriander seedtoss with vegetables. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Mix together ginger, honey, red wine vinegar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, oil in a small bowl. Place chicken breast halves in a 13 by 9 inch glass baking dish. Pour the marinade over the chicken. Marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes. Place the chicken breast halves on the grill and grill for 3 minutes. Turn the chicken breast halves over and grill for an additional 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove the chicken breast halves from the grill. Serve the chicken breast halves warm with the mixed greens.

Peel and core the apples and slice them in half. Place the apples in the crock and add the sugar and water. Stir well to combine. Sprinkle the pumpkin pie spice over the apples and stir in. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Stir well and serve.

In saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Add frozen cornstir and bring to simmer. Add sugar and waterstir until mixed well and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add salt and stir well. Sprinkle with cornstarchstir well until thickened. Serve warm or cold.

Peel potatoes and cut into thin slices. Heat ghee in a pan. Add onions and fry till soft. Add potatoes and fry for about 5 minutes until potatoes are slightly brown. Beat the egg, season with salt and pepper, add the ground cumin and the beaten egg mixture to the potatoes in the pan. Stir gently until the potatoes are cooked through and the eggs are firm. Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and red chilies if desired. Serve hot with toast or bread.

In a small saucepan bring to boil the prunes, water, lemon rind and lemon juice. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add sugar and continue to cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Stir in the vanilla. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

Peel and slice tomatoes. Tear the basil leaves. Arrange tomato slices on plates. Toss basil with tomatoes and cheese. Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and sprinkle with pepper.

I would like to know that which is the best way to make my own vinaigrette?
The best way to make your own vinaigrette is to blend olive oil and vinegar together. This will produce the most consistent vinaigrette.

My daughter was trying to make her own vinaigrette and she could not get it right. So I searched online and I found this recipe. She tried it and it worked out great! It was so easy. Thanks for the
Mix together all ingredients in a jar. Stir before using. Serve over ice or in hot coffee for a fireside treat.

Beat eggs in large bowl. Stir in cheddar cheese and flour. Stir in frozen chopped broccoli. Form into 1-inch balls. Roll in breadcrumbs. Heat oil in medium skillet until hot. Fry broccoli balls until light brown. Drain on paper towel. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 450f degrees. In a mixing bowl combine the flour, oats, and sugar and blend well. Stir in the baking powder, salt and 1/3 cup of the milk and mix until the dough is just moistened. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board and knead gently until smooth. Pat the dough into a 7 by 8-inch rectangle. Sprinkle the surface with the remaining 2 tablespoons of milk and the frozen berries. Fold the rectangle lengthwise several times until the dough and berries are thoroughly mixed. Pat the dough into a 7-inch round and place it on a lightly greased baking sheet. Make a 3-inch incision in the center of the round from top to bottom, and fold the dough to form a pocket for the berries. Gently press the dough back together and brush with the egg and water mixture. Bake for 12 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the berries are plump. Serve warm from the pan or split with a fork and spread with jam or jel

In a large bowl beat together the egg, oatmeal, margarine and water. Add enough water to make the mixture moist. Stir well to mix. Put into an 8-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F until lightly browned on top. Cool slightly, cut into squares. Drizzle with honey. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 180c/160c fan/350f/gas mark 4. Cream the butter and white chocolate in a bowl until combined. Add the brown sugar, golden syrup and milk. Stir well and leave to cool slightly. Sift the plain and self-raising flours into a bowl. Whisk the egg lightly into the mixture then add the chocolate mixture and whisk until just combined. Pour into a 20cm/8in square baking tin or a 20cm/8in round cake tin. Bake in the oven for 45 minutes or until golden-brown. Remove from the oven and leave to cool for 20 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before serving.

Soak cod in cold water for 4 hours. Squeeze out excess water. In a heavy skillet, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil. Add onion. Saute until golden-brown. Add garlic. Saute until aromatic. Add fish. Saute until golden-brown. Add salt and pepper. Stir in parsley. Cover with water. Bring to boil. Lower heat. Cook until fish is just done. In a small bowl beat eggs with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Pour egg mixture over fish. Simmer until set. Serve with wedges of lemon.

Place in a large saucepan: water, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon sticks and cloves. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil and is clear and thickened. Remove from heat and stir in cider and raisins. Cool and serve warm or cold. Makes 1 quart sauce.

In a 9x13 baking dish combine soup, milk and soy sauce. Stir in onion powder and pepper. Arrange frozen cut green beans over top of mixture. Sprinkle mushrooms over mixture. In a bowl combine cranberries and almonds. Sprinkle over top of mixture and cover with foil. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Sprinkle with french-fried onions and serve immediately.

Combine oats and 2 cups blueberries. Pour into an 8×8 inch square pan. Combine egg whites and 2 teaspoons water. Beat at medium speed of electric mixer for 2 minutes. Gradually add cottage cheese and beat 1 minute. Beat in milk, flour and salt. Spread over oats. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Cool. Top with remaining blueberries. Makes 8 servings.
In a large pot over medium heat, add beef and saute until browned. Drain. Add the remaining ingredients. Simmer for 1 hour. Sprinkle with shredded cheese and serve with tortilla chips.

Mix the first 7 ingredients together. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 325 for 15 minutes or until firm but not browned. Cool 2 minutes. Place on cutting board. Cut each cookie into 4 pieces (or 3 or 6). Return to cookie sheet and bake 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned on bottoms. Cool on wire rack. Makes 3 dozen biscotti.
Mix everything together except the spring onions. Stuff the spring onions with the mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with crackers or bread.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine remaining ingredients. Stir in the pasta. Chill at least 1 hour before serving. Makes 4 servings.
Marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours. Drain shrimp and reserve marinade. Grill over medium heat for 3-4 minutes each side or until shrimp turn pink. Serve warm or cold with the remaining marinade.

Preheat oven to 220c/450f/gas mark 7. In a large bowl mix the tuna with the cream cheese. Stir in the corn kernels and 1/3 of the tasty cheese, spring onions and parsley. Season with black pepper to taste. Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured work surface. Cut out 4 10cm/4in circles to line the bottom of each tart tin. Prick the base with a fork and line with a square of baking parchment. Fill the tart cases with the tuna mixture, then cover with the remaining pastry circles. Prick the top of each tart with a fork. Beat the milk into the egg yolk with a fork or whisk until smooth. Brush over the pastry cases, then sprinkle with the remaining tasty cheese. Bake the tarts for 15-20 minutes until puffed up and golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before serving.
Mix together pasta and eggs and seasonings until well mixed. Form into muffin cups and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until done.

Preheat oven to 450. Line cookie sheet with aluminum foil. Wash and dry turkey. Rub inside of turkey with garlic and sprinkle with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Add olive oil and water to pan. Place turkey in pan. Cover pan with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from pan. Let stand for 10 minutes.

Mix all ingredients except for bread and milk in bowl. Place mixture in greased loaf pan or in loaf pan lined with waxed paper. Mix breadcrumbs with milk to form a paste. Spread over top of meat mixture to form a crust. Bake 1 hour 45 minutes to 2 hours or until meatloaf is cooked through and topping is golden brown. Let cool slightly before serving. Serve with potato salad or green salad.
Peel and pit avocados. Mash with a fork to desired consistency. Mix in cilantro, onion, jalapeno and tomato. Add salt and lime juice to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Pound duck breasts flat to 1/4" thickness. Cover with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator for 1 hour. Drain spinach leaves of excess liquid. Chop finely. Mash lean ground chicken with sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, and tarragon until smooth. Spread 1/3 of the mixture on each duck breast. Roll up each duck breast and secure with skewers or toothpicks. Dust all sides of the duck breasts with flour. In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil until very hot. Add duck breasts to pan. Cook until golden brown on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer duck to plate. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to pan. Add spinach to pan and saute for 2 to 3 minutes or until wilted. Serve duck over spinach. Garnish with prosciutto slices.

Place the rims of the four martini glasses in the chocolate and turn to coat the rims. Chill the glasses. Combine the vodka, chocolate liqueur and ice in a shaker and shake vigorously for 15 seconds. Strain the mixture into the prepared glasses and garnish with the chocolate shavings. Serve immediately.
Champagne is the wine that made me fall in love with wine. I am not alone in this experience. Champagne is the wine that people love to drink on special occasions and that also happens to be the wine that the wine world loves to hate (or at least to talk about hating). Champagne is the most famous wine in the world, yet it is not even made everywhere that it is consumed. It is the most expensive wine that most people will ever drink, and yet it is also the most widely available wine in the world. It is also one of the most misunderstood wines in the world.
I first tasted Champagne when I was 21 years old and I was immediately smitten with the sparkling wine from the land of France. I was hooked and I have been

Cook spinach in boiling water for 4 minutes, then plunge into ice water to stop cooking. Rinse spinach in cold water. Shake excess water off spinach. Mix with green onions, bacon, lemon juice, white vinegar, sugar, salt. Serve as a side dish or as a main course.
Mix dry ingredients and set aside. Coat each fish fillet with cornmeal mixture and saute in hot butter in large skillet until lightly browned on both sides. Makes 4 servings.

Combine cabbage, ginger root, and 1 1/2 cups of water in a large saucepan. Cover, bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Combine flour, ghee and 1/4 cup of water in a small bowl. Knead until smooth. Divide in half. Roll each half into a 6-inch round. Combine remaining 1/2 cup water and tomatoes in a small bowl. Heat a heavy skillet over medium heat. Place one of the rounds in the center of the skillet. Spread 1/3 cup tomato mixture evenly over the dough. Top with 1/2 of the cabbage mixture. Brush the edges of the dough with water. Cover and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Remove cover and cook for an additional minute or until the sides are cooked. Remove from the heat. Place remaining cabbage mixture over the dough. Top with remaining round. Cook uncovered for 1 minute. Brush the edges of the dough with water. Fold the paratha in half. Remove from the heat.

In a blender, puree watermelon and watermelon juice until smooth. Strain through a sieve into a bowl. Discard seeds and pulp. Add the lemon and ginger juices and puree until combined. Stir in the sugar and mint extract. Serve over ice and garnish with mint sprig and slice of lemon. This recipe serves four but can easily be doubled.

In a medium sauce pan, cook the barley in the broth for 25 minutes. Stir in the veggies for the last 5 minutes of cooking time. In a small bowl combine the yogurt, mayo, dill weed and seasonings. Serve the yogurt dressing on the side with the toasted barley. Serve topped with a little chopped green onion.

Trim spears and remove scales. Place in a saucepan with 1 inch water. Cover and cook until tender. Drain well and cool. Cut into 1-inch lengths. Mix all ingredients in a saucepan and heat until just below boiling. Pour over vegetables. Bake at 350f for 20 min.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Pour over chicken and coat well. Transfer to shallow baking pan. Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until done. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Wow, that was so many recipes! I’m glad you liked them.

Heat the oil in a medium size skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened about 3 minutes. Add the sausage and cook until browned about 6 minutes. Add the red bell pepper and cook until softened about 2 more minutes. Add the flour and stir constantly until light brown about 30 seconds. Add the stewed tomatoes, green onions and stir together to combine. Serve with pasta of choice.

In a medium bowl combine flour, salt and pepper. Beat egg whites in another bowl until foamy. Dip the chicken in egg whites then in flour mixture. Place in an ungreased 9-in square pan. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until done. Combine milk, corn flakes and cheese. Spread over the chicken. Bake 5 more minutes or until milk mixture is browned. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine the Splenda, salt and lemongrass. Cut the lemongrass into 2-inch pieces. Pound the garlic and lemongrass in a mortar and pestle until finely chopped. Add the garlic/lemongrass mixture to the Splenda mixture. Thread each chicken quarter onto 3 skewers. Brush the lemongrass mixture onto both sides of the skewered chicken. Grill the chicken for 10 minutes on each side. In a small bowl combine the red curry paste, olive oil, Splenda, salt, lime juice and coconut milk. Remove the chicken from the grill. Pour the curry mixture over the cooked chicken. Sprinkle the chicken with the toasted unsweetened coconut. Serve immediately.

Rub rim of glass with cut lemon or lime and dip in white sugar or with juice from lemon or lime to rim the glass. Set the prepared glass in freezer to chill until needed. Next add the 6 tbsp of club soda and 6 tbsp of light cream into the glass and stir gently until combined. Add the 6 tbsp of vanilla ice cream and stir until combined. Add the 6 tbsp of sugar and 6 tbsp of juice into the glass and stir gently until combined and serve immediately with a spoon and a straw.

Roll out half of pie dough and place in a 9-inch glass pie plateflute edge as desired. Arrange half the apple slices on bottom of pie shell, spacing evenlysprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamonrepeat with remaining ingredients. Dot with butter. Roll out remaining dough to fit over top of fillingpress edges to seal and flute as desired. Cut slits in top crust. Bake as directed on packagelet cool for 1 hour. Serve warm or at room temperature with whipped cream. Makes 8 servings (serving size: 1 slice).
The first thing that comes to mind is the “Apple Cream Cheese Tart” that I ate at a café in New York City. The “Cherry Chocolate Cream Pie” was a close second. Both were delicious and I have made them for my friends and family.
I have also made a lot of pies over the years. I have made a lot of pies for my friends and family. I have made a lot of pies

Prepare tea in a large teapot according to package directions. Let tea steep for 5 minutes. Strain tea through a fine-mesh strainer into a pitcher or large serving bowl. Add sugar, stirring until dissolved. Cut lemons in half, then squeeze juice into pitcher or bowl, discarding seeds. Add pineapple juicestir. Add ice cubesstir gently. Garnish with mint sprigs, if desired.

Cut bananas into small pieces. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add banana slices, fry for about 1 minute. Transfer to paper towel. Brush wonton wrapper with caramel sauce, sprinkle with sugar. Place banana pieces in the center of wrapper. Wrap into a triangle shape. Brush with chocolate sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow dish combine breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, pine nuts, crushed red pepper flakes, coarse black pepper, garlic cloves. Beat egg beaters egg substitute and olive oil in a large bowl. Dip each chicken breast in the egg mixture. Roll in the crumb mixture. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until no longer pink at bone.
Boil yams until very soft. Mash them and add margarine, marshmallows, juice and spices. Spread into a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350f until marshmallows are toasted.

In a cocktail shaker, combine lime juice, 1 cup sugar, 10 kumquats, chopped and 8 sprigs mint leaves, chopped. Muddle well, then add 2 1/2 ounces white rum. Fill the shaker half full of ice cubes and shake until very cold. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with 1/2 cup club soda and garnish with an additional 2 kumquats, sliced.
Heat the oil in a saucepan. When it is hot add the ginger and garlic. Stir for a minute, add the rest of the ingredients and bring to the boil. Cook for about 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Marinate lamb in sauce 1/2 hour. Heat oil in skillet, add lamb and brown slightly. Add sherry wine to pan and boil until mixture is syrupy and lamb is tender. Stir in gingerroot. Spoon sauce over lamb.

Cook onion in a large saucepan over medium heat until softened. Add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add mushrooms. Cook until softened. Add tomato sauce. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in olives. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in crushed red pepper flakes. Add penne. Cook 8 to 10 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Sprinkle with parmesan.

In a small saucepan bring the water to boil. Stir in the sugar and simmer until the sugar dissolves. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 5 minutes. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve to remove the scallion. Cool and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks. Makes about 1/2 cup.
Drain water from canned fruit cocktail. Combine fruits and water in large bowl. Stir until coated. Serve immediately.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle the chicken breasts with cornflour and dip them into the oil to coat both sides. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, the mushrooms and wine to the skillet and saute 2 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Add the cream and bring to a boil. Stir the salt and pepper into the cream mixture. Add the chicken breasts and cook 2 minutes on each side or until the chicken is no longer pink. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Preheat the oven to 425. Combine the lemon juice, parsley and 1/2 tsp of the seasoning salt. Rub this mixture into both sides of the trout and the inside of the cavity. Place the fish in a baking pan and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and garlic cloves and saute for 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes, wine and the remaining 1/2 tsp of the seasoning salt. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Pour over the fish. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serves 4.

In a large skillet, heat butter. Cook garlic for 1 minute. Add cauliflower and green onions. Cook for 5 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Add mostaccioli. In a small bowl, combine seasoned bread crumbs and parmesan. Sprinkle over macaroni. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10×15 inch pan. Melt baking chocolate with butter and water in a double boiler over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in flour. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into squares. Place a few cherries in the center of each square. Makes 24.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix dry ingredients together in a bowl. Make a well in the middle of the dry ingredients. Mix the remaining ingredients in a separate bowl. Pour the wet into the well in the dry, mix just enough to make a soft dough. Roll the dough out on a floured surface with a rolling pin until it is about 1/4 of an inch thick. Cut into 1 1/2 inch squares with a knife. Place the squares on an ungreased cookie sheet, about 1 inch apart. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool on wire racks.

Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour to the pan and stir for 1 minute. Add the milk and cook, stirring constantly until smooth, about 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the remaining tablespoon of butter. Serve warm over chicken or other meats.

Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Marinate 30 minutes. Remove from marinade. Place in crock pot. Cook on low 6 hours. Remove and discard ginger. Slice chicken and serve over rice.
