Heat oven to 425. Grease 12-inch pizza pan. Press dough into pan. In medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, saute onion and garlic in oil until onion is tender. Sprinkle over dough. Top with mozzarella and goat cheese. Arrange roasted red pepper slices and olives over cheeses. Sprinkle with oregano. Bake at 425 for 13 to 15 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown. Cut into wedges.

Brown meat with onion in skillet over medium heat. Pour off fat. Add egg to remaining meat mixture and cook until set. Mound rice on plate. Top with beef mixture, egg and ketchup. Garnish with onion and hot sauce.
Brown meat with onion in skillet over medium heat. Pour off fat. Add egg to remaining meat mixture and cook until set. Mound rice on plate. Top with beef mixture, egg and ketchup. Garnish with onion and hot sauce.
Combine milk, flour, sugar, baking powder and lemon peel in large bowl. Stir in egg yolks, beating well with a spoon until smooth. Beat egg whites in another bowl until stiff. Add 1/4 of the whites to the batter mixturefold in gently but thoroughly. Add remaining whitesfold in gently but thoroughly. Pour batter into an ungreased 13x9-in. baking pan. Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until puffy and golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Spread fro

Spread 1/2 tbsp pizza sauce on 1 slice of white bread. Top with 3 slices of pepperoni and 1 1/2 tsp dried oregano. Layer with 1 1/2 oz american cheese and 1 1/2 oz mozzarella cheese and remaining 1/2 tbsp pizza sauce. Top with remaining white bread slice. Butter outsides of sandwich. Cook on a nonstick skillet or griddle until the bottom is brown and the cheese is melted.

Mix together flour and baking powder. Beat eggs and water together and add to the flour mixture. Stir until smooth. Add butter and onions and stir well. Cook on a hot griddle or frying pan until golden brown.
Sift the dry ingredients. Add the oil. Beat in the eggs. Beat in the lemon juice, the kirsch and the lemon zest. Stir in the milk. Stir in the baking powder.

Rub chicken with olive oil. Sprinkle with lemon pepper and oregano. Grill over medium heat for about 8 minutes on each side. Serve with salad dressing and steak sauce. Serve with sliced tomatoes and lettuce.

In large pan, combine sugar, milk and butter. Boil for 1 minute. Add oatmeal and cocoa. Boil for 1 minute more. Add vanilla and remove from heat. Stir in shredded coconut and mix well. Drop by teaspoonful on waxed paper to set--they are not baked.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Combine tuna, garlic, cheese, and seasonings in a food processor until the mixture is uniform and resembles a thick paste. Add the egg and process until the mixture is combined and resembles a very thick batter. Stir in the breadcrumbs and pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow the cake to cool completely before slicing and serving. This is a very moist and flavorful cake which is best served the next day when the flavors have had a chance to meld. This cake can be served on its own or cut into wedges and served as a side dish or sandwich filling. It can also be used as a base for a variety of sandwiches such as chicken salad or ham and cheese. Makes 16 servings.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread ranch dressing on the dough. Sprinkle with the cayenne and garlic. Top with the cheese and basil. Bake for 5 minutes, until the cheese melts.

Heat oil in wok or frying pan. Add the shallots and red chile and fry for 1 minute. Add the pork and fry until browned. Add the soy sauce and sherry and fry until the sauce is thick. Stir in the cornflour and garlic and sugar and fry for 1 minute. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, mix together the stewed tomatoes and crushed red pepper flakes. Bring 4 quarts of salted water to boiling in a large pot. Add penne and cook according to package directions until al dente. Drain and transfer to the bowl of sauce. Toss until well coated. Transfer to platter and top with parmesan cheese.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add yogurt, green onions, lemon juice and zest, sherry, salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 3 days. Serve topped with red onion.
Mix chicken with dressing. Add orange juice. Mix vegetables with crushed red pepper flakes and add to the chicken. Heat. Stir in rice. Garnish with peanuts.

In large bowl, combine first 5 ingredientstoss to coat rhubarb. In small bowl, combine margarine, water and brown sugarblend well. Pour over rhubarb mixture and toss lightly to coat. Transfer to 13x9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spraybake at 375 for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with rolled oats and bake 10 minutes longer or until oats are lightly browned and mixture is bubbling. Makes 6-8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Unroll doughseparate into triangles. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Spread with American cheese. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Cut each triangle into thirds. Bake until golden brown. Serve warm.

Fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet. Fry onion, garlic and flour until onion is transparent. Add milk, stirring constantly until thickened. Add frozen spinach. Cook 1-2 minutes longer. Add bacon. Add parmesan cheese. Stir until melted. Add lemon juice. Salt and pepper to taste.
In small bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add V8 Splash and stir. Refrigerate until partially set. Fold in pineapple, orange segments and bananas. Serve topped with strawberries.

In small bowl, mix first 4 ingredients. Place in shallow dish. In small bowl, mix remaining ingredients. Dip seeds in seasoning mixture and place on waxed paper. Bake in oven at 350 degrees f for 15-20 minutes or until lightly toasted. Stir occasionally.
Tried the Beans & Burger Hillbilly Chili and it is DELICIOUS!
This is an oldie but goodie that I have found in my files.
Wow! Thank you for posting these recipes. I will definitely try them.
Oh my goodness, I am so excited to try some of these!! I love these kind of recipes.
Thank you for sharing these great recipes. I am going to try the Autumn Apple Cider Vinaigrette.

Combine sugar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Stir in coffee until dissolved. Stir in cocoa powder. Pour into ice-cream freezer canister. Freeze according to manufacturer’s directions, or until firm enough to mold easily into balls. To serve, roll frozen sorbetto into balls. Dip into hot water for 10 seconds. Roll in cocoa powder. Serve immediately with whipped cream and a drizzle of hot caramel sauce.

In a heavy 3 quart pan over medium heat combine sugar, evaporated milk and butter stirring constantly until bubbly, add in chocolate chips, stir until melted add in the rest of the ingredients stir until smooth spread into a 9 x 13 greased pan refrigerate when cool cut into squares.
Add tuna to a mixing bowl. Add mayo, relish and sriracha sauce to taste. Mix well. Pour over ramen noodles. Mix well and eat.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two 8x4x2 inch loaf pans. In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients. Beat until smooth. Stir in the flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in the vanilla and the butterscotch chips. Divide the batter between the pans. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
Heat olive oil in skillet. Brown the chops on each side. Add onion. Stir in pineapple juice, vinegar, and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Add salt. Cook until chops are tender.

Peel potatoes and cut into quarters or sixths depending on size of potato. Bring 1 inch of water to a boil in a large pot. Place potato chunks into the boiling water. Cook until tender about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes and place back into the pot. Mash in the butter. Slowly add the buttermilk while mashing the potatoes until smooth. Stir in the chives. Season with the salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Combine tuna fish, celery rib, green pepper, green onion, mayonnaise, salt, pepper in a medium bowl. Toss well. Divide lettuce leaves onto individual plates. Spoon tuna mixture onto lettuce leaves. Garnish with oregano leaves or olives. Top with a sliced tomato.

In a medium bowl combine the shrimp, oil, sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Toss to coat evenly and set aside for 20 minutes. Heat a large cast iron pan over medium high heat and add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and the shallots. Cook for 2 minutes and add the water and garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Stir and add the fish sauce and the tomato rim man. Stir and add the shrimp and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly to prevent burning. Remove from heat and transfer to a serving dish and garnish with cilantro. Serve with jasmine rice and a glass of chardonnay.
Combine dry ingredients. Combine wet ingredients with dry. Add melted oil. Heat skillet or waffle iron. When hot, ladle batter and cook until done. Serve hot with butter and syrup.

Melt butter in medium pan over medium heat. Add shallots and leeks. Saute until tender about 6 minutes. Add champagne and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until liquid is reduced by half about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in cream. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through 1 to 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in dill.

Cut cucumbers in half lengthwise, and slice each half into 1/4-inch rounds. Place in bowlsprinkle with 1 tablespoon saltlet stand 30 minutes. Drain cucumbers in colanderrinse well. Place 4 cups water in saucepanbring to boil. Add vinegarlet cool to room temperature. Pack cucumber slices in clean jars or clean 1-pint freezer containerspour vinegar mixture over cucumber slices. Add garlic cloves to each jartop each jar with 1 teaspoon tarragon. Cap each container tightlychill at least 1 week before serving. Makes 3 pints

Preheat oven to 400. Beat butter and sugar together until smooth. Beat in 1 egg at a time until light and smooth. Beat in vanilla. Mix together the dry ingredients. Slowly beat in the dry ingredients to the butter mixture. Fold in the mashed bananas and the walnuts. Fill greased muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a rack before frosting. Cream together the butter and vanilla. Gradually add powdered sugar until smooth. Spread on muffins.

Sprinkle both sides of steaks with salt and pepper and the basil. Heat oil in a non-stick skillet. Saute steaks until medium rare, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove steaks from skillet and place on a plate covered with foil to keep warm. Remove the skillet from heat. Add the roasted red peppers and olives to the pan drippings and heat through. Cut the steaks in half horizontally and spread mozzarella on the bottom half of each steak. Top each with roasted peppers and olives mixture and roll up. Pour vinegar over steaks and serve.

Spread the low-fat ricotta cheese on a slice of mountain bread. Top the cheese with a slice of low-fat ham and fresh basil leaves. Roll up the sandwich and enjoy!
Zucchini - A vegetable that is rich in vitamin C.
Zucchini is a summer squash that is eaten when it is young and tender. It has a mild flavor and can be cooked in many different ways. It can be boiled, steamed, grilled, or baked. It can also be eaten raw in salads or as a vegetable side dish. Zucchini is a good source of vitamin C.

Cook the macaroni in boiling water according to the package directions. Preheat the oven to 350°. Drain the pasta well. Place the pasta in a 9x13-inch baking dish. In a small bowl combine the wing sauce, flour and hot sauce and mix well. Pour the mixture over the pasta and toss to evenly coat. In a large skillet cook the chicken in the oil and salt and pepper over medium heat for 5-6 minutes or until no longer pink. Chop and add to the pasta along with the celery and onion powder and garlic powder. Stir well. In a medium bowl combine the milk and the shredded cheese. Stir to blend. Sprinkle the mixture over the pasta and bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Stir and bake for 5 more minutes or until the pasta and the topping are bubbly.

Bring potatoes to a boil in a pot of water. When tender, drain. Mash potatoes with a potato masher. In a large bowl, mix potatoes, broccoli, nutmeg, cheese and seasonings. Spread in a lightly greased 2 qt casserole dish. Bake at 350F for 25 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper liners. In a large bowl combine butter, honey and buttermilk. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition and scraping sides of bowl as needed. In a small bowl combine flour, baking powder and saltadd to butter mixture and beat just until blended (batter will be lumpy). Fold in shredded coconut by hand. Divide batter evenly among prepared muffin cups. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 20-25 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Combine butter and milk in saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk together flour, honey, salt, baking soda and vanilla in a large bowl. Add the dry mixture to the saucepan and whisk constantly until the mixture is well blended. Stir in flaked coconut and crispy rice cereal. Drop by teaspoonful onto wax paper. Let cool.

In a skillet brown the meat with the onion and garlic. Add the oregano and the chili powder. Add the corn chips and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add the tomato sauce, water, beans and cook for 10 minutes. Add the cheese and cook for 5 additional minutes. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat broiler to 400 degrees f. Cut the bread in half lengthwise. Brush the cut sides with the garlic and oil. Season with salt and pepper. Broil for 2 minutes or until crisp on the edges. Remove from the oven. Spread with cream cheese. Arrange the tomatoes on the bread. Sprinkle with basil. Serve immediately.

Combine milk and eggs in a medium bowl. Whisk to combine. Add flour 1 cup at a time. Add cheese. Set aside. Heat canola oil in a deep skillet. Dip blossoms into egg batter then coat in flour. Fry in hot oil until crispy and golden. Remove from oil. Sprinkle with mint.

Soak the maraschino cherries in brandy and set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9×5 inch loaf pan. In a bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and saltset aside. In another bowl, combine the eggs and vanilla. In a third bowl, combine the sugar and shorteningmix well. Add the egg mixture and the shortening mixture alternately to the flour mixture. Beat just until moistened. Stir in the cherries. Sprinkle with nuts and coconut. Bake for 1 hour. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss well to blend.

Melt butter and saute onion and celery until tender. Remove from heat and add bread cubes. Saute until brown. Add eggs and blend well. Stir in mashed potatoes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add enough broth to make moist and bind.

In a large bowl, mix together the beans, corn, onions, avocadoes and vinegar. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serves 4.
name: chicken and corn saladingredients: fresh chicken breast, chicken breast, romaine lettuce, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, boiled eggs, bacon bits, italian dressing, sour cream, green onionspreparation:Boil chicken in water until tender. Cut into 1/4 inch cubes. Chop lettuce. Cut tomatoes in half. Slice eggs in half. Chop bacon bits. Cut chicken in half. Mix romaine lettuce, tomatoes, chicken and cheese in a large bowl. Mix together Italian dressing and sour cream in a small bowl. Pour dressing over salad. Garnish with green onions.

Brown beef and drain off fat. Add green onion and season with italian seasoning. Add sugar and worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce and sliced olives. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and add to meat mixture. Serve immediately.

Slice round steak into small pieces. In crockpot add water and taco seasoning mix. Stir together. Add salsa and green chilies. Add the round steak. Cook on low for about 9 hours. Serve over corn chips and top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Mix all burger ingredients together, form into 4 patties and cook as desired. Serve each burger topped with sliced mushrooms. Serve with cranberry sauce for an extra special touch.

Preheat broiler on high. In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add shallots to pan and saute until soft. Add bouillon cube and stir until dissolved. Add wine, water, and seasonings. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes. Lay fish in a baking dish and pour liquid over top. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat. Whisk in cream. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatreduce heat to low and simmer until thickened, about 1 minute. Serve sauce over fish. Garnish with herbs if desired.
Boil butter and broth in pan. Add rice to broth and butter mixture. Add chopped pimiento and scallions. Cook until tender. Add cilantro and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Peel fruit and remove white pith. Shred peel. Cut fruit finely. Add 1 tsp of the water to 1 lb of fruit. Measure fruit and add an equal volume of sugar. Cook until thick, stirring carefully to prevent scorching. Add peel shreds, if desired. Fill sterilized jars, cover and process in a boiling water bath for ten minutes to seal.

Mix all the ingredients together. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour at 300 degrees. Cool and cut into squares.
I love this recipe! I add more raisins and almonds, and I use oat bran and whole wheat flour instead of whole wheat flour because that’s all I had in my pantry!
This is the best tasting granola I’ve ever made. It’s not too sweet and the toasted coconut gives it a nice crunch. It’s not as heavy as regular granola and makes a great snack.
I just made these this morning! My husband loved them and said they were the best granola bars he has ever tasted! He said he wants to try and make them for his own company lunch. They are really good and really simple to make!

Melt honey and peanut butter together over medium heat in double boiler or microwave. Add cereal and peanuts. Press mixture into greased 13x9x2 inch pan. Allow to cool for 30 minutes or until firm. Melt chocolate in double boiler or microwave. Spread over mixture. Allow to cool. Cut into squares.
This is my new favorite recipe! I have a friend who has a gluten allergy and this is the best thing I've found to make for him.
These are great! I made them for my kids to take to school as a treat and they loved them.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Cream together the butter and caster sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla essence. Gradually add the flour and mix well. Turn the mixture out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead lightly until smooth. Divide the mixture into 12 balls. Flatten the balls slightly. Place on a lightly greased baking tray. Bake in the oven for about 10 to 15 minutes. Makes about 12 teacakes.

Heat oil and saute the onion and garlic for 3 to 4 minutes or until they are soft and transparent. Add the chicken and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the chopped tomato and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes or until it is soft and tender. Add the cauliflower and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes or until it is tender and cooked through. Add the broccoli and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes or until it is tender and cooked through. Add the olives and the parsley and cook for another 1 minute or until everything is well mixed and combined. Serve hot with rice or couscous and sprinkle with chopped parsley.
Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper on both sides. Brown both sides in hot oil. Add the soup and the wine and simmer for about 10 minutes or until tender. Serve over rice or noodles.

In large heavy skillet melt butter over medium heat. Add steaks and cook 2 minutes per side. Add whiskey and simmer 2 minutes. Add heavy cream and pepper and salt to taste. Heat to boiling. Cook 30 seconds. Remove steaks and serve.

Mix the ingredients together in a clean crock. Add the cucumbers whole. Cover with water leaving 1 inch head space. Let stand 3 days. Then put the lid on the crock tightly, invert the crock so the lid is on the bottom and let stand 3 more days. You can eat them at this time or refrigerate for several months.

Dissolve lemon jello in boiling water. Add frozen orange juice and stir until dissolved. Add mandarin oranges and pineapple tidbits and stir until blended. Pour into a 13 x 9 glass dish coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate overnight or until firm. Just before serving, sprinkle with coconut.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic in bacon drippings until tender. Add bacon, sprouts, mushrooms, broth and seasonings. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until tender. Makes about 6 servings.

Place 1/4 of the tortillas in the bottom of a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Break the remaining 1/4 of the tortillas into bits and sprinkle over the top. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and half-and-half with a whisk. Add the cottage cheese, salt and pepper. Stir in the crushed tortillas. Pour over the casserole. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until the egg mixture is set. Sprinkle with the mexican blend cheese and green onions. Serve with salsa.

Combine breadcrumbs and parmesan in a bowl. Add butter and mix until crumbs are coated with butter. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancettacook until crisp, about 3 minutes. Add prosciuttocook for 1 minute more. Add green peascook until just heated through, about 30 seconds. Whisk together mustard, sour cream and milk. Mix into pasta with pancetta mixture. Pour into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Top with breadcrumb mixture and shredded cheeses. Bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 300 F. Spread almonds on a cookie sheet and toast until golden. Remove from oven and allow to cool. In a large saucepan bring sugar, butter and corn syrup to a boil over medium heat. Stir until the mixture turns a light caramel color. Remove from heat and stir in cream of tartar. Pour caramel over popcorn and nuts. Spread on 2 cookie sheets. Bake for 1 hour at 250f stirring every 20 minutes. Cool and store in airtight containers.

Preheat the broiler. Arrange ciabatta slices in single layer on broiler pan. Broil 2 inches from the heat for 4 minutes or until toasted. Arrange mozzarella slices on toasted bread. Top each with 2 slices of prosciutto. Sprinkle evenly with basil. Drizzle evenly with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Broil 4 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Heat oil in a heavy fry pan and saute the onion and garlic until soft. Add the tomatoes and paprika and cook for 2-3 minutes. Stir in the salt and add the white wine. When the mixture is reduced to about half its original volume, pour over the fish. Bring to the boil and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the fish is cooked but still firm. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Place the broth, onion, salt, pepper, and basil into the slow cooker. Add in the chicken and cook on high for 4 hours. During the last 30 minutes of cooking add the noodles. Add the cans of broccoli cheese soup and stir. Cook for 20 minutes more. Serve over noodles.

Rinse and pat dry the chicken and cut in half lengthwise. In a small bowl combine the dressing and marinade. Place the chicken in a shallow dish. Pour the dressing mixture over the chicken. Refrigerate 3-4 hours turning once. Grill the chicken over medium heat until done. While grilling add the onions, zucchini and grape tomatoes. Add the pitted olives to the salad. Serve the chicken over the salad with the cheese.
i made it last night and it was soo good!
I would like to thank you for this recipe. It was a big hit with my family. I will definitely be using this recipe again.
I made this for dinner tonight. It was delicious. My husband thought the sauce was a bit too oily so next time I will leave out the olive oil or use much less. Other than that it was very good. I will definitely make this again.
I loved this recipe!! I made it with a few small changes. I used 4 skinless chicken breast halves (1lb) and 1 can of rotel

Mix cauliflower, celery and red onion. In a bowl, mix the mayo, vinegar, sugar substitute and pepper to taste. Pour over the vegetables and toss to combine. Cover the bowl and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with 1 or 2 boiled eggs per person.
Brew coffee in a pot. Add cinnamon stick and brown sugar. Heat until dissolved. Pour over ice cubes. Serve with milk and cream and sprinkle with powdered chocolate milk mix.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add shallot and cook for 2 minutes. Add the pasta and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes or until the pasta is lightly browned. Stir in the spinach. Cook for 2 more minutes. Stir in the cream. Cook for 1 more minute. Stir in the black olives, blue cheese crumbles and black pepper. Serves 4.

Wash the scallops and pat dry. Season with the steak seasoning. Dip the scallops in the flour and place in hot cooking oil until golden brown. Remove from the heat and set aside. In a medium-sized bowl toss together spinach with the carrot and vinegar. Drizzle with the water. Place the scallops and spinach on a plate. Sprinkle with sea salt. Serve.

Preheat over to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Roll out pizza dough to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into 2 inch squares and place in greased baking dish. Beat together mashed potatoes with onion, cheeses, butter, sour cream and spices. Spread over dough squares and bake for 15 minutes or until top is lightly browned.

Beat egg whites and egg until foamy. Add white sugar gradually and beat until stiff peaks form. Add vanilla and beat until well blended. Add cocoa, baking powder and salt and mix well. Add flour and mix until smooth. Fold in marshmallow cream and nuts. Spread in an 8-inch-square baking pan and bake at 350 degrees F for 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack and cut into squares.

Spray cooking spray into medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the oil, onion and jalapeno and cook until tender (3 to 4 minutes). Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the tomatoes and water and bring to a boil. Stir in the beans and reduce heat to low. Simmer until the beans are tender, about 1 hour. Stir in the parsley and season to taste with the white pepper.

Mix bisquick, milk and butter until crumbly. Add brown sugar and raisins and mix well. Shape into small balls. Place balls onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes. Cool slightly then roll in cinnamon-sugar mixture while still warm. Store in plastic container. Makes 36.
name: peanut butter cookiesingredients: butter, peanut butter, brown sugar, vanilla extract, baking powder, flour, milkpreparation:In medium bowl, cream butter and peanut butter until smoothbeat in brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in vanillamix in baking powder and flour until well blended. Refrigerate dough 30 minutes. On lightly floured surface, roll dough 1/4 inch thickcut with 2-inch heart-shaped cookie cuttersplace 1 inch apart on greased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until edges are light

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease an 8x8x2-inch or 2-quart baking dish. Combine butter, milk and sugar in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the flour. Cook and stir for 3 minutes or until the mixture begins to thicken. Remove the mixture from the heat and pour into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the berries evenly over the top of the mixture. Bake for 35 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the berries are bubbly. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping if desired.

Mix together the first 3 ingredients. Dip each ring into the mixture then into the egg substitute. Dip the rings again into the mixture. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add leeks and onion and cook until soft. Add sweet potato and cook for 3 minutes. Add chicken stock and bring to boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add cumin seeds and cook for another 2 minutes. Puree soup with a hand blender and season with salt and pepper. Add yogurt and stir. Serve hot.

Melt 3 Tablespoons of butter with 3-4 crushed cloves of garlic. In a large saucepan bring 1/2 gallon of water to a boil. Peel, wash and slice 4 to 5 pounds of russet potatoes, or enough to fill saucepan. Add them to the boiling water and cook until tender. Drain potatoes and return to saucepan with 1/2 cup of milk or cream (more if needed). Mash thoroughly until smooth and fluffy. Add 2 Tablespoons of flour to thicken. Salt and pepper to taste. Heat remaining 2 Tablespoons of butter. Add 1/4 cup of flour to hot butter and stir until a light golden brown roux is formed. Gradually add 1/2 cup of milk or cream and heat until thickened. Add to potatoes and blend well. Serve immediately while still warm.
Cook macaroni according to package directions. In a large bowl combine the macaroni, bacon, onions, lemon juice and celery. Stir in the miracle whip and the remaining ingredients. Chill 2 hours.

In a bowl, combine the vinegar and garlic. Add the olive oil and blend well. Season with the black pepper and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight before use. Rub the mixture over the meat or fish and refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight before grilling.
In a bowl, combine the vinegar and garlic. Add the olive oil and blend well. Season with the black pepper and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight before use. Rub the mixture over the meat or fish and refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight before grilling.

In a large bowl combine the sausage, eggs and half-and-half. Stir well and set aside. In a 13x9-inch baking pan layer the hash brown potatoes and then top with the sausage mixture. Sprinkle the cheese and vegetables evenly over the top. Bake for 50 minutes or until the sausage is no longer pink in the center. Makes 9 servings.

Mix together the first four ingredients until well blended. Add the vanilla and milk and mix until smooth. Pour the mixture over the walnuts and stir until completely coated. Bake at 250 for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the egg and molasses and beat well. Sift in the flour and the soda and then add the spices. Form into balls and then roll in cocoa. Place on baking trays and bake at 180C for 20 minutes.
WOW! I had no idea that there were so many different kinds of gingerbread cookies. I never thought of making a dessert with Gingersnaps either. I’ve always made just the plain old gingerbread men. You’ve inspired me!
Great information and pictures of all these different kinds of gingerbread cookies! I will have to try the layered chocolate dessert as I love both chocolate and mint!
I love gingerbread cookies. I have never heard of layered chocolate dessert. I will have to try that one.
I love gingerbread. I will be making some of these for Christmas.
I am making the Gingersnaps Soft and Chewy Cookies for sure. They sound delicious!
I love gingerbread. I am going to try some of these

In a bowl combine oats and honey and stir to mix thoroughly. Add melted butter and salt and pepper to taste and stir to mix thoroughly. In a small bowl combine melted butter and garlic and stir to mix thoroughly. Add the oats and honey mixture and stir to mix thoroughly. Pour into a greased 9 x 9 square baking pan and bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes until crunchy and golden brown. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Cook bacon until crisp. Crumble bacon into small pieces. Reserve 2 tbsp bacon drippings. Add onion to reserved drippings. Saute until tender. Add stewed tomatoes and thyme and cook 10 minutes or until heated through. Stir in bacon pieces and cook 1 minute more. Cook green beans in boiling water until crisp-tender. Add to tomato mixturetoss gently to coat evenly. Spoon mixture into prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake uncovered 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Combine mayo, sour cream and mustard. Add garlic salt and Worcestershire. Add hot sauce and mix well. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add brussel sprouts and cook until tender crisp. Drain and toss with mayonnaise mixture. Serve on a bed of lettuce garnished with toasted pecans.

Wash and trim sproutscut in halves and quarter if large. Place in pan with water to cover and add bouillon cubes. Bring to boil and simmer until tender. Add carrots, celery and butter and cook 15 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with cashewsadd thyme and pepper to taste. Serve on toast or with crackers and cheese.

Bring marinara sauce to a boil. Add green pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add cooked pasta and mix. Add chicken. Add mozzarella cheese and mix. Place in a greased casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with garlic bread.

Cook the peas according to directions on package. Drain thoroughly. In a bowl, mix together sour cream, dill, and chives. Carefully combine with the peas. Chill and serve on a bed of crisp salad greens. Makes 8 servings.
cold dill pea salad : Cook the peas according to directions on package. Drain thoroughly. In a bowl, mix together sour cream, dill, chives, curry powder, lemon, juice of, salt and pepper, crisp salad green.
sweet pea salad : Place peas, chestnuts, celery, onion, and cheese in a large salad bowl. In a small mixing bowl, stir together the sour cream and sugar until well blended. Add the sour cream mixture to the salad, then season with salt and pepper. Toss thoroughly with a large spoon. Place in refrigerator for several hours. Add the cashews just before serving, and toss well to thoroughly blend all ingredients.
curried pea salad : Briefly rinse

Slice leeks thin. Cook them in olive oil in a large saucepan or pot over medium heat. When the leeks are soft, add the rice and continue to cook for a couple of minutes. Add the stock a little at a time. Stir continually. The rice should absorb all of the liquid and be creamy. Add the veggie stock a little at a time. Stir continually. The rice should absorb all of the liquid and be creamy. Taste for seasoning. Add the blue cheese and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Place cream cheese in food processor bowladd sour cream and milkblend until smooth. Add remaining ingredientsprocess until well mixed. Transfer mixture to a casserole dishbake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through. Serves 4-6.

Beat the egg yolks until light, add the brown sugar, cocoa, vanilla & saltbeat until smooth. Stir in the milkcook over medium heat until mixture coats a metal spoon. Add rumcool completely. Beat the heavy cream until stiff peaks formfold into the cooled custard. Chill at least 2 hours or overnight. Garnish with chocolate shavings.

In skillet saute onions and bell pepper in oil. Add brown sugar. Add apple juice, vinegar and horseradish. Bring to boil. Cover and simmer 25 minutes. In a small bowl, stir together mustard and cornstarch. Stir into mixture. Continue cooking 5 minutes. Cool.

Bring water to boiling. Add pasta. Cook 10 minutes or until done. In a skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skilletcrumble. Add meatballscook over medium heat until browned on all sides. In a large bowl combine soup, water, pasta, bacon, onion, meatballs, cheddar cheesemix well. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with remaining shredded cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered in a preheated 350F oven for 30 minutes until bubbly.

Mix sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Combine flour and baking powder. Mix into butter mixture. Stir in rice krispies, chocolate chips and coconut. Drop by tablespoons onto waxed paper covered cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool completely on wire rack before storing in airtight container.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Add butter during last 2 minutes of cooking. Drain well. Stir in peas and sun-dried tomato. Add basil. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and set aside.In a small bowl combine oil with 2 teaspoons of the lime juice. Add the chicken to the bag with the marinade. Seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour.Meanwhile in a small bowl combine the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the lime juice, the avocadoes, tomatoes, onion and cilantro. When the chicken is done marinating, thread onto skewers. Grill until cooked through. Serve with the avocado-tomato mixture.

Combine cream cheese and oreos in a food processor and process until crumbly. Press mixture into bottom of an 8x8-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack. Combine strawberries, chocolate syrup, and powdered sugar in a small bowl. Spread evenly over crust. Cut into 2-inch squares. Serve immediately.

Place broccoli florets in large pot of boiling water and cook for 3 minutes. Drain broccoli and set aside. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add broccoli florets, broccoli stem pieces, garlic, pine nuts and cook until broccoli is crisp-tender, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice and cook for 1 minute more. Season with kosher salt. Toss in cooked pasta and grated cheese. Serve immediately.

Cube meat and place in crockpot. Pour water, sugar and soup mix over meat. Stir in garlic powder and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and cook 6 hours on high or 8 hours on low heat setting. Serve on hamburger buns topped with a slice of cheese and onions.

Mix prawns and marinade in a bowl. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat grill or broiler. Thread prawns on bamboo skewers and brush with remaining marinade. Grill prawns 5 minute turning and basting until opaque. Garnish with sesame seeds.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, cocoa, and water. Bring to a boil and cook until the mixture thickens and turns a rich brown color. Add caramel candies and stir until melted. Stir in milk. Simmer a couple of minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in whipped cream and caramel candies. Serve in mugs and garnish with whipped cream and caramel candies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place zucchini, yellow squash and bell peppers in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Sprinkle with garlic cloves. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Bake for 15 minutes. In a small bowl combine balsamic vinegar and pine nuts. Toss to coat. Spoon onto vegetables. Garnish with basil leaves.

Spread mustard on one slice of sourdough. Place cucumber slices on the bottom slice. Cover with romaine leaves. Top with tomato slices. Spread mayonnaise on remaining slice. Sprinkle red onion on top. Add bean sprouts. Cover with provolone cheese. Top with avocado slices. Place on top slice.

Cook the noodles in a large saucepan of boiling water until tender. Drain. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the sweet onion and saute until tender. Add the brown sugar and cook 1 minute more. Add the cabbage and cook 1 to 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the caraway seed, salt and pepper. Add the drained noodles. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add pork and brown on both sides. Add chili sauce and marmalade. In a 13 x 9 baking dish, layer half the rice in the bottom. Cover with half the pork mixture. Top with remaining rice and pork mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until pork is tender and internal temperature reaches 160 degrees. Top with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer.

In a Dutch oven over medium heat, saute onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add chicken gizzard and brown. Add pepper and tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Add water, flour and paprika and stir. Cook until thickened. Serve over noodles and garnish with sour cream.

Cut liver into 1/2-inch slices. Sprinkle with salt and cayenne pepper. Fry liver slices until lightly browned. Place liver slices in casserole. Sprinkle with shallot and pour over wine. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 2 minutes. Stir in mustard. Cover and simmer 1 minute more. Makes 4 servings.

In a mixing bowl, beat together the chocolate chips, butter and sugar until smooth. Add the egg and vanilla. Mix well. Stir in the dry ingredients until blended. Pour into a greased and floured 9-inch square pan. Bake for approximately 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. In a separate bowl beat together the frosting ingredients until creamy. Spread on cooled brownies and sprinkle with toasted coconut and toasted pecans. Cut into squares and serve.

Saute green onion in oil. Add soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Stir in water. Add sherry, brown sugar and garlic. Cook until thickened. Stir in black pepper and sesame seeds. Add beef. Stir to combine. Cook until heated through. Serve over white rice.

Brown bacon in skillet until crisp. Crumble and set aside. Cut bread into cubes. Spread on cookie sheet and bake in oven at 450 degrees until toasted. Cool slightly. Crumble into small pieces. Toss spinach with bacon, croutons and cucumber. In a bowl mix together buttermilk mayonnaise and herbs. Pour over the spinach and toss lightly. Chill until ready to serve.

Brown the chops in a little butter. Remove them from the pan. Add the orange juice to the pan along with the brown sugar, stirring until it dissolves. Add the white wine and ginger. Simmer until reduced by half. Return the chops to the pan and simmer for 2 minutes until the sauce is thickened. Serve on white rice or over noodles.

Preheat oven to 350f. Drain green beans. In a small bowl, combine teriyaki sauce, honey and lemon. Mix together. Pour over beans. Cook bacon in a skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Saute onion and red bell pepper in butter. Cook until tender. Combine with cashews. Spoon over cooked green beans. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Slice the onion in paper thin slices and saute in a small amount of olive oil (just enough to cover the bottom of pan) over medium low heat for 5-10 minutes or until browned. Meanwhile cut the mushrooms into small pieces or chunks (whatever is easier for you). When the onion is ready add the garlic cloves and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Add the chopped porcinis, stir, cover and cook for 5-10 minutes or until all liquid has been absorbed. Transfer to a food processor or blender and puree. Add the mayonnaise, lemon juice, fresh dill, salt & pepper to taste and process until smooth. Taste for seasonings & serve with crackers or bread.

In a large bowl combine the corn, oil and vinegar. Toss well. Place in 15 x 10 inch pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Combine the peppers, onion and parsley. Stir in the lime juice. Add to the roasted corn mixture. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature.

Cream together shortening, brown sugar, egg and milk. Stir in flour, baking soda and salt. Add cereal and chips. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375f for 10 to 12 minutes until edges are golden brown. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut lengthwise into fries about 1/4" thick. Toss with a little extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper and chili powder. Spread out on a baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes until tender.

In a large pot, combine hot dogs with enough boiling water to cover. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 5-8 minutes. Drain hot dogs. Slice into 1/2-inch thick pieces. In a bowl, combine hot dogs with 1 can of chili and 1/2 cup of salsa. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the mixture onto each tortilla. Top with shredded cheese. Roll up and wrap in aluminum foil. Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes. Unwrap. Cut each roll in half and serve with additional salsa.
I’m going to try the beef & cheese wrap recipe. Thank you!

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water until al dente (still firm to bite), 8 to 10 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse under cold water. Shake out excess water and toss pasta with olive oil in large bowl. Meanwhile, combine lemon juice, zest, garlic, salt and pepper in small bowl. Cut artichoke hearts in half. Add to bowl with bell pepper, green onions and lemon vinaigrette. Toss to combine. Add drained pasta to bowl. Toss to coat well. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate up to 2 days.

Mix soup and water together. Place the chicken in the crockpot. Top with the soup mixture. Cook on high for 4 hours. Add the onion soup mix. Mix together the fat-free sour cream and flour. Add the mixture to the soup mixture. Cook on low for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve over hot noodles. Serve with a sprinkle of parsley.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Stir in 1 teaspoon of the salt. Add the orzo and cook 1 minute. Stir in the tomatoes. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir in the remaining 2 teaspoons of salt. Add the lemon zest and chives. Let stand 2 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Stir in the feta. Serve immediately.

Heat v8 juice to boiling. Add rotel and onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 2 more minutes. Add frozen mixed veggies and cook 2 more minutes. Add ranch dressing mix and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Heat 2 Tbsp olive oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes over medium heat until softened but not browned. Add dried lentils and stir to combine. Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 30 minutes. Add mushrooms and bell peppers and continue to cook for 15 minutes more. Stir in scallions and parsley and serve.
Soak gelatin in boiling water. Add cream and beat until smooth. Fold in pineapple and cheddar. Pour into a 13x9x2 inch pan and chill until firm.

Preheat the oven to 400 f. Grease 10 muffin cups or line with paper cups. In a large bowl combine the flours, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and saltstir well. In another bowl combine the egg whites, apple juice concentrate and oil. Stir into the flour mixture. Stir in the rhubarb and glace ginger. Spoon into the muffin cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the pan to cool on wire racks. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve warm.

Melt cream cheese in a saucepan over low heat. Mix in the rest of the ingredients except for the cheese. Pour into a greased baking dish. Sprinkle the cheese on top. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes at 350 degrees F or until the top is brown and the cheese is bubbly. Serve with lettuce and tomatoes or any other toppings you like.
A quick and easy nachos recipe!

Heat oven to 400°F. In large bowl combine beans, garlic, cumin, salt and chicken broth. Pour into 8-inch square glass baking dish coated with cooking spray. Cover with foil. Bake 45 minutes. Uncoverbake 15 minutes longer or until heated through. Stir in cilantro just before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

Melt butter in a saucepan over a low heat. Add plain flour stirring constantly with a wooden spoon till smooth. Add milk gradually stirring constantly till thickened. Add paprika to taste. Serve with pasta or chicken.

Place all the dip ingredients in the food processor or blender. Puree until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve with assorted crackers or fresh veggies like celery sticks or slices of raw carrots or radishes. You may like to add some chopped fresh parsley or coriander to the dip before serving.

Bring broth to a boil. Add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add asparagus and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes until al dente. Stir in cayenne pepper and parmesan cheese. Add more broth if you want a thinner sauce. Serve immediately.

Hard boil eggs and let cool. Peel shells off of eggs and remove yolk from egg whites. Mash yolk with egg whites. Add in the miracle whip and spices until fully mixed. Scoop the filling into egg whites with a spoon or if you are fancy, use a pastry bag. Sprinkle the top with paprika if desired. Chill for at least an hour before serving.

Combine the first 3 ingredients in a bowl, stirring well. Place breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl or plate. Combine 1/2 cup of the soup mixture and the breadcrumbsmix well. Combine the remaining soup mixture and 1/2 cup water in another shallow bowl or platestir well. Dip each chicken breast in the liquid mixture, then in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing to coat. Place in an 11x7-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Uncoverbake 10 to 15 minutes longer or until no longer pink at bone. Sprinkle with cheese if desired. Serve with vegetables if desired.

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg yolks. Sift in flour and baking powder. Add the golden syrup and the ground ginger. Blend well. Drop 30g heaped spoons of the mixture onto greased trays. Bake for about 10 minutes. Cool on trays.
 gingersnap oatmeal ingredients: old-fashioned oatmeal, skim milk, water, molasses, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, vanilla extract, kosher salt preparation: In a small pot, heat oatmeal, skim milk, and water over medium heat. As oatmeal mixture is warming, add all the other ingredients. Stir thoroughly to combine. Let cook until most of the liquid is absorbed, and the oatmeal reaches yknow an oatmealy consistency. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a small bowl, mix together the butter and sweet onion.Place pizza crust in a 10 inch cast iron skillet.In a small bowl, mix together the Parmesan and mozzarella cheeses. Spread the butter and onion mixture evenly over the crust. Sprinkle with the cheese blend. Bake in the preheated oven until the edges of the crust are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
thank you for the recipes. They look wonderful.

Cut tomatoes into wedges. Heat butter and shallot over medium heat until butter melts. Add leeks and tomatoes. Stir occasionally until tomatoes begin to soften. Add asparagus and cook 4 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with pistachios and lemon juice. Add parsley and toss to blend well. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375F. Slice pineapple into 1/4-inch slicesplace on baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. In small bowl, combine tequila, orange marmalade, brown sugar, butter, vanilla and cinnamon until well blended. Brush pineapple slices with glaze and bake for another 5 minutes or until caramelized. Sprinkle with fresh mint. Serves 4.
Name: Pineapple mojito
Ingredients: Mint leaves, Pineapple chunks, Brown sugar, Dark rum, Pineapple Juice
Preparation:Crush the mint, pineapple chunks and brown sugar in the bottom of a shaker. Add the rum and shake with ice. Strain in a highball glass filled with crusched ice. Complete with pineapple juice and stir. Garnish with a pineapple chunk and mint.
Name: Gentle ben
Ingredients: Vodka, Gin, Tequila, Orange Juice, Orange
Preparation:Place vodka,

Boil tomatoes until tender. Drain & cool slightly. Saute onion in olive oil until soft. Mash tomatoes, add onion & seasonings. Bake in 1 quart casserole in 350 oven for 1/2 hour until bubbly & lightly browned. Sprinkle with cheese & bake 5 more minutes until melted. Bake 10 minutes more until lightly browned. Sprinkle with bread crumbs & bake 2 more minutes until lightly browned. Sprinkle with bacon & serve immediately.
name: tomatoes and peppers for lunch
name: chunky cheese dip
name: sliced tomato n bacon casserole
name: broiled tomato slices with herbes de provence
name: tomato and lettuce salad
name: tomatoes and green beans
name: tomato with mozzarella salad
name: tomatoes with pepperoncini

Preheat oven to 375. Spray baking dish with cooking spray. Combine cracker crumbs and cheese. Divide evenly and stuff each vegetable with mixture. In small bowl combine egg and milk. Brush with egg mixture. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from baking dish. Top with dried parsley and freshly ground black pepper.

Mix dry ingredients. Add shortening and rub with your hands until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in milk just until moistened. Turn out onto a floured board, and knead lightly 5 to 10 times. Roll dough 1/2-in thick. Cut with a 2-in round cutter. Place about 1/4-in apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Cut 2 large tomatoes in half lengthwise, add 2 small chopped garlic cloves and a little salt and fresh pepper to each halfplace in a baking dishput the tomatoes in the oven for 20-30 minutes or until the tomatoes begin to softenremove from oven, set aside and allow to coolmeanwhile prepare the fishbrush the salmon with olive oilplace the fish in the oven for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a forkremove fish from the oventop each fish with 2 tablespoons of the tomato mixturesprinkle with chopped fresh parsley and 1/2 cup breadcrumbsreturn the fish to the ovenbake for an additional 10 minutesserve over cooked pasta with a glass of white wine and a green vegetable.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars. Add the egg and vanilla and beat well. Combine the flour, baking soda, cornflakes and chocolate chipsstir into the creamed mixture until well blended. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, add olive oil. When hot, add ground beef. Cook until no longer pink. Add onions and bell pepper. Stir until softened. Add cabbage and garlic powder. Stir until cabbage is tender. Add brown rice and broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer until brown rice is tender. Add Rotel, salt and fresh ground black pepper. Stir.

Cook chow mein noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a 1-1/2 qt. casserole combine soup and noodles. Top with celery, onion, tuna and frozen peas. Sprinkle with cashews. Bake in 350 degree F oven 20 to 25 minutes.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until just shy of al dente. Drain well. Return the pasta to the pot. Add cream. Cook over low heat until the liquid is absorbed and the sauce is thick. Add butter, lemon zest, lemon juice & cheese. Stir until melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine nuts and coconut. In a saucepan, combine butter, bananas, and lemon juicecook on low heat until melted. Mix with nut mixture until well blended. Spoon onto waxed paperlet cool. Cut into bite size pieces and place into airtight container. Yield 24 servings

Put crunchy peanut butter and honey in a microwavable bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minute. Stir in chocolate whey protein powder and old-fashioned oatmeal. Press into a 8x8 inch baking dish. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until hard. Cut into 16 squares.
these were soooo good. i have had them before in the store.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In large bowl mix stuffing and milk until soft dough forms. Add soup, butter and seasonings. Blend well. Spread mixture in 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Lay chicken over stuffing. Bake for 45 minutes. Add green beans and bake 20 minutes longer or until chicken is no longer pink and vegetables are tender.

Beat eggs with water until well blended. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Heat margarine in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add eggs and cook, stirring constantly until eggs are almost set. Reduce heat to low and stir in cheese. Cook for another minute. Add mushrooms and stir until heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in dill and onions. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Combine first 5 ingredients in heavy large pot. Bring to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered 30 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook 2 minutes. Add 1 can tomato soup. Stir to blend. Simmer 25 minutes. Stir in 2 cans tomato soup. Simmer 10 minutes.

In a medium bowl combine the first four ingredients. In a small bowl combine the mint and honey. Pour over fruit. Toss to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until ready to serve.

Mix all the ingredients except the baking soda and vinegar. Add those and beat for 1 minute. Chill the dough for 1 hour. Divide into 1/2 inch balls. Roll in sugar and place 2 inches apart on baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes or until browned. Cool and store in an airtight container.

In a skillet brown the onion and garlic in the oil for about 3 minutes. Add the fish and sprinkle with the spices. Add the tomatoes and their liquid and the water. Cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Spoon into a 11/2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle the topping over the top. Bake for 30 minutes.

Combine vermouth and heavy cream in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until mixture is reduced by about half, about 20 minutes. Whisk in lemon juice and butter and season with salt and pepper. Arrange 4 of the breasts on a serving plate and spoon some of the sauce over them. Repeat with remaining breasts and sauce. Serve immediately. Garnish with lemon wedges.

Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Spread half of mixture evenly in bottom of pan. Add layer of peanut butter. Spread 2nd half of mixture over peanut butter layer. Place in fridge overnight and cut into 8 individual squares.

Melt butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add brussels sprouts and saute 3 to 4 minutes. Add wine and cook until liquid evaporates. Add broth and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in ginger. Add parmesan cheese and cook until melted.

In a pitcher combine the sugar with the water. Add the rose water. Stir. Pour into tall glasses filled with ice. Add a splash of club soda. Garnish with mint leaves and limes. Sprinkle with red food coloring. Rose petal is optional.
 strawberry lemonade with blueberriesingredients: sugar, lemons, blueberries, water, strawberriespreparation:In a large pitcher combine 1 cup water and 1 cup sugar. Add the lemon juice. Slice the lemons in half and squeeze into the pitcher. Stir. Add the blueberries. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. Next day, add the strawberries and stir. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Serve over ice.

In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder, sugar and saltstir with a whisk. In a small bowl combine egg with melted shorteningstir until well mixed. Add to flour mixturestir until just combined. Stir in buttermilk and waterstir just until blended. Heat a lightly greased griddle or heavy skillet over medium heat until hot. Using 1/4 cup batter for each pancakepour batter onto hot griddle. Turn after bubbles form on top of pancakescook until golden brown on both sides. Serve with warm maple syrup. Makes 5-6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with melted butter. In a large skillet or saucepan, combine apples and dark brown sugar and corn syrup over medium heat. Cook and stir until apples are tender. Remove from heat. Beat eggs and milk in large bowl. Dip slices of bread into egg mixture. Layer half of the bread in bottom of prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with half of apples and half of cinnamon. Continue layering until all of the apples are used up. Top with remaining bread slices. Pour remaining egg mixture over all. Bake in preheated oven 40 minutes.

Mix gin and tonic together in glass. Garnish with a lime wedge. Serve with straws.
 korean barbecue beefingredients: beef steak, beef broth, soy sauce, mirin (rice wine), sugar, garlic, ginger root, green onionspreparation:Place the beef in a heavy skillet or pot and add the broth. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the soy sauce, mirin and sugar. Simmer for another 10 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger root and green onions. Simmer for about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Serve over rice.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add the garlic, basil, crushed red pepper flakes to the hot oil. Stir well. Add the chopped tomatoes. Stir well. Cover. Simmer for 5 minutes. Cook spaghetti in boiling water until al dente. Drain. Add the spaghetti to the tomato mixture. Toss well. Remove from heat. Add the Parmesan cheese. Stir well. Sprinkle the Romano cheese on top. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Bring the cream cheese to room temperature. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Coat both sides with the cream cheese mixture. Place the fish in a shallow dish and bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees F. Remove from the oven, squeeze the lemon over the fish and sprinkle with parsley and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season sole with salt and pepper. Mix together black bean garlic sauce and chopped green onions. Spread sole with half of the sauce. Top with the other half of the sauce and the fresh coriander. Place in a shallow baking pan and bake for 15 minutes. Serve with white rice.
Boil potatoes till done in salted water. Mash them well and add the rest of the ingredients. Beat with mixer. Add parsley just before serving. Serve hot.
Combine all marinade ingredients in a large ziploc bag. Add chicken and marinate for at least 1 hour. Grill chicken until no longer pink in the center and serve.

In a large bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. Set aside. In another large bowl combine cabbage and romaine lettuce. Add green onion. Mix well. Pour dressing over lettuce mixture and toss to coat. Sprinkle with pecans. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Cook raspberries in water with sugar until thickened. Strain and add cornstarch to thicken further if necessary. Refrigerate overnight to allow flavors to develop. May be made 2 weeks ahead.

Wash and cut the tomatoes into pieces. Slice the shallot and garlic into thin rounds. Add all to food processor and mix well. Add all remaining ingredients and mix well. Refrigerate and serve with chips or as a condiment.
I love these recipes! They are all delicious and easy to make!
I love these recipes! They are all delicious and easy to make! Thanks for sharing!
I love making my own salsas because you can get all kinds of flavors and spicinesses in them! I have to admit, though, that this is a little outside my comfort zone, but I will have to try it sometime.
I love making my own salsas because you can get all kinds of flavors and spicinesses in them! I have to admit, though, that this is a little outside my comfort zone, but I will have to try it sometime. I love that you can make it ahead of time!

In a shallow pan, combine brown sugar with 1/4 cup of water and 2 tablespoons of soy sauce. Add 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 2 minced garlic cloves. Heat in microwave until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Remove 1/4 cup of mixture. Add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Pat chicken breasts dry. Dip each chicken breast in remaining mixture. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium heat until hot. Add 2 chicken breasts and brown, turning once. Cook 5 minutes per side. Remove from heat and brush with remaining mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
In a bowl, mix beans, tomatoes, oil, salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Cook cranberries, cinnamon, and allspice in 1/4 cup water in a medium skillet over medium heat until the fruit is soft and the liquid has evaporated, 15 to 20 minutes. Press mixture through a fine sieve to remove seeds and skin. Combine jam and cranberry puree in a medium bowl and stir until smooth. Let cool slightly and stir in lemon rind. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/gas mark 4. Melt butter in saucepan and stir in milk and flour. Bring to boil and stir until mixture thickens. Stir in cheese and seasoning. Let cool. Grease 2 loaf pans. Press mixture into bottom of pans. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes until browned. Melt butter in saucepan. Stir in milk. Bring to boil. Stir in flour. Cook for 1 minute. Add poppy seeds. Pour into mould. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with butter.

In a large bowl, sift together the almond flour, splenda, and baking powder. Cream the butter and then add the splenda mixture. Beat until well mixed. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Form into balls and place on a waxed paper covered cookie sheet. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes or until set.
Name: low-carb almond sugar cookies Ingredients: almond flour, splenda sugar substitute, butter, egg, vanilla Preparation: In a large bowl, sift together the almond flour, splenda, and baking powder. Cream the butter and then add the splenda mixture. Beat until well mixed. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Form into balls and place on a waxed paper covered cookie sheet. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes or until set.
Name: no-bake birdseed cookies Ingredients: oatmeal, raisins, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds, pure maple syrup, crunchy peanut butter, vanilla Preparation: St

Saut the leeks and celery in butter in a small saucepan until tender. Drain liquid. Combine the vegetables and bread in a bowl. Add the seasonings. Add the chicken broth and toss well. Let mixture sit for 10 minutes. Heat stuffing in the microwave 30 seconds before serving.

Saute onions and garlic in olive oil. Add meat and brown well. Drain excess fat. Stir in the tomatoes, salt and pepper. Cover and simmer until meat is tender. Serve over cooked pasta and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Prepare double pie crust. In a large bowl, beat the sour cream and egg until well blended. Add sugar and mix well. Add flour and salt and mix well. Fold in berries and nuts. Pour into pastry shell. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool and serve with whipped topping.

Combine evaporated milk, sugar and pineapple juice. Cook over medium heat until mixture reaches soft ball stage. Remove from heat and add the lemon juice. Cool for a few minutes, then add the butter. Stir until mixture thickens and loses its gloss. Add the candied fruit. Pour into a 9 x 13 pan and let cool. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray pie pan with cooking spray. In medium bowl, mix hash browns and cottage cheese. In large bowl, combine eggs, salt and pepper. Add hash brown mixture and hot sauce and blend well. Stir in green onion and paprika. Pour into sprayed pan. Bake 45 minutes or until done. Cool slightly. Garnish with bacon. Serve warm.

Place dates in food processorprocess to make a fine paste. Add the water, lemon juice & sugarprocess to make a smooth paste. Transfer the mixture to a bowl, add the butter & mix to blend. In a separate bowl combine the oats with the baking soda & saltadd to the date mixture & mix well. Spoon into a 9x13-inch greased pan & press down to form an even surface. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with almonds if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small saucepan combine soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger and garlic powder. Heat and stir until sugar dissolves. Add cayenne. Spread the almonds on a baking sheet and pour the soy sauce mixture over them. Stir to coat and bake for 10 minutes. Cool. Store in an airtight container. Makes 1 cup.

Cut peppers into 1/4-inch strips. Cut onion into 1/4-inch slices. In a large nonstick pan or on a stove-top grill, heat cooking spray over medium heat. Cook beef until browned on all sides. Remove from heat and add peppers and onions. Heat through, stirring often. Stir in lime juice. Serve in tortillas topped with your favorite toppings.

Peel and slice banana and star fruit into 1/2 -inch cubes. Peel and slice mango and kiwi into thin slices. Make sure to remove all seeds. Combine lemon juice and honey in medium bowl. Dip fruit pieces into lemon mixture. Place fruit on wooden skewers. Place on large tray and freeze overnight. Scoop coconut ice cream into bowl and sprinkle with flaked coconut. Serve with fruit kabobs.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and ham to skillet and cook until crisp. Remove bacon and ham with slotted spoon. Add onion to skillet and cook until softened and lightly browned. Add tomato and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in ham and bacon. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. Add chicken legs and toss well to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a jelly roll pan with cooking spray. Arrange chicken legs on the prepared baking pan and bake for 30 minutes or until the juices run clear when the chicken is pierced with a knife. Serve hot.

Combine condensed milk and peanut butter. Add Bisquick to milk mixturestir just until blended. Stir in chips. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 9-11 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 1 1/2 dozen.

Combine tuna, peanuts and mustard. Mix together cream cheese and mayonnaise. Combine the two mixtures and chill. Slice biscuits horizontally. Brush tops of biscuits with melted butter. Spread tuna mixture over bottom layer. Top with second biscuit layer. Sprinkle with flour. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut each tart into 4 wedges.

Combine flour and seasonings and dredge cutlets. In a large skillet over medium heat, add butter and dredge pork cutlets. Saute in butter until golden brown. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, add white mushrooms and garlic. Saute until tender. Add chicken stock and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook 1 minute. Add the cutlets and cover. Cook over medium heat for 4 minutes. Add light sour cream and heat until hot. Serve with fresh parsley.

Combine milk and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add rice and cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until tender. In a separate saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and add the pumpkin, parsley and seasonings and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir the cooked rice into the pumpkin mixture and serve with cheese.

Rinse shrimp, peel & devein, pat dry & sprinkle with salt & pepper. Marinate 2 hours, or overnight, stirring occasionally. In a large skillet, heat oil over med heat. Add shrimp, olives, onion & vinegar. Cook 3-4 minutes or until pink. Serve warm.

Drain canned tuna (if you use drained it will be easier to mix). Mix all ingredients together (except butter). Cut bread in half and spread butter on each half. Place a slice of tomato on each half and layer with lettuce leaf, onion slice, slice of tuna mixture, lemon juice on the tomato slice and a little salt and pepper to taste. Replace top slice of bread. Makes 2 sandwiches.

In small saucepan over low heat combine powdered sugar & margarine. Stir until blended. Add milkheat & stir until smooth & creamy. Remove from heatstir in peanut butter & vanilla until smooth. Coolpour into 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan. Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Spread with melted semisweet chocolate. Let stand until chocolate is setcut into 1 inch squares.
Blend cinnamon, sugar and cream cheese. Stir in raisins.

Boil potatoes and drain. Add 1/2 of the dressing. Mash to desired texture. Add remaining 1/2 of the dressing and miracle whip. Stir in egg and green onions. Chill.

Spoon the refried beans evenly on top of the chips. Evenly spread the cream on the beans. Sprinkle the cheese evenly on the cream. Sprinkle the salsa evenly on the cheese. Microwave for 30 seconds on high power until the cheese is melted. Serves 4. Prep time is about 5 minutes.

In a large bowl combine chopped vegetables, basil, vinegar, oil, salt and pepper. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Tear bread into 1-inch pieces and add to vegetables. Mix gently. Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes. Serves 6.

Place chicken breasts into large zip-top bag. Pour in soy sauce and bourbon whiskey and shake well to coat chicken breasts with the marinade mixture. Refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place chicken breasts into baking dish and bake 20 minutes per side, or until chicken is golden and cooked through. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, combine pudding mix and light corn syrup. Stir for 2 minutes. Stir in peanut butter and stir until well blended. Spoon into 8-inch square pan. Sprinkle with cheerios and press down. Chill. Cut into 1-inch squares.
Pudding Squares Recipes
These pudding squares are an easy no bake treat to make.
