1 (10 ounce) bag miniature marshmallows
1 (10 ounce) bag Cheerios Toasted Oat Cereal
1 (12 ounce) bag miniature reese's peanut butter cups, divided
Combine the chocolate pudding mix and milk. Stir for 2 minutes.
Stir in the miniature marshmallows.
Pour into a 9x9 pan.
Sprinkle the mini reese's peanut butter cups evenly over the pudding.
Sprinkle the Cheerios Toast

Place bacon in skillet and cook until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove bacon from skilletdrain off drippings leaving about 1 Tablespoon. Add green beans, bell pepper, chicken broth, bacon drippings and salt. Cover and cook 10 minutes over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally. Remove cover and continue cooking about 10 more minutes or until the liquid is evaporated. Serve with bacon or not, as desired.

Spread cream cheese onto each slice of whole wheat bread. Arrange cucumbers, alfalfa sprouts and olive oil over cream cheese. Place tomatoes in center of bread slices. Top tomatoes with lettuce, peppers and avocado. Drizzle red wine vinegar over each sandwich. Cut sandwiches in half. Serve immediately or chill until serving time. Serves 4-6.


Heat the oil over medium heat and add the onion, carrot and celery, stirring occasionally until they are softened but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Add the stock and tomato puree and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the remaining vegetables and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes more. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Place tamales in microwaveable bowl. Add enough water to cover. Cover bowl. Microwave for 5 minutes. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Microwave for 30 seconds. Stir in sauce mixture. Serve with tamales.

Combine garlic and lemon juice in a bowl. Let sit for 10 minutes. Marinate the chicken in it for at least an hour. Drain off the marinade. Place the chicken on a rack on a broiler pan. Broil about 4 inches from the heat for 15-20 minutes until done. Turn once while broiling.
In a large pot over medium heat, combine the broth, water, chicken, beans, corn and cumin. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heatadd salsa, pepper, and onion. Serve with tortilla chips, if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix the quinoa flour, whole wheat flour and baking powder. Add the oil and water and mix well. Roll the dough into balls and place them on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Store in an airtight container.

Combine mustard, worchestershire sauce and lemon juice. Add garlic powder and oregano. Dip fish in mustard mixture and then into rice flour. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes until fish is done and golden. Garnish with parmesan cheese.
Combine all ingredients except fish. Mix thoroughly. Set aside for flavors to meld. Line cookie pan with foil and lightly spray the foil with olive oil spray or pam. Arrange fish in single layer. Broil 2 minutes. Flip fish and broil 2-3 minutes. Top each piece of fish with mixture. Broil 2 -3 more minutes until cheese is brown and fish is flaky. Serve immediately.
Combine mustard, worchestershire sauce and lemon juice. Add garlic powder and oregano. Dip fish in mustard mixture and then into rice flour. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes until fish is done and golden. Garn

Bring 1/4 cup water and cornstarch to a boil in medium saucepan. Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heatstir in drink mix and crushed pineapple until blended. Cool 5 minutes. In a shallow dish, combine reserved 1/4 cup water and cornstarch until smooth. Stir in sweetened flaked coconut until blended and smooth. Working with 1 apple slice at a time, dip each apple slice in the cornstarch mixture and then in the drink mix mixture. Repeat procedure until all apple slices have been dipped and completely coated. Let stand 30 minutesdrain well on paper towels. Sprinkle apple slices with powdered sugarset aside. Repeat procedure until all apple slices have been dipped and completely coated. Let stand 30 minutesdrain well on paper towels. Sprinkle apple slices with powdered sugarset aside.

Slice cheese into small cubes. In a small bowl combine cheese, shallot, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Let stand until ready to use. In another small bowl toss together pear slices and walnuts. Spread butter on each slice of bread. Place two slices on a plate. Top each with a pear slice. Spread cheese mixture on one slice. Top with other slice. Trim crusts. Serve sandwiches with salad.
name: curried egg and ham wrapsingredients: hard-boiled eggs, curry powder, mayonnaise, garlic chives, coriander leaves, lettuce leaves, lavash bread, hampreparation:Place eggs, curry powder, mayonnaise, garlic chives and coriander in a bowl. Mix until well combined. Place 2 lettuce leaves along 1 short end of 1 sheet lavash bread. Top with one-quarter of egg mixture and one-quarter of ham. Season with salt and pepper. Roll up firmly. Repeat with remaining lavash, lettuce, egg mixture and ham. Ser

Pre-heat oven to 450f. Coat the fish with flour and season with salt and pepper. In a large fry pan heat the butter and garlic until golden brown. Add mushrooms and cook until they are soft. Add the white wine and simmer until the liquid evaporates. Add the cream and cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Put the fish in a baking dish and pour the sauce over. Bake the fish for about 10 minutes.

Cut dough into 12 even pieces. Roll each piece into a 6-in. circle and place on baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400° for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. In small bowl combine 1/2 cup melted butter and egg until smoothspread over top of each ring to within 1/2 inch of edges. Sprinkle each ring with 1 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bake at 350° for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon chopped parsley and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.
name: garlic breadingredients: mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, garlic, dried basil, dried oregano, dried rosemary, round sourdough loaf, butterpreparation:Preheat broiler. Mix mayonnaise, parmesan, garlic and herbs in bowl to bl

Spray a large frying pan with cooking spray then cook the chicken until no longer pink. Mix in the salsa & paprika until well blended. In a separate bowl beat the cheese sauce ingredients together. In a third bowl beat together the sour cream & adobo seasoning. Spray a 9x13 baking pan then layer the tortillas. Top each tortilla with a spoonful of the chicken mixture then a spoonful of the cheese sauce. Sprinkle the top with the shredded cheese. Cover & bake for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven & sprinkle the top with the sour cream mixture. Bake uncovered for 5 more minutes.

Beat eggs and powdered sugar together. Stir in cornstarch. Cook on low heat until thick. Add soymilk. Cook until mixture coats the back of a spoon. Cool to room temperature. Add vanilla. Chill. Fold in 1 quart of whipped cream. Chill. Add to ice cream machine.

Preheat oven to 350F. Spray a 9×13″ baking dish with nonstick spray and set aside. Melt the chocolate in the microwave until smooth. Set aside and let cool slightly. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes). Beat in the melted chocolate and vanilla extract until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour and baking soda and add it to the mixture in two parts, alternating with the sour cream. Stir in the chocolate chips with a spoon until just incorporated. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it out evenly with a spatula. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the top is slightly puffy and the edges are just set. Let cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.
We love our homemade chocolate chip cookie bars! They are so easy and delicious.

Heat oil in large skillet. Add beans and stir-fry 1-2 minutes. Add ginger, garlic, soy sauce, chili-garlic sauce, vinegar. Stir-fry 2-3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Prepare and bake cake mix as directed. Cool and crumble. In a bowl combine butter, brown sugar and caramel topping. Add crumbled cake mix. Add egg. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 pan. Sprinkle nuts and ground cinnamon on top. Bake at 350F for 20 minutes. Makes 12 bars.

In a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, warm 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil. Season the beef cubes generously with salt and freshly ground pepper. Cook the beef in the heated skillet until browned. Remove the beef to a plate and set aside. Add the pancetta to the skillet and cook until crisp. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil to the pancetta fat in the skillet. Add the onion to the skillet and cook over medium-high heat until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the beef cubes back to the skillet along with the balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, and beef broth. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the skillet and simmer until the beef is very tender, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Check the skillet occasionally and add more broth if it dries out. Remove the beef to a plate. Pour the sauce into a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Return the sauce to the sk

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in honey and mustard. Add in orange zest. Add in orange juice. Cook until sauce thickens. Add in broccoli florets. Cook for a couple of minutes. Add in water. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat. Garnish with hazelnuts. Serve.

In a heavy bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add sliced mushrooms and stir fry until golden brown. Add the carrots and cook 2-3 minutes more. Add the wild rice blend and stir fry another 2-3 minutes. Add the beef broth, bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer. Add the sirloin strips and cook until tender. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Serve hot.

Toss steaks in flour. Beat eggs with 1 Tbsp water. Dip steaks in eggs then coat with breadcrumbs. Heat butter and oil in skillet. Fry steaks for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until browned. Serve with lemon wedges.
Brown meat. Drain fat. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer until cheese melts. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Cut the tomatoes into 1/2 inch chunks. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar and oregano. In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes and the olives. Add the dressing and toss to blend. Serve the salad at once or cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Just before serving, sprinkle with the feta and serve.
Scoop out avocado flesh. Place in bowl. Add lemon juice, sea salt, chili powder, cumin. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat 1 teaspoon of oil in skillet and saute carrot and zucchini. Add the rest of the oil and the Rotel. Stir and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil. Cook until the rice is tender.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a large resealable bag. Add the beef and turn to coat. Refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Drain the liquid from the bag. Place the beef in a 9x13-inch baking pan. Bake for 4-5 hours or until meat is fork tender. Increase the heat to 400 degrees and turn the oven off. Let stand for 1 hour. Remove the meat to a platter. Strain the juices through a fine sieve and pour the juices over the meat. Serve with the reserved onions. Serves 10 to 12.

Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees. Dry-dredge the chicken in the flour and set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat melt the butter and olive oil. Brown the chicken on both sides. Add the hoisin sauce to the skillet and cook until the sauce has reduced by half. Add the juice of 1/2 an orange. Stir in the oranges and red pepper flakes. Remove from heat and sprinkle with green onions and chopped nuts. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Combine yeast in warm water with a little sugar. let sit until creamy. Add butter, salt and the rest of the sugar. Add the egg and beat until smooth. Add the flour slowly until dough forms a ball. Roll out the dough to the thickness of the bottom of a glass. Brush with egg yolk wash and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add the ground turkey and warm water until the turkey is just browned. Drain the water and stir in the seasonings until well mixed. Add the lemon peel and stir again until well mixed. Cook for a few minutes until the seasonings are well mixed with the turkey. Serve hot.

Select basic or quick bread cycle. Add all ingredients except beer. Add beer and oil with 1 minutes remaining of mixing. Remove dough from machine and divide into 8 pieces. Shape into rolls and place into greased 8x8 pan. Cover and let rise 10 minutes. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes.

Preheat the broiler. Rub the grapefruit halves inside and out with the honey. Season the inside of the halves with the cardamom. Sprinkle the sugar over the grapefruit. Broil until the sugar has caramelized, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Put the milk into a saucepan with the baking chocolate. Over low heat, stir until the baking chocolate is dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly. Remove from heat and add the sugar and cornstarch, stirring until smooth. Serve hot.
There are 500 calories in 1 cup of Hot Chocolate.
Calorie Breakdown: 15% fat, 72% carbs, 12% prot.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Gradually whisk in the milk and continue to stir for about 5 minutes until it becomes creamy. Add the onion and the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the grits and stir well. Add the olive oil and salt. Cook, stirring constantly over medium heat for about 25 minutes. Add the cheddar cheese and stir until the cheese has completely melted. Stir in the thyme. Remove from the heat and stir in the scallions. Serve immediately.

Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add crushed pineapple. Cool to room temperature. Fold in whipped topping. Spread into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Garnish with carrots.

Follow package directions to prepare macaroni shells and cheese. Add corn and black beans to the macaroni mixture. Spread in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with green olives, sliced green chilies and chopped tomatoes. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Add 1/4 cup water and 1/2 cup sugar to a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium and boil for 2 minutes. Add lemon zest and 4 cups water. Strain through a fine strainer. Refrigerate until chilled. Add vodka to 3 cups of the lemon syrup and stir well. Refrigerate until chilled. Serve in chilled glasses. Garnish each glass with a slice of lemon.

Combine sour cream and mayonnaise in a bowl. Stir in basil and oregano. Add salt and pepper to taste. Fill pita pockets with a spoonful of the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bake in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 5 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Wash and trim the cauliflower. Cut out the core of the cauliflower and break up the florets. Arrange the florets in an ungreased shallow baking dish. Combine the sour cream, salt and pepper, and sprinkle over the cauliflower. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top of the sour cream. Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
name: broccoli cheese casseroleingredients: broccoli, flour, milk, butter, shredded cheese, bacon bits, onionspreparation:Melt butter in saucepan. Mix flour and milk together until smooth. Add broccoli. Cook until tender. Add shredded cheese and bacon bits. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle onions on top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.
name: broccoli-cheese casseroleingredients: broccoli, flour, milk, butter

Peel the tomatoes. Bring the water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the peeled tomatoes and the remaining ingredients. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 45 minutes to 1 hour. Strain the mixture through a colander or through a cheesecloth. Serve chilled.
name: tomato cucumber and green pepper chopped saladingredients: fresh lemon juice, garlic clove, olive oil, romaine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, green bell pepper, green onions, mint leavespreparation:Mix lemon juice and garlic in large bowl. Whisk in oil. Add remaining ingredients. Toss. Season with salt and pepper.
name: ripley tomato saladingredients: tomatoes, blue cheese, italian dressing, fresh basil, fresh ground black pepper, sea saltpreparation:Cut the tomato into eight wedges. Top with crumbled blue cheese. Top with basil. Top with dressing. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
name

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown chops in butter in a skillet. Add apples. Stir together butter, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Spoon over apples. Dot with butter. Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until apples are tender.

Dissolve yeast and honey in warm water. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in salt, oil and herbs. Beat in flour until dough is too stiff to stir. Turn out on lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Place in greased bowl, turning once to grease surface. Coverlet rise in warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down. Divide dough into 2 pieces and shape into 12"-14" ovals on lightly floured board. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic and herbs. Let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk, about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 20-25 minutes until golden brown and loaves sound hollow when tapped. Serve hot.
Preheat oven to 350. In skillet, brown chops in hot oil. Add applesauce, brown sugar, and mustard. Cover and bake for 1 hour or until tender.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut the sausages in half lengthwise. Thread the sausages and vegetables alternately on four double thicknesses of foil. Drizzle with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with rosemary. Fold foil to enclose. Grill for 20 minutes. Open foil and turn sausage halves and vegetables over. Grill an additional 20 minutes.

Peel the cucumbers and slice them into 1/4 inch rounds. Sprinkle them with the butter and season with the salt & pepper. Place the bread slices in the sandwich maker and spread the butter mixture over them. Top with the slices of cucumber. Cook for 3 minutes until the bread is crisp. Makes 4 servings.

Place the vanilla bean in a small sauce pan and cover with hot water. Let steep for 10 minutes. Remove the vanilla bean pods from the hot water. Save the pods for garnish. Combine the champagne vinegar, olive oil, honey and tarragon in a blender or food processor and blend until well emulsified. Season to taste with salt and fresh ground pepper. Pour the dressing into a small bowl for serving or into a jar with a lid for refrigerator storage. Garnish with a vanilla bean pod or with fresh tarragon sprigs. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Slice the french bread into 1-inch pieces. Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with garlic and bake another 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Top each piece of bread with a slice of zucchini. Sprinkle with ricotta cheese and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake another 2-3 minutes. Remove from oven.

Place apple slices in a bowl. Add cinnamon to taste. Melt marzipan in microwave until soft. Drizzle melted marzipan over apple slices. Place on one slice of buttered bread. Top with second slice of buttered bread.

Cream together butter flavor crisco and sugar. Beat in egg, orange extract, and zest. Stir together flour and saltgradually add to creamed mixture and mix well. Form dough into 1-inch balls. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 8 minutes. Cool 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet to wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350. Crumble cracker with hands. Spread on plate or paper towel. Dip each breast in melted butter, then roll in crumbs. Place in shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Bake uncovered 30 minutes or until done.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and add raspberries. Let cool. Serve over ice. Top with soda.
